column6: No comment
No comment

Great service! The bartenders and servers were great! The ambiance was super chill and laid back. The food was great! The drinks were really good! Came here on Sunday Drag Bingo afternoon from 1:30-3pm. The host was so much fun! Great times
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is really laid-back you walk in and seat yourself but I think it maybe best to sit by the bar cause you have to go and get your own drinks but the cooks bring outs the food to your table natasha was at the bar and she cool it was only her on the floor working though and I don't know why but anyway ill be back just really laid-back place to just drinks and chat!
No comment

Great happy hour- $5 beers on draft, excellent selection of beers in the beer fridge in the back; solid smash burgers. Wings are a tad dry. Noticed a blue cheese burger added to their menu so I had to try it- have to say, the patties were a bit dry this time, and were a bit too heavily salted, so the burger overall was way too salty because blue cheese in itself is salty. But I guess that's not really a problem of it can be washed down with ice cold beer right?
No comment
Great, lowkey atmosphere with a fantastic happy hour. Any the owner Megan is the sweetest. Highly recommend.
No comment

Came here with a group of friends. Walked in and no one greeted us so we assumed we could walk up to the bar and order our own drinks. Bartender was sooooo rude. None of the tap beers were labeled so I had no idea what they carried. Every question seemed to bother the bartender. We had one round of drinks and left. Never again.
No comment
Cute neighborhood gem with a rockabilly vibe! They have the fanciest and most unique mocktails... there's even one called Optical Illusion that's made with N/A gin and egg white.
No comment
No comment

Solid cocktails (I believe I went for the Giggle Juice), great bartender and my first time eating cheese curds (verdict: they are good). If you're in the area and in the mood for a drink, I'd definitely pop in here!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Loved this spot, located in downtown Brooklyn. They're open pretty late, until about 4am. I loved the flamingo theme they had going on. They have a variety of beers on tap as well as some frozen drinks. The bartender was really nice and let us sample some beers before we ordered. There is plenty of space for sitting at the bar or elsewhere, it's pretty spacious!

Stop by someday Bar after work with a few coworkers and decided to grab some drinks and appetizers. We opted for cheese curds, fried Mac n cheese, pretzels, and garlic parm wings. We were able to order on the TabbedOut app which was pretty cool because our orders came right out without saying a word to the waitress. This place is super cute and has a flamingo theme decor and a cute blue velvet couch. There's plenty of seating both indoor, at the bar and outdoor. The food was ok wings could use a bit more flavor, but definitely a good after work spot.
No comment

Amazing cocktails (try the Georgie!) and a huge selection of beer. The owner, Megan, is incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and committed to making this one of the best bars in the neighborhood. I also love how there are affordable small bites that you can enjoy while having a beer. Proper small bites other than fries are so hard to find!

I was here on Friday during the snowstorm, I was greeted at the door , temperature check and sigh in. I proceeded INSIDE to a table and ordered a tap beer , then got the Restaurant week special, a cheeseburger cooked medium w/ Swiss cheese , lettuce , tomato and onions and fries . It's a lot of fries to go . The place is big on the back and has a full bar. Also has cans and bottled beers Togo also . The old look good enough to eat . I wanna try the chicken wings next time . It has outdoor heaters if you wanna sit outside. I spoke to the owner here Megen and she's very beautiful and nice . The place has a pizza oven but it's not in used for now . SOMEDAY I be back again to have dinner here ..

Loved it we were the only ones sitting outside for awhile. I had some of the caprisuns my friend tried a few of the draft beers. We both got wings i got a dozen Buffalo and he got a dozen wings as well but split the flavors some truffle wings and some teriyaki.  Hated the truffle butter ones they tasted really plan and blah but everything else was delish. Waitress was cool,helpful and attentive. First restaurant I've been too thats taking info for contact tracing though. So even though we sat outside just to use the bathroom we had to leave our contact info. Other than that loved it! Will be returning.

I was tempted to write a very detailed review about my last two experiences there, but I won't. I'll simply say that it's a two-star experience when Cairon (sp?) isn't there. When he's there, it's a top-notch experience. My friends and I have decided we will not return unless he's definitely there. To his fellow colleagues, please prepare yourselves for the ever annoying phone call: "Is Cairon working this evening?" Smooches!

Really impressive menu and safe outdoor seating right now! The cocktails, mmm, depending on your tastes there's surely one that will satisfy - I personally suggest the Jaberwocky which is as delicious as it looks. As for food, it's above average bar fare, and my pick are the chicken wings. Truly can't believe I hadn't been here before covid. Will definitely be back!

The cocktails and bartender were great. There was a large bar selection. Sadly, the first time we went the kitchen staff no showed so we were unable to get any dinner. We came back a few days later and tried the Burgers--not very tasty.

Was very impressed with the food here, way above a typical bar. Started with the mini empanadas, which were packed with flavor and came with a very tasty dipping sauce. Next we tried the chicken tacos, which were my favorite. Chicken was very flavorful and tender and the shells were nice and crispy and held everything perfectly, could eat a dozen of these easily. For my main I had the fried chicken sandwich which was cooked perfectly. Nice and crispy outside, tender and juicy inside. The pickles and aioli added great flavor. I thought the fries were meh, but was so impressed with the rest of the meal that I didn't really care. Think they could knock it out of the park with a good cajun fry or perhaps something like waffle fries but that's just me. Will 100% be back here to try more of their menu.
No comment

Liked this place. Didn't have the food but there was an unusual group of whiskies to sample (fairly priced, too), excellent draft beers, and a big old fridge full of to-go local craft cans if you're so inclined. Server was friendly. Funky but not obnoxious decor. Clientele a mix of attractive, interesting, and weird--i.e., the right mix.
Great local spot - good veggie burgers and a solid selection of beers on tap. Nicely toes the line between dive and non-dive as a bar.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I work at Clover Club down the street from Someday Bar and when you are in the craft cocktail scene hospitality is huge also knowing the product you are selling is a big one. Megan the owner is such a force to be reckon with and has hold down her spot with all types of curve balls but she has such a keen eye for a strong team as well! Ciaran the bartender is hospitality at its finest and is personable and creative and on top of his game when he is busy as well. And the food will gladly soak up anything you are drinking and always delicious and innovative as well! After a long day at clover I enjoy hitting up someday before the long ride home in Astoria I love this spot and the spot! Craft beer selection is a amazing, food is always delicious and fun, and service is INCREDIBLE!
No comment
No comment
This bar is the best! Great owner, amazing Chef! Go and show your support for this outstanding place to eat and drink!
Awesome vibe, people, food and drinks! Had the black bean croquettes with fries excellent!

No place better for catch-up drinks than Someday Bar. I had walked past it many a time during the lock-down and always had it on my radar to visit when Brooklyn started to come back to life. It did not disappoint. From a really good draft beer list to amazing buffalo cauliflower wings to a thoughtful layout - owner Megan R. knocked it out of the park. You have a new regular!

Let me tell you, Someday Bar was certainly great. Great great atmosphere. Someday Bar has a fantastic Smash Burger, try it I think you would really like it, I certainly love it. All of the staff are incredibly helpful - you truly feel welcome and taken care of. My family and I plan to be regulars here.

Found this gem a few months go and have crowned her my favorite local spot. Megan (owner) is the absolute sweetest and she makes the best vodka cranz in town. The fried chicken sandwich is bomb and friends say her beer selection is great too. If you're local go grab some food and to-go drinks to support now but once this clears up you absolutely must go for happy hour. 10/10 all around
I absolutely adore this place. Everyone on staff is amazing at their craft. Friendly, perfect. LOVE! ‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍
Awesome food ! I had the Mac and cheese bites and pretzel w. bier cheese and it was all very yummy. Bartender was super nice. I'll definitely be back for the bites.
Terrible food and weak drinks. DO NOT place to-go orders because they will cancel on you at the last minute.
No comment

Great beer bar that is remarkable tough to find in this immediate area. Doubles as a beer store but togo seemed to all go for $8 or more, so stick to drinking onsite. Tons of beers from the greats in NY like Barrier and Grimm. Heavy IPA available and all for $8-12. Got locals and easy to find mixed with the rates and all styles. Got full bar as well and wine and food (though kitchen closes before bar). Cold inside and can get loud but good beer bar feel. Tap list needs to be better displayed as portions are on multiple mirrors so you're literally walking the venue to pick a beer, but other than that a great find for a beer lover and typical prices that don't gouge you for getting the good stuff.
Amazing beer selection, delicious craft cocktails and super staff! Really enjoy Someday Bar!

Stopped in for a beer on a really hot day last week. Bar was open 11 days according to the owner. Great beer selection and she had a strong knowledge of all the local beers in NY. Didn't see the menu but the burger that came out look delicious. Side note: the beer was extremely cold which is key, sounds simple but some places can't seem to achieve it.
Love this place! Food was excellent- had the burger, pierogies, and charcuterie plate. Beer selection is great and affordably priced! Definitely check our this new spot!!

I have been to this bar a few times and every time I went it feels like a pleasure to be there. They have an awesome selection of craft beer on tap. They have food but I always get there late when the kitchen is closed. Brain is a great bartender and make some awesome cocktails. If you want to enjoy a good craft beer selection or a great cocktail this is the place for you.
Really great bar! Nice conversation, amazing drinks, and great atmosphere. Highly recommend! Will be back.

Good beer selection and the food sounds yummy. Giving 3 stars for decor/atmosphere. Looks like an 80s dive bar (maroon and green, wooden accents) that they slapped neon signs on. I wish they had either kept it classic OR painted all the walls and brass mirrors white. It's kind of oddly stuck in-between.

This place is amazing and I'm a bit bummed we didn't discover it earlier! It's primarily order-at-the-bar but the bartender/owner, Megan, came by every now and then to check on us and take orders anyway. The whole staff was really friendly and quick. The restroom is gender neutral and clean with plenty of toilet paper (especially by bar standards). Happy hour lasts until 8pm and with a good array of $5 beers it was easy to make the credit card limit of $10. Best of all the music was such a fantastic throwback that we needed to know the playlist (Fastball radio on Spotify)! It was also perfect volume where we could talk without losing our voices but still hear it. We will definitely be back!
Great ambience and very good service.bartender CHRIS she is just imazing.she wellcome us warmly and big smile on her face.Definately will come back.
Great place. Really friendly bartenders. Decent cocktail and beer selection. Kitchen is only open to 11pm but bar is open until 4am
No comment

This has become our go-to spot and we are so happy that they were able to open for outdoor seating! The owner and staff are so kind and welcoming. Drinks are tasty from their cocktails to their extensive beer list! Food is delicious as well!
Amazing spot for craft beer, so glad it opened in my neighborhood! Will def be my new go-to spot. Can't wait to come back to try their cocktail and food menus, too.
Very attentive and nice staff. Good burger, delicious fries if you like seasoned, crisp fries. Great tap selection, fresh delicious cocktails. Cannot go wrong.

I absolutely love this bar.  It's got everything I need (WiFi, food, daytime hours on the weekends) plus the friendliest owners and bartender, an extensive beer list, cocktails, and a comfortable vibe.  So glad they are in my neighborhood.  We've needed a place like Someday Bar; I'm so glad they're here!
Delicious pierogis and happy hour until 8pm? Not too shabby, even if the music is god awful. The owner is very nice, too.
Great brunch and a perfect neighborhood bar. Try the Bread Pudding French Toast. It's decadent.

New bar across the street from my apartment. They seem to have a pretty big following already. I was excited but then I was disappointed. I went in to grab a drink, was greeted and served immediately. My friend got a beer which was definitely less than a 1/2 pour. My prosecco was not bubbly. I requested another. Also not bubbly. Probably not going to take my chances again. I feel bad for the bartender lady who has to serve the unbubbly bubbly.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've heard a lot of hype about this place, but I don't think it's anything special. It's just another breakfast place in my opinion. Considering the food was nothing out of the ordinary and didn't have anything special about the taste, I don't think it was quite worth the money. If you want to go to a brunch place that looks trendy/nice, then is place is fine, but if you want legitimately good food, maybe go elsewhere.
No comment

Been here a few times. Food is always great but the staff makes it outstanding. Just stopped in for a quick bite after all day travel. Had the grilled Halloumi and the salt and pepper eggplant. Both outstanding. The Eggplant I wasn't thinking I would like, but the tzatziki gave it a bright creamy zing to the salty eggplant. Sat outside on a nice NYC spring day.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

WHAT A VIBE. Such a cute, trendy and yummy spot. Their menu has a LOT of healthy and nutritious options. I came here with a group of 5 (made reservations) and we all loved our breakfast dishes. Food tasted so fresh!! Good service as well !
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Nice spot for brunch! As expected, it was pretty crowded with a 30 minute wait on a Saturday around 11:30, although it would have been nice if we could have made a reservation instead (not available for a party of 2). Waitress was friendly and attentive, and gave a great suggestion to get the haloumi. I got the mashed avocado on seeded bread with the arugula side salad. It was light and felt like the right amount of food, although the avocado mash was a bit bland for my liking. My friend got the chicken prego and said it was tasty, and also loved the haloumi. Would come back again!
Great food and excellent service. A colleague and I had lunch. We especially enjoyed the healthy options snd sensible portion sizes
No comment

I need to come back for brunch because I was not blown away by the dinner. I had the chicken and it was so peppery that I had a coughing fit every time I took a bite (this has never happened to me before anywhere). Cute spot, but be prepared to be on top of the people next to you and have them able to hear every word of your conversation.
No comment

Came for brunch. We had reservations and there was a slight wait but they seated us in their outside enclosed heated area. The service was really fast! All our dishes were good. I had the Mediterranean Breakfast and the salad was super fresh. Loved the combo. Didn't feel rushed even though we were done earlier. Would recommend.
No comment
No comment
The service was good and the steak was delicious but the peri peri chicken kebabs were as dry as styrofoam. My friends liked their burger and salmon burger as well
Extremely friendly and efficient staff.  I had the salmon burger and it was very tasty.

I've been to the one in the West Village and Chelsea, the food is good. I strongly recommend reservations because this place gets packed (on a Monday morning). The food was really good, my party of five really liked it (missed the grapefruit and yogurt pic). Wait staff was cordial and efficient.
No comment
No comment

cute interior but mediocre food. the green shakshuka was small and not very flavorful. if you ask, they will give you an extra piece of bread for free! The cucumber chips were probably the best dish of the meal but still nothing that special. I also ordered an Arnold Palmer (sweet tea and lemonade) which was $10 :(
No comment

I really enjoyed Jacks Wife Freda. I may be late to the game on this one as it was trending on tik tok for being thee spot and now trending again for being 'basic' but honestly a good breakfast is a good breakfast. I was very happy with my meal the Mediterranean breakfast is light and felt healthy to eat. The sauces were all great and the cucumber salad seasoned just right. I paired it with a cantelope mimosa and had a nice time with my friends. The wait wasn't even that bad only 25 minutes on a Saturday.

Nice American/Lebanese fusion brunch spot with a selection of food for any sort of craving. Compared to online reviews, it was a touch overrated (although the sauce with the steak/eggs was A1). $20 a dish. 4/5 stars as a brunch spot.
Just recently moved right beside this location and have already been numerous times. Great affordable menu with some stellar options. Always fresh and always great service.

I liked what I got both times - halloumi with poached egg on bread (just small portion and on the lighter end) and the duck bacon egg cheese sandwich with an arugula salad, which was delicious (highly recommend). Why only 3 stars? The waitstaff is a hit or miss. Usually I won't gripe about it but our waiter was so unfriendly and rude, she spilled water on our table filling up the glasses and even a bit on my phone and didn't say sorry. Asking her for anything felt like pulling teeth. I'm sure there are others places or maybe another location that one could go to for a decent brunch.

I have never heard of it but apparently it is a trendy place. It was empty when we came a little before noon. I think they open for breakfast too. I went with the mimi's salmon burger with arugula salad. The salmon burger was delicious. It held together well and had good seasoning. The arugula salad was bland and I would have rather went with fries. The middle eastern bowl also was done well. It didn't have too much spice so it worked. This is a hip place and it made me feel cool eating there! 4 stars.
I got the green shakshuka and was disappointed. The sauce was watery and the challah on the side very thin. I left hungry having finished my entire entree.
No comment

It's fine. 3.5 stars really. Everything was well presented, the location is cute, the staff was friendly. The food was just fine. We went for a weekday brunch and had mimosas, the beet spread, avocado toast, waffles, yogurt and the mayas breakfast bowl.  The beet spread didn't taste like beets but did have a great beet color. The avocado toast was fine but needed some salt or something spicy on top. The waffle was very sweet, but folks liked it. The yogurt was a small portion was was very good with the mint and granola. The breakfast bowl was fine. Overall this was a fine breakfast/brunch spot but I'm not going out of my way for it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Ate at the bar and bartenders are awesome make drinks fast and delicious.  Had the cauliflower app was beyond good.  Drinks are the bomb.!!!! Def come here we are at the bar with kids they rock!!!

The wait on a Saturday around noon was about 45 mins, which wasn't as bad as we were expecting. We ordered a side of Duck Bacon and Fried Zucchini Chips for the table. The duck bacon was very rich and super tasty! The zucchini chips were perfectly crispy yet soft in the middle. I ordered the Madame Freda sandwich, which was savory and the egg was perfectly oozy. Everyone in my party also loved the food that they ordered. 10/10 would recommend!

A day in the city led me here with my daughter and cousin. We were looking for a nice breakfast/brunch spot and Jack's came up in my Yelp recommendation. When we arrived there was a little line and the hostess said it would be a 15 minute wait but it actually was only like 10 minutes before we were seated. It seems to be a favorite amongst the neighborhood and rightfully so. It's not a big indoor space but they do have outdoor seating . It's very charming and the staff is just wonderful and very welcoming. I started out wanting breakfast but quickly changed my mind when I saw the burger a customer was eating. Lol My daughter and I ordered the Jack's burger and my cousin ordered Jack's breakfast. For drinks we ordered the Mint lemonade and the Watermelon mimosa. No doubt, the burger was the best one I've had in a while. It was cooked to my liking which made it even more delicious. Usually you don't really get it how you order (medium, medium well, etc) Everything was delicious and I wish I had room for dessert but I was full. If you're in the area, I highly recommend this quaint spot. Enjoy!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I wasn't sure this place would live up to the hype. However, the vegetable curry bowl was very tasty and a decent portion. Plus, the restaurant is so charming and pretty that I didn't mind the wait!
No comment

The food is amazing here. Love the cauliflower and zucchini crisps. Visiting from California & Bradley was super sweet and attentive to me & my family . Super important to me how a waiter is & he totally nailed it. Also the guy with the tattoos (sorry I didn't get a name) was super friendly. Is the little things that can make a person's day. Recommend this place 1000% percent!
No comment
A decent brunch place in a great location. The menu has lots of options. Grilled halloumi is really good.
Lovely service and ambiance, delicious and fresh food. The duck prosciutto and green hot sauce are excellent! Would definitely come back and recommend to others.
No comment

My friends and I made reservations for 10:15am and we were seated within 2min when we arrived. The service is fast and everyone working there was friendly and conscientious. My friends ordered the Mediterranean breakfast and it looked delicious. Definitely a good value, if you appreciate volume eating, because their plate appeared full of food. I ordered the poached eggs and it looked like a quarter of the food that was on their plate. It was good but I do feel like I overpaid for what I received. Bottomless coffee was $5 and it was always filled by their attentive staff. The tables are extremely close to each other and it was very loud at certain points of our brunch, not due to us. Overall I might go there again and try something else, but the amazing staff and quick service makes it worth the price.

We had to wait but not too long to be seated and we had to sit outside which wasn't terrible per say, it was just very warm outside and kind of odd because we sat on the opposite side close to street and random passerby walked right between us. Server was nice enough and the bathroom was clean, however there is 1 shared bathroom so be prepared to wait. However all in all the food was really really good and I loved the lemonade. I would go back and probably will.
Yummy chicken schnitzel and mashed potatoes!! Great waitress & service. We are outside and it was comfortable and warm. We preferred eating outside because of covid and also because it was quieter.
Delicious.  More than a safe bet for breakfast an amazing choice!   Yum!  Mediterranean-American done very well.
No comment

We came here for lunch and they have an amazing selection for breakfast, lunch dinner or just brunch. The service is amazing, Brendon was very attentive and courteous. Best of all the food is amazing. Highly recommend the Jack's breakfast. The skirt steak was cooked to perfection. My wife enjoyed the Mediterranean breakfast. We will definitely be back!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Gluten free options! The Mediterranean breakfast was superb. My friends got the shakshuka and enjoyed it. Beware the restaurant is very busy, so make a reservation and get there right when your reservation time is.

Cute brunch spot with great outdoor seating. It's always crowded on weekends so be prepared to wait a little. I got the rosewater waffle which was okay, and my friend got the shakshuka which was a winner. We also had the seasonal watermelon mimosas which were so good!!
No comment
Great food and service.   Sat at the bar for a quick bite when we first arrived to nyc.  Would def recommend this place.
Super overrated, especially for nyc. Way better spots throughout nyc for food or brunch.

My party of three was sat immediately because we were willing to do outdoor seating. I ordered the green shakshuka, which was good, but the halloumi I added was a must for textural diversity (otherwise watery) and to make it altogether more filling. The margaritas were also good. I would prefer the portions to be 15% larger, and this is coming from someone who does not eat a ton. Service was moderately attentive, and the postcard+pens given with the check are cute. Since this is relatively centrally located, I think it's a good option for dinner before a night downtown. Seems well suited to large groups as well.
I liked the vegetarian curry. Was good. I don't eat meat. Server was nice too. Would hit it again.
Loved my meal! Such a fun dining experience out on the patio. Wish they offered free refills on drinks but was overall a great meal and great waiters.
No comment

Came here for lunch today - the place was super packed and we had to wait 20 minutes to be seated despite having a reservation, definitely a very popular spot! My friend and I thought our meal was kind of overpriced for the portion sizes. None of the dishes were particularly impressive, but all of them tasted good. The green shakshuka was decent, but the amount of bread that came with the dish was not at all enough so definitely ask for more bread! We asked for an extra slice that we weren't charged for. The roasted cauliflower is pretty good, and the roasted capers add a delicious touch (even for my friend who dislikes capers). The rosewater waffle was the best item, but the honey syrup is *essential* (the waffle is quite dry otherwise). Overall, good service and cute place but in our opinion, not really worth the wait or price point.
No comment

I just recall the food was delicious, the service friendly and they kept refilling my coffee. What more do you want. It was crowded and apparently reservations are tough to get. My friend got it for us and we were there for a weekday work lunch. For whatever reason the bathrooms were quite busy.

Had the burger--it reminded me of a cafeteria burger. The small size I prefer to a huge burger, but it looked and tasted cheap. I've had better diner food. For $19, really disappointing. Fries looked good, but had a weird aftertaste. I saw someone else send back a burger or sandwhich of some sort, and fries--they swapped for a salad, though I couldn't decipher why.
No comment

Great stop for lunch or dinner with friends. Newly working in this area and I decided to stop in for lunch. The preggo sandwich with fries was worth the hype. The only downfall was that the sandwich was very small, the price and the pictures were a bit misleading. I thought it would be bigger than that, instead, I felt like I was eating a burger from a happy meal. I'll definitely be back to try something new, but that sandwich needs to be a bit bigger.
No comment

Great spot for brunch in the city on the weekend. Great outdoor seating, great service and delicious food. The Peri Peri wings were 5 stars they had a great smoky grill flavor to them. The waffles were good not great but delicious of course. Definitely coming back for the French toast.

So many people recommended this restaurant to me as a staple in the city and it basically lived up to its name. It's perfect for casual dining-- be at brunch, lunch, or dinner. The service is fast and the restaurant is comfortable. The food overall was good but not great. The rosewater waffle was not particularly incredible, but good nonetheless!
Fabulous  menu, friendly service, generous pour.  Our table had tofu spaghetti, kale greek salad and a very fine burger. All terrific.  Good value for a charming meal.
No comment

If I could give this 10000000 stars I would. The food here is AMAZING!!! Also bring that my boyfriends parents are from the Middle East and I eat a ton of authentic Mediterranean cuisine, this hit the spot for me. Came for brunch with a bachelorette party and was created and sat right away. Our server, grace, was fantastic and gave us recommendations as where to go that evening.  We started off with fried zucchini chips and coffee. The coffee was great and the chips very tasty with the accompanying aioli. I ordered their famed Mediterranean breakfast which includes scrambled eggs, avocado, pita bread, labne, and a Shepard's salad.   The labne was the most delicious I've ever tasted! I wish I had more room to order the grilled haloumi. For dessert, our waitress gave us complimentary flourless chocolate cake and malva's pudding cAke. I think both were the best things I've ever tried in my entire life. So mouthwatering. Anytime anyone wants to go to brunch in the city I'm recommending jacks wife freda!!
No comment
No comment

This was my first time coming to this location and the service was horrible - rude, slow, at times nonexistent, and filled with micro aggressions. My friends and I visited for a double date that quickly went south once it came time to pay. It was very clear their card system was down. One card was taken, then another, then another and we were left sitting wondering what was going on when they swiped. After attempting to swipe several different cards (credit, debit, even gift cards) of different variations (visa, mastercard, discover) under several different names of our party, we were told their system was broken (which was obvious at this point). We gave them several more cards which still didn't work, then the manager came over to tell us everyone else's cards were working except ours which was a wild implication to make considering no other party was leaving or paying at the time and we were the ONLY Black table in the restaurant. Instead of attempting to figure out what was wrong with their system (perhaps restarting it, retyping our order, literally anything besides just swiping) or offering us anything for the inconvenience while we sat an extra 20 minutes for them to figure out their system or providing us with more insight and options as to what was happening, the manager made a member of our party get up, leave the restaurant, and walk to an ATM to pay in cash. Again, we were offered nothing for our inconvenience. To top it all off, the manager came back before we left and was very rude and confrontational. I've been to this franchise several times and typically have a good time, but will definitely not be returning to this location. The BK location is a lot more friendly so unless you have a more "diverse" crowd (if you get what I mean), I'd skip out on the 8th Ave location. Even a better demeanor or offer of dessert or shots would've gone a long way all inconveniences considered. But considering the comments made about what "other tables" were doing, it's clear they were making shady assumptions about our party and have a specific demographic they prefer to accommodate. My partner was very sweet and still tipped which is more than I would've done for such a hostile and shady experience.

It was bustling at 10 AM! We sat outside in the toasty space. We were right under the heater and we couldn't tell that it was 30 degrees outside. $5 for bottomless coffee is awesome! My salmon burger was tasty and the fries were crisp and good. I would return!

New York, to be honest...not my favorite place. Yet, this restaurant proved itself to be a memorable place. First of all, we went in with no reservations, but still got seated rather swifty. Right off, the waitress greeted us wonderfully, complimented my shirt (it was indeed a good shirt, my most recent hysteric glamour purchase), and my lashes (also indeed a nice pair of lashes, which I will not name the brand of because I am a gatekeeper oops!). I ordered the prego roll, with grilled halloumi and avocado added on as per the recommendation of the wonderfully perfect waiter. I also ordered the cantaloupe juice, which I really do not recommend. Incredibly bland and normal tasting, for 8 dollars... I was expecting a much more dramatic taste. Anyway, the food was again really just fine. I mean it was a meat, cheese and avocado sandwich. Have got to say, their green sauce is absolutely impeccable! Honestly, go here for the nice, clean environment more than the food. A little side note, that I think really made my experience memorable is the fact that right behind our table, there was a nice mom and young son duo. The mother, she was quite the angry andy. They were reviewing math, addition to be specific, and oh me oh my, she was very frustrated at her son for failing to understand 7+8. I have got to say, I do blame the mother, she was not a good teacher at all. This entire encounter  made me think about this quora post I saw, where I read many people from the East Coast think of CA people as less intellectually capable, and more lazy. Which is probably true, but as a CA resident myself, I was excellent at addition, and in fact excelled to learn about multiplication and division in the first grade. Will I ever come back here? Probably not, but if you are looking for a quick place to just get breakfast and take a nice pic, I recommend it!

I was in New York City for the weekend with friends/family and we after looking for places for brunch we decided to try Jack's Wife Freda in Chelsea. I am so happy we did!! The food and service were amazing!! I had the Madame Freda with one of the best Bloody Mary's I've ever had.  My vegan cousin enjoyed the Mashed Avocado Toast with the Cantaloupe Mimosa and my other cousin had the Duck Bacon, Egg and Cheese sandwich with the Nana's Tea, which was the most delightful looking and smelling tea. Everything from the food, to the employees, to the ambiance of Jack's Wife Freda was perfect and I can't wait to go back!
No comment
So good! I had the Madame Freda and some coffee and both were *delectable*. The atmosphere was cute and i'm definitely coming back to try other things on the menu.

We stepped in for brunch at 3pm, perfect time to get there as I heard there's usually a wait, but we were offered a table right away, loved the bushwick vibe decor, and music was great, our server Alicia, was charming, and attentive, we ordered the peri peri wings to share for apps and it was heavenly, well seasoned and fell off the bone, we gobbled it so fast, and left only bones, lol. For mains we had the Bennie's chicken Schnitzel with mashed potatoes & I had the whole grilled fish which was a branzino with couscous and chopped salad, just wow! Perfectly seasoned the way I like it, and really really quite tasty! We were over the moon, stuffed but happy. Definitely a great brunch. Not very cheap, but hey! I'll always put my money where my mouth is. I highly recommend.

Had heard about this place before and had been wanting to try it for a bit! I always pass the Soho location but tried out the one in Chelsea. Came in on a Sunday morning and the staff was really nice and got us seated quickly without a reservation. Wide variety to choose from on the menu but I just ended up going with the mediterranean breakfast. It was good but in my opinion not worth the $16. The eggs were straight up on the plate which is ok but since they were over easy would have preferred on bread or something else. There was not enough pita and the avocado was also just there. The green sauce though was amazing. Didn't try any of their drinks but they also looked good. The ambience was really great though and it was definitely giving Sunday morning brunch vibes. Probably wouldn't come back but happy to try it.
No comment

My first time here and it definitely lived up to the hype as one of New York's favorite brunch spots! The staff was so accommodating and welcoming and brought out drinks and food at the perfect time. We got treated to the Malva pudding by our wonderful server and it is a MUST HAVE if you dine here or grab drinks! The WARM, MELT-IN-YOUR-MOUTH dessert is a great size to split and not overly sweet. Can't wait to go back!

Came here on our impromptu walk in the village and were lucky enough to walk in and get a table without a reservation. Service was great - our waiter was very attentive. The food was also awesome and came out very quickly. I had the steak and eggs (Jack's Breakfast) and the steak was cooked exactly how I asked. It's pretty tight and cramped inside the restaurant and the bathroom line can get a little backed up, but we had a great experience.

I've been wanting to try this place out for a long time and I was in the city this weekend running errands so it was a great time to do so. I was craving a big and classic breakfast. My fiancé and I were a walk-in and they were able to sit us under 5 minutes. That was a plus! Our server was very friendly and attentive. I ordered Jack's breakfast with my steak done medium well and my eggs sunny side up. Overall, I don't think the portion was suitable for the price in which you pay. My meal was good but nothing took it over the top that made it stand out aside from the green sauce. When I got my plate there was one slice of toast on it. I thought to myself where is the other half. Lol. I asked my server about it and he said bread is unlimited so he brought me a few more slices which was cool but I thought it was odd to serve someone just one piece of bread as bread being unlimited may not come to one's mind since it's not really advertised. The bread was not toasted at all. I did not try any cocktails from the bar as I drank the previous night so I got a latte instead. The latte was served cold. I asked my server to have it warmed and without no issue he had a new one made. After the fix, I enjoyed the latte as I am a fan of Stumptown coffee. I do think this place is an overrated spot.
No comment

@AtlanticTheater member and made dinner reservation at Chelsea location. Required credit card for reservation --unusual for a modest bistro. Upon entry, hostess (identified later as manager named Marie) was immediately confrontational. She was immediately nasty and unaccommodating.  We would have left immediately but were unfamiliar with the area and had time constraints - also had provided my credit card for reservation guarantee. Tables small and close together, food mediocre at best.  For example when I asked for a table with a little more space - she suggested I sit outside (in 40 degree weather). Then when I told them I had a food allergy and was told there were no substitutions. While our waitress was pleasant, it didn't stop Marie (alleged manager) from continually coming over speaking rudely and confrontationally. Would never eat there again. Would have walked out if we hadn't been pressed for time and confined to this location.  This restaurant has a serious problem with staff.

I went here with my aunt and cousin, and we had a great lunch. We ordered the fried zucchini chips, prego roll, and chicken kebab. I didn't expect much from the fried zucchini chips, but they were absolutely delicious. So crispy and flavorful. The prego roll was also yummy. The meat was tender and seasoned just right. The chicken kebab was also good, but it was definitely my least favorite among the 3 dishes. Overall, loved the vibe and food.

The food was not much to write home about. Fairly bog standard Mediterranean style brunch fare. I got the Chicken Prego and it was a bit greasy, a bit small, and overall just ok. Great service, nice outdoor setup that kept us warm on a freezing cold day.

Good food, great service, nyc prices, overall it was a good experience. We were quickly seated on a Saturday afternoon, party of 4. Drinks came quickly and the food doesn't take long either. My sandwich was amazing! I highly  recommend that, everyone else seemed pleased. I recommend!
No comment

Oh this place is pricey for the food you get! It for sure was good, but was my meal worth $50?  Not sure about that one. I came in with a friend last night. Indoor dining was open now so we sat inside. We made reservations for 6:30. It got pretty crowded by the time we left around 8. We started with some cocktails. I got the cantaloupe mimosa and it was amazing actually. We started with the zucchini chips. I was a big fan of the aioli it came with. I ordered the madame freda as my entree. It was pretty delicious but I am a bit appalled that it cost $20. My friend got the chicken prego. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. Overall a good meal and worth trying once but I'd say it's overhyped.
No comment

This place is fine if you're in a bind and want a variety of flavours. Nothing stood out as exceptional that I would come back seeking out, but things were well done, though at a higher price point than you'd expect. You really need to order a bunch of things to feel proper full. The peri-peri wings were great, especially the seasoning, while the chicken kebab (actually tikka) were fine (the side of couscous and chopped salad helped fill some of my appetite). It was my first time having the matzoh ball soup, but the Jewish friends I was with said it was solid (though why it was 7$ was beyond me). The one thing I appreciated, though, was that we came as a group of 8 and they were able to accommodate on the spot and make it work.

Great brunch spot that we found in New York! I tried the poached egg with tomato and halloumi which was amazing. It was like an eggs Benedict with the grilled halloumi on the bottom and whatever sauce it had on it complemented the dish well. It tasted incredible and was pretty filling. Cute atmosphere inside and service was quick.

Lovely server who did everything she could to be sweet and helpful. Food was below average for the price. Overcooked salmon and crazy over salted kale. Didn't think that was a risky dish, but go figure.

Food was so delicious! I got the salad with the chicken stewer which was grilled perfectly and the seasoning was amazing. My friends were also happy with their burgers! Now the chocolate cake.... This cake was seriously out of this world, highly recommend trying it! It was super moist and was gone in seconds! Service was great and food came out very quickly!
Delicious fresh food with delicate flavors and unique offerings, and great coffee. Staff was attentive and friendly.

I only stopped in here for dessert, so I'd like to go back and leave them a proper, updated review. I came here a couple of nights ago when it was rather cold and windy. They had to keep the door open due to covid, which was initially rough because it was super windy but they were nice enough to close it for a few minutes at a time, which was helpful. We were also able to walk in without a reservation, which was great. If you stop by for dessert, the Malva pudding is great and comforting.
So so so good!! And good service - wait was a little long so the waitress brought us out complimentary juice!

This is not your typical breakfast but it is delicious. Portions are just right, with some dishes even being on the smaller side, so you can not only order a dish but can also sample another. Always fun to get to sample menu items.

The food was good but they have no respect or care for allergies. I am highly allergic to sesame, soy, and nuts and the waiter completely disregarded my allergy - even telling  me things that listed tahini and sesame as being safe for a sesame allergy? I would highly recommend allergy training as it's a pretty basic nyc restaurant.

I have heard of this place, but never had a chance to go. I was blown away! Everything was so fresh and delicious. I tried a little bit of everything and I had not a single complaint about the food! Service was quick for the most part, especially when juggling indoor and outdoor dining. This place is now on my favorite brunch spots list!
Phenomenal brunch with multiple locations. My friend ordered the halloumi brunch, and I had the mediterranean breakfast with scrambled eggs. Everything tasted perfect

Jack's Wife Freda has been on my list for a while, and I had some extra doordash points so I felt like a little splurge. I had takeout and got the peri peri chicken. Chicken was delicious, and so was the salad. A little spicy, a little smoky. Would definitely come back to try other stuff. One thing I did notice was it came with a green sauce which tasted like (I think was?) guacamole, yet didn't really complement the chicken. Delicious anyway though
No comment
No comment

This is a solid go to when you're in the city. The food is really unique so weather you're going for brunch or dinner, you're bound to have a great meal. Everything always tastes fresh no matter the location and even if you don't make a reservation they usually can seat you with 15 minutes. I really love their tea and lemonade as well. Highly recommend this city staple!

Normally, this restaurant is relatively good. The other night I went and was served undercooked meat which eventually led to food poisoning. The waiter was extremely apologetic about the food and brought me a new order and a drink on the house. I greatly appreciated the good service but was upset with being served purple meat that was hardly edible. I expect a bit more from this place as it's typically quite good. Wait staff gets good marks from me while the kitchen needs to be more attentive to prevent further sickness.
The food was merely satisfactory, especially at $20 for a small chicken sandwich at lunch. Great waitress, lively atmosphere.
First time here ever and I went along with the fish a la plancha... it touched the soul
No comment

Cute spot for brunch in Chelsea. Stopped by pre-COVID and it was super packed, the tables are a little on top of each other and you'll definitely need a reservation to get in. I ordered the madame freda which was great as far as croque madames go. Would love to try some more items on the menu!
No comment

I hate to give bad reviews, but you guessed it, I'm about to. It wasn't the food, the menu was creative and healthy--I've never seen Spaghetti Squash & Chicken Meatballs on a menu before--and it was delicious. Friend's Chicken Kebab is good also. Bennie's Chicken Schnitzel, fine too. What was the problem? We went to the Chelsea location at 7 pm and it was SO LOUD! The place wasn't that big but it was full and the noise ricocheted off the walls and around the room like bullets. Everyone was screaming at the person next to them just to be heard. It was a harsh, deafening cacophony. And I still wouldn't have given a bad review except due to all the screaming and spitting going on I got Covid!! I am very cautious about going out, had never had Covid ever, and it was clear where I was infected. I'm sure this is where a lot of people must be getting infected due to all the screaming & spittle. No one in my party got Covid except me; I was the one seated on the outside of the booth interacting with the shouting waitress. Who was nice and apologetic. But, management should install some sound-absorbing ceiling tiles. If you must go, try breakfast and you might avoid Covid and a noise headache.
No comment
No comment

Jacks wife freda was my first indoor dining experience since February, and it felt totally safe and clean. The service was impeccable and the food was tasty. I had the eggplant sandwich with an arugula salad   The sandwich was fresh and light, but the salad was way too salty.
Underwhelming. Mediocre. Overpriced. Weirdly small portions without the finesse. Not sure I can come up with more to say, which I guess says a lot.
No comment
No comment

Decided to come here with a friend because brunch is King. I was particularly hungry this day and decided that Jack's Breakfast ($25) is exactly what I needed. The skirt steak was cooked perfectly, but the best part, which I wished there was more of, was the spicy avocado and herb everything sauce. Packed the perfect amount of punch and perfectly complimented everything on the plate. While the prices are on the higher side, you will not be disappointed in the quality of the food.
No comment
No comment

We came here for Saturday brunch and were able to get seated immediately which was great. Between the two of us we ordered a couple cocktails, the grilled halloumi, grapefruit and yogurt, and the rosewater waffle. The grapefruit and yogurt and the waffle were both pretty good but the highlight for me was definitely the excellent halloumi.  The cocktails were refreshing and the right level of strong which was great.  The service, however, was not great as our server was a bit rude and not attentive. All the other staff we interacted with were great though.
Two words... Duck bacon! Game changer, we also had their matcha. Glad we came across them while visiting, wish they had a location in the Bay Area lol Highly recommend them

I've been to this spot in various locations around the city. The shakshuka tends to be my favorite, although pricy for how basic the dish is. Rose water waffle is also delicious. However, I tried their burger recently and was disappointed. Other than the beef patty on a bun with tomatoes, the dish did not come with anything else (no onions, or lettuce). Taste was also bland.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was amazing! The service from the minute we walked in was great! I had my kid with me and they gave her lots of coloring and sticker activities to do, as well as a cute kiddies cup for her water! The food was 10/10 and service exceeded my expectations! Great place!
The breakfast bowl is spectacular, as well as the cauliflower that we began with. The cantaloupe mimosa was okay

My fiancée and I grabbed a couple drinks and some brunch. Unfortunately, it was an incredibly windy day which cut our experience a bit short. I had a couple glasses of red wine while my fiancée had one of their signature cocktails. We also shared their duck bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich along with a side of fries. The fries are outstanding. They're on the slightly thicker side but we're super crispy and a bit flakey. They were just thick enough that I tasted a bit of that baked potato filling yet not in an hearty way. The staff was very accommodating and tried to make the best of the inclement weather.

I've been here twice in the last few months. Both times were winners! I love how this place does a great job of celebrating all things breakfast, lunch and brunch. Plus, thank you for giving halloumi it's rightful place on the menu! Oh my god I swear, this is a cheese that isn't on enough damn menus in NYC. As someone who frequents London often, they pull a strong halloumi game, and finally I found a place that gives it the space it deserves! I'm guess Freda loved halloumi. Thanks Jack for helping all of us halloumi loving foodies what we need, grilled ass cheese that belongs on every damn thing! Come here and make your belly happy! Other hit list items: freshly squeezed cantaloupe juice. And holy moly, the cheesecake will blow your mind. That crust is sinful. Can't wait for another visit!
No comment
Not following any covid guidelines. Pretty much accepting guests at 100% capacity. The only protection is the plexiglass barriers but there were a lot of people dinning indoors.

Great service, great tasting food, terrible portions. I understand value isn't necessarily the selling point here but I just personally prefer being full after spending $25+ hahah... That said, the steak in the Jack's Breakfast was amazing-- a bit more cooked than I requested but still very tender and flavorful. The pickled onions and grilled tomato were also a great touch and worked really well with the steak and green sauce. Again, my only gripe was that $25 later I was still hungry and had to go up the street to Brooklyn Bagel to get full. Seems like portions are generally pretty small here!
No comment

Great little spot in Chelsea! I've been to the other  location in the west village which is a little bit less congested, but food remained delicious!  The staff was very kind but due to the cold weather people waiting to be seated were crowding up the front of the restaurant and standing over people as they were eating. Other than that it's always a great experience at Jack's Wife Freda! I enjoyed a warm matcha drink and Mediterranean breakfast bowl.
No comment

Terrible service. Mediocre at best food. Sat next to smelly subway entrance with broken fan so was uncomfortable and hot and nauseous the entire meal. Extremely overrated for the price and snobby staff.
No comment
No comment

The food is great! I ordered the chicken prego and was really satisfied with that order - I also got the fries that came with which was good. The staff wasn't too good at refilling waters but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that they were never not busy while I was there.

Children's portions. If you want to eat, you should order at least a couple of dishes. The burger I ordered was medium rare, but in the end they brought it well done and slipghtly burnt. I can't complain about the quality of the products, but I'm hungry. Also, cheese is extra.

Was an opportunist last weekend, woke up early, got my coffee just to beat the crowd at Jacks wife Freda! Have been wanting to visit this place for almost dinosaur years and finally made it! We waited for 45 minutes but it was worth that extra effort!  I got the Green Shakshouka served with challah bread that were crispy and delicious! Only one tiny issue was that I asked mine with avocados which they forgot to add, but they got a plate of it in immediately when asked, my husband got the poached eggs with grilled tomatoes and halloumi which he really like, I tried the halloumi which were surprisingly soft and really good!. For drinks we got the Fresh Cantaloupe juice, they are actually freshly squeezed served in huge glasses. My hubby also got a side of fries that were thickly cut and crispy! Highly recommend!

This place is great! The vibes the food it was fantastic. I went on a saturday afternoon and it was very busy so i wonder how this would compare to a weeknight but overall it was a great experience. It was a little loud, so maybe not the best place for an intimate date but it was great place to eat some food and enjoy the vibes. Unfortunately our waiter forgot to put our order into the system and we waited a very long time for our meal but the waiter gave us drinks on the house to apologize. Although everything tasted great and was delicious, i was left wanting more. Therefore, i think my big critique of the restaurant would be portion size to price ratio. You definitely are not getting a bang for your buck but you are getting a somewhat appropriate size meal for what you are paying for, so maybe do not come and expect to get a giant plate of food and possibly order an appetizer first to make sure you leave satisfied.

Great brunch spot! Usually pretty busy so I would recommend going a little later like maybe around 2pm on a Saturday, which was when I stopped by. There was no wait for a party of 2, which was great. We were seated immediately and service was super fast. I had the green shakshuka, which came with the most delicious bread.
No comment

Was swayed by the long brunch lines I'd seen at the Soho edition and so took a seat at the Chelsea location. Service? No complaints (mostly. See below): Friendly and efficient. Food? Whoa. The standard burger was tired looking-- no zip to it. Onions probably sautéed 5-6 hours earlier. Dried and unappetizing. Burger done as requested but somehow dry. Fries were 6/10. Had obviously sat awhile. The bill: $20.45. I tendered a $20 and a $10 thinking I'd leave the $5. The server returned my "change." $9 in bills. Huh? I know cash is out of fashion but if you don't have coins, pass the discount on to me! As I was leaving, a three top of Gen Zs sat down. "My sister says this place is overrated" says one. Yup!
No comment
No comment

Great brunch with very diverse menu options. We went as a group of 4 on a Sunday during the pandemic. Outdoor seating is the only option other thank takeout and delivery. Thankfully we were seated right away facing 8th Avenue. We ordered multiple watermelon margaritas, which were really good but extremely pricy ($14), especially because they came in a very small glass packed with ice. In terms of food, we ordered the Whole Fish ($30), the Jack's Breakfast ($25), the Madame Freda ($19) and the Rosewater Waffle ($14). I personally had the Jack's Breakfast and found it filling and delicious. The plate came with a medium rare skirt medium sized skirt steak, two eggs any style (I picked poached), grilled tomatoes, pickled onions and one piece of sourdough bread. Additionally the plate came with a small side of their "Freda's Everything Sauce". The sauce is addicting, super tasty with a good spicy kick. Overall we had a very pleasant experience at this location, and will likely return.

I came to their Chelsea location after a long time recently. It was Saturday and I came here for brunch around noon. The wait for a table was over 90 minutes, but since I was by myself I was lucky to get a seat at the bar within 15 minutes of getting there. I got the latte and the green shashuka, both were pretty good. The staff is very friendly however at the bar, they seemed a little spaced out. I'll probably come back here but definitely will not be waiting for too long to get a seat.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Came her numerous times and I order the same thing, Prego roll. That being said, the service aren't the best and the fresh cantaloupe juice is not worth paying $8 for. Overall pretty good.
No comment
No comment
No comment

FOR CHEAP PEOPLE.  The service is awful, all the waiters have an attitude. They don't even care about you. They made me and my family feel very uncomfortable, I believe it has to do with my parents having an Spanish accent. Very rude to us. It's not worthy spend your money here.

Wow this was the most disappointing spot ever, nothing like the other location. It's a mess, I spent $14 on cold brew that tastes sour and burnt. I was trying to show my sister a good time and the service was terrible, the person rolled their eyes at me when we asked for our food to go because we needed to leave. Just a really sucky experience. It's upsetting, I wish I had spoken up about the terrible service and food there.
No comment

COVID-19 outdoor dining review: this Jack's Wife doesn't get quite as mobbed as some of their other locations, so during the pandemic it's been easy enough to roll the dice with a walk-in, especially if you're a table for two. They're not doing anything extraordinary, but serving really good simple, healthy-ish food that's always well-executed. My default is the chicken kebab with couscous (the chicken is NEVER dry), but also love their greek salad and the steak and eggs. And the add-ons here are bomb: the pickled onions, house hot sauce, and the spaghetti squash are so good. I keep buying jars of pickled onions so I can have more at home! Service can be a bit touch and go depending on how busy they are on the weekends, but usually food comes out very fast. I've also done takeout + delivery from this location a lot and am never disappointed in terms of food quality + speed.
No comment

This is for delivery only.... Had the chicken sandwich and fries.... Great. Paid 20 bucks for this chicken kebab.... Incredibly disappointing!!! This is how I opened it up, pretty poor. And Caviar didn't give a full refund. Wife loves the veg curry here but it's hard to justify ordering from here after this

column3: Roma Norte, Ciudad de México, Mexico
column6: this place is really yummy. my favorite dish is the rose water waffle but i also love the shakshouka and the meatballs! it's really expensive though. i also cannot recommend the duck bacon.... if you like regular bacon you probably won't like it.

This place 100% lived up to my expectations. Everyone has been telling me to come here for brunch, and I was not disappointed. My one tip would be to either make a reservation or come right when it opens- about 30 minutes after we got there, there was a line down the block. The staff was super friendly, there was a ton of outdoor seating, and the music and vibes were amazing. The food, although on the expensive side (most was around $20 for a meal, and the cold brew was $7), was absolutely delicious. And it's the kind of brunch where you can walk away and not feel sick- the food I ordered (Maya's breakfast bowl) was healthy yet filling. And it came with an amazing green spicy sauce. I will be returning soon!

This was very bustling place for weekend brunch. We were seated fairly quickly, though, and the food came quickly! We shared the Rosewater Waffle and the Poached Eggs with Grilled Tomato and Haloumi. The portions were smaller than typical brunch but enough to fill you up until your next meal!
No comment
No comment

I'd fly to NYC every weekend just to eat the Madame Freda. It is everything and more. Absolutely delicious. The melted cheese, perfectly cooked egg, the duck prosciutto, the butte bread, the cheddar béchamel sauce. How can one resist? Perfect serving size. Visiting this place is a nonnegotiable when in the city. The malva pudding is pretty solid as well. It's a muffin and it swims in  a warm buttery caramel syrup. Yes, please!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Probably one of the nicest people here! As soon as I walked in I was esrly for a reservation so they had me wait for my friend and told me to wait for a nicer table to open up for us. The waiters were attentive in refilling coffee and water and ever so friendly. I would love to come back here again!

The food here was good. I got the green shaksuka and the fruit crumble. They were delicious but I had to wait 10 minutes for every necessity--my fork, a napkin, an extra plate, everything. This place gets pretty busy and I would understand if it was particularly so, but I went at 2pm on a Monday. There were four other customers in there and I just couldn't understand the long wait. It actually made me late to a meeting. Food? Amazing. Service? no bueno.
Delicious food and super friendly staff! The outdoor setup was a bit chilly but I would still love to go back! We loved the brunch, especially the hot toddys!
No comment
No comment
I cannot say enough about this adorable little NYC place. The food was delicious. The wings cooked & seasoned perfectly. Nice cocktail selection. Friendly staff & great atmosphere!
No comment

I came for a drink outside and was not a fan of the service. It was very slow and it wasn't busy. The server was not sure of what I asked for (whisky on the rocks). Closing out the tab also took awhile. I had to get up and physically give my card to someone to pay. Won't be coming back anytime soon.
Excellent friendly service! Great happy prices on drinks with three different delicious margarita choices. Tasty, fresh and healthy food for brunch, lunch and dinner.
No comment
No comment

Love love love this place! Some of the best brunch you can get it the city. Super unique dishes along with the classics. I've also gone for dinner & it was delicious, but I think that their brunch reigns supreme.
No comment

The food was served ice cold.   They were way too busy for the server to even reply to our requests.   The Chicken Schnitzel was cold and flavorless.   It needs butter or something to add flavor.  I've tried this place so many times and it is always bad.   It's a shame as it is on my block and I would love to come here. But this is the last attempt.
No comment
No comment

Yum! Good food and good service. Despite crowds and no reservations allowed expect for large parties they move people through quickly. The servers and kitchen take allergies and food sensitivities seriously which is always appreciated. Vegan, dairy free and gluten free diners can eat easily on this menu. Personally recommend the breakfast bowl. Portions aren't huge so know that if you are super hungry. You'll leave satisfied not stuffed.
No comment

came for saturday lunch. a short wait and we were seated. menu has a fair assortment of breakfast focused dishes and lunch/dinner options, I still felt it was a tad limited, definitely felt more breakfast/brunch geared. overall food was good quality, service and ambiance were average. prices were a bit steep for what was being served and portion (salad $14 + $8 chicken). would've gotten cold brew but the $7 turned me off. it is the city, but i feel there's many other places where this price point gets you a much better meal. not mad about going but nothing memorable

Dined in the restaurant and it was good. Decided to order the spaghetti with chicken meatballs that comes in a tomato sauce. If they meant it to be an oil sauce that would be a more accurate description. Basically had precooked spaghetti in a vat of oil.

This place is very aesthetically pleasing. I ordered the shashuka which is basically two eggs in a tomatillo sauce served with two pieces of little toast. I was expecting  to be wowed however I felt that for the price point and reputation of this place the meal was not very complete in a sense that it was two eggs, sauce and toast  and left much to be desired, as I can whip up something similar at home. When I eat brunch I like a complete meal and I did not feel this was a complete brunch experience. At least it should've come with some home fries or a side of breakfast meat or fruit.
No comment

Love their Peri Peri Chicken. My fav there. Solid margaritas as well (although a bit pricey for the size maybe). The staff here are super nice. We go every couple of weeks and eat outside when not too cold.

Great atmosphere and charming attention to detail. It's slightly unintuitive to be seated without reservation, but more than worth it once you're settled. Food is incredible and service is great. Jack sure is a lucky guy!

This place is a must for those in Chelsea, the ambience of Jack's Wife Freda especially at night. The candles and corner location make for a great first date or for a nice evening dinner. The wait staff is also nice overall and welcoming. The food however tastes fresh and delectable, nothing special or over the moon. The Jack's burger is soft and just tastes like a simple burger. The chocolate cake was delish and the caramel on the side was to die for but the cake itself was a bit disappointing. I've heard the brunch is their golden egg so I'm interested in trying that. Prices are reasonable so I would return for more casual situations.
The food is good but does not blow your mind. If you like a mix of everything you will find something for everyone. A little pricey, but good family vibes.
No comment

My sister and I had brunch here today when we went down to Chelsea Market. What a delight! The restaurant is so warm and welcoming and the decor polished and clean. Our server, Katelyn was a nice as can be and told us all about so many dishes. My sister had the excellent drip coffee to start. Then she had the Schnitzel special. It's hard to make a tender, flavorful schnitzel, but Jack's Wife Freda does it very well. It came with a field green salad that added crunch and brightness. I had the Greek salad and added peri-peri chicken on a skewer. If you've never had this chicken, you are really missing out. The chicken was delicious and the thin slab of top quality feta rounded out all of the fantastic flavors. This was one of our favorite brunches!
Adore their watermelon margs. I'd come for those alone. But everything is good. Brunch and dinner. Staff are super, always incredibly friendly and efficient. Excellent addition to the neighbourhood.

My hubby and I swang by for brunch and cocktails after walking around the city bit. The food was absolutely delicious and our waitress, Lilly, was SUCH a sweetheart! Service was on point, the place was spotless and very well organized with the precautions for COVID, and overall our experience was phenomenal. We'll definitely be returning!

The hype for this place is so real. Lovely brunch spot with excellent service and fresh food! Ask for hot sauce to go with your eggs and your server will bring out a delicious homemade green sauce that pairs perfectly with eggs! With your bill, they'll give you a postcard for a cute souvenir of your experience. I'll definitely be back!
My servers name was Jose! By far the nicest person I've ever dealt with. This place is lucky to have him.  The food was amazing, drinks were fabulous and the service was clearly above and beyond.

It's just not worth the price in terms of lunch (maybe brunch is better). The food, for us, is below average. We thought that about their original location. It's doubly the case for this one on 8th...

Food was pretty good, ask for their green sauce! They check your vaccination cards before going in. Extra star for taking safety precautions but one less because it would've been better if staff wore masks too.
Food is so-so. A bit over hyped. Waited for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Won't come again if the wait is still like that...

Yummmmm! PLUS cute spot and amazing marketing and branding! Even the to go bags are super cute. I cannot wait to go back. I have the wings and they were different and yummy. Fries were super good. This will be a favorite.

Need to update their opening times. Its says they open at 8.30am on Yelp but when I went on a Thurs at 10.30am - they said they don't open till 11am. I understand its difficult with Covid changes so just fyi to note.
No comment
No comment

Best dish I had in the USA so far is the Madame Sandwich. Will eat again. Great service, trendy. I highly recommend for anyone who wants something different. Prices are ok, cofee rocked. Just make sure to come with companions.

I really had no idea when to expect going by the name but Jack's Wife Freda was amazing. We waited a short time before we were escorted to our outside table. The decor was adorable with small tables, flowers, green plants. We enjoyed a cantaloupe mimosa which was so refreshing. For an appetizer we had the roasted cauliflower with creamy garlic dressing and capers then, my daughter and I split the Mediterranean Breakfast. It was all so delicious I wish I lived closer so I could go more often to try everything on the menu.
No comment
Great place. Outside dining with heat lamps. Wonderful roasted eggplant sandwich on a baguette, plus crispy fried zucchini which was AWESOME. Not cheap but great quality.

The salmon was cooked perfectly and I got it with a really refreshing mint lemonade - wish I had a glass of that right now. It was either spinach of kale under the salmon - I can't remember now. The greens were good but could've been a smaller serving of it on my plate, with a drop less garlic. Still a great meal and really nice to sit outside if you enjoy people watching and don't mind if it gets windy.
No comment
No comment
No comment

went the other day to grab a drink w a friend. had a lovely and light espresso martini and everything looked so good on the menu that we plan to come back next week to try the food!! everyone working was super kind and friendly and chatted with us a bit, and the place was very clean and nicely lit. great location right near the subway and overall a wonderful part of the night!
No comment
Great atmosphere. Great service. Food is average, but it's a fun place to hang out. Stay away from the waffle and avocado toast, stick to the eggs.

Came her for breakfast and wow is the word to describe this place. We got seated right away and the server came by to get our drink order. She had great recommendations. The shakshuka with tomatillos is atypical, but so worth trying. I got the duck prosciutto sandwich. It was absolutely delicious. When I'm back in town, I would definitely come back. Shout out to the server with the buzzed hair, you were awesome!!

It looked so cute from the pictures, I had high hopes for this place since this was the first stop of my NY trip. Unfornateuly it didn't live up to expectations. We ordered the green shashuka, rosewater waffles, and madame freda. The green shashuka looks pretty but it just tasted like eating Mexican green salsa with bread. I much prefer the red tomato based shashuka over this. They also give you only two tiny pieces of bread which is not sufficient at all. The madame Freda tasted great but there was barely any prosciutto. The soft bread was good but overwhelmed everything else. The rosewater waffle was the breakout of this breakfast. Surprisingly really light and the rosewater taste shined through. Don't get me wrong, the food tasted great. But for the price I was expecting something more. Didn't feel like this place was worth it and that it's just all hype.

My cousin and I had lunch at the newest JWF location on 8th Ave and 16th street last weekend when we were in the city visiting my niece. We arrived around 2 pm and were seated right away. As we had early (for NYC) dinner reservations, our goal was to not overeat, so we split an excellently prepared burger and fries. The burger was topped with duck bacon and avocado--super delish! I had the beautiful and yummy mint tea, which was a welcome treat on this frigid day. Cuz had a latte and was very complementary of it. Our waiter was lovely. The atmosphere is a delight. I love Jack's Wife Freda.
Rosewater waffle was sooo good. Service decent, but definitely felt like I was getting rushed out of the restaurant. It was busy, so I guess I get it. Food good overall!
No comment

My friend and I went around lunch time, we thought we'd have to wait as usual especially reading the reviews for other locations, but surprisingly were seated right away. The interior is small and cozy, loved the cute sayings on the sugar packets and enjoyed the overall ambiance of the restaurant. I got the Madame Freda and my friend got the Maya's Breakfast Bowl. Food was delicious but service wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Overall, it's definitely instagram worthy, and worth a visit if you're in the city.

Nice area, way less busier than soho's location. Don't need a reservation and wait is really fast, if any. L train and blue lines just across the street. Further down but still walkable to the 1 train. Nice food and flavourful and warm home style but not too heavy. I can never seem to be full here though, wish the portion was bigger. I even shared a dessert with my friend after the meal, still could eat another meal. Decent drinks and desserts are pretty good too. If you have a sweet tooth their dessert is just right, not overwhelmingly sweet. I really enjoyed their Flourless Chipotle Chocolate Cake and I still think two sharing one is enough. I don't think I can finish the whole thing, it's pretty rich. Most of their items on the menu are all very tasty the only problem is I'm always half full when I eat a dish. The price is pretty reasonable, just seriously wish there's more. Good service and busy and noises but not too loud. If you are looking for a chill and quiet place, this is not that quiet and slowed pace though. Worth a try though and I would come back just not my always go-to lunch/brunch place.
No comment

Delicious American/Mediterranean cafe tucked away in the west village. My friends and I were able to find a table for 4 on a Saturday morning for brunch only after a 10 minute wait (is this even NYC?!) because of the fast and efficient turnover of customers in the cafe. Their servers were polite, friendly and offered to explain the specials of the day (eggs Benedict with beet sauce). Being a fan of the traditional tomato base shashouka, I tried the green tomatillo shashuka with feta cheese and was not disappointed! The flavor of the green sauce blended perfected with the silky yolk of the poached eggs, topped with chunks of feta cheese on a freshly warmed slice of bread, it was perfection! The affordable price for the shashouka was nothing to laugh at especially in the west village! My friend and I shared a plate of 6 Peri Peri chicken wings, perfectly portioned to share, marinaded with a delicious blend of spice and spiciness and cooked tenderly! The waitress even brought small plates for our table to share. Overall a fantastic experience and will recommend friends to return here for an enjoyable and wait-less weekend brunch experience in New York!
No comment

Best advice: don't go here. Any restaurant near by is better! We got a meal that has eggs,  some bad cucumber salad and a spoon of tasteless yogurt for like 20$!!!! Do not go there. Bad food , no choices and overpriced everything.

Love this place! Very cute and the food was amazing! We ordered Madame Freda which was sandwich with duck prosciutto and chicken kebab. Both was amazing especially the Madame Freda! The French fries were so good too! Love this place. And you can also make reservation for 6 people and above.
No comment

We are not usually hanging in this hood but had an appointment in the area and was hangry when finished.  We walked into JWF and sat at the bar for a quick bite. The vibe was chill and had a bistro feel. I ordered the crab cakes were amazing with lots of meat and little breading. It was accompanied with a yummy sauce.  I asked about the sauce and was told it was tomato, jalapeños and cheese sauce but it was very thin so the cheese surprised me.  My husband got the burger and was happy. It's just bun and beef with a roasted tomato. The green spicy sauce was very good. Pretty sure the fries were frozen or just not very good. Alcohol pours are slight.
No comment
No comment
No comment

It goes without saying that brunch here is fantastic, but I am here to specifically talk about the chocolate chipotle lava cake. It's a bold statement but this was honestly the BEST dessert I've ever had. You must leave room to order this!
No comment
