The staff at the Chelsea location were so friendly and professional service with free coffee to go! Food is yummy. Go, go, go to brunch spot!
Great service. You can tell that the staff take pride in their restaurant. Consistently good food and frequent coffee refills. Highly recommend!

Food was just okay. But the service? Not so good. We had to wait 20+ minutes and people who entered later were seated before us by a waiter who did not bother to check that we entered way earlier. Far too busy for the quality. Massively overrated.
No comment

Great food! Great service! I brought my 9 month old baby with a stroller. They are really nice and removed one chair from the table for our stroller. I already recommended to my friends and colleagues!! Thank you!

Service was fantastic. Very attentive even though they were packed. Love how they keep filling your water. We got seated after only a 15 minute wait which is really nice for a Saturday. I had the green shakshuka which was really good. Especially if you like cilantro.  The hot sauce on the side was excellent. I had the cold brew on tap which was very potent. Definitely got me buzzing. The cappuccino was really good. The rosewater waffle was OK. A little dry and not as flavorful as we thought it would be. It might've been better with regular maple syrup and whipped cream. Also, it needed more fruit.

We ordered jack's breakfast. It is delicious. I like the poached egg and potato. The steak is well cooked. The mint lemonade is somewhat sour, I prefer the cantaloupe juice better. Nice brunch experience.
No comment
Overhyped, but a fun breakfast option with unique food. The duck bacon was a little limp and the portions were a little small, but I liked everything overall.

Very cute restaurant and if you go before 10am you won't have to wait in line. Green shakshuka with feta was so good but unfortunately was served lukewarm. Duck bacon was fantastic. My friend ordered the croque madame and he said it was lovely. Would come back and give this spot another try - hopefully my next dish will come to me hot and not lukewarm!
No comment

I truly only have positive things to say about this place. I've been here a few times and have always had a great experience, but this past time, and the catalyst for my review, I went by myself and I could not have had a better time. The staff was so incredibly lovely and accommodating and I truly felt special. It's rare to have that at any, let alone incredibly popular, restaurant in NYC. I should have taken pictures but all I can say is, get the Peri Peri Chicken and Flourless Chocolate Cake. Many other menu items are wonderful, but these will not disappoint.

Second time here and I love it. Super chill, server & host are super nice and were very accommodating with my baby stroller. Food comes out hot and too perfect to be true. Great atmosphere, quick service, and THE BATHROOM (smells so good and super clean!) plus in my book. Food was so good. I had the prego roll - amazing. Great Gem in Chelsea!

Jacks wife Freda is awesome! The vibe is cozy and quaint. We sat at the bar and had a great mimosa! Gennifer was our bartender and she was the best! She had a constant smile and was kind and personable. She treated us to Malva cake, a slice of heaven, and you must save room for it if you come here for food! 100 percent would recommend it here the food and staff is out of this world!
Delicious! Second location in Chelsea was just as good as the first. Amazing breakfast bowl with quinoa and avocado, loved it! Great Bloody Mary too :)
I went for brunch- there are definitely better places to have a fun brunch. Overall the food was good, but small portions for the cost. It's a high end brunch option so don't get too drunk here

We had an amazing dining experience last Friday night. The food was fantastic and the service was nothing less than perfect. Kaitlyn(sp?) was a wonderful server and she took such good care of us. This is the first time I've been to this restaurant and I was truly blown away

10/10!!! We celebrated my husbands bday on 1/2/21 and they could not have been nicer or more fun. We had to wait about 20 min at the start to be seated but there were seats for waiting and our entire party wasn't even there so it wasn't an issue. Both the owner and waitress noticed and started our meal off with complimentary fries and Prosecco. Throughout the evening we had attentive service, stayed warm with heaters, we're given space to take our time and enjoy drinks and at the end they offered shots with our dessert. It's always appreciated when a restaurant goes above and beyond but to give away free items during a pandemic is incredible. We thank you and will be back!
The food here is not that great. I wouldn't come back here. The challah and green shakshuka was a small portion.
No comment

Amazing brunch. The food is fresh, peanut allergy friendly, and so SO yummy. I will be sure to come back. The breakfast sandwich is not on the menu but it was amazing. The duck bacon was different but so delicious.

I ordered an order for my office lunch on caviar. Placed the order at 11:30 for a 12:45 delivery. The food arrived soggy, cold and damaged. The restaurant is only 2-3 blocks away. The food could not have gotten that old and gross within that amount of time and was sitting there. The food was not made correctly to the order. I was charged extra for bacon and sides that I didn't receive. The food was very disappointing. I wouldn't recommend spending this much money for low quality food.
No comment
Very good restaurant. Grey Dog and Westville are arguably better. But this is a great local restaurant -- meaning local to the area but also local to the block.

I wish I could give this place 10 stars!!! I am a big fan of the other JWF locations, and being a waiter myself I'm always impressed with their vibe. However, my new favorite is 8th Ave location. I stopped into their new location and I was welcomed by a warm and inviting staff. I felt very welcome from the moment I walked through the door. The staff is excellent, every single one of them made eye contact and said hello at one point or another. The food is always terrific!!! I had grilled halloumi with grapes. It was incredible. Thank you for a great lunch experience. I can't wait to return!!!
No comment

A friend had recommended this restaurant since we were staying nearby and we were very happy with our dishes. The menu is diverse enough to have great options but not overwhelming. We were a little underwhelmed with the size of the drinks (hence the 4 stars) but we were here for the food so it wasn't a huge deal. The place is cozy and the service was good. Great little spot if you are in the neighborhood.

1st time here but not the last.  I went solo. I'm a woman of a certain age...the age when you get ignored and seated by the kitchen.  I did sit by the kitchen however, I was treated like a VIP.  Everyone asked me how I was doing, refilled my coffee cup (delicious coffee) and stopped to chat.  My food was delicious and served in a timely manner.  I've never seen a more hospitable crew.  My server EJ was attentive as was Marco and Mina and others whose names I didn't get.  I highly recommend this place.  It's wk 1 for them and it was packed but making a customer feel at home and welcome is such a nice quality that I will be going back and telling friends to go there as well.  thank you  JWF for a lovely brunch

I went here for dinner on a Wednesday with a friend and it was the perfect amount of casual and comfortable. It's well lit and was pretty quiet around 6 when we got there. By 7 when we left, most tables were full and there was a wait. The wine, burger and chicken sandwich were pretty good. I don't think I'd order the burger again (felt like a small portion with a regular bun I could buy at the store) but my friend enjoyed the chicken sandwich.
No comment

Came back to town to visit and catch a few shows. Once you live in New York City no matter where you move to you always miss it. Was looking for a restaurant and found Jack's which I've never tried before. When I arrived there was no seats outside and it is a beautiful day outside And my favorite past time when I lived here was people watching so I didn't want to be trapped inside. The owner, Maya, offered me a free drink at the bar while I waited for the table and then continue to check on me and create a more personal connectivity as she said the human contact while I waited. I was very pleasantly pleased with the level of concern and attention for one single person ordering a meal when they had groups waiting. Besides the fact that I've never had customer service as good as this, the food was amazing. I had their sirloin and a few glasses of wine, I would highly recommend this place to anyone who is either visiting or lives in the city. It is A neighborhood gem.

Seated right away outdoors around 11am. Super nice staff. Jack's breakfast was amazingly yummy, tender and great value. $15 for that tiny size of roasted cauliflower appetizer is ridiculous though. $7 for cold brew was easier to swallow but come onnnnnn

Excellent customer service. Fabulous menu. Clean and pleasant atmosphere. Matzah ball soup like your grandmothers.... eggplant baguette great flavors with fresh ingredients. Ask to look at their cookbook while you wait.... in the beginning it tells their story.  Loved it. Will be back.
No comment

Jack's Wife Freda is pretty good, but I don't know that it's worth a super long wait - we dined here for a Saturday brunch, and were lucky to only have a 5-10 min wait around 10:30 AM. The location is very aesthetic and food not bad, but not quite worth the prices to me (almost $20 for a sandwich - Eggplant Baguette - w/ tax and tip). I am happy to pay a steep price for brunch, but it would ideally be for more food. My friends enjoyed their meals (Green Shakshuka, Mediterranean Breakfast, Rosewater Waffle) - I had hoped to order Maya's Breakfast Bowl and substitute egg due to an allergy, but with an upcharge for replacement my meal would have been almost $25.

Wow. Just wow. Came in for take out stayed for the amazing service. Phenomenal team that's actually focused on customer experience. Gwen and josh were the most unexpected amazing hosts- I decided to enjoy my takeout in House and what a good decision. If you want to feel like a human again and also have amazing food ( burger was 5 star) come here. Now.

My husband and I worked in the service industry for over 12 years and we know what good service means. This place provides outstanding service. Amazing staff! From the moment we crossed the door, we heard a welcoming "Hello!". We saw smile after smile. Food was delicious but the staff!! They were extraordinary!! Keep it up!

Nice place with really good comfort food ! Had the green shakshuka that was very interesting, very flavorful and not at all spicy (for those who doesn't like spicy food). The challah toast was delicious and they have great French fries. It's a good spot to have a nice breakfast type of food al day long !

We had a wonderful experience at Jack's Wife Freda today. The food was terrific - I loved the Madame Freda, and we all enjoyed the flourless chipotle chocolate cake - by far the best and lightest flourless cake I have ever had.  The staff was friendly and attentive. Overall a great experience - I would highly recommend Jack's Wife Freda!
Such a great brunch experience! The food was amazing and the staff was very accommodating for our big group. Thank you guys!

The people and the food here are absolutely amazing! The atmosphere is so warm and the whole staff makes you feel like you're at home. The poached eggs with grilled tomota and haloumi is delicious. I will be back every time I visit NY.
I love the duck bacon and poached eggs. The sugar packets are so cute. I love the ambiance here. Best brunch spot!

This is probably the restaurant I feel the most comfortable at - at home even. When I think about the general idea of a restaurant, memories of here come to mind. The platonic ideal of cute, cozy manhattan restaurants. It's not too cheap or too pricey, too stuffy or too modern, too casual or too glamorous, too cramped or too open - it's not too anything. It's just right. Cocktails - great. Food - all of its good. Service - never been bad. Price - just right for what you get. Always happy when I leave this place. Probably each thing you can get here can be slightly more perfectly executed, and probably is, somewhere else in the city, but almost no restaurant can do each thing this one does so nearly perfectly all at once. If you're on the fence, definitely go. The one and only problem is that you will not be the first to discover this place - it can be crowded with a decent wait on popular nights, but just plan accordingly. Note: only ever been to the 8th ave location.

I've been here for dinner twice and both times have been fantastic! Even when it's super busy the front staff always make sure you're attended to and comfortable. Amazing food and cocktails and there's always something new to try! Last night I had Kaitlin as our server and she was great, very attentive and sweet. There was an error on our receipt and Kaitlin and the manager took care of it immediately and even gave us a complimentary round of rose! I will definitely be back!
Cold burger. I expect something else for a burger of $20, at least lettuce. Very cheap wine that they offer at that place if guests bring that wine at my dinner parties I will be disappointed.

Great food - however service was not great. We came on a Monday morning when it wasn't busy and even then, they gave our table away to a group who was after us. They also forgot our drink and sat our party of 3 in a corner when the restaurant was fairly empty. Thankfully the food made up for our experience.

Pretty basic in terms of some of the items on the menu but I got the eggplant and lam lasagne - it was really good. Kinda on the expensive side but good. The beer dip was also good. Nice staff. Expensive. But some of their menu items were kinda basic for the price.

I was there tonight and had a lovely dinner at the bar. The bartender Lucas was attentive and kind.  The manager Mark, extended himself and helped me when I had forgotten my leftovers.  This restaurant will definitely be a neighborhood favorite.

Delicious, cozy, trendy place for brunch!  Our waiter was awesome and the menu is unique.  I tried the watermelon juice and the Madame Freda; both were amazing!  The duck prosciutto was delicious, and the eggs were cooked exactly how I wanted them.  We would definitely go back again for brunch or for dinner!
Great vibe and great service - fantastic brunch place. Food was very good as well, and it's in a cool spot
No comment

I came here for brunch last weekend. There was what was clearly a beard hair baked into my madame freda, which I showed the waiter. It took more than 25 minutes for me to receive a new breakfast and then I was still charged for the item.

My husband and I recently visited Jack's Wife Freda and our experience was simply divine. We had the kindest server, James who truly made it worth the second trip back. He suggested the Madame Freda and it's a must have on the dinner menu. Great environment, would 10/10 recommend.
Ordered Greek salad with chicken.  For the price the food was mediocre.  Chicken was bland.  Nice ambience.   Order came out fast.  I'd say save your money and go someplace.  Nothing special .

II have not yet eaten in this place, and that's b/c it's impossible to get any information from them - eg are they open today; do they deliver to my address;  etc.  They refer me to Caviar for delivery - but the items we want are marked "available later" or something like that.  So we still can't figure out how to order from Caviar and why this restaurant doesn't even answer its phone.  So here we are - starving, and no matzoh ball soup, or anything else for that matter.  It's absurd.
Overpriced, miniscule brunch portions, packed. If it looks Instagrammable, they will come I spose.

I would have given this restaurant another star if it wasn't for the incompetence of our waiter, Gerald. He split the bill for our party and severely undercharged one member of our party. Since we were honest, we waited for him to come back. We waited 15 minutes. When we pointed this out, he didn't even thank us. Next time, we will just walk out, The food was fine and the drinks were very good. But the end of this dinner completely ruined the experience. The food is average and overpriced and the service is mediocre at best.

Brand new Jacks Wife Freda (third one downtown). Different vibe than SOHO - brighter larger. Food is consistently good. Service is excellent - staff very friendly. I had the chicken prego- chicken was flavorful and perfectly cooked. Drinks were excellent- my wife loved her Bloody Mary. It is a bit noisy and crowded so be prepared for that.

awful service. not recommended for families with kids as the servers are highly impatient and just want to get as many parties seated and then kick them out even when they had not finished eating their food.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Relatively new restaurant - found out about it through a review in the New Yorker so had give it a try on our latest trip to NY.  On a weekend night it wasn't too busy which was actually a good thing (reservations can be made on Yelp).  Mid size dining room with nice modern decor, warmly lit with lights in red shades, well spaced tables.  Laminated bilingual menu with pix for some of the dishes.  We had kung pao shrimp (very good), fried string beans (excellent), twice cooked pork (not bad but a bit bland, being a less spicy dish), appetizers - fungus (black wood ears - very tasty) and chili bean jelly (ok), pork buns (in Chinese it's easily mistaken as soup dumplings which they are not). For dessert, jelly in brown sugar syrup (could be a bit more flavorful but quite refreshing). Overall a great addition to the neighborhood. Online reservation accepted which is convenient.
No comment
Very authentic szechuan food (a rarity for this neighborhood). Very unique menu options as well as excellent service. We will be back!
No comment

This authentic Sichuan restaurant is an extraordinary find. The food is fresh and delicious, and servings are typically generous. The staff is attentive and gracious, the restrooms are clean and spacious, and the humble interior is delightfully free of piped in music, allowing for conversation, which invariably will turn to how special each dish is. From a simple dish, like cucumber in soy sauce, to a more complex eggplant with hot pepper, to a whole grilled fish, every dish elevates this type of cooking to a new level. Run --don't walk -- to see for yourself.

This restaurant is incredible. We got the sliced beef in pickled veg soup and it was one my favorite dishes I've had this year. The flavors were perfectly sour and savory, complimenting the beef really well. We also got the sliced fish in chili oil and that was really delicious as well. It was not too spicy, and super enjoyable. Will have to come back here to try more dishes!
No comment

The food here is pretty solid for the location but you can probably find better in Chinatown. The fish was definitely my favorite dish. The fish was very fresh and flavorful. The cold jelly noodles were disappointing as the noodles were hard and didn't have any bouncy jelly texture at all.  The sauce on the jelly noodles just tasted like lao gan ma (canned chili sauce you can purchase at Chinese supermarkets). The beef tongue was decent and the beef with sour soup was also good. Overall, a solid 3/5.
Authentic Chinese food. Ordered takeout for Sichuan Style Spicy Fried Chicken and it is the best I've ever had in NYC.
So good and so authentic! Did I mention the portions were huge? A nice thing to see in these times of inflation. Would definitely come back.
No comment
No comment

I love spicy food and accidentally stopped by here, got spicy chicken, pan fried beef and veggie fried rice than I went back again after a week, I think that tells you enough. Loved every bite only thing is after spicy chicken some will not have fun doo doo if u know what I mean. Going back soon
No comment
No comment

What a great addition to the neighborhood. No frills, just great sichuan food. We tried the fish fillet pot in chili oil, twice cooked pork, dry fried string beans, and mapo tofu. The winner of the night was the twice cooked pork - crispy veggies, tender pork, not over-sauced, yum. The string beans were excellent - mouth-numbing tastiness and not soggy like other places. Fish pot was ginormous; the fish was flaky and seasoned well. Mapo tofu was the least memorable but still a good version.
No comment

I stopped in to this place after work. I was exhausted. I just wanted a glass of wine and some good Chinese food. This place delivered. Nice size tables and very spacious restaurant. Attentive service. My white wine relaxed me after a rough day at work and my eggplant and string bean dish was delicious!  Hot and sour soup was good too. I ate alone and did not feel self conscious. I will be back!

Authentic and delicious. It can be very spicy but you can ask them to tone it down.  The staff is very accommodating.  Atmosphere is pleasant, calm (tables reasonably far apart), not hectic like a lot of the other East Village places.
Favorite Szechuan food in Manhattan / NYC by far. Will definitely be going back here.
Good food, fair prices.  I've been here a number of times.  Several restaurants in this exact location failed - I think these guys will stick around.

This place tastes horrible and is exceptionally unreasonably overpriced. I ordered chicken flower soup and it just some egg white flowing in clear water. So does baby vegetable with chicken broth, it's just clear water. Taste absolutely disgusting

One of my new favorites for fish in chili oil. This is not your cheap Chinese takeout but given where inflation has taken those prices this is a great deal. Fish is very. slightly less flavorful Cafe China / Szechuan Mountain House but for a no wait (compared to hours for Szechuan Mountain House) the decision to eat here is easy
Excellent food! Excellent spice! Excellent service! We want to work through the menu.

Had the fish in chili oil and green beans and eggplant and everything was great to have a Szechuan place this good and this close to where we live is going to be a game changer! Watch out Han dynasty!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The latest incarnation at this address is a Sichuan restaurant with food just as good as in Chinatown. We liked our ma po tofu and Sichuan dumplings in hot oil. We live nearby, so will probably go back soon.

Finally some authentic Chinese food in Gramercy!!!! We had the MOST delicious dinner made from fresh ingredients and the perfect blend of spices:  Pork Buns, Green Beans and Eggplant, and Crispy Fried Chicken - all cooked to perfection! The staff was super attentive and friendly (shoutout to Kat!) and the atmosphere had the perfect blend of clean and bright without feeling cold. So happy to welcome So Do Fun to the neighborhood!

I'm sorry we ate the food too fast to take any photos. It was extremely great food. Yeah, I said extremely great. Service was amazing. Kat was so nice! Can't say enough high praise. Will be coming back for sure.

Just had a large bday gathering and was able to try a good number of dishes - Standouts were both fish dishes - hot chilly oil and the pickled version.  Everyone loved the double cooked pork, spicy dried chicken and sliced beef tomato soup.  Portions are big and the only miss was the pan fried beef.  Service was excellent.
Szechuan mountain house is way better so idk why you would pick this place instead of walking a few extra minutes for better food

This place is a gem! We're thrilled to have a consistently delicious, friendly, Sichuan restaurant in the neighborhood. The mapo tofu dish is amazing. The hot & sour soup is great. The spicy fried chicken is fantastic. We've tried other dishes, but those are our favorites so far.
Highly recommend. Food was delicious and the ingredients seemed fresh. Not greasy at all. Food came out quickly. Reasonably priced.
Amazing food and experience. It's definitely the best and most authentic Chinese food in the area. Order the chili fish or the shredded pork with garlic sauce. Delicious!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The interior setting is nice. They aren't trying to cram in tables like so many nyc restaurants. The margherita pizza & tiramisu were good.

The food and service was great. Menu had a good variety of options. We had the Tartufo (truffle mushroom) pizza as an appetizer and for mains we got the Squid Ink pasta and a mushroom pasta. Both were very good. The space is beautiful and romantic which is one of the reasons I booked it, but it was very loud in there, which I know they can't really control. Maybe because it was a Friday night.
Good food and service. Nice modern Italian food plus gourmet pizza. Good drinks. Beautiful atmosphere.

My niece asked for Italian so I yes, tou guessed it, ... I YELPED italian restaurants near me and came upon this place. It was a 20 min commfron my home and accessible by public transportation. Upon entry we were greeted by the host and immediately seated. Our server went over the menu and made recommendations. Tuna tartare was the suggesi happily tried. It was divine! We also had ravioli and ragu pasta (cant recall the exact name). The niece had mango for sorbet which was the best we've had. Our waiter said it was imported from Italy. I'm just happy I didnt have to fly to italy for this greatness. In summary... delicious food, excellent service, beautiful ambiance and decor. Not cheap but worth the coins.
No comment
No comment
While menu feels limited, every dish is delicious. Impeccable service and ambiance is classic and chic.
No comment
No comment
Excellent food and excellent service, beautiful restaurant, great new addition to downtown Brooklyn!
No comment
No comment

All the food here is very good. Beautiful restaurant too. Great place for a date of dinner with friends. We ordered pizza, pasta and apps there was nothing we ate that we didn't enjoy. You can't go wrong visiting here. The dough on the pizza was perfect. Also try the steak tar tar you won't regret it!

I had my birthday dinner here last night & it was such a great night all around I had to highlight all of the details. The ambiance, the decor, perfect for a celebration & can definitely see coming back for an intimate date night. The staff are so attentive, polished and friendly! Marco the manager was memorable, he was so present & charming and clearly was invested in making sure our group had a great time from seating comfortably, enjoying food, and having top notch timely service. Our waiter Vinny and a few others that checked on us were all so pleasant and accommodating. Now the food! Everything literally everything was delicious. Presentation, temperature, taste, nothing was lacking. We tried so much of the menu and I left feeling like I just have to come back and try more. Highly recommend this lovely gem of a restaurant. Thank you guys for a great birthday evening!

I luckily live pretty close by, which has allowed us to order for pickup and get their food very quickly and have it still be very fresh. Last time we ordered we got the Amatriciana and the ragu with a side of meatballs. Pasta and all the ingredients were very fresh. Very tasty and hit the spot. Prices are reasonable and their pizzas look delicious too. Need to try dining in one of these days.

A gem!! So happy we stumbled on this place for brunch!! The food exceeded our expectations.  Everything was absolutely delicious!! The waitstaff was very attentive, and the vibe was exactly what we needed.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This restaurant is a gem.  From the walk in greeting all the way to the service and food.  When I walked in I was greeted by a lovely host.  I didn't have reservations but they accommodated me and my daughter.  We were greeted by staff and our waiter who was awesome.  I ordered my happy hour drink which was a blackberry Margarita, yum .  I ordered the fried calamari, with shrimp and zucchini which was perfect.  I had the ink squid pasta with seafood and my daughter had the cacio e pepe, she loved it.  She also had the lavender soda which she loved.  For dessert we shared the torta al Cioccolato,, the different flavors in this dessert was amazing, highly recommended.  Looking for ambiance this is the place, full ultimate experience.  I will definitely be back.
No comment
No comment
Interior is gorgeous! The food was good, we got the cacio e pepe, some other pasta dish and a margherita. The drinks were not good we all left them after a few sips.
No comment
No comment

If you are looking for ambiance and a romantic dinner than this is the place to be in Brooklyn. The Interior design is flawless, the different mixture of lighting is amazing! There is a great selection of wine and tasty pizza. The wait staff were on top of it our wine glasses and water were never close to empty!

Had an excellent dinner here last night before seeing a play at BAM. Shared the beet salad, Loreto pizza, and Cacio e Pepe with my dinner companion. All delicious and served with just the right timing in between. We never felt rushed or like we were waiting for our next course.   We each had cocktails we thoroughly enjoyed - a Negroni for me made with mezcal, and my friend ordered Sophia's Temptation  - a lovely concoction with pineapple infused gin and cassis.  We were too full for dessert. The waitstaff was friendly and very helpful and knew a lot about the food and beverages on the menu. It was nice to see that they didn't look rushed or overworked. I will definitely come back here again so I can try more things from the creative but also accessible menu.
No comment

I've visited here multiple times. And I love this restaurant. I was attracted by its interior design when I first saw this restaurant. I love how the lighting design at this restaurant. After, I came in and was impressed with how good the food is. The pasta, pizza, appetizers, and desserts are all amazing. Recommend their affogato, fritto misto, squid ink fettuccine, prosciutto pizza.  The most important thing to know is you do not need to wait in a line to be seated for good food. Good environment, lovely servers, fantastic food, and no need to wait for dining. Where else to find a restaurant like Loreto in NY? This is a great place for friends and family. you can't go wrong visiting here.
The restaurant definitely lived up to the hype. The decor, service, atmosphere and food were all amazing.

We've had two really good dinners here prior to shows at TFANA.  The decor is lovely, the food is tasty, portions are generous, and the service overall is attentive. I highly recommend the pasta dishes; last night I had a bucatini with guanciale, which was a special and is a must order for future visits. I didn't love the pizza husband ordered, but he clearly did because he ate the entire thing. I do wish there was a simple salad on the menu.
No comment

Great food. Super friendly and attentive staff (no need to wave to get anyone's attention; five different people would check on how we were doing). Also, great food. The peach pizza with ricotta was delicious. Will return!
Solid appetizers and pasta; generous pours of wine; friendly service; nice outdoor dining setup.

I came here for a dinner party yesterday and the space was amazing! The food was good. I had their pasta which was thick and solid, and I had their branzino and pan seared chicken.  John the bartender was amazing! I would definitely visit again
No comment

Such amazing atmosphere, food, service. Everything that we ordered was delicious. You have to order the polenta, I could have eaten the whole plate and I don't even really like polenta. The polenta was amazing  can't wait to go back
No comment
No comment

While I've only been here for drinks and dessert, I rave about this place and it's because of the lovely bartender James! You can tell he's passionate about mixology and continues to update the cocktail menu as he discovers new concoctions. Excited to try the oat milk espresso martini during brunch
No comment
No comment
No comment

New restaurant that is still getting their flow established. Super cute and stylish interiors. We ordered a few pasta dishes and my boyfriend think he ate a bad clam. Would come back to try other dishes but wouldn't try the pasta again. The service was very slow but friendly and professional.

If you are in need of an excellent restaurant near BAM then you must visit Loreto Kitchen. I stumbled upon Loreto after making a purchase at the Apple store. I walked in and I couldn't believe how fabulous the space was. I grabbed a bar stool, ordered some wine, and slowly became enthralled with the space. After ordering I noticed that an old friend was working at Loreto. Marco Chirico who worked at Enoteca is the GM at Loretto. Marco guided me thru the menu and pointed me to excellent wine's. The Steak Tartar was fabulous, as was the Livio Feluga Pinot Grigio. Marco paired my next course with an excellent Barbera. I was not particularly impressed with the Linguine with Clams. The Chef was stingy with  Clams as well as with  Clam juice. I plan to return to Loreto in the near future, and I hope that the Chef will correct the problem.
No comment
Tummy pre theater option. Great bar. Tasty pizzas.  And fun staff.  Highly recommend.
No comment

Had to plan a quick business dinner and this lovely and elegant Italian restaurant was nearby.  I have walked by this establishment many times but have never dined.  Although we did not have a reservation we requested to dine inside and was quickly seated to our delight.  The hostess was very friendly and welcoming.  The servers and waiter was attentive and well spoken.  The appetizers were few and included lots of meat options which was fine so we opted for the calamari.  Truthfully it was not that special.  I ordered a peach Bellini which was refreshing.  I had One of their specials for the night which was gnocchi pesto and my business date ordered spinach and feta cheese ravioli. Both of the dishes was delicious and mouthwatering. We had room to spare and I definitely wanted to try one of their desserts and I immediately ordered the tiramisu. It was well made and was sized perfectly.  Lastly, the decor was classy and elegant.
Great food, drinks, ambiance & impeccable service! (Thank you Feliciano!) We will definitely be back soon.

Loreto exceeded my expectations. From ambience to the actual food. I must admit there were a few discrepancies that tainted my meals with them but those reasons are minuscule to the food. The first thing I must say is that they have the best prosciutto I've had in a while. It melts in your mouth like butter. Definitely the one thing on the menu I've had each time I've been there and it doesn't disappoint. The next best thing I would say is the Amatriciana, it was a beautiful experience, that dish. Apart from that the quick bites like the Polpette, the Barbabietola and the Tartufata pizza were just great! The pizza, I just didn't like how it was served, half way it got soggy due to the way it was plated. It should be served on something aerated to allow the crust to set properly. The air conditioning at the back on the left side, should be avoided in summer due to it being too strong, chilling your food faster. And on two occasions my servers and waiter forgot to place bread for the table. The drinks are solid and I repeat my visits regardless. I believe anyone dining will definitely enjoy.

Great staff with a chef problem. $15 for one piece of bread with a brunch order of French Toast. But then again, it's my fault for ordering "French" anything at an Italian restaurant. The Eggs Benedict and Pasta Carbonara looked beautiful but were delivered luke warm at best. Proper plating and portioning would have fixed our experience. We offered feedback but were told that French Toast was meant to be an add on and not an individual dish. Most of our friends order it as their whole meal; they would have left hungry (and underwhelmed) if we had invited them. Everything with their professional waitstaff seemed on point, but sadly they were not empowered by the poor decisions of whoever controls the output of the kitchen.
No comment
No comment

Wow wow WOW, outstanding ambiance, decor, service and the FOOD!!!  Everything was absolutely delicious!  Started with pizza , the gem lettice salad with  was over the top, followed by cacio pepe, TO DIE FOR and the Branzino was one  of the best ive EVER had. Completed out meal with a lovely macchiato, chocolate cake and grappa!!!!! Soooo excited to come back to try more of what the chef has to offer! Just terrific!!!!
Great place for a date or late-night drink. Fancy and very adult. Tasty pizza. Friendly and attentive staff.

I was searching for an Italian spot for dinner the other night and came across Loreto. The service was just as incredible as the food. Now to talk about the food. My friend and I shared the Fritto Mistri (Calamari with Shrimp and Zucchini) which was accompanied by a marinara sauce. After we had shared the Barbabietola which was a delicious beet salad. We also indulged in the Loreto pizza which was perfect size for sharing, the Burrata was creamy. For dessert we couldn't decide so we shared the Tiramisu and the Cheesecake Pudding, both a 10 out of 10. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a lovely date night or business meeting.

I literally paid $23 for some noodles and garlic. I ordered take out and the image of the pasta with clams showed several clams (7-8) and good portion of pasta. I ordered and received what's in the image - enough said. The pasta was just ok, kind of tasteless and had some strange grit that made it very unappetizing to eat. The three clams I got were sandy.

We had a family brunch at Loreto and were extremely pleased. The restaurant is beautiful, the service was excellent, and the food was delicious. We will definitely look forward to returning to Loreto!!

The food and the vibe were the best I've had in the neighborhood, hands down. Although the wait for service was long, I've found that to be more common right now as restaurants struggle with staffing. Hopefully they're paying their staff fairly! The servers were friendly and knowledgeable. I had the Orecchiette Broccoli di Rabe, which I loved. My buddy had the pizza, which rivaled Robertas. I'm going back to have a pizza myself. The restaurant is beautiful and overall we had a great time.

Went here last minute with a friend on a Sunday night and was blown away by the meal- my tortellini soup was so simple yet so good, I could tell the chicken broth was made fresh, I could drink it plain. The desert too was incredible, the chocolate was rich but the fluffy texture made it taste so light. Head an after-dinner americano and was given complimentary shots of limoncello. Would love eat here again!!

Ashley was the best server ever. The food was delicious and amazing portions. Brunch options are fantastic - our party ordered 4 cheeseburgers and they ate them all. The zucchini frittata is tops, too.
Beautiful new restaurant in Downtown Brooklyn. Good service and the food is delicious.

I'm so glad this place opened up. The food, service and ambiance were all amazing. It's very hard to come by a restaurant that checks off all the boxes. We got the the burrata, eggplant (melanzane), brodo di pollo and endive salad as appetizers and shared the margherita and caccio & pepe, ravioli and mushrooms. All 10/10. The tiramisu was the best I had ever and the deconstructed cheesecake was unreal. Will definitely be back!
Had an amazing time there, food is great, service was excellent, restaurant is very modern and sparkling clean. Right next to BAM! Will b back !

This establishment did an amazing job taking care of my niece and friends for her high school graduation on 06/27. My niece said they had a blast and the food was absolutely amazing. Thank you to the entire Loreto staff for doing such a great job making my niece and friends feel special.

Wonderful experience after seeing the film at Bam. The food, service, and ambience were all first rate. Eggplant appetizer was delicious and splendidly lighter than most of its kind. The cacao Pepe was on point as well. Wine list was not copious but their selections were more than adequate. Service was attentive and friendly.

After a show at BAM, we went to dinner at Loreto. Beautiful ambiance, but the food was over priced and just not great. The standout for the meal was our appetizers--a beet salad ($14). My companion's caponata was just ok ($24). This foreshadowed trouble. Although pasta seems easy, it's not. My companion's squid in pasta ($35) was a tad overcooked and the and over sauced, so it overwhelmed the briney taste squid ink taste in the pasta. My Vongole ($24) had 8 of the most minuscule clams, and the pasta had no real distinction. We had to ask for bread (which was delicious) twice. The wine was good- a nice Nebbiolo ($56). Not great, for a total of $210. Very sweet waiter. Probably a good place for a pizza and wine after a show, but stay away from the pricey pasta dishes.
Amazing service and food!! Ambiance is amazing and on the perfect block. Had the cacio Pepe and appetizer!
Not a fan of their outdoor seating. Sighted rats coming from the public seating area next door.
Great Italian food, great service and atmosphere, and a very welcome addition to the neighborhood.

GO HERE! Loreto was amazing in service, food, ambiance, and hospitality. Our waiter Vinny was so kind and helpful and has generations of experience in the business. The food was exceptional in a  Great Brooklyn local neighborhood. We tasted a few of their great pastas, loved them all. Wether on a date or with your family Loreto will absolutely serve you with their best!

Loreto is a great addition to the neighborhood! Ambiance was great with plenty of outdoor seating, and service was outstanding. There was never a point when we were looking for the waiter. Food came out very quickly. We ordered the meatballs, Loreto pizza, and the ravioli, all of which were very solid. Dessert was the highlight of the night though. We ordered the chocolate hazelnut cake. It was a thin slice of cake, with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, covered in caramel sauce, and it was so delicious!
No comment
No comment

Just had one of the worse experiences of my life and this restaurant from a very rude waiter. When I reported to the management. They said he has never acted that way before. Basically they took his side and said I was lying. Is it a crime being black in NY? What a shame!!!!!!!!!! I will never go to this place and will never advise anyone of colour to come to this place. It is not friendly if you are non white.
No comment

Thanks a lots to yelp for recommending Loreto Italian Kitchen & Bar. Extremely friendly, fantastic menu items & atmosphere. Fantastic food, Prosciutto Di Parma was terrific without a doubt. This Prosciutto Di Parma was done just perfectly. Service was outstanding and every one working here was very nice and hospitable. We can not wait to go back.
Food a drinks were delicious. A little bit on the pricier end for my taste but totally worth it. The service and environment were quality. The ambiance makes it a great place for a date

Once you finally get seated, you'll be fine. The food is delicious with a depth of flavor that lets you know a chef who loves their craft is in the kitchen.  Once you finally get seated,  the wait staff is attentive and seem to be happy you arrived. Attentive with the right amount of check ins. But try to avoid sitting on the highway-- the row of seats in the middle, the fast passing staff to both sides of you can be daunting.  Other than that, the atmosphere is pleasant, comfortable and modern, high ceilings say food cathedral and warm tones feel cozy.

From the service to the food to the ambiance everything was amazing!  They were even sweet enough to give us a Tiramisu on the house for our anniversary. I highly recommend this place- you will not be disappointed and we will definitely be back!

Dont think about it twice! Loreto is upscale and approachable. The staff and the manager Al are incredible. They greet you with white glove service and make sure you're happy until the very end. It's not fake, it's authentic. This restaurant cares about delivering a luxury non-pretentious experience to guests. They treat you like family and the ambience is on par with what you would find at 1 Hotels or a European supper club. And I haven't even started taking about their food. Let's just say their customer service is nothing compared to the quality and taste of their food. 10 out of 5 stars! Highly recommend! I'll be back!

Such a lovely addition to the neighborhood.  The service was fantastic, the food was lovely.  We had the beet salad, calamari and pasta.  Both pasta were fresh and the sauces we one point.  Give them a try, you won't regret it, we'll try the pizza next time they looked great.
An absolute divine experience. The decor, the food, the cocktails, the service -- exquisite.
No comment
K, well, this place is amazing and that's all I've got to say about that. You would be so glib not to try.
Great food, drinks and service, not to mention beautiful restaurant! Highly recommended!

My friends and I had a lovely dinner at Loreto. We ate inside on a Monday evening. The restaurant was busy enough but not too crowded. We started with delicious cocktails- highly recommend the spicy margaritas! The bartender, Eddie is a true mixologist! Our waiter, Vincenzo happily greeted us and made us want to order everything off the menu. He was knowledgeable about the preparation and flavor profile of each dish. He made it a true fine dining experience, changing out our utensils and plates for each course and splitting/serving our food. Everything we ordered was delicious- fried eggplant, pizzas, cacio e peppe, tagliatelle, pork tenderloin- flavorful and cooked to perfection! Shout out to the amazing chefs! We can't wait to go back!

Great location, great service even though they were understaffed and we were waiting for everything, they did it with a smile and since the Rona, every restaurant is understaffed. The food is very mediocre and the prices are pretty high for such mediocrity. I know the place is new so we will go back at some point to check it out again.

10/10! What a fantastic new restaurant - exactly what the neighborhood was missing! We had the most amazing evening at Loreto. The ambiance was perfect - the decor is very well done.  Our waiter Vinny was superb - the service here is unparalleled! The cocktails were impressive and creative. And the food was amazing. Our favorites were the cacio e pepe and the chocolate torte with salted caramel! The desserts are worth it! Can't wait to come back to this restaurant!

What a wonderful dinner this was! I came here with a few friends and it was an incredible experience. Vincenzo was our waiter and he was AMAZING! Took his time explaining the menus to our table and really was spot on with everything he recommended. We had a bunch of pastas and meatballs it was so all so delicious. The cocktails were spectacular! We had spicy margaritas and they were delicious. I highly recommend going to Loreto for a fun ambiance  and delicious! Will be back
Great new spot.  Went for brunch then back again for dinner.  Amazing food, nice attentive staff, and all round nice experience
Had an amazing experience last night. Everything from the food, which was exceptional, the service was excellent and the ambiance is welcoming and charming. Will definitely be back!

We had a double date here and everything was just perfect: the food and portions, the atmosphere and vibe. Wine list has good options and deserts are very tasty. Save some space for their desserts! I really enjoyed everything. Looking forward to come back again.

Delicious! It's a new restaurant so we wanted to sample everything and every item was great: pizza, pasta, pork entree, even the salad was delicious. We did outdoor dining on the sidewalk because of COVID but the indoor seating looks really nice too. Recommend for date night or just a good dinner out!
Loved this new find. The food was very fresh and delicious. Had the most satisfying and tastiest Tiramisu. The service is awesome. The staff is polite. Definitely coming back soon!
This is a beautiful place, the service was just as great as the food. Our host Al was amazing i would definitely recommend and will be there again myself in the future.

My experience at Loreto was nothing short of amazing. The host greeted my friend and me with a warm welcome. The ambiance of this restaurant is incredible. Perfectly lit, warm and cozy atmosphere with minimalist, boho decor. Minimalist deep house music played in the background at an appropriate level adding to the calming, laid back environment. We started off with two delicious glasses of wine. Next was the beef tartare served with two large toasts. Very good, but could have used a quail egg on top in my opinion. The radicchio salad was very nice. Lastly was the mushroom pizza which was also on point. The manager, Al, and our waiter, James, were super friendly. They attended to us enough without being overwhelming. Our tiramisu dessert was our delicious end to the dinner. Overall, this was a great experience. It felt like a pre-covid dinner and brought a little bit of normalcy back in our lives. We will definitely be coming back. Thank you Loreto!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was incredible and I feel like this place is not getting the hype it should be. We tried the muhamarra dip, Lebanese chicken tacos, the lamb baklava and the lobster manti. My least favorite was the manti - it was cold, the portion felt really small and it wasn't that exciting to me but my friend loved it. Everything else we had was amazing and very different. Not what you typically think of for Mediterranean. Music was a bit too loud and service was slow but if you're looking for great food and cute decor - this place is a great option...I think they're going for a lounge and party vibe at night so don't eat super late if you're not into that.

Reyna in the New York outpost of Reyna in Toronto. A simply beautiful space with a great vibe, Reyna is much more of a club than a restaurant. The best food are the smaller plates. The entrees are actually large platters for a group. The drinks are great. Dress in black and you will feel right at home.
No comment
Amazing location and design! Drink recipes were to die for and the food just as great
No comment
No comment
Great food and the drinks are so unique and fun! Beautiful atmosphere and would totally go back again :)
Absolutely stunning addition to Union Square! What an amazing opening party - couldn't get enough of the Victorian theme. Wine, drinks and food are 100! Add this to your list right now!

Absolutely stunning place, very cinematic! You can tell a lot was invested in the design, which creates an amazing 'wow' factor and cozy/warm atmosphere. The problem is, it is a restaurant, and that part was a bit neglected. We ordered a few dishes, and they were not in line with the visual quality of the restaurant. Service was good.

Beautiful new restaurant just south of Flatiron, great for a romantic date or big group before a night out. Get the Lebanese Tacos, the house made dips and the Arabic style French Fries to start - then the Paella and the Sea Bream for mains. Went with a group of girlfriends on a Thursday and they were packed, definitely recommend making a res ahead of time.
Beautiful place! And cocktails are top notch. I felt like this place a breath of a fresh air. New York needed it. Definitely coming back.
I went back again - the service and food were great! Everything came out really fast.
I heard about this place through a friend that is bicoastal. The vibe, decor, food, and overall ambiance is amazing! I highly recommend this place. Also, try the Lebanese tacos. So delicious!

Second time here and we love the food. Good Mediterranean spot. Cocktails are on the expensive side  but a good place to start the night with one or two since there is a good vibe and good food. Great spot for dinner or to grab a small bite. Definitely will be back!

Vibe was way off, staff seamed lost and untrained don't know if this place is planning on staying around but first impression for me is they are not gonna make it. Can't comment on food because it took so long I left before eating
No comment
so delicious - food was incredible, great ambience and vibes and the servers were awesome! everything we got food wise was a 10/10 and I highly recommend the dessert as well. great new spot!
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Came here for dinner on a weeknight, ate dinner at the bar. Service and atmosphere were both good. I ordered the braised short rib and it tasted more like a chuck roast. There wasn't a lot of marbling to the meat or that savory fattiness you would normally get from a short rib. The asparagus, green onions and potatoes which accompanied the meat as well as the sauce were good. @38 dollars, this was indeed an overpriced dish based on it being a chuck roast rather than a short rib.
Wonderful first time experience.  The waitress Audrey was incredible. Very knowledgeable and helpful. Her recommendation were exceptional.   I will definitely return. .
No comment

Finished our trip to NYC with a visit to Del Frisco's. We were staying across the street at The Conrad, so this was an added bonus.  The fare at Del Frisco's is representative of what you would expect from an upscale steakhouse. The steak was perfect and the entire meal was excellent from start to finish. Our waiter, Joe, was very attentive to our group without being ever present. The Cheesesteak Eggrolls were incredible! For dessert, we had the coconut creme pie and it was the perfect finish to a great meal. This isn't Applebee's or Friday's, but you won't need a coat and tie either.

This is a tough one to judge because our waitress was very friendly and was running around like crazy but for a high end restaurant we didn't have the experience I would have expected.  We ordered soup and salad to have before our steak, specifically asked for them first and yet somehow our steaks came out first and were rare instead of medium.  When the salad, soup and bread came out the soup was cold and the bread was also hard.  When we sent the soup back we were told there wasn't anything left for another bowl.  I didn't see any management walking around supporting the staff and checking on tables which is unfortunate because it's a higher end restaurant and you expect a good experience.  I would have done a 1 star but the waitress did seem to be trying.  It wouldn't be a place I would rush back to.
Decor is a little outdated but everything I ate was amazing. I suggest the wagu steak omg I'm starting to drool
No comment

Food is always great here. Great drinks. We had the crab cake and iceberg wedge for appetizer. Steak and and seared scallops for main with Asparagus and truffle Mac and cheese sides. Everything was delicious and perfectly cooked
No comment

Had an okay experience last time I was here at this location. Food was good, drinks were amazing as usual, but the experience with our manager was terrible. We had a simple request and his attitude from the beginning of our interaction was horrendous. He acted like he had better things to be doing than speaking with us. I asked him his name and he didn't want to give it but I think it was Evo or something like that. I want to give credit to our server Olga, she was very busy but still never neglected us and our bartender Brittany was the star, she checked on us even though she was behind the bar and not directly serving our table. Once she saw my family was upset with how we were spoken to, she made sure that we were taken care of the rest of our visit. Not sure if that manager had a bad day or something but you should never speak to guests how we were spoken to, especially as a Del Friscos. Absurd.
Tried giving this location another try but ugh it's so bad ! Every single thing I ordered taste like hospital food. My waitress was very sweet and friendly but oh god the food is so bad sorry

My friends and I had a good experience at Del Frisco's Grille. This was my first time at the New York location. We decided to eat outside. My food came very fast which was great but it wasn't "fresh out the oven" hot. Our waiter also forgot several requests but was friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. I'd definitely recommend the cheesesteak egg roll and the jumbo lump crab cake. They were so delicious and paired well with Norton red wine.
I did not expect such a great meal from this place. Excellent menu additions, spotless. Exceptional
No comment

For the most part,  the flavor of the food was excellent with the exception of the asparagus (not pictured) the crab cakes and calamari were amazing but the food was on the colder side of room temperature. I imagine everything thing made fresh/to order is amazing all around.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We reserved a table for 7. We arrived on time, and sat down in 3 minutes. Friendly hostee. We took some time to figure out our meals. Waiter is great and be patient. He stoped and talked to us several times during our meals. I had Beyond burger with sweet potato. Classic food. Can't go wrong with it. My coworker had shaved prime steak and ribs. Delicious food. Nice atmosphere. Sit back and relax. I will come back again.

Went on the Saturday before Valentine's Day. Was hoping that it would be a great experience.  Would've been great to give five stars but I cannot. The food was ok. Not great not bad but just ok. The waiter was very attentive and served with good timing, knew what to recommend and was familiar with then menu. He by himself was a 5 but he couldn't overcome the food or the ambiance. And by that (ambiance) I mean it would have been probably 4 star worthy but there was no heat!! NYC in February with no heat. Should've received a text warning before arriving. I could not wait to get out of there. Waiter explained the heat issues when I mentioned but that certainly was a horrible icing to a meh cake. Will not return.
No comment
No comment

Service was amazing and food was as well, server at bar or maybe a bartender with ponytail and curtly hair was super kind and attentive. Had the egg rolls which are insanely good and also the burrata. Came after a long work shift by myself and definitely got to wine down and felt like the service was super friendly, wish I got the bartenders name but people like him make this industry great! Will definitely be back to have more entrees! The food runners who brought the food also greeted me with smiles and were super kind. The spicy strawberry margarita was great, please try this place out!
No comment
No comment

I went here for a work lunch with my friend.  We each ordered the filet mignon and the Mac and cheese to share.  The filet mignon was cooked at a perfect medium rare.  I don't think it comes close to my all-time favorite of Keen's filet mignon, but it did come close.  The Mac and cheese wasn't my favorite but the strong drinks made up for it.
No comment

It's a nice place to have steaks and the outdoor sitting is truly nice in the summertime. However, I have to admit that the calamari there is even more impressive than steaks. Their staff is super friendly and attentive (think about the price... they have to, right?). Sometimes, just too attentive - they took away my plate too fast before I even finished!
I think the food was on spot and highly recommended it for anyone with distinct taste. great experience.

Ehh this was just ok. The menu was super limited so del friscos forced my hand and made me commit the cardinal sin of ordering a $20 beyond burger at a steakhouse. I been to the regular location a few times and enjoyed my meal there. But here, the menu is smaller the portions are smaller and the flavor was very non existent. My beyond burger was alright I had better impossible/ beyond meat burgers for less than that. The salmon in my Caesar salad tasted as if it was just cooked not seasoned. The best part about my meal was the fries and my cocktails, which I had about 6 and left completely sober. Service was cool but this ain't it!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My God I've never left a one star review I am so deeply embarrassed for our poor server that their manager had the audacity to not even apologize for an epic fail as far as our order was concerned the experience was so cringe.... We sat down at 8:15 and walked out at 10:16 and I didn't even eat my food in the restaurant absolutely embarrassing they need a new team and new management.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Not what it used to be. This used to be my favorite place in the area before Covid but things have changed. Upon entering the hostess was rude and uninterested. Maybe a bad day but a terrible first impression. Our server Zory was great- attentive and friendly! Our food was just ok. We had the steakhouse salad and tuna. Maybe they are still short staffed but there was no manager touch and food was slow compared to before.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Good service, nice lunch crowd.  Steak san with good au jus and mild horseradish.  Side salad with light vinaigrette.
No comment
I enjoyed the ambiance, the food was good. I thought it would be packed but it was very low key . The perfect margarita was amazing !
No comment

i came here last night with my boyfriend and it was such a great atmosphere! the waitress was super nice to us and our food was delicious! we both got the 8oz filet mignon but it was a bit medium-well. we asked for medium and it was more cooked than pink - no biggie still delicious. i wish it came with sides - the sides were very pricy (sweet potato fries for $12? lol and mashed potatoes for like $11?) kinda extreme to me -  i get it's a little upscale but i've been to upscale restaurants before and they came with sides usually or at least the portion wasn't super small especially for the price! either way - enjoyed the environment and our food and drinks! definitely check it out if you're in the area! it's also by the water and battery park city!

This review has been a long time coming since I had visited at the end of February. I dined here at the suggestion of a date and all I can say is that my date made a great choice. When we arrived, there was a slight wait even though we had reservations, but not too long. I believe we waited 5-10 mins. We were eventually seated in the downstairs dining room, which was very quiet, secluded and had a romantic vibe to it. We were greeted warmly by our waiter who took our drink orders and supplied water to the table. My date wanted me to try several dishes so we ordered the following. Sautéed asparagus, crabcake, thick cut bacon, potatoes au gratin, and lobster mac & cheese. All were delicious, well seasoned and hot. For our entree's I had the salmon which I liked very much, but didn't care for the mash it came with. My date ordered the Tomahawk steak medium which he loved. Overall it was a great dining experience and well worth the money spent. I would definitely visit again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great place great steak. Hope is a bartender that's great. She ll help you out with whatever you need. Great hospitality. Got the steak and asparagus to go (because of covid). Outside service available. Great atmosphere

Timing between courses was slow. Cheese steak egg rolls were not hot enough  in the center to melt the cheese. Ribeye steak was delicious as were the mashed potatoes. Coconut cream pie had way too much whipping cream and not enough custard filling. Wait staff was great and friendly.
Very nice, upscale restaurant.  Food cooked to perfection.  We had reservations and had no wait time.  The staff was very knowledgable of the menu and made excellent recommendations. Quality food....
No comment
No comment

Went here this Sat. Feb 12 for a bday lunch for my friend and a sister. We enjoyed it tremendously. The food altho it looked small - was definitely very filling, delicious and very good quality.  We had for apps -  cheese steak eggroll, crab cake- which was so so great, and ahi tacos - all  must try!! We had the steak, scallops and fish/chips for our main.  And then the coconut cake we shared - as we were so full by then.  And we want to give kudos and many thanks to Jose for his wonderful service - he was so very attentive to our needs and knows every single item in the menu and had been on point in his recommendations depending on our personal taste and specific preferences.   A passionate worker and class act!!  Thank you.... we enjoyed the experience...

Went here for the first time and the food was incredible. Although the portions look small they are very filling. We ordered the filet mignon, truffle mac (highly recommended) and asparagus. The sangria is also a great pairing with the steak. If you like cheesesteak egg rolls I suggest trying those too. We will definitely be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Usually a big fan of Del Friscos but this was a disappointment. Salads were bland. Sides (mashed potatoes and mac' cheese) were awful. How hard is it to make good sides at a high end steak place? Steaks were solid but didn't make up for rest of meal. I recommend you find another steak house.
No comment

My boyfriend and I were in the city about a month ago and we went here for a late lunch. We came down for the day from Albany, NY. We had done our shopping and come across this restaurant on our way back to our car and figured it was as good a place as any to get lunch. Needless to say, we were very, very disappointed. Now, I've been a server for over 10 years and I am not picky at all, and neither is my boyfriend. He ordered a burger and I ordered the salmon. The burger was literally drenched in pepper and the salmon tasted like it had been coated in sea salt. I think it was probably the worst meal I've ever had out to eat. The only thing we could eat was the fries. Neither is us complained because we just aren't those kind of people. The server was great and the wine was good, but we were both left wanting more. We would have been better off getting street food or Applebee's, it was that bad.

Pretty good spot. Very overpriced for a standard lunch but if you're celebrating it's worth it. To be honest, if you're looking to spend over $100 at lunch it's probably better just to go to the Del frisco double eagle steakhouse. Service is nothing too great. The steaks are good but, as mentioned if you want to pay a lot, just go to double eagle.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I'm really surprised given Del Frisco's is a steakhouse.  The Prime Beef Short Ribs were super lean, stringy with no marbling at all.  It was difficult to eat as it was dry.  On top of that I ordered 2 of them at $45 each.  Portion wise was small but would've been acceptable if the meat was a good cut...very disappointing!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is my favorite steakhouse in NYC. The food was pricey but well worth it. The scenery inside was beautiful with nice painting decorations and lights to brighten up inside and a sports bar in the middle with seats going all around the bar. They also have a patio option to sit outside. Our waiter was Johnathan and he was the best, he served us in a timely manner and gave us great recommendations. I recommend this place to any steak lovers.
No comment
No comment

Came here for lunch the other day. Ordered the Steakhouse salad. Asked for medium rare and got medium rare. Steak was quite bland though, and the bacon and deviled egg that were supposed to be in the salad were non existent. This is the second location I've been to and not impressed.
No comment

We live nearby and went to this place for a quick lunch at 2pm. 2 other tables were still there drinking after lunch and we were the only table ordering. I had to go inside the restaurant to ask someone to take our order after waiting for 10 minutes, and then we sat there for 40 (forty) minutes for two salads to be served. When my husband asked the waitress about where the food is, she said she would find out, and then passed by us twice without an answer. So we walked out and luckily by this time other restaurants in Brookfield have reopened after disinfecting post-lunch. Oh and ridiculously expensive for what it is, no starters below 20 no salads below 30. I can recommend PJ Clarke or merchants river house

Came here for apps and drinks with a friend. The cheeseburger egg rolls were everything!!!! We also had the ahi tacos which were so yummy. A bite pricey but high quality eats indeed. The service here is perfection! Great staff all around.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Man, went here in August for my birthday. I was treated by my lovely lady and we both love steak.  I literally have no complaints about this restaurant.  Our server , a Spanish male from the uptown manhattan or Bronx area was super friendly and had great feedback about the menu.  We partook in a steak and a bottle of wine that when paired together was fabulous.  The restaurant was sexy and sleek, clean and to my knowledge pretty new, and it looked every bit of it.  My only gripe to be nit-picking is that it doesn't stay open later, but given the area I can see why it closes at the time it does.  I can't wait to go back and have another sexy dinner there.
Stabbed myself 5 times with salmon bones. Pretty disappointing for a venue of this caliber.
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of the neighborhood favorites, Del Frisco's Grille never disappoints with its diverse and delicious menu. While prices are on the higher end compared to other local eateries in FiDi & Battery Park, you can still make out okay with the right dish (sans alcohol of course). One of my "go-to" meals is the baked chicken served with mashed potatoes and asparagus in a scrumptious jus. The chicken itself is juicy with crispy skin on the outside and both sides leave you full but not overly so. If you're looking for a nice place to eat that's a little more upscale, this is a great place to try on the weekends when the busy work crowd is absent. An added bonus is the friendly/helpful staff and the relaxing ambiance of the restaurant.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Another stellar experience at DelFriscos - Bravo - Service - Drinks - Food - atmosphere - amazing as always - highly recommend the Artichoke Beignets- outrageously delicious
No comment

Went to this restaurant on mothers day and the food was horrible. Then while eating we spotted a mouse the manager grab a cup from the bar and was trying to catch the mouse. And wasn't able to catch it. This was so disgusting the manager didn't ask us of we were ok or even apologize for this incident. And on top of they we still had to pay the bill. After this I tried getting in contact with the restaurant corporate company by email and phone call but didn't get any response. So now I will be calling the health department. I advised everyone that's looking to eat here not to go not unless you like nasty food and a manager playing cat and mouse while your eating.
Loved the service and absolutely loved the steak. Made to perfection! I enjoyed the crab cake as well. But the Mac and cheese was a little too runny for me! Overall great meal :)

3.5 Stars. It was a lovely summer evening and the ladies and I got a table outside. Lovely setting and charming staff. Food and drinls were very good. However service was sloooowww. But the manager did give us free coffee and dessert for the inconvenience.

Overall the food was good. The service on the weekends is TERRIBLE. We had to ask for our drinks and bread. Forget it if we wanted another round of drinks (btw we were going to order another). A random guy folding napkins had to bring us our food. Forgot to mention it was my birthday and I watched the hostess tell the waitress and she forgot. We live down here and would expect Del Frisco's to be as good of quality over the weekends... we won't be back here. My special day here was everything but special.

The food here is disgusting.  Ordered 2 salads and water.  $70.  Both had brown lettuce, old steak that tasted gamey and Tyson chicken tenders that have been sitting around too long.  After about 2 days it's safe to say we fortunately did not get sick but that was definitely a close call.  Never returning.

Food is very good, service could be a bit better. The ahi tacos are a must! Order comes with 4 little tacos. The deviled eggs are great - SO truffley.   Love the mushroom flatbread. If you are gluten free the flatbread is a MUST. it's ones of the best gf crusts I have had. Location is nice with outdoor seating. The white sangria is fun and tasty - very strong peach flavor and on the sweeter size. It even comes with a strawberry peach popsicle in it!
No comment

Came here for a dinner with coworkers and we sat on the upper level dining area which was nice and intimate prior to anyone arriving. We ordered the Philly cheesesteak egg rolls which were amazing along with the Mac & cheese and the asparagus balls. Everything was phenomenal and our waitress was very personable and bubbly which was a nice touch. Over all a great evening ill definitely be back.
No comment
No comment

Had a lovely meal on Sunday 8/9. Meal came to 105 however the next day I found the restaurant had charged me 345. No explanation as to why money was basically STOLEN from me but Was assured by the manager Ashley I would have my refund but still have received nothing. Absurd that I have to be calling everyday to trace my refund.

I love del Frisco's but this location charged me a incorrect amount for an item, admitted to charging the wrong price and the manager never refunded the $$ i was overcharged. Also gave me a free appetizer voucher worth $16 when the item that was incorrectly overcharged $24-$28 in value. Will also bring this up with Del Frisco's corporate. You can't have one price on the menu and charge a different price because your dining menu and computer systems are not up to date.

The chicken sandwich was one of the worst I've had, comparable to a McChicken at McDonald's. My mistake for ordering this at the steakhouse but this is one dish I would not order again. Steaks are good, truffle mac & cheese and ahi tacos are also good.
This is a nice place with good service and good steaks but everything is too salty.  I've complained several times but they never learn.
No comment

No comment

I went here on Valentine's Day for a dinner with a couple of friends. It is a very nice classy establishment. We all ordered the jumbo crab cake with the Cajun sauce for an appetizer and I must say delicious! Three of us had the filet mignon   8 oz steak and it was very good as well (which I expect from a steakhouse lol) , the seasoning placed the steak was just right, one of our other guest had the halibut and he said it was good as well. We had their signature Valentine's Day dessert and it was so good when you take a bit of all it ( saying the cake , piece of strawberry, white chocolate & whip cream ). We got a free dessert because the waiter didn't realize she order all steaks to be 8oz and one was suppose to be 12 oz (it's ok mistakes happen ). It was such a nice gesture to add on the dessert we all appreciated it. I will definitely come back again & recommend this restaurant to anyone.
No comment

We went for lunch my steak sandwich was over cooked the fries were so soggy and greasy you could squeeze the grease out of them the waiter said that's how they are their double fried!! I'm like that's fine but I shouldn't be able to squeeze the grease out so he finally took them away and by the time we got new ones there were a little better but still had soggy gross fries and we were just about done with our food it took so long. Service was so slow other clients came in after us and left before us and we only had 2 sandwiches nothing else. Wrote to company as well and never received any response. If we ever visit NY again be sure we won't visit here!
Sexy rib eye. Creamy mashed potatoes. Salmon cooked to perfection. Add this place to my list of steak restaurants

I have eaten here about 5-6 times (I live nearby) since the soft opening two weeks ago. The food is delicious and the options are great. I always come with my daughter and they are so nice and kid friendly. Sherwin the manager really goes above and beyond to make sure the service is impeccable and the customers are happy
No comment
No comment

Writing this before getting the bill because Im trying not to curse!! But we Traveled from CT and unfortunately choose the worst place to eat at! For the price we were expecting a nice meal... not perfect but nice... all we got was a 40 min wait to get our food and 1/2 of the place was empty... the french fries explained the wait as they had to walk to a mcdonald's to purchase their leftover fries! We had to pick through them to see which ones we could eat!!! then my husbands $49 steak was BURNED and raw inside, he had to dip it in ketchup to mask the awful, burned, unseasoned taste of his steak..  would have had a better lunch at a food truck (where they seem to care more about the customer service) ! Feel bad for the waitress..  ok... got the check!  THIS PLACE SUCKS !!!!!!!!!!!
