Stopped by for cocktails and apps before walking around the area. Can't say enough about the quality of the drinks and food. Love this place. Lonnie was our waiter, and he was honestly the best waiter ever. Handed us a few discounts on apps for our next visit, brought us cake for a birthday, and make major recommendations for us. Must stop here!
No comment
Right near battery park. Stopped in for a quick lunch. The steak egg rolls were delicious along with the grain salad bowl.  Great outdoor seating with great service.

2.5 stars.  Wouldn't come back.  First time here.   Ordered a lot of food and surprisingly the food was not very good.  Not sure if it was what I ordered.  Had shrimp cocktail and the shrimp was very hard to bite into.  It was still pretty frozen. The halibut was ok, but missing flavor.  Coconut cake was not very good and too much cream.   Asparagus was old and chewy.  The mac and cheese was good.  Service and decor is the only good parts of the meal.
Very slow service. Waiter brought all courses at the same time without us asking for that. Filet mignon came in over medium well instead of medium. Corn bisque was okay.
No comment

Wonderful dinner. We are there back to back nights. The new Sommelier is amazing and I'd highly recommend asking her to help you with a pairing or wine selection. Great values on the wine list. Can't wait to visit again.
No comment
No comment

It's a chain and a pricy one, but I am a fan of Del Frisco's. This location is perfect for business lunches, especially if you work in Brookfield Place, and they have a private room for larger groups if you need more peace and quiet. There's no dress code, although you'll see plenty of suits around. My only gripe is that they wouldn't let us choose which table we wanted to reserve.

We (9 of us) were celebrating after the Tribeca Film Festival at the Regal Battery Park 11 and needed a brunch stop, so decided on this place in Brookfield Plaza. To say the brunch menu was limited was an understatement. 3 items, really, but there was a full lunch menu.  I ordered Fried Sammie something from the brunch menu, chosing what I'd hoped was the safest bet. It wasn't....  Fried egg on a burger? Barely edible. The safest was a salad. The coffee though, was superb, as was the Chardonnay. That all said, the wait staff was patient and attentive. And mindful of our celebration, they  brought us two desserts, gratis. We really appreciated the touch and scarfed them down. Won't be going back anytime soon, though. Tourist trap, par excellance, really.

First time at Del Frisco Grill anywhere. Went to the one at Brookfield Place. Seemed cramped and more like bar than a restaurant. I saw stairs going upstairs and asked if there was seating upstairs and they answered "closed". Not sure of the situation. For the few tables that they had, service was very slow, but all wait staff were extremely pleasant. The Ahi Tuna was a little over cooked but very good. I asked for the fried noodles to be replaced with something else. The waitress suggested Broccolini and it was excellent. The steaks were very good as well according to my guests. Sangria was very good as well! Will go back.

Not sure what is up with this location. Went in for a business lunch for 3. We all ordered entree salads and it took 45 minutes to be delivered to the table. The salad was pretty good, which was the only reason for two stars. After eating, we were told by the waiter that due to the extended wait, dessert was on the house!  Thanks!  We ordered, only to wait another 25 minutes for the dessert. During our wait, the waiter presented us with the check!  He processed the check and came back to us with the final receipt before we even had dessert!  While we were eating the finally delivered dessert, the waiter went to fill our water glasses only to spill a nice glass of water in my lap!  A fine end to an equally miserable lunchtime experience.

My husband and another couple decided to celebrate New Year's Eve with a steak dinner and decided to visit Del Frisco's Grille. Unfortunately it was a subpar experience. Although the staff members were warm and friendly, there were only two waiters covering the entire upstairs. A few tables had trouble getting  attention from the servers and were clearly upset with the service. The worst part was the lack of heat during the peak of winter. Guests had to leave their coats and scarves on while dining. I ordered the filet mignon with the foie gras butter; it was not as good as I expected it to be, because everything arrived cold.
No comment

HORRIBLE experience there. First off after we were seated the waiter took forever to come see us, about 30 mins. Then when we he finally gets to us he doesn't even welcome or greet us, just "You ready to order". When our plates come he didn't give us all the utensils needed to eat our meals so we had to ask for it. Then half of our parties plates came out cold, at that point we were all so annoyed so we asked the manager to come over and vented out our frustration with the cold plates but she didn't really seem to care either. She took our plates back and brought out "fresh plates" but only for it to came out cold again. Mind you these plates were to meant to be hot. At that point we just paid and left because this type of service is a joke. Never again would I go.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment

After visiting the World Trade Center we walked around in search of out of this world food. We originally had our heart set on another venue in this food court, however when we saw the chefs cooking over a hot grill and line of people we changed our mind and try this place. We got a seat facing the grill and we got to see all the delicious food being prepared fresh. We ordered the hamburger with fries and steak and a side of brussels sprouts with bacon. I had of the burger done medium well and it was surprisingly flavorful (no weird smell that meat sometimes has) and still juicy! My husband ordered the steak (also medium well), and judging by his look of sheer and utter satisfaction on his face he liked his food as well! Despite being full, the smells kept wanting more. So we ordered a side of brussels sprouts with bacon and the flavor combination was phenomenal. My husband is a carnivore but he devoured these Brussels sprouts like they were his first meal in decades. The salty chewy bacon and caramelization on the Brussels sprouts is a match made in heaven! We will definitely come back here and try the cray fish which we thought was lobster at first because it was so big! Everything was a hit for us!

We had several meals here. Lunch and dinner. The staff is well trained and very friendly. It's a bit pricey. Salads are great as are the steaks. Ours were done perfectly. I also had a martini and they also brought extra olives for it. Strange to say it: I found the waitresses skirts a bit too short, like an inch short of their butts. The men are given shirts and ties to wear but the waitresses are dressed like bar girls in a strip joint. They should be given alternative choice of dress to wear. It's a big space. If you want more quiet ask to be seated upstairs.

While the restaurant is nicely decorated and appointed, the food was terrible. We ordered scallops and tuna. The scallops tasted pre cooked and microwaved. The tuna, also very precooked, were chewy and served over a cool Asian noodle that was tasteless. Even the peanuts tasted old and refrigerated. Service was ok.
No comment

Came here for a business meal with clients. Fair warning, it's not a quick lunch place due to its size and popularity, but the food is well worth the wait. I had a tomato and mozzarella flatbread, while the rest of the crew had salads. Portions were nice and we had re-branded the salads as "big salads" by the time we were done. Quality experience all around.
No comment
No comment

We followed previous yelp reviews and got the cheesesteak egg rolls to start - definite must-try! Very tasty and the sweet chili sauce worked great with the steak and cheese. The bf thought his baby back ribs were great, but not as good as you'd get at a steakhouse, which is understandable. I got the prime rib stroganoff and it was just ok. Lemon cake was very yummy! The waiter was very friendly. I was surprised how quickly we got our food based on other reviews about slow service. However, it did take us very long to get our dessert and check at the end and we did not get our waters refilled.

I must say this was a wonderful experience. We were celebrating my little brother's birthday and our server, Ciara was amazing, pleasant, and very knowledgeable in regards to the menu. And the bus boy Phil was great too. I highly recommend that you make them apart of the permanent staff, they are truly a valuable asset to your establishment. Ask for Ciara!

Our group only had drinks and some french fries but we loved it! Del Friscos has a great atmosphere and wonderful staff. Our waitress Paulina was so nice and we loved to talked to her!!! The french fries tasted very good and had a good crunch. The drinks were very good and the water actually tasted good.

So happy this finally opened in the neighborhood. Came for dinner with my boyfriend last night and had the best experience - awesome vibe, great staff and amazing food. Our waitress Brooklyn was on point with service and recommendations - we had the cheesesteak egg rolls and tuna tacos which were the BEST we've ever had. Also really enjoyed the steak sandwich and truffle Mac and cheese. Great cocktail menu and really nice bar scene. Definitely will be back!
The decor is amazing as is the bar.  The only thing that keeps me from giving this place 5 stars is the lack of a Steak Caesar salad.
In the running for worst burger in NYC.  Do yourselves a favor and take this atrocity off the menu.

Went to meet a friend for drinks. Sat at the bar. Brooklyn the bartender suggested the VIP drink which was great! The atmosphere was great the staff was awesome and Keith the bar manager was very accommodating! Defiantly will start bringing clients here for dinners.

I stopped in here after work for a quick drink and loved the atmosphere. The outdoor seating is great but decided on a seat at the spacious bar. I was quickly handed a menu by Crystal the bartender. She recommended their VIP cocktail which I tried and was very impressed. Next I tried the perfect margarita which was superb as well.  I was well taken care of by not only Crystal but by her coworkers Devin and Jesse as well. The GM Sherwood even checked in which was a great personal touch! I didn't have time to stay for food but will definitely be back!

I had great expectations to return to this place which I knew from some time ago. I had a good memory of my previous experience. I am somewhat disappointed. I  ordered bread which came after my food had arrived.  A sad, hard, not very warm piece. Not the quality you would expect from a place like this. The steak however was awesome, very good.  To their bad luck (and mine), the pen I was given to sign when paying leaked the ink and stained my hand. Overall not a great experience for a bill close to $100.

Extremely disappointed, and would consider my night a complete failure.  After sitting at the table for 1 hour, we still had not received our main course -- we watched two full tables have their entire meal, pay the bill, and leave during this time frame. Our sever did not even check on the table nor ask if we wanted a refill on drinks. Finally we just asked for the bill and to cancel the food. I would even recommend this place to anyone
No comment

My time spent at Del Frisco's grille is always amazing, however today exceeded EVERY expectation! My server Moira was vibrant, warm, and wonderful. As I was dining by myself, It was comforting to have a server other than Moira touch my table (I believe her name was Marie, and she was equally as wonderful). The crab cake was delicious, the wine was phenomenal, and the service was impeccable. I'll certainly be returning and spreading the word to my friends and colleagues.

Food, Service, and Staff are all great. My personal favorite is the Shaved Steak sandwich which I usually get with the white Sangria. Everyone is friendly and knowledgeable and even the managers come over to tour table and make you feel welcome and right at home. Patio as well as upstairs seating give you options as to where to sit, although reservations are highly recommended because of how busy the place gets. If you're not in the mood for food and just want to grab a drink (again the white sangria is really good) the place has a really nice bar with some great bartenders (Brooklyn and Devin just to name a couple of them) Lastly, they also offer a rewards card where you get FREE food and drinks the more you Dine with them! The only thing better than good food and drinks is FREE good food and drinks. If you haven't already checked this place out, do so soon. You won't be disappointed.

Can't tell you about the food. they Kept us waiting at the bar for 20 minutes. Then gave us a table that was empty when we walked in. It was next to a heater that sounded like a jet engine. When we asked for a different table they had none because they had given them to "walk ins". We left.

First experience at a Del Friscos. Went on a Wednesday night around 7pm and the place had an average sized crowd. We were seated downstairs in probably the worst seat in the house. Avoid getting seated right in front of the front turnstyle door, especially when it is 28 degrees outside. Was freezing. The place was loud. And to top it off, the heater above sounded like a construction scene. The bang noise was extremely loud the entire meal, I thought I was in a TGI Friday's. The server said it does this all day. Get that fixed. The food was very tasteful. I got the ribs and they did indeed fall right off the bone! My significant other got the Salmon, which was tasteful, but the asparagus were very fishy being the skin was laying on top of them. Overall the atmosphere was an awful ambiance and experience for the price paid. Not running back anytime soon. Very disappointed with the overall ambiance and experience for a high dollar. Go elsewhere.

I was disappointed. They told me they don't carry cheesecake at this location- although on my way out I saw something that looked very much like cheesecake on someone else's table. They wanted me to have their prepicked, no substitution autumn meal.  The steak was charred on the outside and overcooked. Medium Rare apparently translates to medium and well done there. Little flavor and toppings were too salty. Blue cheese dressing on wedge salad was watery. Coffee was bitter. Mashed potatoes seemed to lack taste. Best thing was the coffee cake. Will not be a place I return to. When I want to spend $90, I'm sure I can find somewhere else.
The worst food ever. Shrimp cocktail dry, small. Flat bread undercooked dough. Fries over cooked. Crab cake spongy and nasty. Coconut cream pie has a raw crust. Went home and threw up all night.

Came here the other day and dined outside. Overall a nice dining experience with exceptional service by Karla and tasty food. The cheese steak egg rolls with the sweet chili drizzle were honestly too good. The corn chowder was also worth ordering as well. For mains, my boyfriend ordered the stroganoff which was a different item to see on a menu and I ordered the kale and brussel salad which I enjoyed very much. The only thing I will say is it did seem to take a while on the order but perhaps they are still adjusting to being newly open. Looking forward to visiting again.
Mac and cheese was good but be prepared to wait some time for your meal. - Casual bar like atmosphere. A little pricey.

Probably one of my favourite steakhouses. I don't care if it was a bit pricier than most, they made up for it in the quality of service and the amazing food!! Everything was done perfectly. Spend the extra money, have a great all around dining experience.

First time here and last. Took 20 minutes to get drinks. Chicken and mash potatoes were cold. Ask for manager, didn't really care. I send it back. Than they offered me free dessert. So I missed dinner, while my wife had salad. Unbelievable.

My wife and I went their on our my birthday/ wedding anniversary. We were seated by our server Daniella. Daniella was very pleasant and answered all our questions regarding the different dishes on the menu. She is definitely an asset to the company. We ordered a couple of drinks that were very, very good. Try the cheesesteak egg rolls, you won't be disappointed. For the main course I had the filet mignon with a lobster tail and my wife had the cheeseburger  with fries, both were great. We also had dessert which was also good. Great atmosphere, staff, drinks, and food, you will have great dining experience here. I almost forgot, they  sang Happy Birthday/ Happy Anniversary to us, we were touched by that.

Came here for anniversary dinner on Sunday evening. Made a reservation through Open Table and I left a comment that the occasion is for anniversary and they did take a really good care of us! They placed a celebration card decorated with every staff's signature on our table which made me smile to begin with! Our server, Kelly with short hair and eyeglasses was amazing, warm, friendly and attentive. Food was good, especially the Bone-in Ribeye was perfectly cooked! Great atmosphere, attentive staff, fast service. We ordered Coconut Cream Pie at the end of our meal which was very delicious! Everything was perfect to celebrate our anniversary! It exceeded every expectation! Thank you.

I visited the restaurant last night after a movie and ate at the bar..the food and service were OK.  The menu was also ok just a bit overpriced for what it was.   I could get past all that until a roach ran past me at the bar.  I get it's New York and this happens but it's definitely gross when you are eatIng and worse when you are paying a high price.  As we were walking out the manager came to apologize and said next time we came in she would take care of us.  That all seemed nice but she didnt offer  her  name or card so what's the real incentive for me to come  back.  Just a tip for management if you really want to apologize and have the customer return then do something for them that night or truly offer something that is tangible to the customer to return. The customer shouldn't have to  find the manager (assuming she even work there next time ) and then ask if she remember the statement.  Just my thoughts!!!
Great atmospheres and convenient location if downtown. Steaks were terrific, service great, and not too crowded. Def recommend.

Service was good. Food was subpar. I have dined at the other locations and the food is good elsewhere but we ordered a prime rib sandwich tonight that was simply inedible. Medium rare that was not prepared properly. Tasted like raw mush and had odd gamey aftertaste(not in a good way). I couldn't even manage to get one bite down. Unfortunate as I truly hope this was just a one-off and growing pains for a new location. We live in the neighborhood and frequent Brookfield. Hoping for better if we try this venue again.

We live the next door so this place quickly became our "go to" when we don't want to venture out of our neighborhood. This place definitely has corporate feel, plus it is located in the mall (well, a trendy cute mall but still a mall). The food is EXCELLENT  - lots of healthy options. As I mentioned, the ambiance is very corporate and a bit touristy on weekends, but the quality of food is probably best in the entire neighborhood (considering that two of Danny Meyer's restaurant are across the street). We always manage to walk in and get a table without a prior reservation - I guess it's just our lack as the place gets busy.
Mediocrity.  French dip or whatever they called it was WELL DONE and bread seemed microwaved. No happy hours.. just a place for drinks and frustration.
The most expensive stake restaurant in ny and serving size depressing.  Not even a bit of bread to start. I will never go back to this restaurant
Terrible service.  We actually got a dirty napkin.  Waiters and servers are never available.  Food is fair.

Fantastic place. Firstly the service - the servers have actual personality and are very nice and somewhat funny. The food is great with options for both modern cuisine and salads and burgers. Atmosphere is great. Prob my favorite spot by my office.
Unbelievably slow service, even past rush lunch hour. Don't know whether the corporate parent is starving the kitchen of resources. Completely unacceptable.

This place is very nice and the food is phenomenal but there's a white man who stands at the counter where the food is being cooked, scratching his head from wearing a sweaty baseball cap and then touches peoples plates. Talk about NASTY. And he is rude to his staff.

Elvira was so fantastic and the food was absolutely delicious. Ribs fall right off the bone, cheesesteak egg rolls heavenly, arugula prosciutto flatbread the bomb, great cocktails, and topped off with Nutella bread pudding. Awesome service and great food!

I recently ate at Del Friscos Grille and can't say enough good things about my experience.  My cheesesteak egg rolls and tuna tacos were amazing (the cheesesteak eggrolls are so good you feel like you did something wrong after eating them).  My steak was cooked to perfection AND they had my favorite summer beer, Montauk summer AND wolfer dry table rose all fantastic and exactly what I wanted.  The manager Sherwin even came up to the table, it was certainly appreciated, and the staff was super pleasant. Would go back for a work lunch or person meal anytime.  Keep up the good work!!
No comment

Been at del friscos grille in boken and other locations. Quality of the food seemed to have gone downhill significantly, while the prices shot up. Not happy with the wait, the service or the food. For $100 meal, I expected my food to have more quality and delicious ending. It was like food from Boston Market and I wouldnt have had to wait as long. Sad but true
Fantastic location, close to One World Trade Center, 9/11 Memorial, and Battery Park Regal Theater...You must try the shaved prime steak sandwich, delicious. Get the Lemon Cake for dessert.

Wow. Went with BF on first night. Liked it so much ch have been back for lunch and one more dinner since. Incredible steaks. Best steaks in Tribeca besides Puck's place in the Four Seasons. I will be back and back again.

I normally go to Double Eagle but decided I didn't want to deal with holiday traffic this time of year. So what do I do, give the Grille a try. Plus my new job is down here so it was convenient. Had I known it was a lower end Del Frisco's I would've never went. We were seated upstairs which looks like a diner but with steakhouse prices. Although our server was very nice, the service was extremelyyyyy slow given that it wasn't even busy. Took forever for water or drinks. Got a grey goose dirty martini = nothing to brag about, Ordered the Prosciutto Di Parma flatbread = delicious! , got the Prime Ribeye = ordered medium rare, came medium but decided to just keep, charred broccoli with honey tahini = ok, truffles Mac and Cheese = amazing! So, lesson learned. If you're going to spend the money, pay a little more for a better experience at the Double Eagle.  Not a total bashing but once and done. Never again.

My Husband took me here for Valentines Day and yes it was crowded and yes it was noisy and yes we were given a table alongside the Bar.  So What!!  This is NYC and I'm not looking to dine in a monastery.  Our Server Annie was fantastic.  She truly went above and beyond.  I have some serious food allergies and I was confident that she was on top of this with the kitchen.  We asked for suggestions and she was honest in letting us know what isn't the best and what her favorites are.  We took her advice and started with drinks.  I had the perfect margarita and it sure was, my Husband had a sapphire Martini and he said it was one of the best he's had.  We shared the flatbread with mushrooms and truffles.  It was terrific and we were already getting full but we soldiered on and each had the filet mignon medium rare, truffle mac and cheese and the parmesan broccolini. The steaks were cooked perfectly and I loved that the person who brought them over asked us to cut it to make sure it was cooked according to what we asked for.  The steaks were like butter just melting in your mouth, so delicious!  The truffle mac and cheese is a must, you have to try this, tons of cheese, crusty and delicious and the broccolini was also good.  I can't say enough about Annie who really made this experience great.  I figured that we would be rushed since it was Valentines Day but we were anything but rushed.  We were so stuffed we took a piece of their lemon cake home. If you like lemon and cake this is probably the best you will ever have!!  So don't wait, go and ask for Annie, tell her Mo sent ya!!!

I have been to the new del friscos grille downtown twice and it has been above and beyond my expectations every time. The restaurant has a great cosmopolitan vibe with a contemporary decor and a great use of space. The staff greeted us warmly and let us hang out at the bar and outdoor patio while we were waiting for the rest of our party. Bartenders made the girls really yummy cocktails. First time I ate there I was in the main dining room and the second was a party in the private dining room. The food came out quick hot and delicious. The steaks got this awesome salty crispy char on them that gives way to perfect pink meat undernearth. Do yourself a favor. Get the truffle mac and cheese. And omg the dessert. I never liked coconut cream pie until this one. The managers were super nice too. Hooked it up with VIP shots. You are not finding this quality for this price at other steakhouse in the area. The private dining room is perfect for special occasions. I will be back for more tuna tacos for sure.
No comment

This is a really spacious Mediterranean spot in Hell's Kitchen. I love the high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows - it really opens up the space. The apps we got were good. My favorite was the mezze platter that came with 5 different dips, a vegetable cup, and some pita bread. We also ordered a dumpling-like app that was fried on the outside and held beef inside. Delicious! I ordered the burger, which was good, but my friend got the caesar salad and that look amazing. The caesar plate was huge and they do a great job of presentation. The fries were too potato-ey for my liking (I prefer crispy over potato) but they came in cool spiral shapes.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I really loved everything about this place was 100! (the vibe, the decor, the food, the dessert) It was all outstanding! tons of vegetarian options available. All of the dips and salads were excellent. Need a little work in the service department but it was okay. I especially loved the innovative food, it was all something new. Will definetly come back again!

A really cute spot at the Pendry Manhattan West! We came here for a late dinner and it did not disappoint. The vibe is modern, chic and contemporary. We had a great server who was attentive and efficient. We started off with the dips and let me tell you, you have to get this for an appetizer if you don't have any dietary restrictions! We had the Ember-Roasted Eggplant, Whipped Ricotta and Kabocha Squash. They were paired with a delicious Bazlama flatbread. For my main course, I had the Smoked Cherry Baby Lamb Chops + brussel sprouts as a side. They were fantastic, especially paired with the cherries. Lastly, for dessert, we had the Kataifi Cheesecake. It was light, airy and quite tasty. If you're looking for a chic and sophisticated spot serving Eastern Mediterranean fare, this is it
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow - best Mediterranean food I've had! Got the eggplant, green tahini (my favorite) & ricotta. The artichoke was also good! The staff was great & fixed the uneven table instantly. The only complaint I have is it is very noisy there so I would not suggest going there if you plan to have a lot of conversations.
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food and service was top notch. The only reason for 4 stars is for the loud music they play in the restaurant. It was very hard to have a conversation if your in a bigger party.
Simply amazing! If you love Mediterranean food, you must try this restaurant! The restaurant was aesthetically pleasing. The service did not go unnoticed. My water glass stayed topped off haha
No comment

We came here for dinner and the food was great! Service was great with lots of water refills. The restaurant is beautiful and is perfect for drinks at the bar as well. I do recommend a reservation. The portions are smaller than I think they should be for the prices.

The place has a nice vibe if you want action. I thought the bar area was a little close to the sit down dinners area.  Attentive service and good cocktails. The food was good and the dips are a definitely try.
No comment

The food was underwhelming.. chicken was barely seasoned, tuna tartar had some fishy tasting pieces. Cheese was tasteless. The best thing about it was the flambé.. also, why bring that after the last main dish? Service was decent.. if we ever come back we'll just have a drink and the green tahini dip which was really good !!
No comment
No comment

Excellent Mediterranean cuisine. Everything I tried was amazing; whipped ricotta with apricots, duck, cherry lamb chops and lemon sorbet! Love the rooftop bar and overall atmosphere. Definitely worth stopping by for an amazing meal paired with some ambiance.

Zou Zous! Yum yum yum. Was in the Manhattan West area and stopped in for lunch and at 11:30 right when it opened they almost couldn't seat me and my friend because of how booked they were. So definitely come with a reservation, be okay with the bar or prepared to wait. The space itself is gorgeous and connected to the equally beautiful Pendry hotel. Was just here for lunch so didn't get a cocktail sadly but they looked amazing. My friend and I split the 3 dip dip tower and got the chickpea with black garlic which was delish and probably my favorite. The other two were whipped feta with apricot and roasted eggplant both were very good just on the sweeter side so be prepared if you are in the mood for salty. We also split the fattosh salad with chicken and it was so fresh, crisp and flavorful. I really enjoyed zou zous and would come back for dinner or drinks. I've had better Mediterranean in the city but it's definitely a great option especially when you are in the area.

Since posting my initial review one of the managers reached out to me about my bad service experience and invited me back for another meal. Having just had that meal I can say it was a night and day difference and the service here tonight was phenomenal. Definitely chalk up the first time as a fluke and as the first time, it was a delicious meal. Would come back and recommend!
No comment

I loved everything I had at @zouzousnyc so much that I really want to go back soon! The filet mignon was so perfectly cooked and I keep thinking back to the juiciness. The appetizers were absolutely amazing too, and I'm now a huge fan of the green tahini and whipped ricotta dips! Very nice environment so I highly recommend for a slightly fancier day/night out!
No comment

Cute atmosphere on the west side in the new-ish district of restaurants and bars near Hudson Yards. I'm glad I tried it, because I love duck in most forms, but realized when eating the duck borek that that's one texture I'm not so into. It was a nice treat for the chef to drop ours off. The mezze and dips are all delicious and we had some tasty sides. It's a little pricey, reflective of the area, but it would be a great place for apps and cocktails with a follow up cocktail on the Miami-feeling roof.
No comment
Came here with girlfriend for brunch. It's interesting concept but nothing special about the food.
No comment
No comment

A definitely different experience that I haven't had ever since being an ex-New Yorker. A friend of mine told me about this place and took me here on a double date. So after being seated, we decided to start with some appetizers. The dips were different on my palates but definitely tasty and unique in flavors. The drinks were delicious also, I personally had the 'field trip' & that was delicious. My friends liked there's also. The tartar was okay, a unique dish but not one that was my personal favorite. The fried chicken was delicious but my partners didn't like the shell (fennel cups) that encased the lobster. The beef manti was the best to me. The sauce that complimented it was to die for. To close the meal was ice cream, but when it was served the waiter started to put olive oil (like cooking oil) on the ice cream. Really different wasn't the best tasting but not the worst at all. But overall a good restaurant with different taste on all the items. I highly recommend.
No comment

No comment

Inside the Pendry hotel is this delicious joint. Last minute reservation got us sat at the counter. I actually enjoy sitting closer together (there is no corner seating for two) and watching the chefs. Counter is beautiful by the way.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We stopped in, 5 of us for a friend's 50th birthday, on a Sunday afternoon and it was a magnificent surprise! Everything from the decor, the service, the cocktails, and the food blew us away. We will definitely be back and tell all our friends. I've worked in hospitality for over 20 years and every moment of our time there spoke to the beauty of what we all try to bring our guests. Thank you!

New/cool place for after work drinks. Got there early and sat at the bar. I actually tried most of their cocktail menu. I was a tab disappointed by their cocktails on tap. The dips were delicious and filling.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great place to come with your parents! Mine loved it! Came here with my parents and my friend Maggie and we ordered a bunch of dips which were all great. The duck pie thing is highly recommended but skippable, it was my least favorite thing (too heavy for me). The cheesecake was the most memorable part. Also a beautiful restaurant! We also got the cabbage (it was okay) and lambchops (yummy!)
No comment

We had been looking forward to our dinner here ever since we visited Chez Zou (a great cocktail bar option). The food and service did not disappoint. We started with the dip platter, choosing the ricotta, chickpea, and eggplant dips. All of them were incredible and something I will be going back for more of. We were already pretty full by the time we finished that so went light for the rest of the meal. We got the latkes and lamb chops, both of which were solid though the latkes were a bit more oily than expected. To finish we had their version of a cheesecake and it was incredible. The bottom layer was baklava, on top of which was the cheesecake portion. The portion size on the dessert was massive so splitting it amongst several people is very do-able. Will definitely be coming back
One of the best Mediterranean restaurants I've been to in the city! Everything we had was fantastic - especially the dip platter and the hot kasseri cheese. Great service, excellent atmosphere. 10/10

This place is good. The dip tray is a must order, but honestly - the environment itself needs a little work. For some reason it feels like you can hear a pin drop in this place. Probably didn't help that when I went it was about a quarter full, so it didn't feel too great. Plus the area it's in gives you a big mall restaurant feel. The service is great, good wine list, good selection. The salads are a hit - and the filet skewer will be in my dreams for a while. So well seasoned.
No comment
No comment

We had a few minutes before the start of the event we were attending in the are and decided to just grab quick drinks at the bar. We only had the drinks here, but what we had I did not like at all. We had a regular margarita and gin and tonic and both were not good! We both had high expectations for this place, but unfortunately the taste of the drinks don't justify the prices. I've gone to dive places with better tasting drinks. How do you mess up a regular margarita?! Anyhow, it was bad and we definitely won't be going back here to have drinks again!
Way too expensive!!! The prices are designed for expense accounts. If you care anything about money I do not recommend.

Close to my work location, I have come here multiple times for lunch with co workers. I love their dips and bread platter. Several of my coworkers enjoyed their burger, but I have only tried their fatoush salad with a side of herb chicken kebab...always a hit! Would love to come out here for dinner someday.

Had to wait about 10 min for our table on a Tuesday night, despite having a reservation. Saw that walk ins were not available. All the food was really great and the ambiance was nice too. We asked for all of our food to be packed, and the waitress said they dont pack the dips that but she'd make an exception.
No comment

Came back again for dinner and got the kasseri cheese, the lobster tagine, and the charred broccoli. The broccoli was good but the other two were average and probably not worth the price. There really wasn't much lobster (maybe one 1 pounder?) and it was a little tough and a little lacking in flavor (and had too much butter).
No comment
No comment

Quite happy with the overall experience at Zou Zou's! Good service. Wait staff was attentive, and the hostesses were excellent!! Good food! Highlights were whipped ricotta with apricot dip as well as the potato latkas! Branzino (fish) was really good! Great drinks too! Would definitely recommend!

Major pros to start, the restaurant is absolutely stunning, the bar staff was friendly and the dips were delightful.  For drinks and dips it's top notch but the tuna tartare felt like a hunt to find small cubed individual pieces of tuna in a small plate, the focaccia didn't feel like the right bread to pair with the hot kasseri cheese and three of us had Duck Borek as our entree and left half of it on the table not because we weren't hungry.  The latkes were tasty but needed a dipping sauce and the charred broccoli was tasty. Would come back for an after work bar moment but not a seated dinner

Found a beautiful restaurant with delicious food on a night out with my friends. The decor was unique and the vibe was relaxing. The staff was very friendly and patient. We ordered the dip selection - whipped ricotta, eggplant and chickpea, artichoke, flatbread, the wadi rum jeweled rice, the hot kasseri cheese (just the presentation alone was so much fun!) and the branzino. Everything was so yummy. Definitely would recommend for a future date night or anyone looking to try something new.

We enjoyed Zou Zou's a lot more than I expected to.  We sat at the bar sans reservation on a Saturday night, but the place was full.  It was definitely weird catching glimpses of the Whole Foods where I shop through the restaurant windows - Manhattan's version of strip mall dining, I guess.  It also reminded me of those mall restaurants, like Cheesecake Factory or Houlihans.  Once again, lots of out-of-towners and folks from New Jersey.  But the food was good!  We began with a trio of dips and some good flatbread.  The little gem salad was a bit of a misstep - while the charred grapes were like little jewels, they couldn't save the overly acidic dressing on the salad leaves.  The lamb chops with cherries were succulent and the latkes, which reminded me of McDonalds hash browns, were the perfect foil.  Everything was interestingly spiced, too, which was a joy, and the Golden Negroni was a good match for the food.  Service was very professional.  Prices are strange - small plates and vegetable sides are very reasonably priced, mains are exorbitant and the wine list is steep.  We will be back!
No comment

I was very much looking forward to eating here.   I got reservations and the business was closed.    How can someone that owns this place allow for reservations to be booked when it's closed.   And to boot.....All the hours of operation are different posted on Facebook, yelp, and on the front of the restaurant.   Seriously get your act together.

Wow!!! Wow!!! Wow!!! Highly recommend you! Great service , very friendly stuff, delicious food! Manty is a must. I dont have a picture of them because they were sooo spectacular that I forgot to take a phone.  Everything is beyond any expectations

I'm so glad I tried Zou Zou's because I was really pleasantly surprised! I went with a few friends for a casual dinner and we were blown away by each dish we tried. Aside from the beautiful display for each menu item, the flavors were really good. I also really loved the appetizer plate and would definitely order it again. A must try spot for this year!!
No comment

Really loved the beautiful interior and tiled decor as well as the overall ambiance that is both quite relaxed and trendy. Food was really delicious and offered a slightly different twist on classics that you would expect from a Mediterranean/Middle Eastern restaurant.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a beautiful place to share food and drinks!!  The flavors were exciting and perfectly balanced in every dish we had!  The dips are a journey... get them all with a bread choice or two!  The green tahini with foam is dreamy!!  The fire roasted half chicken with a buttermilk milk dipping sauce presented in grilled onion cups was gorgeous and delicious!  It is not pedestrian to order this chicken dish - my new favorite in the city!  Our server was super friendly and described everything so well that we were drooling.  The cocktails were fantastic!  Next time we are getting the sangria!
This restaurant is so chic and beautiful! The service is amazing and the food is delicious! You must try it for yourself! I've been 3 times already.

Loud and chockablock with diners in a lofty, Jules Verne like setting where the amazing food hits keep coming. Terrific for large groups to share whole leg of lamb, big steak and unique, delicious Mediterranean appetizers. Not so good if you're a looking to talk over a quiet dinner. A complimentary red cabbage salad had our group of ten buzzing, as did wonderful spices that none of us seemed to have tasted before. Very attentive wait staff. Lots of fun.

The food was amazing. The flavors were so delicious and I enjoyed everything I ate. The overall service was good, but the server for my table was kind of rude and favored the table next to mine. This made the experience uncomfortable. However, I would come back for more food and the amazing ambiance.
No comment
We were so excited about the opening of this restaurant and it did not disappoint! The dips were by far the highlight - especially the Kabocha squash one!
No comment

Amazing food and ambience. Definitely recommend. We loved the fattoush salad, it was delicious. The walnuts really made it pop. Lobster kebab was excellent also. Our favorite dip was the green tahini.
One of finest Mediterranean food in Nyc. Try the keg of lamb feeds family of 6 or more
No comment

Food was great, ambiance was on point, cocktails were amazing... still thinking of the kataifi cheesecake!! but this place deserves 5 stars because of the wonderful staff that were so accommodating when i dined here on 1/16/23. I was waited by a gentleman named Harrison who had the most positive attitude and he was super attentive to my friend's allergy concerns. We also had a few cocktails at the bar after dinner, and the bartender that closed that night was super nice and served me the best mezcal i've had in a while. Thank you Zou Zou's - cant wait to come back.

This was a great place to go for dinner with a group!  I'm not the biggest fan of Hudson Yards but will definitely travel for this place! I recommend doing family style and ordering the dips and lamb.

Great food, great service, great location what more do you need! We started off by having the three dips, followed by the lamb and filet all of which were great. With that being said the cheesecake dessert stole the show

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: The greek yogurt with olive oil and lemon granita was heaven on earth. Sooo good I would come just for this alone!!
No comment
No comment

This review is for the hostess' at the restaurant. Last my coworkers and I arrived for dinner. With no reservation, we asked be placed on the wait list. This was at 6pm and were told there was a 45 minute wait. Upon arrival, other guests with no reservations did the same and were told the same. Fast forward to 7:45 still no table for my coworkers and I, who are black btw, but all the white guests received tables. I'm don't want to accuse the staff of racism but this is exactly what it felt like. Not to mention there were no black people dining in the restaurant. This needs to be corrected.

Honestly, in my opinion this affair is overpriced. The menu does not have the proper descriptions and we are just assumed to know what they mean. I got dumplings and it did not mention the fact that they were going to have beef in them. The dips were good, but again, so expensive! I would not recommend.

Just incredible .  Drinks, apps, main course to desert.  Everything is so amazingly well plated and served And tastes even better.  Get the dips (all off them especially the ricotta), and order the duck- i sweer, it's one of the best dishes you'll ever have - and know this - it's for 2 people , so don't overwhelm yourself lol.  I'll be back!
No comment
Wow!   One of our must do's in NYC!   Make reservations as early as you can to get a table. The dips/spreads are amazing as is the Moroccan chicken.  Great staff and a beautiful environment.

We had a reservation and showed up on time.  Restaurant was nearly empty and they insisted on us sitting at the bar.  We asked for a table and they offered to wedge between literally the only two occupied tables.  We walked out.
No comment
Great foood. amazing place.definitely i will back again

Our service was absolutely terrible. Incredibly slow and we had to track down our server anytime we needed anything. Some of the food was good, some mediocre, but the drinks were teeny tiny and $20. We made jokes they were $10 per sip, as the wine pours are so small and the cocktails were mostly ice. I would not come back here - there are 1,000 other restaurants in the city more worth the money.
No comment

I leave a lot of positive reviews because I genuinely have had mostly good experiences at New York City restaurants but this experience I had at zouzous is going to be something I will talk about for the rest of my life. We had a reservation at 5:15 and were seated promptly on time. This restaurant has hands down some of the best food and best service in the city. Everything was to die for to the point where we almost licked our plates clean. After ordering three dips, oysters, manti, sea bass, hot cheese dip, honey butter pull apart buns (I think that's what it was called) and a few drinks, the manager came over to let us know that the restaurant was over booked and we had to change tables. we weren't even annoyed by that and honestly would've been ready to go anyway but not only did we switch tables, the entire meal was comped and we had a bottle of Moët champagne waiting for us at the next table. We were treated like absolute royalty at this restaurant and I can't thank the staff and chefs enough for such an amazing, amazing experience. Special shout out to Kaia, Otis, and I think Brent or Brett for treating my table so well.
I live in the neighborhood and come here at least twice a week. It's one of my favorite restaurants and bars in the city for both the food and the ambiance. HIGHLY recommend.

The atmosphere was so great. The food was great, especially if you like Mediterranean food. Waiter was a little short when we didn't order as much food and drink as he was wanting, but that seems to be the norm in NYC dining.
No comment

Fourth time in New York, first time trying this place.  Service and food where amazing.  Made reservation and was seated promptly.  I had a west side Old fashion which has been by far my favorite of all time.  Ordered most of the dips to be able to sample with my family, all of which were amazing.  The eggplant dip was definitely a winner.  If your in a group larger than 4 I would definitely suggest the lamb.  The serving size was more than enough for 5-6.  Overall presentation, service and taste where great.  Definitely suggest to anyone in the area.  Looking forward to coming back to New York for a repeat.
No comment

It was a really nice place with amazing food. Some of the dishes are quite expensive depending on the quantity but overall a wonderful experience. The staff were friendly and the rooftop bar adds a fun factor for after-dinner drinks.
No comment

I had a 9:15 reservation on a Friday night. We arrived exactly at our reservation time and were told that our table would be ready in one minute, we did not end up being seated until 9:45 and not one person apologized or acknowledged the 30 minute wait. We tried a trio of 3 dips, the squash dip was very bad and the other two dips that we got were mediocre at best. The kasseri cheese was so oily and hard it was almost impossible to eat. The duck burek was the only food that we actually enjoyed of the night.

Subpar. Ordered two different salads and for the price there definitely isn't anything special about the food. Ordered dips and they tasted like they were already pre made from a grocery store. Needs a new menu revamp.

We hosted our mom's 85th birthday at Zou Zou last weekend. I have a very cool mom who wanted a fun atmosphere with great food. Zou Zou knocked it out of the park and made us look good. We started with passed horsd' and each dish was better than the next. From the lamb meatballs, to the tuna cones to the moroccan fried chicken to the lobster roll. We then sat down and a plate of dips with truly the best pita I have ever had was placed on the table. We then each selected our starter- I had the fatoush salad which was amazing but too large of a portion. I then had the beef which was cooked to perfection. Our sides were the potato latkes and the broccoli. Can we talk about the latkes? With a roomful of critical Hanukah celebrators these latkes were voted the best they have ever had. Even my mom who makes a pretty good latke. We ended with a choice of two desserts. A lemon yogurt (super refreshing) and a chocolate pudding type dessert. That was my least favorite dish. But what also makes a great event is great service and each member of our team that night went above and beyond to make this evening truly special. Thank you for celebrating with us!

The food was definitely Mediterranean....the 5-dips with bazlama and crudite was  surprisingly good. Although we couldn't order the Moroccan fried chicken or the Duck Borek, I did tried the mezze plates.....they were delicious. Now I know the restaurant definitely wants their customers back for dinner. Can't wait for that SECOND CHANCE OF DINING!!!!
Had a great time for lunch at zou zou's! Yummy food, big portions (we had leftovers) and attentive service. Would come back to try dinner!
No comment

Food is delicious, beautiful restaurant and outstanding service. It was our anniversary and they had a hand written note waiting for us at our table and complimentary Champagne! Get the dips to share and the duck - so yummy!
What happened? The food is still good but the staff is among the worst, we left and went to Hidden Leaf upstairs. Save your money and go to Hidden Leaf for good food AND GOOD SERVICE.
Beautiful new restaurant in the Pendry hotel! Definitely order the whipped  Ricotta dip- it's delicious! ! The filet screwed was fantastic!

Went with a large group. They were able to seat us at a comfortable table outside. The wait staff and management were really attentive, and the service was great. All food was excellent! The chicken with buttermilk was delicious, and all the dips were a big hit. Whipped feta in particular was delicious. If possible, I would recommend dining inside because of the large amount of Chinese lantern bugs in the area. That's the main reason for the four star review.

The food here is amazing! The atmosphere is great. We ordered the fried chicken which was recommended and the portion was pretty big to share for a party of 3. We also ordered the lobster tajine but that not so much it was very small portion. The cocktails were pretty good and refreshing very unique options. The dessert was great. We also got a round of free champagne from our server which was a nice touch to the night.
No comment
What else can I say other than the food was delicious, the ambience was welcoming, and the service was exceptional. We will definitely be back!

Excellent dips and breads, and I enjoyed the Quinoa Tabbouleh salad (with beets and pomegranate seeds). Portions are on the smaller side, though, so you don't get a lot of bang for the buck. None of "big salads" really qualifies as big, except maybe the Cobb. There's an abundance of outdoor seating and the general ambiance is great. Service is also generally good. We did have a kerfuffle when one of our party requested some juice with no ice. The waiter brought juice with ice anyway, refused to take it back to correct the mistake, and finally just transferred the juice (without ice cubes) into another glass, resulting in a minuscule amount. That said, they didn't end up charging us for it, so fair enough.
No comment

Excellent food, drinks, ambiance, and service! You really couldn't get better than this! And the prices aren't terrible! While there were many memorable part of my meal, the labneh ice cream with olive oil stole the show for me! I now crave it every time I think of it, luckily it is right around the corner from me! PLUS, all of the above mentioned services are ALWAYS consistent! I cannot wait to return!

Very spacious and beautiful interior decor. We got three dips to share - the ricotta with apricot was great, refreshing and sweet like a dessert. The smoked eggplant was also very good, with a little kick from the peppers on top. The hummus is the least special among all three but the black garlic oil was a nice touch. We asked for grilled Bazlama to go with the dips. It was freshly hot from the beginning, but the air conditioner in the restaurant was so strong that the bread got cold pretty quickly :( For the main, we shared a big Shaved Vegetable Fattoush with grilled prawns on the side. It was an awesome salad with a variety of textures and flavors provided by crunchy lettuce, apple, candied pecans, dried apricots, and most importantly, the cracked pita (?) chips. I'm also a big fan of the mixed-in mint and dill. The french fries were pre-seasoned and fried well. Overall, a very nice meal. All dishes were delicious.
For a Middle Eastern inspired menu and the meat isn't halal? It makes you wonder- 100% never going again.
Wonderful.  Loved this inventive unique gem in the middle of Chelsea Yards.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  The food is melt in your mouth delicious.  I'll be back!!!!

We came here for dinner at 10:30pm after our train got into town. The food and ambiance were nothing short of incredible. The restaurant was busy, but we were seated right at our reservation time. Our service was great and she had great recommendations on the food. We are all five dips and sampled from the mezze plates with the lamb chops stealing the show. There are a lot of options in NYC, but zou zous should certainly be on your list!

a perfect experience overall! we were here celebrating thanksgiving and a family members Macy's Day Parade Debut, which we noted in the reservation, and the manager and staff did everything they could to make the night memorable. the food was delicious from start to finish, everything was beautifully prepared. we highly recommend the dips and tartare options to start, and the cheesecake is a must have dessert. great ambiance with beautifully architecture. would definitely return :)

Grabbed lunch at the bar today. So glad we did. Great bartenders making hand crafted cocktails. Our margaritas did not disappoint. And the Zou Burger was AMAZING! Perfect spot when visiting Hudson Yards.

went here for a date night, loved the ambiance of the whole place from right when we entered. service was good and the food came out super fast. for drinks, my bf got the Manhattan west, which he loved and said was one of the best manhattans he's had, he was tipsy off one glass! I got the road to Jericho, was nothing special but good. for apps, we had to try the dip trio, we got the eggplant, whipped ricotta, and green tahini. all were delicious, our fav was the green tahini as the aquafaba and cilantro really gave it so much flavor. we got the pita (bazlama) with crudités and got more focaccia on the side bc you can never have enough bread right? we also shared the 'our manti', which really surprised us, had no idea they would be little cute dumplings but sooo much flavor inside and the meat was cooked excellently, our only complaint was that there wasn't more of it! we also shared the crystal valley chicken, the onions and buttermilk were a nice touch for extra flavor and presentation which I had never seen before. the chicken itself was tasty but could have used more flavor IMO; we shared the wadi rum jeweled rice with it and that was super delicious, very fragrant as soon as it came and a lot of flavors mixed in there. overall super happy with the experience and definitely will be back!

What a delicious restaurant that landed in the arm pit of NYC.  The interior is open and airy and well decorated.  I went with 3 friends and we basically toured the menu.  We had the oysters (delish), the 5 dips, the flaming cheese, the honey rolls, roasted sweet potato, lobster tagine, kebab, jeweled rice and dandelion greens.  There were definitely some starts of the show - the oysters, dips and kebab.  I wasn't a fan of the sweet potato as it was so charred on the bottom, I felt like I took a handful of charcoal from the firepit and decided to chew on it.  Really gross.  It was my fault for just cutting a piece off whole and not scooping the potato out, but it was really awful, like spit into the napkin awful.  We could have skipped the rice and greens as well, as they were pretty unmemorable.  Everything else was right on the money.  They offer various portions of wine if you don't want to commit to a bottle.  The lemon ice dessert was delicious too.  Definitely give this place a try and make sure to eat the cheese while it's piping hot!
No comment

I think this restaurant has amazing service and ambiance, but the entrees are a bit overpriced for what they are (although they are meant to share!). I loved the spreads/dip, but that was my favorite thing out of the flaming cheese, fried chicken, dumplings, and dips.

One of the best meals of our recent NYC trip. I loved everything we ordered - fried chicken, and the dip assortment were my favorite. AND the cheesecake was a showstopper. Probably the best desert I've ever had.

Have been twice for lunch, both times it was excellent. Our served Jess (had her both times) is knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. Definitely get the dip sampler for an appetizer, all of them are amazing, especially with the bread, and very filling. I had a salad (shaved vegetable and the Cobb) both times I went. Preferred the shaved vegetable salad as the Cobb had too much hard boiled egg for my liking. The BBQ prawns are a great addition to the salads. Will definitely go back.

It looks like a pricey place when you look at the menu but what isn't made clear (I don't know why) is every dish is made to share. We had the duck borek which is supposedly for 2 but the two of us could only finish half and it came with a salad. So what seemed like a pricey place which had the ambiance and service to justify it turns out to be a major value for a group. Bar Pendry which is essentially the same establishment is definitely a good move for cocktails after. It's such a cozy experience over all with hotel level service all around
No comment

Came here tonight with a group of friends for dinner, and can easily say it was one of the best meals we've ever had! We all got drinks and ordered the dips, oysters, branzino, and hot kasseri cheese to share. It was all absolutely delicious, but then our waitress Kaya (who was so kind) brought out the fattoush salad to try on the house. As we were going to order dessert, the manager told us they had overbooked for dinner and needed to use our table for an upcoming reservation. We assumed this meant we'd be getting the check, which was totally understandable, but then he said they had another table ready for us, had champagne waiting, and that they were going to comp out entire meal for the inconvenience. All just for moving tables!!! We couldn't believe it. Then we ordered the cheesecake to share, but instead one of the managers (believe his name was Odis) brought out all three desserts for us. Even before the food was comped, this was going to be a 5/5 review. But the incredible service, unbelievably kind and attentive staff, and beautiful atmosphere really makes this place a must-visit. We will definitely be back!!!!
Loved this place!! The service, food, drinks and desert were all excellent. Great vibe too! Definitely want to go back soon!
Fantastic place for a date, dinner, birthday, dinner, or drinks. Bar upstairs. Good is shareable. Got 5 entries and a bunch of apps. pricey around $110 per person but worth it
You must try the Leg of Lamb! I can't think of anywhere else in the city that offers this level of Mediterranean fare with an upscale atmosphere and sophisticated ambiance.

So I read on multiple websites that this restaurant was rated between a 4 star and a 4.6 start. We were completely underwhelmed... We ordered the three dip platter which was OK at best, they didn't give us enough vegetables and when they asked if we wanted extra they charged us for the vegetables. In addition, we had the charred broccoli which was cold and the branzino which was actually good. I would say this restaurant is mediocre at best, don't bother

Amazing dining experience! Went here for dinner with my dad before a show and loved everything. Preparation and execution of dishes by Chef Sperling were impeccable. Service was thoughtful and attentive by Katya. Will be back!
The food is ridiculous! The bread, the oysters, the charred broccoli. I have not had anything here that didn't taste good.
No comment

The food was great and the service was as well. We had cocktails, multiple courses, and a desert cocktail. We got the check and as they brought back our cards the host came over to tell us rudely that they needed the table immediately. We literally were tipping and leaving. I couldn't believe it. I will not be back. There were multiple empty tables around us and we were two people. Unreal.
No comment
No comment

This restaurant is beautiful and the food is so good! Service is also great - we obviously had a great experience. Loved the Grilled Bazlama (similar to pita bread) and green tahini. I also loved my salad and the burger was v good - not too greasy. Great ambience - we'll definitely be back!!

THANK YOU CASHIA! Not only was she an amazing waitress but really took the time to get to know us and recommended things based on our preferences. As someone who suffers from food allergies she triple checked everything that came to the table and let me know what I could and couldn't have. I will ABSOLUTELY be back and highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for some amazing food, five-star service, and BEAUTIFUL atmosphere.
Had an amazing time here! Great cocktails and great service. We didn't have a reservation and they were super accommodating and found us a spot. Will definitely come back. Great vibe.
Love the vibes - very hip and spacious and the food is amazing. Perfect for second date type of mood or just friend reunions

The food, decor and service at Zou Zou's is incredible! Don't sleep on the dips, salads or chickpea burger (I'll be having cravings for these in months to come!) The pull apart bread is amazing as are the Mezze's!! We went for lunch and were seeing a show so skipped on the cocktails & wine, but they looked incredible and the bar is absolutely stunning!! (The wine list is also really wonderful.) I also celebrated my birthday so got to make my wish on yogurt & lemon sorbet - it was SO good!!! Not to mention the fries are impeccable!! What an amazing new, yet timeless spot to open in Hudson Yards! Hats off to the Quality Branded team who continue to push the envelope in food, design & service! HIGHLY recommend!
Poor service. Brendan D. was incredibly rude and told us to go home when we couldn't find the door out.

Great experience in the new Manhattan west neighborhood. The restaurant gives a cool lounge like ambience and has a good fusion of western and Arab cuisine. Highlight is the Moroccan Fried Chicken which is the perfect combination of dry spices rubbed on crispy, hot chicken. The spreads and broccoli were also on point. Definitely an untapped jewel in the neighborhood

Mediterranean menu, lovely decor located near Hudson  Yards.  Delicious hamburger , hummus, other items one doesn't usually find on a menu. A bit expensive but one pays for quality.  It was recommended to me by a chef so my expectations were high.  Go and enjoy!

We had a wonderful dinner here last week.  Definitely needed a reservation and glad we were able to get one.  We were only two people and I am a pescatarian so my husband is determined to get back with a larger group so he can try more dishes.  We did share the mezze platter which was amazing.  We had all 5 choices, the bread was fabulous and the  crudite fresh and a nice selection.  He had the lamb chops and rice side and was very pleased with both of them.  Dinner was nicely paced and the wait staff was very attentive.  We thought the pricing was very fair for what we got and the location.  We will definitely get back here.

Wow - the food is amazing and the service is just the right touch! Price point is a bit on higher side and well worth it for the ambiance and well just good and unique food. This is a different middle eastern experience... truly curated and retaining the classic middle eastern culture - while providing unique and fresh flavors... you will be amiss if you forego Zou Zous!!!

We don't have a photo because we ate it too quickly! We loved every dish including the chickpea burger and the whipped ricotta. Can't wait to go back. The woodwork in this restaurant is beautiful and offers a nice ambiance to gather around a table and literally break bread together.

Made an account so I could leave a review! We dined at Zou Zou's last night and it truly hit the spot. The food was fresh and inventive. Our server, Marisa, was fabulous and really helped us navigate the menu. We have a lot of nut allergies and she was very helpful with what we were able to order. The sommelier, Scott, was wonderful too! He helped us pick a bottle from Spain after giving several suggestions to choose from. They both made our evening. Scott suggested we come back to sit at the bar and order one of the bottles we were thinking of getting, and that's exactly what we'll do! Thanks again Zou Zou's.

First time went to ZZ's and never again. Burgers tasted like fake meat, fried in a oil, and waitress never returned to see how was the food, asked for ketchup and server never came back. My money was totally wasted because am having a heart burned  from the fried burger bun!!!!! NEVER GOING BACK!!!

What a great addition to Hudson Yards. This place is super buzzy & vibey. The food is incredible, from the dips, to the bread, Moroccan fried chicken to the lamb chops, everything was 5 star. The bar made some solid drinks as well. This is a definition of a great restaurant that is run so efficiently and smoothly. Grab a drink at Bar Pendry afterwards!

Really incredible food. The wait staff was kind and incrediy attentive. Plus there's a great bar upstairs of you want to keep the party going. Great spot for a birthday or group dinner and get a bunch of small plates to share.

Food was excellent but it was so loud in there you couldn't even enjoy it. I had to scream across the table just so my husband could hear me. If you go, make sure you don't sit near the bar to try and avoid that problem. The drinks also took far too long to come and we had to keep reminding them about a food item we ordered. I wouldn't recommend going if you're looking for a relaxing meal.

column3: Huntingdon Valley, Lower Moreland Township, PA
column6: Lovely dips in a beautiful setting with kind staff. Slightly pricey but comes with the territory for a Hudson yards flagship. Nice filet skewers too.

I was completely blown away by this place. Beautiful atmosphere, great service and awesome food. The dips were fantastic, gem salad with roasted grapes and za'atar was arguably the best salad I've ever had and the desserts were absolutely incredible. Portion sizes vary - appetizers and desserts were especially generous portions and made it easy for sharing.  I can't wait to go back! Though it was on the pricier side, it was worth every penny.

This was my first experience at Zou Zou's. The food was average. The service was great. The biggest issue was the presentation of olive oil in one copper serving kettle and a copper grinder with salt. The olive oil tasted rancid. When copper meets olive oil it creates toxins. I'm shocked this was never a thought by anyone within the restaurant. Lawsuit waiting to happen. We informed one of the managers. He was very kind and comped our check (was not expecting this) and indicated he informed the general manager. I hope they change how they serve these condiments as it is a serious health hazard.

One of the best meals I've had in years! Started with the dips and bread. The kaboucha dip was incredible. They were all great! We all shared the branzino and ZOU ZOU duck. Fantastic ! The cheesecake was so unique and beyond delish! The highlight of the meal. Run don't walk to this place
Go!  Middle eastern made dreamy.  World class design by avroko, amazons wine list.  We shared a raft of small plates followed by a wood grilled bronzino.

The food was decent but pricey but unfortunately the waitress, Marielle G, was super unfriendly and rude. We asked a question about a dish at another table and she said she thought it was the lamb but didn't know as she couldn't see it. Just a strange comment and seemed like she couldn't be bothered. I was really looking forward to dining here as I came from California but she soured our experience. Not a hospitable experience for a new restaurant.

Very bad and unprofessional service. They have a lot of members of staff but they just forgot the appetizer I ordered and it took really long time for them to realize and react. In this whole unpleasant process, my server only showed up once and disappeared. It is an overpriced place.

This was my first time coming here, and probably my last. We decided to check this place out for a work happy hour. While we were getting our drinks we saw a mouse lost wandering around the tables. Since we're in the middle of the city, we assumed that it might scurried in the entrance so we informed the waiter but he didn't seem to have much care for it. We were a party of 5 or 6 using the bar area and ordered constantly, both drinks and food. This didn't seem to matter to the bartender because as soon as we stood up from some stools (if we are 5 paying costumers we are entitled to 5 stools), he asked to other costumers on a tone for us to hear "do you want to sit?" And pointed at our stools that also had our bags. He said to us "they want to sit", we moved our things and stayed standing while we were wrapping up. We ordered a drink for one of our friends and the bartender just replied with "it will take a while". It took long. However what bothered us about it was that our friend had half a drink left and placed the drink at the bar, the bartender took it away which seemed that given the other signs he was trying to rush us to leave. We had to tell him she wasn't done and he had to make a new one. Corporate happy hours are pretty pricey, we're not just ordering water and taking up space. Even though it felt that way.
Very good pizza and pasta for the family. They have beer on tap. Friendly service and a great selection of dishes. Cozy place to sit.
No comment

Great friendly service with classic pizza shop menu options. I tried their fried calamari which was pretty good and I requested it with spicy marinara which added a great kick to it. The location of this spot couldn't be more convenient if you're visiting Roosevelt Island right by the train station and tram station and by Riverwalk Commons. There are casual seating options inside and outside and sitting outside will give you a nice view of the bridge and Riverwalk Commons.

fast and efficient service! Fried Calamari was good and crispy. Ask for the spicy marinara with the Fried Calamari, it really enhances the meal! Indoor and outdoor dinning is available. I sat outside with the beautiful view of the Queensboro Bridge. Cost efficient spot in Roosevelt Island. Definitely coming back.
No comment

It's good. Above average, but not out of this world. Portions are generous. I'd say their desserts are by far the star of the show here. If you're looking for authentic, home made italian food, just go in to the city. If you're looking for something quick, this will work. The cannoli are delightful, the cheesecake is delectable, and the bananas foster cake it out of this world. I enjoyed the experience over all. Staff is kind. Neat location.
No comment
No comment
Stopped for a quick bite.  Pizza is flavorful with nice thin crust.  Fast friendly service. Bathroom immaculate.

I've ordered here many, many times for eat in, delivery and pick up, and I've noticed a lot of inconsistency in the food.  The last time I ordered will probably be the last time I order.  After calling in an order for a pepperoni pizza and wings, and confirming, I got a cold cheese pizza and dry wings.
Excellent pasta.  Friendly service. Carlo! Went with a party of 9 and all enjoyed their dishes.  Really tasty.  Worth a detour.
I love this place  Awesome pasta and deserts. I live in Roosevelt Island and really appreciate having nice place to order delicious food. Thank you

Alfonso, Oscar and company run a good place. Always friendly, and was the first "new" restaurant to be a part of the redevelopment around the Riverwalk apartments. This is the only pizzeria on Roosevelt Island; one of its very food establishments, actually, with the expected result.   As is typical of any Roosevelt Island enterprise, it aims at the lowest common denominator, so it's no surprise that the crust on the pizza is too thick and too sweet.  the toppings are no worse than in any typical by-the-slice joint, but because business is limited,  the pies have been sitting for a while, and when they are re-heated, become, somehow, crackerlike, so that it is impossible to fold them without breaking and having the toppings slide off.   It's disheartening.   There are some by-the-slice places that get it right, but this isn't one of them.

The food court at the Canal Street Marketplace just recently opened and got to check it out. The place is brand spanking new so it's clean and pretty hipster. I wanted to try the ramen, which is by ippudo, but going to save that for a colder day. There were a number of other fast casual oriented choices with a seating area in the back. Ended up at Oppa, the Korean barbecue place. Basically, it's bulgogi beef, spicy pork, sesame chicken (no, not the breaded and fried Chinese version), or tofu in your choice of burrito, rice bowl, salad, or mini tacos format. I went with mini tacos since they're sold individually and I could try all the different meats. They all come with some combination of chopped lettuce, kimchee, carrots, tomatoes, and sauces. Here's the kick - as any true Korean BBQ lover knows, KBBQ is best when the meat gets a little char on it, caramelizing the sugars to add a sweet taste. Oppa flame torches the pre-cooked meat right before serving it to you, imparting the goodness of Maillard reaction! Genius! I thought the blowtorch would leave a fuel smell, but not here. Note to the wise, the mini tacos (soft corn tortilla) do not travel well because of all the juiciness - eat it there if possible. Otherwise, expect a bit of a mess. Basically, the sauces make the whole thing taste pretty good. Of the three, I would have to say that the spicy pork was the best. It had a nice heat without being overwhelming. The kimchee was actually pretty decent for not-homemade. The staff was hustling and grooving to keep the line moving. The one guy who torches all the meats was clearly working quickly but he was paying attention, so props to him. Plus the food is served in a container that claims to be fully compostable! All in all, definitely warrants a return visit.

Cool place to check out if you need shelter. It's not very big and seems pretty clean to me. They got an area to sit and eat toward the back and near the entrance too. A few shops to eat and to the left is a place to shop idk what but looks like hipster stuff. Free wifi but you need fb, insta or something else to connect to it. They got bathrooms too!

The space is too small and the prices are too high, couple that with a very dirty bathroom that's never or hardly ever serviced. I'm not a fan of cramped spaces and this seems to be a glorified foodhall in the middle of Chinatown, NY.

The food, though good, was definitely NOT worth the price. Right when you walk in and look at the menus, you can tell each place really jacks up their prices because of the hype. The burger was pretty small but was 10$... it's much more worth it to eat literally anywhere else in Chinatown. The acai bowl was smaller than I thought it would be and was definitely not worth the 10$+ I paid either. I've gotten cheaper bowls with same or better taste at other places. Bottom line: you can get better, cheaper food anywhere else. The only good thing about this market is that it's a very nice, spacious place with a very hip vibe. There's a big room next to all the food vendors with art and little shops (also too expensive to actually buy anything)
