This place has great food! And a lot of choices! That's what we loved was the selection! If you are in Chinatown at lunchtime I wouldn't miss the Canal Street Market. It wasn't what i expected but it was even better. The only downfall I could see is that it was hard to find seating.

Went here with my friend because we are interested in fun, special food. We had a nice variety of options and we enjoyed our food. I personally loved the design of the place, it was as if Urban Outfitters designed a food court. The place was rather busy and we were lucky to get standing tables. The shops had cute assorted goods that we browsed brought after eating.
Nice place to shop to be around since this is a little different around canal street. There is food located in one size, and stuff to buy in another.
No comment

I can't say how happy I was to discover the Canal Street Market! In a section (and street) of the city that carries a reputation for lacking restaurants and being full of fake Louie bags, the Canal Street Market completely changes the stereotype. Since I am constantly around this area, I decided to give it a try, and was SO happy I did. Walking inside you feel completely transported away from the sleaziness of Canal Street, and into a clean, neat, and healthy market. It reminded me a lot of Eataly but with all healthy food, and I immediately ran to Lulu's to grab both my Dragonfruit Acai Bowl and Avocado Toast. So delicious and worth it! I am going to take my little cousin when I go back, because I know even she would enjoy the selection. It is going to be my new go-to, I absolutely cannot wait to explore the other stores and juice bars.
most stuff was closed, but i got some really good ramen and boba! i def recommend for some good lunch
No comment
No comment

WOW am I glad that I stumbled across this place! We initially came to Canal Street Market for one of the little stores in the market place (Mandu KPOP Store) but we were thrilled to find a trendy cafeteria right across the space. Aside from a variety of different and hip Asian restaurants, there was Greek food, a pizza parlor and my favorite...BOBA! I loved the selection that this place offered and you really can't go wrong with choosing anything here! This place is a must if you're in SoHo!
No comment
This place is NOT a market. I came here to get some basics.. carton of milk, eggs, toilet paper, frozen pizza rolls.. none of that was available.
The meal is just perfect , from portion to flavor you can't go wrong. A must try is Izakaya / Samurice

A lot of good creative conscious food seemingly well made- fresh ingredients and what not. I walked past Izakaya/Samurice and I noticed tiny bowls on their counter for display with rice and various toppings. In one bowl I saw some appetizing looking beans over rice (or so I thought). In front of that bowl was a hand written note that said "very healthy!" Nattō is what it was- fermented soy beans. Probably one of, (if not the MOST) unappetizing foods I have ever eaten in my life. The slime factor alone...couldn't do it. Anyway my issue is that Nattō is a Japanese delicacy and should be better represented other than just saying "very health!"..... I honestly tried to take it back and get something different and was told "Sorry we don't do that." The rice was good?...
Great stuff just pricey with targeted advertising to hipsters, great food though. High quality sushi, salad, and juices.

I knew I H A D to come here because this place was featured in one of Fung bros yt videos. Definitely worth the trip coming down here! This place is located right in the heart of Chinatown and with so much construction going on, it might be hard to miss. I thought this was strictly a food court typa place but I entered through the market side and was blown away. It was so aesthetically pleasing and I love the idea of supporting local businesses and artists! I really just came here for the food tho. I tried the steam rolls from Joe's and it was so good!! I didn't get a chance to try the other stalls but will be back again!

This is such a fun little place to check out while walking down Canal street, a bunch of vendors selling artwork, skincare products, handmade jewelry and even thrifted items. I didn't get a chance to go next door, but they sell food and drinks. It's also a nice break from people hounding you to buy their stuff, you can just browse and make small talk with the vendors about what they are selling. Support your local businesses and check this place out.

I came for a tiny exhibit by Mass Appeal and honestly, this place sucks. Firstly, it's very confusing because when you walk in there are booths selling a bunch of random things from jewelry, to leather bags, to cups. Then, when you walk to the left side there are food booths selling Asian fare. When I asked for assistance the employees were pretty snobby as if to say I don't belong there lmao. I went to get some bubble tea but the lines were ridiculously slow. I have no idea what the point of this place is but okay.

For a relatively small space, this food hall / boutique does a lot with a little. All of the vendors are unique and take pride in their craft. Dumplings were good and I really enjoyed the Peruvian ceviche and the green lemonade was fire. Call me a fan.

Good hipster eats. Ippudo, New Korean BBQ & Dim Sum dishes made for a filling meal. Lots of ramen, savory miso. Chipotle style bugulgi rice bowl & the dim sum set with cucumber chili side dish gavr us a taste of three asian cuisines. Nice ambiance, chil friendly staff. You can even do your bespoke shopping and get coffee or boba while you plan your Chinatown snooping.

I love this market! Great seating options, not too crowded in the middle of the day, and an amazing selection of delicious food. I'd definitely recommend Joe's steamed rice rolls -- the rice rolls were delicious, cheap, and super fulfilling. Quality place!
Really cool little market with several options for food and drinks, as well as clothing, jewelry, and decorative house items.
This place is great! There are a ton of great food options and there are a bunch of great vendors. Lastly, did I mention that they have a boba guys?! I will be returning.
I came here when the market was closed. But the office coffee shop was still open. I really enjoyed my time there. BEST cappuccino I have ever had!

I come here for Boba guys and to look at the local vendors. Canal street market is the new face of gentrification in Chinatown. The modern and minimalist design inside the market conveys the attitude of the millennials who grew up around the area. Prices are what you'd find anywhere in the city. Not crazy expensive but definitely not cheap. It's a pretty dope hangout spot though with all the local food and item vendors that opened up here. but yeah, I definitely have to admit I come here mainly for Boba guys, LOL.
No comment
Most of them take credit card. Must find sth you like here n good to support local business :) Next to subway station

Really cool indoor food courtish/market place. We had the Korean rice bowl with spicy pork and it was pretty good although it felt a little spicy. It might be a little tough to find eating space so you may have to wait for someone to leave
Good pizza And ramen... it can be crowded in there but the food isn't so  bad. A little pricey but not terrible
I would expect it to be bigger but it is more like a small food court with a few boutique store.

Cute, millenial-friendly place in the middle of Chinatown. If you find yourself in the area, it's worth stopping in for a bite, however, none of the stalls are stand-outs or are worth coming to from outside of the neighborhood. We tried favorites from a few of the stalls: Hong Kong bubble milk tea (run of the mill), basic ramen (SUPER expensive to add on normal ramen additions), and sushi burrito. As a frequent traveler, I've been to a lot of markets just like this, so I expected something to stand out, but they were all pretty forgettable.

I loved this market! We had boba guys and it was very good. Add more sweetness if you like sweet tea, because mine wasn't very sweet. This market is a good place for groups to meet up and wander around. The small shops are nice too look at, but very expensive! Also, WE SAW WINNIE HARLOW! Which made the experience there even more memorable.

Hand made goods shopping. Lots of food options, Ramen, Boba Tea, lobster rolls. I was there to rest from the haggling of fake knock off bags, drink some boba tea, use the restroom and charge my phone.
Very cute and perfect for window shopping, but everything is so expensive!  Got a cool present (a dart) for the BF under $20 though.

I am really pleased to find a modern, clean market and with good Asian food!  Well done and hope this is a continued trend to clean up Chinatown without losing the cultural aspects that make Manhattan a great place!

This is like a bad dream. Canal street is grungy as hell, and I love it like that... when you walk in "canal" street market it's like a hipsters wet dream. A bunch of urban outfitter wearing youngsters eyeing you down and waiting to suck your souls dry by selling u their special coffees from Brooklyn or little jewelries they made.... who cares, ok it's stupid and embarrassing , give me back pearl river market.
Another knock off food hall of mediocre food stands that would never survive on their own. There's a reason why...

Just went there this weekend, CSM is one large room with multiple "indie" vendors that come from NYC to California. Right now, CSM is a cute holiday market that you can browse for 30-60 minutes, maybe pick up something or two. Their stated plan is to become an all-year market with food options; when I went there was no food (besides Mast Chocolate. I'm thinking Chelsea Market, Grand Central Market, Gotham West Market, Turnstyle Market for the Chinatown/SoHo area)... excited to see that fully realized in the future for CSM.

Have been here a couple of times, mainly for the Boba Guys here but also to just drift around the goods vendors in the other room. There's a lot of food here that I would love to try, but it is Chinatown so there's so much other food to try & I end up already having eaten by the time I arrive! There's an Ippudo outpost here, which I'd be interested in seeing if I like better. The goods are SO cute!! The aesthetic of the whole market is also really hip and happening, minimalist in fact. There's a plant one, quite a few jewelry and candle/stationary ones. Rather pricey, but goods are really interesting and the artists are often present and ready to customize anything you'd like! It's always clean, not too crowded, and has a cute seating area in the back for people to chill or chat with one another. It's a really chill vibe, less claustrophobic than Artists & Flea in the area, and has a lot of really cute decorative knick knacks/jewelry catering to the young millennial.

There is much to love at Canal Street Market. The craftsmanship booths are full of pretty things and the food hall has many good eats. Best of all there's a Boba Guys location inside.  Better than best of all, inside you can find some of the cleanest bathrooms in Chinatown.

Cute, trendy spot to spend an hour or two. Grab a drink, some food, and dessert & catch up with a friend or enjoy some solo time. This place has a handful of food vendors that has a little something for everyone- from salads to Pokè, bubble tea, smoothie bowls, ice cream, coffee, and Korean/Mediterranean/Japanese/Chinese cuisine. The main downside is the tables in the eating area do not come with seats so you have to stand to eat unless you find a seat in the back lounge (which has limited furnished seating and looks like a modern museum exhibit). After grabbing a bite, take a stroll around the flea market to look at some creative and hippy artwork and cool handmade goods. There'll sure be something interesting you'll find that will strike up a funny conversation and some light humor. Overall, pretty cool place to walk around and chill. I would come back to try some other items that I missed next time.

This place is super cute with tons of different options when it comes to food. The boba tea is really good. Definitely going to have to come back and try the Ramen place. I will update this as soon as we get our order for the Dim sum place
Tucked around the corner from the office, I loved this place! Ordered the "Red Belt" ramen from Kuro-Obi -- absolutely delicious, highly recommend!
No accessibility for strollers but cool location good vibe. Only tried boba guys but want to try the ramen at Kuro obi and sushi at uma. No chairs but standing tables.
Took my traveling student group here, and everyone tried something they had never had before. It was great for options and I Loved the Japanese curry with fried chicken!!

Atmosphere is hip. Food is mediocre at its best. Something like this should have opened in soho/east village. Not chinatown. The food court in Flushing Chinatown is hands down the best! This is just another whitewashed tourist trap.

Fairly small food/goods market. They have a good variety of food vendors from sushi burritos to ramen to bubble tea. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and there was no line for any of the food. There were a lot of people just chilling in the back. Checked out the stores on the side selling stuff from jewelry to mast chocolate - interesting variety. Unfortunately I didn't buy anything. If you're around the area check it out
Wow - most amazing place - all local artisans selling their wares in a truly unique environment.  Hip without being too hipster!  Something for everyone!  Support local - great gifts!!
Great place in Chinatown. Like food court but more friendly environment.  Plenty of choices. Give the new life to China town.

We were walking in Soho and got lost, finding ourselves on the edge of chinatown. On the search for bathrooms, I saw a sign that said "food hall now open" and being a fatass, I held my pee to explore. WOW!! What a hidden gem! This place had some of the best foods to snack on and I am so glad we got lost. Bathrooms are so clean and there's a shopping area and lounge area with outlets.
No comment

i LOVE this place. There's a plethora of cute, healthy and tasty food booth options, which is mostly asian cuisine and also includes organic smoothie and fruit bowl bar, cupcake bar, cafe and more. the little shops are full of beautiful art, jewelry, plants and tons of other items that you wouldn't see in most other new york stores. although all of the items were pretty expensive, it was a great experience to browse through all the variety in the canal street market.

Ive enjoyed Canal Street Market since it opened last year as there are not too many places near little Italy where you can find a  clean  open meeting place with WIFI ,quick salad , a bowl of ramen, or a  coffee under one roof. The vendors are carefully curated presenting a local selection of jewelry, chocolate, fiber art ceramics and more

This review is merely for location choice.  It's literally located in no-where Canal St. far south end of Chinatown.  I guess this locale was scouted to give the food stalls a better chance away from the actual C-town eats competition.  It's a spacious outpost for those who may work near-by or perhaps a stop-over from the train station, otherwise its not a place with foot traffic.  There are a number of food stall choices and it seems most stations are efficiently turning take-out orders.  The right half of the store house the food vendors and the left half are for retail vendors.  The back of the food area does have limited seating for eating and not the best restroom.

This place is great! We ate ramen from the first store when you walk in. Don't know the name of it but it was incredible. So delicious and we got a coconut lime shaved ice from the last vendor. UNbelievable. So yummy. After we walked over to the market and I got the coolest earrings from beroep tech. They are minimalistic and really interesting and pretty. Can't wait to wear them. Will be back to Canal Street Market!!

A nice concept and a welcome space, but I could easily have given it a 2 star rating.  Unfortunately, the food is neither exceptional or reasonably priced.  The attached retail adds to a nice vibe, but the food component REALLY needs to up its game.  Still, the place draws a consistent-enough crowd - Canal St surely can use venue like this.  I'll keep it in mind as a place to duck into on a rainy downpour, but otherwise, Will stick to the boundless real restaurants in the neighborhood.

this place was nice. lots of food places to choose from and very cool local artists selling goods. bathrooms are pretty clean. only downside is that there are only two stalls. kinda wish they added more becuz this place gets pretty busy.
Great location with many options. Love the seating. Don't get the bubble tea it was watered down.

Really expected more exciting vendors in the craft area.  A food court in Chinatown is kind of superflous, don't you think.  Two stars because there are clean restrooms.  Noon on a sticky, warm NYC day and no a/c.

My first time here and this is what you call gentrification of the old Manhattan Chinatown.  This is definitely a newer establishment than I was here the last time. I like the place, it's half market and half food hall.  It's a popular spot, so get there early.  I tried Boba Guys and Loved It!  I'd definitely come here again seeing that all food halls around town are a popular spot just like the Dekalb Market Hall in Brooklyn, you should check that out, too!  My go to is also the Chelsea Market.  I love to eat!

Was a fun experience, with overall a strong assortment of vendors. For food I tried Kuro-Obi, ramen was good but for casual ramen in this neighborhood I far prefer Ramen Lab in Nolita (with rotating chefs, but always unique and amazing). I loved Daveys ice cream sesame and green tea flavors -though the single portion was a little too large. The retail part is very well curated, specifically I was impressed by the variety and quality of organic, local, unique, and often handcrafted cosmetics. You can also find a brand of fresh face masks (single use, refrigerated ones) and a florist selling little bonsai-style creations for your home, both of which i thought were unique and cool. Would have loved to see a few more good options, and some of the boring ones (eg fresh and co and nom wah which has two other branches nearby anyway) replaced by more unique ones.

Dropped by here as a walk-in. You'll see a line but it's quick. The ordering process was really fast. The cold noodles and the hot noodles were both really good. Ambiance is cool. The concept of this place. Definitely recommend this ramen place. One of the better ones in the city and around the neighborhood. Only 4 selections of noodles but all good. Would definitely come back here again.

I came here as a solo diner on a weekday. I was seated at the bar overlooking the kitchen. I ordered their signature tsukemen ramen. The soup was thick and flavorful. The thick ramen had a good texture. I think it's the best places for tsukemen in the city. Also, a good place to stop by as a solo diner.

This was my first time having tsukemen and it did not disappoint. It's still so flavorful and refreshing to have on the warmer days.

Came here at 11:45AM and was maybe the 20th person on line. Opens at 12. We got inside at 12:15PM. Sat down, ordered the tsukemen with warm noodles. Food came less than 10 minutes later. I got my noodles with chicken and a side order of pork. Not sure if it's because the chicken was a bit bland but the pork was amazing. Definitely go for the pork. The noodles had fantastic texture and the dipping sauce was just amazing. Well worth the wait and would wait again next time to eat it once more!

I can confidently say that this is one of the best ramen places in NYC. This might even be one of the best that I've ever had! The line for this spot goes by quickly, and I only waited for 15-20 minutes on a Saturday around 2pm. You order online and they bring out the food super quickly since the menu is small. There are only bar seats as well so it's very intimate. The tsukemen is a fishy and porky broth, so if you don't like fish it might not be for you. The noodles are super thick and chewy and hold onto the dipping broth so well. The Tontori was extremely delicious. The broth is rich, and the thin noodles pair well with it. The pork chashu is juicy and tender. I love everything about this place!

I've been to the original store in Atlanta and I was surprised by some of the differences. This store has a small selection of the noodles compared to the Atlanta store and doesn't have any side dishes like gyoza. They also only have counter seating so going with a larger party may be difficult. The noodles were ok and service was very fast. It feels a little expensive for noodles especially compared to the many cheap eats in Chinatown so I'm not sure that I will be back.

No comment

This place is absolutely incredible. The tsukemen here is that deep, rich, brown sludge like Tomita Ramen has, which you get when you mix chicken and fish. You order on an app here, which is fine, but it makes you not want to order more once you put in your original order. Seriously though, some of the best dip ramen in all of NYC right now, and vying with the greats like Cocoran and Tabe Tomo.

Some really good ramen. I got the dipping ramen but I would definitely just get the regular ramen next time. I tried my friend's and I thought it was much better. Very flavorful and would come again. I got here around 1 on a Friday and did not have to wait at all. It was about $23 after tax and tip for 1 bowl.

I came here twice. The first time to try the tontori and second time to try the tsukemen. Both times I went before opening on a weekend for lunch. This seems to be a good time because you can get seated right away and the line is much longer by the time I'm done. Tiny space. Very attentive service. I have to admit tsukemen isn't really my thing but I love how thick and chewy these noodles are. The dipping sauce is so thick it reminded me of Japanese curry. The tontori broth is rich and flavorful and paired nicely with the thin noodles.

I came here with my family because my mom is in love with anything that has to do with ramen. She's super picky with her food. She absolutely loved this place she said it was really good and I also enjoyed the food too. It was really delicious. We probably only waited for like two mins before getting seated but after us the place became overly packed so good thing we got their on time. The broth itself was super flavorful and the noodles was very chewy, it was just so yummy! We came as a party of 3 and it was honestly just bomb. everyone inside were very sweet and we had no regrets. we will definitely come back here soon!

Went to Okiburo for a quick lunch before a tour at the Tenement Museum a half a block away. We are so glad we did - the hand made noodles (that we can watch from our counter seats) the finely crafted soup - heating the bowls, assembling the ingredients one bowl at a time, the flame torched pork belly slices with caramelized edges- turned out to be one of the best, perhaps the best ramen we've ever had. Including ramen shops in Tokyo and Osaka. Bravo Okiburo, we will return.

No comment

Awesome new place! The ramen is served cold however the soup was hot which made it a great balance. Loved the flavors! Be mindful that they currently do not take reservations so be prepared to wait. Once inside, you scan the QR code to order and pay, your noodles come out within minutes! Very fast and efficient process, would definitely come again!

This was pretty good.  I got the namesake tsukemen. The broth was very good and the noodles were excellent. Pork chashu was good. I was intrigued by them having chicken but that was just ok. Decent sushi egg. I'm more of a tonktatsu guy myself or maybe I'd go 5 stars.  It does seem to be one of the finer specimens of tsukemen available in New York.

Great food and service!! We waited about 5 minutes to be seated outside on a rainy night and one of the workers brought out an umbrella for us which was so nice of her. Ordering was so fast and easy as well as the time for the food to come out. We tried both things on the menu, the TonTori was so yummy and rich, and the Tsukemen was so flavorful, my first time ever dipping ramen into broth! Definitely recommend coming to this place for comfort and delicious food.

I stopped by on a Tuesday for lunch ~2pm and was immediately seated - there weren't many guests around this time so definitely no line. I got the spicy tontori ramen and am a huge fan! The broth is nice, thick and creamy. Love that everything was ordered and paid for on the mobile phone. Servers were all very respectful and responsive!

No comment

On a Saturday afternoon at 2pm there was a long line outside to the end of the block, but it moved fast (20 min). The inside seats around 30 total. You order via toast tab, pay, and they bring the food to your table within 10-15 min. I ordered the tsukemen with an egg and bamboo shoots as add ons. I was kind of annoyed from the lack of toppings, especially that basics didn't come with the base version. The broth was rich, salty, delicious, and enough for the normal portion of noodles even with generous dipping. The noodles were thick and had an amazing chew. The pork chasu was well cooked but a little thin for my preference.

I wanna say I came here on a weekday night and the wait honestly wasn't too bad.  If you have a party of 4 or more, they may try to split you up, so just keep that in mind.  We opted to wait til an area of 4 opened up, and it wasn't that bad.  I will say that the ramen was well worth the wait.  It was an incredible tsukemen, one of the best I've had.  The dipping broth is pretty dashi forward adding a nice complexity to the flavors.  The noodles were also pretty bouncy and chewy, with a nice thickness.  If you're a fan of tsukemen, this is definitely a spot worth checking out in NYC.
The best ramen I ever had in NYC(and I had lots of it :)) so so flavorful! And service is amazing. Absolutely must have.
No comment
No comment

I came here on a Friday night around 5:30 pm. There was no wait. They will only seat you if everyone in your party is there. First of all, this place isn't an area where you will take your time eating. Most people eat and go. The seating is tight which makes it harder when you are all bulky from winter coat. I got the dipping ramen. The ramen was delicious. I love the texture and how bouncy it was. The soup based for dipping was rich in flavor. As for the pork, it was a little too salty for my taste. Overall, I will come back to try their soup base when I'm not so bulky.
No comment
Such quality tsukemen for a great price!! I'm so glad I've found a place in NYC that lives up to Japan
Absolutely delicious! I had the tsukamen- but I always forget to order extra pork chashu - which is amazing here! And the service is great, they are very welcoming. 2 very enthusiastic thumbs up.

First of all I want to say I am not a huge fan of ramen, but I finished the whole bowl. I am not a huge noodle person. Also, it was worth going super early and waiting in line for over an hour. Make sure you get there early or they will cut you off. There is very limited seating and they are open for a limited time. This is the dipping ramen noodles so the sauce is saltier and less soupy. I liked all the toppings inside of the dish. The pork was so tender and the egg was cooked perfectly. I was surprised that I liked the lime in the dish. Now I feel like I'm going to need a lime for all my ramen bowls. The eggs was cooked perfectly. It was had a nice yoke that was runny but firm. I especially loved the fact that the noodles were thicker. It didn't taste like ramen noodles. It was closer to a udon noodle. The noodles soaked in the broth perfectly. I got an order of the hot sauce and I think the hot sauce is worth the extra price because it add a nice kick to the meal. Also, the service i great and the food comes out so quickly! I am so glad I was able to try this place! You need to try it too!

Came here on a Tuesday with friends. Opening is at 5, but if you want to try to come early I would highly suggest. Got here around here at 4pm and we were the 2nd group in line. They start taking about 6 or more people at a time. Ordering is super easy online and you can keep your tab open if you want more. I got the spicy chicken tontori, which was super flavorful and the noodles were nice and thin. Everything was fresh and delicious. Food comes out super quick and we were all done around 5:45pm. Definitely a place to check out if in the neighborhood!

The noodle texture was AMAZING!! The broth was very good but I wish it came piping hot. By the time I dipped my noodles for the 2nd time, the broth had become lukewarm and wasn't as enjoyable as the first bite. Being greedy, I ordered a kaedama and it was honestly a huge portion... and I couldn't finish it. Note: They don't have any takeout containers so I couldn't bring the noodles home.

Freshly made in house ramen noodles. So flavorful and choice of pork was so good. Ordered the tontori but will need to go back to try the Tsukemen.

This place is the bomb. It's so hard to find solid tsukemen in the city. Everyone makes it differently, and the most variance is always the concentrated broth. Okiboru aced every aspect. The broth was flavorful, not super thick and overpowering, but perfect for dipping. The noodles were thick and chewy. The egg was prepared well. And the pork was outstanding. Love the efficiency here in terms of their operations. You sit, order, and pay via mobile before you get your food. Saves time for everyone.

I came here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon when it opened at 1pm. I knew there was a wait so came early (around 12:30pm) but clearly not early enough. You definitely have to come here by 12pm to be let in for the first seating. There's no vegan or vegetarian options since there's only pork or chicken. I like how everything is automated though since you order and pay by phone which makes the place very efficient. I ordered the  spicy tsukemen which was pretty spicy. I used only half the chili paste. The noodles were freshly made, bouncy, and had a good chew. They do use flour from Japan (has more proteins). The soft boiled egg and chashu were perfectly cooked. The dipping broth was flavorful and they give you a lot (I guess in case you want to order extra noodles). I want to come back but maybe in 6 months when hopefully there's a shorter wait. I don't like waiting for an hour for food because I get hangry haha.
No comment

Came here ~25 minutes before opening on Thursday afternoon and there about 5 people ahead of me. Tsukemen was good overall; I enjoyed the chewy consistency of the thick noodle and the warm broth. The soft boiled egg was super duper salty (and so was my friend's) and the chasu was ok. No appetizers at this time like in their other location. Not much going on in terms of interior but an open kitchen. The ordering system was efficiently done through your phone.

Even though they have a very tiny menu (and restaurant), this place is so worth checking out! I tried tsukemen noodles in Japan and fell in love with having slightly thicker noodles to dip into a gravy-like sauce, and now I am so glad there is a place in the US that is also delicious! They serve it with a slice of lime but make sure to squeeze it to balance the slight saltiness of the dipping broth--the acidity takes it to another level! Hands down recommend even with the long wait time. Definitely worth it!
No comment

We came here on a Sunday at 12:30pm, just 30 mins before it had opened. The line already had about 10 people waiting. Within a few minutes, the hostess came out to greet everyone and let us know they'll let us in earlier, just wanted to make sure they don't accept cash and what our choices for the menu would be. As we were seated, each spot had a QR code to scan and order for themselves. I went with Tontori with both chicken and pork protein and extra egg. It took about 10 mins for our dishes to arrive. I really enjoyed the broth, tasted very rich and creamy. I'd come back to try their signature dish for next time.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best I've ever had. I went in December while visiting the city and I dream of this meal. 1000% worth the wait in line. The lady was so sweet and kind. I can't wait to come back.

I came with my friends to line up on a sunny, warm weekend morning before they opened at 12PM. If you want to be part of the first batch on such a day, you would probably have to line up before 11:30AM (what I gathered from seeing the line at 11:15AM and witnessing the line turn around the corner by 11:45AM). I did not go on line until my friends arrived to join me at around 11:45-50am and we were seated at about 12:55pm. The place probably seats about 25 people. We divided ourselves to smaller groups in order to be seated earlier. Make sure to have a phone that can pay digitally via QR code, since that is the only way to order and pay for the food, which comes shortly afterwards (~5 mins). I tried the tsukemen with pork chashu and ajitama. I would recommend putting all the toppings in really early on because the broth gets cold 10-15 minutes later. The first bite of the dipped tsukemen was delicious, salty, and full of umami flavor. The noodles were thick like udon, and the chashu was soft, tender, and melted in my mouth. I wish the broth was served hot, rather than warm, but it was rich, thick, and delicious nonetheless.

We had a slight wait when we visited at 4PM (around 30 mins). But it was definitely worth it! The broth was super flavorful and the noodles were super chewy. You don't get sick of the broth either because it doesn't leave a greasy after-taste. Highly recommend this restaurant!
No comment
I don't normally finish the entire bowl of ramen, broth and all, but here I drank every last drop! Simple yet delicious. I hope more items get added to the menu.

This place is super authentic. Waited about 15-20 minutes outside in order to get in. The host was super accommodating to make sure everyone's parties were accounted for. Onto the food: the Spicy Tsukemen was phenomenal. It was creamy but not salty at all and the noodles were cooked perfectly. I'd recommend ordering the cold noodles w/pork for sure. Definitely a gem in LES

Came here at 2pm on a Sunday and there was still a short line. Don't let it intimidate you though because it moves pretty quickly. There were about ~4 parties in front of us and we were seated within 15 minutes. The inside fits about 20-30 people and everyone is basically next to each other, don't expect much room. They have a QR code at each seat to view the menus and you pay for your food at time of order. The service is quick and you'll be in and out within 30 minutes. I ordered the tsukemen with warm noodles (you can also get it with cold) and it was delicious. I recommend the warm noodles because the broth cools down relatively fast even with the warm noodle addition. The broth is extremely rich and pairs well with the thick noodles. The portion is very generous, it comes with meat, naruto, and scallions. Definitely not a good place for groups or a casual sit down meal. But if you want quick and delicious food this is the place!

So... this place was good. Delicious even. But I've had Tsukemen before, and I wanna say that the broth was just a touch on the "fishy" side. Tell me I'm wrong?  Completely uneducated opinion, but shouldn't the broth be scalding hot? Just one man's opinion. Open to being wrong. But that's just how I felt.
No comment

Best Tsukemen in New York hands down! I've tried many ramen shops in New York but none of them are specialized in one type of ramen-in this case Tsukemen. The noodles taste handmade and the soup is aromatic and strong. The shop runs at a fast pace and even faster rotation of customer, similar to the ramen culture in Japan. The only inconvenience is that the restroom isn't very accessible-the entry is often blocked by chairs and customers. Overall one of the best ramen I've had in New York

Great place for tsukemen. The noodles were the star it was nice and bouncy. I got the spicy tsukemen and my friend got the spicy tontori. Spice level was not that strong. The staff was very friendly and it did remind me of Japan.

A very nice and delicate delight. Happened upon them on a rainy day, 20 minutes before opening. The only time I've seen only one couple in line, as it's usually down and around the block today we got lucky, and it was so delicious.

we came here on a tuesday before opening, which i highly recommend. the line was crazy long by the time we left around 5:45pm. i got the spicy tsukemen which was incredible. the broth was super creamy and the noodles were thick and delicious! the pork chasu was the cherry on top. Food comes out pretty fast, and the chefs were super friendly. prices are round $18-19 which isn't bad. highly recommend!
Delicious. Get the addons esp the egg. Dip the noodles to your preferred potency level. Enjoy!
Best noodles I've had in a long time. Friendly staff, amazing food, easy ordering. 10/10 super happy.
No comment
No comment

I had my inaugural experience with tsukemen and found the salty and umami broth so delicious that I ordered extra ramen noodles. The courteous waitresses and the melodious background music of Studio Ghibli added to the enjoyment of the experience, making it even better. I highly recommend trying it out!

A perfect example of doing something simply yet perfectly. This place only offers ramen and tsukamen (both in regular and spicy) but each plate is crafted beautifully and you can taste it in each element. The broth is intense and full of umami, same for the sauce of the tsukamen, the egg cooked perfectly and the noodles deliciously chewy. We waited about an hour in line to be seated but would definitely do it again.
No comment

Probably the best ramen I've had so far in NYC (slash also in my life). We ordered the popular spicy dipping ramen (Tsukemen) with egg and bamboo added and it was incredible. The broth was rich and delicious and the noodles were perfect with it. The staff are nice and the wait was not bad at all. Would definitely go back!

First time trying Tsukemen. Glad I tried it. Small restaurant but fits a good amount of people. Stood on line for maybe 15 minutes for 2 seats. Ordered and paid on my phone. Food came out within 5-10 minutes. I'd say the noodles were a great texture, dipping soup was vey tasty. Chicken chasiu was different. I prefer the pork chasiu. Would definitely go back to have this again and try the ramen.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Best ramen/tsukemen in NYC? Yes! This place is also probably the best tsukemen I've had in all of the U.S. The noodles are thick and incredibly Al dente. I haven't had any other dipping noodle as close to the one at okiboru. The broth is thick, rich, and creamy. The chasu pork is melt in your mouth soft with a lot of flavor. There are no weak points in this dish. I'm glad to have tried it during opening weekend and can say I will definitely be back!
I definitely think this place is worth the wait. I don't come to nyc often but I think we'll try to fit it into our future trip plans.

If you can, I recommend getting there 10-15 minutes before they open because there will be a line to get in! The inside is cozy and tightly packed but service is very fast. The hostess is very friendly and will answer any questions that you have. They don't take cash(!!!) and you order via a QR code using your phone. As of December 2022, they only offer thin noodle tontori ramen and tsukemen (thick noodles that you dip in a separate broth), with spicy versions. I ordered the spicy tontori ramen and it's probably one of the best ramens that I've ever consumed. The broth was incredibly flavorful and lightly spicy, the thin noodles were chewy, and the pork that came on top was delicious and melted in my mouth. My friend ordered the tontori (dipping noodles) and the broth it came with was incredibly rich but the amount that stuck to the noodles was perfect. Both of the broths were rich but they didn't leave our mouths feeling greasy after we finished. I will definitely return.
No comment

My boyfriend and I kept seeing videos on instagram for Okiboru and decided to give it a try. Let me tell you, it did not disappoint! We decided to try on a Sunday and get there before the time they opened at 1pm. We arrived around 12:15 and there was already a small line and it got longer quickly. Definitely get there before they open to skip the wait! Once opened, we were easily seated at the bar around the kitchen and ordered via QR code located at every seat. Keep in mind, it's credit card payment ONLY. Service was great and super friendly. There's only 4 options to choose from. But, all done masterfully. I had the tsukemen with warm noodles. It was easily the best i've ever had. The noodles were cooked to perfection. The broth was so flavorful and decadent. The pork that topped the bowl... I wish I could've order extra to go. It was packed with flavor and had the perfect char. 10/10 would recommend and have again. The reason I only got 4/5 stars is because the seats are extremely uncomfortable and the space is tight. But, all in all, give into the hype! It's worth it!
Food and service hit the mark! Between the time time we got in to the time we left the staff was always very pleasing and but the food hit every note!
No comment

Okiboru serves incredibly flavorful dipping broths that is flavored with chicken and fish. It is paired with the perfect chewy noodles. I got the spicy tsukemen, and they do not go easy with the heat, but the spicy sauce is on the side, so ease into it at first. If there is one thing I must criticize, it would be that the noodles are served cold, so dipping it in the hot broth lowers the broth temperature considerably over time. Tsukemen is probably a dish that you are supposed to eat fast, so be prepared!

But it was definitely worth it! The broth was super flavorful and the noodles were super chewy. You don't get sick of the broth either because it doesn't leave a greasy after-taste. Highly recommend this restaurant!
No comment
No comment
Amazing, simply amazing. Tsukemen noodles are a bit hard to chew, but very good flavor. Ramen broth is just A1 if not, one if a kind. 1 hour and 30 min wait in a raining day. Worth it

The food was great , but on the paper menu I saw online the kae-dama for the tsukemen was $3.90 but when I actually saw the price of it on the online menu it was actually $9.50. I don't know if it was a mistake on their end or intentional.
The best ramen I've ever had and that includes Tokyo. They make their noodles fresh, they put so much care in each bowl. It's just amazing.
Wow! Worth the wait! I have been here 3 times and the food has always been consistently delicious.. I will be returning!

I must go back for their other ramen. I might give a better rating. Their thing is Tsukemen, which I didn't order. Their normal ramen which just so happens to be the first on the menu was good but just soup is slightly too heavy while surprisingly light on the tongue. Service is incredible meaning the lady was super nice. Ambiance is solid Japanese middle to low class real ramen mood. It feels like you're rushed to eat because maybe you just entered Japan. Maybe it's just so authentic, you might just not take your time to eat but slurp with fury. It's definitely real. It's Real Ramen. It's Ramen Time when you eat here. Be ready. (I do think you should just order their 'thing' which is tsukemen)
No comment

So this place is known for their dipping ramen but it was so cold out that I ended up just getting the regular ramen. This isn't the most extensive menu but I got the vibe it's because they really specialize and craft what they do serve (I was right). That ramen was some of the best I've ever had  The broth was flavorful, the noodles just right, the pork and chicken were tender and tasty too. I found myself not missing the extra add-ins I usually get for ramen. The hostess was so kind and tries her best to get you seated as soon as possible  but you have to queue outside as there's no waiting space inside. And you won't be seated until your full party is there (no reservations). Now the price was definitely the most I've ever paid for ramen. Let's say on average ramen is around $14-$20, this easily hits $27-$30  That said - I did really enjoy the food, service, and atmosphere so I would put this more in the special occasion dinner category  worth checking out for sure if you've never been!

Arrived 1.5 hours before opening on Sunday morning and it was well worth the wait. We got both the tsukemen as well as the tontori; both were delicious but I would come here for the tsukemen given there are less options in the city. Noodles were a perfect texture and the broth was delicious. The ordering system is super fast and easy (QR code in front of every seat) the only downside is that the broth doesn't stay hot long enough for me to enjoy past the first few bites.
Really cramped seating area servers are nice but food is type small for these prices. I can't give anything more than 3 stars in it still hungry.

Food here was absolutely delicious!! I live down the block so I decided to line up an hour before opening (crazy, I know) but I've seen the insane line every day after work. While I was in line, there was at least 60 people behind me all awaiting this glorious food. We were let in finally at 5pm and were seated quickly and our food was out in about 10 min. They have the Toast app so we ordered and paid, finished and headed out. Let me tell you about this flavorful broth! The broth was rich, without being too salty. It was perfectly balanced and the noodles paired perfectly with each bite. You could tell these noodles were fresh as well because they were so springy and perfectly cooked. I was initially surprised at the amount of chashu pork, but let me tell you those two pieces were more than enough! They added another dimension to the bowl and were charred in front of us, in the most exquisite taste. Definitely worth the hype and will go there again!

I had the tsukemen with chicken broth, and omg was it delicious! The broth was so tasty. I thought I was going into umami shock. The pork is good too. I got one that was nicely grilled/fried. It didn't have a layer of fat which was great. Space is small but that's ok because we went early.

Wish I would have taken a photo before but it was honestly so good, got pork and an egg with spicy broth - and the service is amazing and so quick! If there's a line it goes so fast and is well worth the wait
No comment

Great ramen but I would not come again taking into account the hour+ wait. The spicy tsukemen is basically the original + a spicy paste (tastes very similar to kimchi). The noodles were well made - bouncy and closer to udon thickness compared to ramen. The dipping broth was thick and well made. Take note that egg is not included (additional $2).

I came here to try the Tsukemen to see what the hype was. You order by scanning the QR code. There is only about 2 choices to pick from. I ordered the spicy one and added an additional egg to my dish. They give you water. Small restaurant, there isn't a lot of seating area where you are facing each other. Noodles came pretty quick. I googled how to eat Tsukemen before my dish came. The difference between ramen and Tsukemen is that the noodles come separate and cold. You dip the noodles into a broth that warms it up. I thought the broth tasted like curry a little. The spicy sauce came in another little dipping dish that I added to the broth. The noodles were good. Texture was good and tasted hand pulled/made. One downside I would say is that the broth got cold before I finished my noodles so towards the end it wasn't as good. It was my first time eating Tsukemen and I think I prefer ramen so the noodles stay warm and I love drinking broth. I did not drink the broth, I felt it was too thick. I would try this again as the noodles was good and the price wasn't too bad. I think it was around $25 with tip.
Pretty crowed for a Thursday late lunch, but I. Didn't have to wait in line if you go by yourself. Service is quick. Ramen is good
Came as was denoted as "the highest mich star ramen in the world opens in NYC". Having had lots of Ramen over the years and several faves in Japan - this lives up to the hype :)

Came at 130p on Wednesday solo. No line and had a handful of seats available. First time trying Tsukemen, so have nothing to compare it to. Noodles were size of udon noodles and comes cold with scallions, lime to squeeze, 2 pieces of pork, 1 piece of fish cake, and seaweed. The fish umami broth came hot in a separate bowl and was very flavorful. I started dipping food in the broth, but then just wound up pouring all the broth over my noodles. I will come back to try hot ramen. Very friendly service. Scan QR code to order and pay with CC on Toast web browser.
Good eats but had to wait 2 hrs.  Very limited menu,  think noodles was chewy and delicious.  Came on a Saturday the lines die down around 2

The broth was good and the food was tasty, but the service was lacking, upon entering wasn't greeted or noticed for more than 7 minutes just standing at the door. It's not a cheap ramen shop your paying $18-$20 for a bowl of soup the least a food establishment can do is provide good service, especially for those prices.
Absolutely amazing place. Taste just like Japan. Fills up fast so get there early. Can tell why it's Michelin rated.

It doesn't get much better than this for Tsukemen!!! I've been to Japan 7x and I've eaten all over the country. Okiboru is killing it! There are only about 4 things on the menu right now as even though it's not said, they are obviously in the soft opening phase. So know that there are only a few things on offer and don't go looking for the buns as I did. With that, the noodles are the best I've ever had, the bite, the texture, just everything about them are off the charts amazing. The chashu (pork) was so good, fall apart tender and had a nice sear on it. The egg was cooked perfectly with the yolk having a custard like texture which blew me away. Now to the broth for dipping the noodles. There is no other way to say it! If I could I would swim in it, I would. OMG... SO silky, SO smooth, SO flavorful. It's the best I've ever had. The chef knows what he is doing. To end, know that the dishes on offer are just slightly warm to room temp. Mine was not hot and that's exactly like it's served in Japan. It was worth the wait. Don't walk, RUN...

This is solid, nothing spectacular.  Tabetomo 'gets it' and I've had much, much better when in Tokyo.  Tsukemen is not super common, so I suppose I shouldn't complain, but I was just a bit underwhelmed.

really really good!! the broth was rich but light at the same time in how it coated the noodles. the noodles were super chewy and delicious. also the chashu was *fall apart while picking up it with your chopsticks* tender. insane. go.
The best Ramen I ever had!!!! They sold out by the afternoon so get there early. Noodle texture is top tier. Will definitely be back
Not your traditional ramen but holy sheeesh this was so delicious. The flavor of the broth was out of this world. And the noodles were amazing. Worth waiting on the line to get in

Pretty darn good Tsukemen with tasty broth. The broth did seem a bit on the salty side and lukewarm, so I would have preferred to have it at least a bit hotter. Will give it another try and get the ramen next time to compare. The housemade ramen kaedama went really well with the broth imo and I preferred it over the thick noodles that came by default with Tsukemen

Best tsukemen I've ever had. The broth was so rich and earthy, the udon was cooked perfectly. Ordered the ramen as well, they were decent and would be considered just as good as other decent ramen shops. Must get their tsukemen but if you want to try both, taste the ramen first then tsukemen.
No comment
The best worst food on the island! Love jus bad food and all of the terrible entries and even worse appetizers. Support your local jus bad food!!

Jus' Bad Food you are most certainly terrific, I had a lovely experience here today. 5/5 For atmosphere. Every thing I've tried so far has been amazing. Terrific central location, first-class service. Great location, fantastic atmosphere will be back soon.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great place for photos and drinks. Lovely pink couches and aesthetic. Make sure you DO NOT STAND and get photos they do not allow that. The menu is prefixed with options. I loved the appetizer we shared and my kale chicken and waffle was a nice blend of sweet and spicy. The staff was ... ok. As I waited to be called to my table you can hear the staff talking about the comment I left on the open table app about it being my birthday and I'm a content creator. I just didn't want to be seated in an awkward place bc I was definitely going to take photos to post. But it's New York. My actual waitress was nice and helped me with what drinks I may/may not like and that was appreciated. Price was expected. I think such a pretty place should have staff that is ready to help people have the experience they are desiring not catch attitudes about it.

Solid spot for a catch-up with gfs. The place is rather small so I wouldn't recommend it for a large group. The food was pretty good - we got the burger, the dumplings, tuna tartar, and chicken and waffles. The dumplings and waffles were the most memorable items. Drinks looked pretty but didn't taste strong or complex.  The service was pretty average for the area. My biggest drawback with the place was how cluttered it felt inside and the vibe felt a bit touristy.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon with a group of 4. Definitely make a reservation because it's a very small spot. It's so so cute on the inside! The seating and bar area very pretty. I got the chicken and waffles and it was delicious! Knocking off a star because drinks were tasty but not strong, and the chips that came with tuna tartare were stale.
No comment

super friendly staff with attentive service. We made a reservation as two people for 6 pm on a Tuesday - completelyyyyy empty. It is only prix-fixed menu, so we did the dinner menu for $45 pp (drink not included). I got the signature while we were young cocktail served in the bird glass - pear vodka based, definitely a tad too sweet for my taste but a beautiful presentation. The apps were much better than the entrees IMO - brisket was a little bit tough and lukewarm when served, while the salmon was slightly undercooked in a fishy, mildly unpleasant way. Food overall a 3/5. Definitely cute, and major props to our waiter (service 5/5) but most likely would not be back.
Only went for drinks and they were pretty good! I tried the talk dirty to me and it was delicious, tasted like a drink you would get in Mexico.

Dined here with some friends for a late brunch on a Saturday, of course we made reservations. This place is very cute, has all the ascetics however is very small with limited seating. We had the prefix brunch menu. I ordered the Kale salad, Avocado Toast and for my cocktail, I had the Uh huh honey, which was odd because the drink should have been golden yellow like honey however it was pale peach in color. The food was delicious and my entire party agreed to come back.

We made a reservation for the Prix fixe brunch for a bachelorette party and it was an absolute delight. It is such a cute West Village spot with pretty cocktails. We got a table right by the window and that added to the charm where we could enjoy people walking by whole enjoying some great food and cocktails. The service was really quick. We got the dumplings, omelettes and the if you're a bird, I'm a bird cocktail came in a cute bird shaped glass.
Amazing Service. ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS FOOD , the place is super super cute and girly, amazing for Brunch with lots of cool drink options

This place is super small so you definitely need to reserve a table in advance but also so cute. They have prefixe brunch menu. I had the kale salad and the burger with a side of truffle fries. The fig jam on the burger was everything. Who knew I needed that in my burger. Drinks were yummy too. Good for a girlfriends brunch but I did see a couple.
No comment
No comment

cute ambience and the drinks were so fun and delicious! I love the vibe in this place and the fries were fantastic. Didn't have a full meal here but it looks awesome and I definitely would come back to try more!

This place is smaller than I thought but very cute and cozy! It's a prix fixe menu so my friends and I just ordered different appetizers and mains so we could share. We also ordered truffle fries on the side and that did not disappoint! I'd def recommend the tuna tartare as an appetizer -- that one was my faaaave.

I'm not sure how I never knew about this place until recently, but I'm happy I discovered it! It's a very cute spot with delicious cocktails and food. Yes, I guess it's on the pricier side, but not really, considering the neighborhood, the vibe, and the quality of the drinks and food. The servers, chefs, and bartender are all on point and very friendly and accommodating. Definitely try the Brussels sprouts. That dish alone is enough to bring me back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I visited this cute place last year during pride month!!! Amazing drinks, food and decor! We even asked our waiter to make us the gayest drink- he bought over a songbird glass lol. I had a blast and making memories with my friends there.

Not only were the cocktails beautiful, they tasted delicious!! I came across this restaurant on instagram and saw how amazing the drinks looked I had to come see for myself. First I tried the, if youre a bird, im a bird too cocktail. It was sweet and delicious but I finished it way too quickly haha. Then I had the while we were young cocktail (purple one) and that one was my favorite. It was basically like a sparking cocktail which I love best. The drinks sneak up on you so trust me it is worth it! The presentation for the dumplings were beautiful to go along with the drinks. The bartender was the sweetest gentlemen ever making everything a 10/10! I will definitely come back with a different set of friends and have them enjoy this amazing place!! Thank youuu

Adorable place! Very cute decor, and loved the drinks we had! Highly recommend to go with a group of friends, it's super cute and girly. Such cute decor I just wanted to live there!! Highly recommend their signature drink!
Such a cute little place! Food was really good & they had cute, fun drinks. It's a little on the pricier side but would still recommend!

The cutest brunch place! The drinks were fantastic too and I love how well portioned all the sets were as well. Definitely check out this spot if you're looking for a brunch or dinner spot. The place doesn't hold that many tables so make sure to make a reservation!
No comment

This restaurant is a lovely place to stop for a quick brunch, but it is quite pricey. It's really small so most customers had to opt for outdoor dining but the service was great so it wasn't a problem for me and my friends. Drinks were so tasty and the names of the drinks on the menu added a nice touch to the restaurant's aesthetic! Food was served fresh but it was just okay. I recommend going for the appetizers.
Great food. Excellent service. Price fix menu with quantity for the price. Highly recommend this little gem!

I had this place marked down for quite some time and I finally was able to make it. This is a very small place but super cute and worth the experience. Definitely a brunch with the girls kinda place. Let's start with the decor!!! The colors are adorable and perfect for pictures. Our waiter I wished I remembered his name was adorable and gave us the best advice. My friend had the waffles and chicken and she told me it was really delicious. I had the salmon and it was very filling. Just a great spot all together.

I was traveling alone in February and walked by and stopped in. Luckily there was availability for me, but definitely make reservations! I had such an amazing time chatting with other patrons, the host and bartender!! I was truly having a NY moment! The food and drinks are amazing! I cannot recommend this place enough and cannot wait to return!
No comment
No comment
Cute place to stop for a drink! Had nice signature cocktails that were delicious! I had the Too Good For You Cocktail.
Came here for my sisters birthday. We had a great time and took alot of great pictures. The staff was super. The food was delicious.  The drinks were beautiful but could have used some more alcohol.

This place was made for Instagrammable millennials -- it's really beautiful with the soft velvety pink couches and marbled tables! The food and cocktails come out looking so dreamy that you're so scared to even touch them because you'll ruin how it aesthetically looks! However, just because it looks super pretty doesn't always guarantee that it'll be super delicious! It wasn't the best meal I've ever had and it definitely didn't fill me up but I also was hesitant to order more dishes because it can get really pricey! If you're looking for a place to take tons of cute pictures, I highly recommend checking out here! If you're looking for creative cocktails and food that will fill you up, you're better off looking for another bar! NYC is swarming with restaurants after all!

This is truly one of the best dining experiences i've had in the city so far! Came here for brunch and the food, service, and drinks were incredible (and very reasonably priced)! Definitely make a reservation but 10/10 recommend
So pretty and the food matched the atmosphere. Definitely make reservations in advance.

Came here for Sunday brunch and this place did not disappoint! The drinks were incredible and the food was delicious. This is the perfect brunch spot To catch up with friends (and the inside is very cute and instagrammable). They also have outside We did the two course prix fixe brunch menu and each and every dish and side was SO good. Will definitely come back soon!

We had reservations for an outside table, not realizing it wasn't an enclosed outdoor table and the host quickly pivoted to find us two seats by the bar which turned out to be perfect. The bartender, Angel, was charming and attentive, his cocktails were excellent, the food was delicious, the service was outstanding and the atmosphere was festive and lively. Definitely going back.
Went here with my friend from college. The burrata appetizer was amazing and so was the burger! Very cute place!
3.5 stars; drinks are so expensive but bartender and other staff were really friendly. super small but cute. gave us free shots for my boyfriends birthday.

Came here for brunch this past weekend. The food was delicious. We got the truffle fries, chicken dumplings, kale salad, and While We Were Young burger. The burger was unreal- came with brie cheese and fig jam. It was bomb. We did a $39 pre fixe menu. Kinda pricey, but I guess it's NYC. Definitely recommend coming here for a nice brunch.

Place was smaller than shown in picture. Foods were ok. Nothing impressive. And it was too hot to stay inside.

Arrived as a party of 4 on a Saturday 5:30pm. Reservations are a must. Very small place. Chance of getting a table to eat as a walk in are slim. We had the truffle fries, burger, short rib, and salmon. All were very good. No complaints about any dish. They were prepared well.
100% would recommend this place to anyone visiting NY! It was so delicious - I went for my birthday brunch and was so pleased. Not only 10/10 dishes but the ambiance was amazing too!

The staff was really friendly and attentive. Also great atmosphere and cocktails. The burger and cauliflower fritters were so so delicious!

Lovely experience! The restaurant is very cute and cozy, small but it has a great atmosphere. It's decorated beautifully. Sometimes places like this that are very "instagrammable" don't have the best tasting food, but that's not the case here. Everything was delicious! The prix fixe brunch was worth it, definitely go for the pumpkin with ricotta and the truffle fries. The drinks were lovely as well. Also our server was wonderful and super helpful. I would definitely come back :)

I can't say enough great things about this place! We ended up here on a Saturday afternoon while we were wandering the neighborhood and I'm so glad we did! The service was impeccable - I wish I remembered our server's name but they were awesome (tall, blonde with color in their hair). We were able to sit at a picnic-style table - the last one they had available. Every drink we had was delicious and I would recommend or order again. For food we had the roasted Brussel sprouts, salmon, and tuna tartare - all excellent! I will definitely be back and plan to bring others here. Also the bathroom is very clean and easy to get to through the restaurant - not the case with a lot of places we've been.

Best service I've had in the city so far. Came with my friend on a Saturday afternoon. They had a fixed price menu with great options. I had the kale salad and avocado toast, she had the tuna tartare and the burger and fries. We both loved out food. Their drink menu is really unique-- I can't remember our drink names but mine had tequila, kale, and cucumber-- it was the perfect amount of sweetness if you want a drink that isn't too sugary but isn't stiff. Our waiter and waitress were sooo friendly and the outside seating is cute. Our waiter opened up our umbrella for us without us even asking. I will say this is an expensive/borderline over priced spot but I don't even care because the service was so good.

Its has amazing food - so much better as i went with no expectation! Burrata, vegan dumplings, cauliflower totes, brussell sprouts with the bird shaped glass for cocktail! Nice brunch place for girls to meet and catch up

This place was one of the most adorable places I've been to in a while. My family & I came for brunch & couldn't be happier. We were a party of 4 & we all ordered something different & were BEYOND satisfied! Bartender was NOT stingy w/ the alcohol! Everything was served w/ care & presentation was a plus! Everything was hot & fresh! our waiter Steven & his rainbow hair were awesome! Steven took such good care of us we were loving him! I ordered the burger & a side of Brussel sprouts. It didn't sound appealing at first (cause who doesn't want fries w/ a juicy burger!) but it was AMAZING! I can't stress enough how good everything that was ordered was! The place was very small but they definitely made sure that everyone was of a good distance apart which made me feel very comfortable! I actually really enjoyed it. would definitely recommend & definitely would come back :)

This place is so cute and our waiter was super nice. We shared a bunch of plates... everything was great but the burger was my fav! A must try

My friend and I came here for dinner tonight. As many other reviewers have pointed out, it is a tiny restaurant (with about 10 bar stools and 4 tiny tables). I would not recommend this place for any party larger than 3. The menu is a prix-fix for two courses and they have a pretty good selection to choose from. The cocktail menu is great and we both enjoyed our drinks a lot. The food, however left much to be desired. Our 1st courses were okay and our second courses while better, were nothing to write home about. This is definitely an instagrammable restaurant but not worth the money for the food or drinks.

Come for the ambiance, stay for the food and drinks. This West Village spot has a great pre-fix menu. One app and one entree for brunch. My date and I ate the chicken dumplings, tuna tar-tar, burger, and chicken and waffles. All were great. The cocktails were good too. Expect to spend a decent amount, but that's to be expect in the WV.

I am absolutely in love with this restaurant. The ambience is romantic and chill. It's great for a date night. I loved the witty names of all the cocktails. Cocktails were delicious but food was even better. We had the cauliflower gnocchi which was my favorite. The saffron mushroom enchilada was okay. The menu is prix fixe which was the only thing I didn't like. We ordered the two entrees and two appetizers (burrata and truffle fries). This was more than enough food for two people. I would definitely go back. If you plan on visiting, you should definitely make a reservation ahead of time.

I don't recommend this for "large groups" (more than 4 people). Came here for my friend's birthday & the prix fixe on the website didn't apply to us. We were forced to do this Family Style thing (which is just the whole table sharing some of the "for the table" appetizers/starters on the brunch menu and choice of entrée per person) that came with unlimited cocktails for $120 per person (ends up $156 per person with tax & gratuity) for 1.5 hours. NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!! It'd be a different story if we were allowed to do the prix fixe brunch on the website, so go with a group of 4 or less. The food was good, but nothing spectacular. Drinks were creative and all that, but again --- not worth $156 per person. Nope. We also couldn't order anymore cocktails 11 min before 2pm (they HAD to prepare the table for the next party).

After a not so great experience at a place nearby, my two friends and I ventured to this spot for dinner and drinks. We had such an incredible time. Our server was so wonderful & lovely and really took the time to explain the superb cocktails; He made us feel right at home. I had the salmon which was to die for, one of my friends had the Tuna Tartare and the other had the brussels sprouts. The cocktails, which we each tried at least three, were outstanding, the different presentations for each were on point. Three of our friends eventually joined us and we had a few more cocktails. All and all the perfect evening.

Everything here is marble, pink, and crystal.. pretty much everything I love. The drinks were really good as was the food. It's a really small place and the tables are close together so you may have to sit really close to other people (I came here pre-COVID). I definitely recommend trying this place.

Wow, what a cute little place! I came in for pre-brunch drinks (yes, it's a thing!) and ordered the bird drink and the drink shaped like a globe.  Both were amazing from the taste to the design and shape of the glasses. Strong and refreshing. We went to brunch at another location, but I will definitely stop by again to try their food.

Such a cute spot for a girls brunch day. Drinks and food were all on point! Highly recommend and would definitely come back

Came here for my Bachelorette Brunch on a Sunday--Absolutely amazing! However, it is very small so I suggest getting here early. We sat at the bar and had a wonderful experience mostly due to the bartender! I forgot his name but he was very knowledgeable and gave us great recommendations. We did the prix-fixe menu and I ordered the Burrata, Chicken waffles (who knew a Kale waffle would be delicious?), and Truffle Fries (best fries I've ever had!). Everything was delicious!! The bartender also gave me a complimentary drink--If You're a Bird, I'm a Bird.

Absolutely the cutest place for a meetup w a friend to catch up. Lots of great looking drinks and a fun area to hang out in post-meal/drinks.
Unbelievable cocktails and service. Bradford was our server and he could not have been better. Truly some of the best cocktails and service I have had in NYC. Please give this place a try.

Omg. This place is so cute and the cocktails were beautiful and delicious. We ordered the If You're a Bird, I'm a Bird first. The bird glass it comes in is beyond adorable and it tasted DELICIOUS. Pear Vodka, honey, lavender, lemon, and pear juice. I love all those ingredients! Next we had the While We Were Young. Another delicious vodka based cocktail with vanilla bean and sparkling wine. I think there are a couple of other things in there but I can't remember what off the top of my head. All I know is that it was another beautiful cocktail that tasted just as good as it looked. The gold rim of the glass was a nice little detail that gave me Gatsby vibes. For food, we shared the burrata and truffle fries. I liked the burrata a lot. I definitely want to come back and try more of the food. And of course, the cocktails too.

I am impressed, While We Were Young was actually astonishing. Clean and cute mood. I could not decided what I wanted, so I chose Tuna Tartare, and it was absolutely amazing. Fabulous. Perfect service and staff. Overall, I think that this is an awesome place.

I cannot handle the cuteness and perfection of this place!!!! Ummm where do I begin???! Yes it might be a bit small but they do not overpack the seating so you're comfortable. We luckily walked in when there was no line and a table was available so we were seated right away. And soon as we sat there was a LINEEEE outside. That's how good it is. We ordered a Bloody Mary and some cute pink drink with a clothes pin. Both were delicious. I ordered the fig burger, truffle fries and my husband got the Benedict. Everything was perfect. I seriously can't wait to come back so I can try every drink on the menu. Love! The decor is perfect. Love the coasters and marble tables. I would be honest and say the food presentation could use a little more effort given how beautiful everything else is. But overall great!

Super cute drinks. The restaurant is quaint and fabulous decor. The staff is also super nice! Great experience.

The chef, whom is African American has an amazing gift!!! Every dish taste soooo good ! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Not to mention the cute fancy drinks!

Very expensive cafe compared to most in the area, so if you go, know that in my opinion you're going for the aesthetic. The food is good, their drinks are good. But they didn't wow me for the prices that they were set. I.E. I didn't think the truffle fries were SOOOO out of this world good they were worth $18. Very pretty cafe though if that's what you're looking for. Go for the aesthetic for sure if that's your thing. Very average food and average experience.

Perfect little gem of a spot. I was worried it would be all looks but was happily surprised with delicious food and crafted cocktails. The chicken and waffles are a must try!

This is my second time here with my friends, and everything was delicious per usual. Drinks, food, service--excellent. My personal fav is the "If You're a Bird, I'm a Bird" cocktail. It comes in a little bird shaped glass with a flower garnish. Pre-COVID the indoor space was picturesque with fresh flowers and dainty colors; however, outdoor dining wasn't bad at all. I would suggest doing a reservation beforehand as seating is limited.

Because the space is so small, I would highly recommend making a reservation before heading here. However, it should be noted that they do charge for no-shows to reservations. I came with a group of friends for brunch on Saturday afternoon. The space is super pretty and the drinks were great. I thought the food was good, but not phenomenal. I started off with pillowtalk, which was a nice fruity drink. We also split truffle fries among the table, which was yummy, but again, only as good as truffle fries from anywhere else. For my entree, I had the eggs benedict, which had poached eggs, thick bacon, and kale on top of arepas. It was good, but I think I've had better arepas. The kale and arepa did not have a lot of flavor and although the sauce was really good, there wasn't really that much sauce to make up for the lack of flavor. This is a good place for cute pics and a nice brunch experience, but not the best place for brunch.

I thought this little gem was sooo perfect and pretty. The food was so delicious, beautiful and all the waiters were very friendly and so accommodating. The only downside was that I made reservations for 9PM, but wasn't able to be seated until 9:30. The lady was very apologetic and nice about it and she let us sit down by the counter area to warm up instead of waiting outside.  10/10 would recommend for brunch, cause then you can truly see how beautiful the restaurant actually is!

My favorite restaurant in the city.  Great food, great cocktails and great service.  Their best cocktail is probably the 'If You're a Bird, I'm a Bird' and it comes in the cutest little bird shaped glass.  I also love the Brussel sprouts.  It's the perfect spot for a girls' night out.

Absolutely loved this place. I cannot tell you enough how you have to go here. The food was amazing. Chicken kale salad and dumplings to die for. The drinks are fantastic and so extremely sweet and pretty. Service was on point and everyone was very hospitable. This place is awesome for photos. The decor and color and flowers make me want to crest this space in my own home.  Def a must try!!

Overpriced? Definitely, but a good experience none the less! Definitely a small space so make a reservation. My friend and I went for Saturday afternoon brunch and had reservations at the bar. Loved sitting at the bar and watching the bartender make the fun cocktails! I had the "one night stand" which was flavorful and had a hefty amount of tequila. For an appetizer we had the dumplings which we just eh but my favorite was the chicken and waffles! Super crispy and flavorful. As a sweet surprise at the end the bartender treated us to a shot of a special cocktail concoction she made. All in alI it was a great experience but with the price point I doubt I'll make it a regular brunch spot.

Cutest place ever!!! I loved everything about this place. The setting was very intimate and chill. The food and drinks not only look amazing but taste just as good. I ordered the chicken and kale waffles. Delicious! This place is a must try!

I've come here twice and it doesn't disappoint! It's really small and I went around 5 PM both times with no wait time for dinner. The main hostess/waitress is really nice and professional. I've tried three drinks (bird, young, honey) and all were delicious. I loooooove the truffle fries and also enjoyed the spicy chicken dumplings and mushroom lasagna. I'll absolutely be back! It's so beautiful inside and would be great for photos.

The waitress was nice enough to let us wait inside the room cuz it's too cold outside. Their chicken and waffle and their burger are my favorites.

Prime example of #eatingfortheinsta: the decor, food, and aesthetic of the restaurant attract the modern and stylish diner. The menu is unique, tasty, and the waitstaff was attentive. As other reviews noted, seating is a tad tight, but not obnoxiously so. I would recommend it, but maybe not if you have an extensive wait. Great brunch option for you and your gal pals.

A gem in a big city! Great brunch food too. Perfect place to show off on instagram! I got the avocado toast and it was splendid. I did not get any cocktails, but they looked really pretty. Make a reservation if you can. Small building!
