Cute little place with charm and a great Barman "Darrow" that can suggest what to order with a beautiful smile . I'll definitely come back for more . The food is excellent and the music is not overpowering for once . The location is great . Easy to get to and close to other shops . Perfect for our brunch weekly  escapade .

This place is so darn cute but it is WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAY smaller than it seems in pix. Probably the size of the length of the word "way" as I've typed above, lol. No, seriously. Anyway, stopped by with a friend, no reservation so we didn't get a booth, call in advance and reserve if you want that seating. Place is tiny, probably best for 2-3 dining IMO, cute date spot. I love, love, LOVE this cocktail bar! It is so ridiculously cute and the drinks (Pillow talk and Morning After) were exceptional. The bartender Jay and Jakob provided such great service and attention to detail in providing fabulous drinks! Will be going back for sure!

First off let me start by saying everything about this place deserves a 5 star rating. The food, decor, the staff absolutely amazing. Had a brunch date with a girl friend we both had the avocado toast (sounds simple enough ) wow, probably the best avocado toast I've had.  We also tried the cauliflower tots yuuuuummmmy! No dessert ?, no problem French toast did the job just fine. I highly recommend a girls date to this spot. Heads up make reservations the restaurant is pretty small but worth it !
No comment

Went on a Monday at 5:30 and it was empty minus two girls at the bar. This place is very cute but a lot smaller than I thought it would be. Burrata was stunningly presented and all the flavors went well together. Chicken and kale waffles tasted "interesting" but weren't even insta worthy so I'm not sure what would motivate you to order them. I would just get the burrata (and the cocktails sound like they were tasty and pretty) if I were you.

Super cute and "instagramable" spot, just wish there was more seating. Staff is very friendly, patient and don't make you feel rushed to get out, even when there are obviously people waiting outside just for a drink lol. They serve brunch as well but we only popped in for some mid-day drinks, which were GREAT. I tried the "too good for you" which had tequila, kale, lime, agave and cucumbers--this was surprising so good and unique. Plus having kale in my drink kinda sorta made me feel so fresh and healthy after eating 4 cookies from Levain's shortly before lol. Next I tried "one night stand" which was tequila, watermelon, and Chile agave. This was so bright and refreshing. My husband tried the "while we were young" which was vodka and some vanilla bean--this was a tad sweet but very well put together. Honestly their cocktails are so beautifully and delicately done...will be back next time in NYC to try some food as well!

Beautiful food that is very well put together. My compliments to the chef! Servers are on their A game.  Loved it... only thing that threw me was the menu switch-eroo. I still don't understand how I was charged $10 more for a "pre-fixed" menu but presented with a menu with different pricing when I ordered. I also was not given an itemized bill. Feels slightly shady. I had to ask for an itemized bill. They fixed it but I had to ask and press for it to be fixed. ***CHECK YOUR BILL.***
Amazing food, cocktails, and ambiance! The restaurant appealed to all my senses.  The Duck Bolognese is to die for!
Ate here yesterday with a friend, food and drinks were amazing, but the service was my favorite part!! Steve was so sweet, professional, and a joy to have as our server.

Didn't get a chance to eat here. Like most people, I came here because it was Instagram famous lol. I didn't stay for two reasons: 1. The place is extremely small. So small you'd have to go outside to change your mind lol. Seriously, it's literally one room. I didn't feel like being cramped next to strangers. 2. The menu is small. There were only 5 options to choose from for dinner and two of them were vegan. I'm not vegan. I'm glad I didn't  make a reservation. They charge you $25 a person if you cancel. The staff were friendly and the space was cute. Now that I know what to expect and come back on a slow day to have a drink but that's it.

Walking by this place, I would not have expected such a cute environment inside.  It's very cozy inside, but we were lucky enough to grab seats at the bar by the window for drinks.  The food menu did look quite tasty, but we stuck with our drinks on this visit: The "It Take Two to Make a Thing Go Right" and the "While We Were Young".  Both were delightful - unlike anything I'd had before, but with great, complex flavor profiles.  Service was friendly and prompt - would definitely like to stop back in here at some point on my next trip to the city.

They never disappoint when I come here.  Food and Service is top notch every single time.  Drinks....the best!  Burger...to die for!  I can't wait until quarantine is over to revisit this amazing restaurant.
Great little place! Enjoy octopus app and the burger and fries. Good service and vibe. They brought a candle for my sister and her bday dessert.
No comment
Was a bit disappointed in this place. The service was taking too long. The place was Incredibly tiny and very loud however cute!

I came here last night and now I am obsessed! While We Were Young has got to be one of the best stops to go to in the West Village, if not the whole city. The atmosphere is whimsical and inviting. The cocktails are adorable and creative, I loved my lavender cocktail because it was well-balanced and it's presented in a bird glass. I shared a Brussel sprout salad with pumpkin seeds that was spectacular. The winner of the meal has to be the Brie cheeseburger. The burger was cooked perfectly and the arugula, along with the fig chutney compliments all of the other flavors beautifully. Our server/bartender, Darrow, went above and beyond to make our experience memorable. FYI, the place is smaller in person that in pictures, so be warned it is a small restaurant. I highly recommend checking this sweet spot out for dinner one night. It was definitely worth the trip and I'm looking forward to coming again for brunch!
Racist and rude. I would never go back to this place and the waiter literally said he doesn't care if he leave a bad review.

Went with a group of friends for my birthday brunch and everything was awesome. We went there before they opened on a Saturday so we can get seats for 8. So glad we did because the place got real busy after. Everyone there was really friendly and accommodating. Our waiter, Steven, was SO great. He was genuinely nice and memorized all our orders without writing it down and even got our food perfectly with the substitutes/changes to our orders. Definitely impressed our whole group. We all loved him. Another plus is the aesthetics of the place. Everything from food, drinks and deco of the place was so pretty. We came out really satisfied. Must try:)

Super duper cute spot. Drinks are super instagramable. Prices are reasonable. We really liked While We Were Young drinks. However, the pillow talk drink and the bird one tasted like soap. Weird, right? I don't know what they put in it but taste was really gross. Staff is friendly

This place was one of the best brunch spots I've been too. From the food to the drinks, everything was phenomenal. Small little place, but its so cute... staff was great too...  recommend anything on the menu. Especially the tuna tartare, best I've had.
Can't wait for this to reopen for seating! Love this place and I take my out of town friends here all the time!!

Writing this review months later because I was just reminiscing on an amazing trip with friends and must recommend this perfect spot. We had been walking all day and were looking for a cute place to grab a drink and after a few failed attempts, we came across While We Were Young just by chance and managed to snag a table. Boy am I glad we did!! The inside is pink and just my vibe, the drinks were just what my Instagram feed and tired legs needed, and the playlists are curated to perfection! I couldn't recommend it more!! Would be so cute for a birthday get together or just when you need a girls chat. So obsessed and can't wait to make it a regular spot when I move to the city!

Cute, lovely, precious, tiny lil place. Its a tight fit for groups but they make it work. I didnt eat but the food looked great. The drinks are AMAZING and very thoughtful. Typical nyc prices $15-19 per drink. Well worth it;)

So upon entering the building, it is MUCH smaller than I thought it would be. Its probably the size of a small dunkin' donuts, but the ambiance and decor are bright and beautiful nonetheless. Our waiter was very upbeat, polite, and made us feel very welcome! When it was time to sing happy birthday, the entire restaurant joined in and it was so cute! The drinks taste splendid and the food is very filling! I will definitely be coming here again!

If I could describe the show Sex in the City to a restaurant it would be While We Were Young! This place is beyond cute and completely instagram worthy. The drinks were so unique and although the food was your typical take on bunch, it was delicious and has its own unique taste. The vibe was so girly and perfect. The place is small ... like really small but I was lucky enough to get a table during brunch time. I would recommend making reservations if going for dinner, for brunch anticipate a wait unless you get lucky. Ladies make it a point to come here for brunch with your girls!

Super cute place. Very small. The cocktails were very good and the brunch menu was nice. We stopped in the spot based on YouTube recommendations, very glad we did during our trip to NYC. We enjoyed our little brunch there. Go early as there aren't many seats so you may get turned away.

This place is great for taking cute pics for the 'gram but that's pretty much all it's good for. The restaurant is tiny, probably has a max capacity of 20. The tables were so close together, we may as well have been sitting at a communal table. That's how close we were to the diners next to us. Also, the service was terrible. The waitress wasn't very friendly... She also messed up on both my food order and my friend's which elongated the wait for our food. She also somehow managed to spill ketchup on another patron's hair. I don't know how but I looked up from biting into my burger and heard the waitress telling the patron not to move because she had a little ketchup in her hair. The only thing good about this place are their fries and the ambiance/decor. So if you're an avid Instagramer and love thick steak fries, check this place out! If not... STAY AWAY!

This place is super instagram worth! It's like an instagramer's dream, however some of their food isn't that good. I ordered an avocado toast and I didn't like it at all. I came back a couple of months later and I got their crisp chicken sandwich, the sauce in the sandwich was really good but I my chicken was is bit burnt. I just think that food here is a little overpriced. They're selling their truffle fries for $18 and most places sell them $13-$15.
This is a cute brunch restaurant. The food tasted really good but the portions were TINY. Also, why was the watermelon juice $9? Was the watermelon from heaven or something?

Went here with some girlfriends tonight to celebrate the end of our school year. The cocktails were gorgeous and delicious. Obviously on the more expensive side if you've seen the menu, but they were well worth it. We also got the cauliflower tots and kale salad as well as the burger. All items I tried were beyond expectations. The staff were all exceedingly friendly and helpful with recommendations. All in all it was a pricier night for me as a student, but I would definitely go back with friends visiting town or for a small celebration of some sort.

Jacob was extremely helpful and attentive.  The drinks were Excellent, all of them!  I started with the burrata with pear, it was killer, and as my main the tenderloin was perfect.  Pace of the meal was ideal, didn't feel rushed at all, and never felt like I was waiting for any measurable period of time.  Pleasantly surprised by this restaurant, usually the most hyped spots are disappointing.  I'll definitely be back.
No comment

The only reason I gave this place 3 stars and not 2 is because the coffee cake French Toast with cream cheese ice cream was delicious. Otherwise.... a strong 2! I didn't Really like that whatever we ordered came out not As I expected it. I think they thought that it was being Inventive or "different," but sometimes you just need to stick to the basics. The omelet was deFinitely not an omelet, more like a flat  potato mix with eggs. The burrata only came with one cracker for two people to share.... which means there were spreads still left on the plate - AKA Money wasted (and trust me this place was pricey$$!). The Bloody Mary I ordered was as I expected but virtually no spice to it - pretty bland. The cauliflower tots were good but I expected kind of lightly fried cauliflower.... this was more of a cauliflower purée inside a fried ball. Just not what we expected for the price. ANOTHER REASON this place gets a crappy review is because it is SO SMALL that they make you wait outside in the cold  until your entire party is there! When there were countless seats at the bar inside where people could comfortably wait! There are NO heat lamps either which.... come this winter... will be a real bitch for people having to wait outside in the cold!! The service was incredible and to our server... sir you were a joy!! Other than that... the food was mediocre - definitely NOT worth the price.... and I won't be recommending or returning. They need to focus more on hospitality and sticking to the basics in specific areas!!

This place is too trendy for me & I love it. Ambience is beautiful. It's a very very tiny spot, the whole restaurant is 500 sq ft. Get the fried chicken and waffles! You can do without the truffle fries though. They were okay. Drinks are so aesthetically pleasing& it's such an instagrammable place.
No comment
Super cute spot with great food. Smaller space so don't come with large groups and make reservations, but worth the wait!

Review for the bar only. Giving this 5 stars as it is simply the prettiest little space around and the drinks are equally adorable, and delicious! Prices are standards for the West Village, and you're really paying for the ultra-trendy vibe and the prime people watching (try to get a seat at the window bar!) Will certainly be back multiple times, most likely on the weekends when I am in need of a reprieve with a girlfriend and a beautiful cocktail.

Located right in West Village, While We Were Young is a cute, quaint and intimate restaurant. Definitely suggest making a reservation as space is limited. All the tables were adorned with fresh flowers which added a nice touch. Interesting cocktails selection and impressive presentation as well. I'm a lover of Gin but not fond of sweet or fruit infused drinks but their Something Fruity w/ Gin cocktail was damn good! Suggest trying the Big Eye Tuna Tart from 'starters' (be aware comes packed with garlic) and enjoyed and Duck entree (also note the menu frequently changes).

This is a tiny tiny restaurant, literally 3 small tables and a small bar, size of a large walk in closet. But it's so cute! Perfect to go with your girls and have fun drinks. Everything is pink and light colors. Super chic. Everyone their was pretty much girls, dressed cute or ready to go out. Oh the only men their were a cute server and bar tender.

Went for brunch with a friend. Menu was small. Avocado was okay but the cauliflower tots were pretty good. Drinks cups were cute. Its a verY small restaurant so it get really loud with everyonee trying to talk over the music which was playing pretty loud. Might be better just for drinks at night.
No comment

ADORABLE bar! Very intimate space with a few bar stools and even less tables. Came for drinks which were well presented and strong. Expensive but perfect for a nightcap. Don't bring your broke friends
No comment
Came in for my birthday and absolutely LOVED the vibe/ cocktails/ food! Would definitely come here again. The staff was friendly and welcoming.
No comment

The decor is super cute indoors and the drinks are yummy! We heard (and read) that the food left much to be desired so my three girls and I got up early one Sunday morning to make it here when they opened to get good seats. We arrived around noon when they open at 11am on Sunday and the place was pretty packed. Please keep in mind this place can fit like max 20 people - and I might be reaching with that. All of our drinks were pretty, strong and tasty. I would go back with a friend to try the food just to say I have.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend and I were so excited to check this girly date night spot out this Monday. The restaurant was a vibe including decor and music. The drinks were amazing. We each ordered two drinks: while we were young and falling for you, which is photographed. I also ordered talk dirty to me which tasted like paradise. There was a prefix 2 course menu and I ordered spicy dumplings and my friend ordered prawns. For our entree, I had a yummy burger and crisp delicious truffle fries and my friend ordered grilled beef tenderloin. The food was a 8/10, drinks a 10/10 and service 5/10. Now maybe we were overthinking, but we did feel very rushed by our waiter Steven and felt like he only kept asking us specifically if we were ready to pay. That was a tad bit annoying because no one else was waiting to be seated. He would ask for the check and say no rush but continue to rush us. He was very nice but kind of a non genuine type of nice. It felt fake and forced but nonetheless we would def come again. If you're paying a lot of money and leaving a good tip, your experience should be amazing.
Food and beverage are great. Creative brunch menu, I love it. The place is less spatial than I expected, so allow some wait time.

I booked the tables for a Saturday brunch a month out and the process couldn't have been easier! I received a response within 24 hours and the Prix Fixe menu is something you can't find anywhere else!!! UNLIMITED COCKTAILS FOR 1 1/2 HOURS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! My friends and I were shocked. It ended up being $90/person (14 people) with unlimited drinks, an appetizer, and an entree. They brought out two cakes for my birthday so everyone could enjoy. There were vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free options for my friends. The service was extremely attentive and flexible with my party. Every person in attendance said this was the best brunch they've been to, and we brunch for a hobby. We 100% will all be going back either on our own or in a group. I am considering doing my party there again! Thank you to the staff for being organized and upbeat!

I came to this restaurant because my friends recommended me. The restaurant was pretty but small. Me and my friends, 3 of us, were seated at the bar area. While we were waiting for the food to arrive, we saw a big cockroach and we have to help the bartender catch it. When the bartender told the manager about it he just came over to the bar area and stare at us. He did not say sorry or do anything, not even one word, maybe its because we're asian. The reason I gave them 1 star was because of his attitude. We never expect to eat for free or any discounts because I'm in the restaurant business. We even give the waiter a 20% tip. So we're never going back.
No comment

Good spot for insta post. But the food is overpriced and awful. Place is super crammed and you cant enjoy yourself when you are in a box and when the girl next to you is gossiping right next to your friking ear. Not a good dining experience overall.

This was the first time I came here and I have to say I was extremely impressed with the ambiance and service. We ordered the burrata and fig salad, which was phenomenal. Also, even though the place is very small, the wait was minimal. I will be back again for sure!

Came here yesterday for a drink by the bar. This place is so cute! They have the nicest staff, an awesome playlist and super fun atmosphere. The food here is delicious! Had a great time and would definitely come back here.

An instagram wonderland. The most photogenic avocado toast you've ever seen in your life. And probably also the most expensive. But the place is so darn cute, I'd say it's well worth it. Delicious cocktails too!

This restaurant was recommended by a friend who lives in NYC and it was hands down the best meal of our trip! The quaint, romantic atmosphere of the restaurant was perfect for our date night. All three of our courses were exceptionally delicious and the cocktails were even better. This restaurant blew us away!!!! I highly recommend While We Were Young.
No comment
Such a cute little restaurant/ cocktail bar! Absolutely loved the vibe in there I had The Plan B and it was probably one of the best cocktails I've ever had, it was gone in about 30 seconds

also one of those Instagrammable spots, really tiny space but generous in their portions and the food is so tasty! and their cocktails make cute pictures whilssssst getting tipsy - so cant complain about that - overall the whole dining experience was good, and we went during off hours on a weekday so it wasn't crammed and busy (so we got a seat by the window) and the service was pleasant too.
This place was so delicious! Def a tiny restaurant so make reservations. All of the drinks and food met all of my expectations! Our service was great also. My friends and I had a great time here!

Went here for dessert and drinks with a friend Saturday -late afternoon  - was full but it emptied out and the tables sat empty for the whole time I was there. They would not seat us at the tables because it's only for customers ordering brunch which is understandable. Asked the waitress if they could make mocktails because we don't consume alcohol she checked with the bar and said yes. Second waiter came along took our order and said no we don't do mocktails when we told him the first waitress said they do only then did he okay it. He was very rude just gave us our dessert and drink and the minute we took our last bite he bought the check over and said "looks like you're ready for the check" I don't normally write reviews but honestly other than the cute aesthetics this place doesn't have much going for it. Hire better trained waitstaff.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a 7:30 "bar seat" reservation on a Saturday evening. Arrived a few minutes prior. We were able to sit right away. Service was very good. Bartender took our drink then dinner order. The pace that everything arrived was good. Drinks and food were very good. Will definitely go back to try their other dishes.
Super cute restaurant with amazing cocktails, staff are attentive and friendly, great vibe for cocktails and snacks with friends

Came here for the cocktails. This millennial pink themed restaurant is an adorable spot for photo ops. Super small seating area (bar/window seating and 5 tables alongside 1 wall with 2 seats per table and maybe 1 table with 4 seats?). Bottom line= don't come here with a large group. You WILL wait/be disappointed and they don't seat you unless your whole table is present. My friend and I ordered the "While We Were Young" and the "Something Fruity With Gin" both $16. While We Were Young was the better tasting cocktail out of the 2 we tried because the gin cocktail was way too sour for our taste. For $16 cocktails I expected strong but delicious/pretty drinks but it was just decent. I think everything seems prettier than it actually is because of all the cute decor. After taking a look at the very limited and overpriced food menu decided to end our visit with the cocktails and eat somewhere else. I was also disappointed that I came here to take cute cocktail pictures and the rose bouquet at the bar area was yellowing/dying... aka couldn't get cute pictures. Would I come back again? No. Would I recommend girlfriends to come and takeIG pictures but only order drinks? Yes (with reservations).

Elegant and cute, little bar in the city. Great cocktails and the chocolate mousse was delicious. The staff were very accommodating and chatty at without being overbearing. Didn't try the food but the menu sounded appealing; would want to come back for brunch but it's so small that I'd assume the wait is horrific after 1pm. A great date spot.

I came here on my day off and was definitely impressed. I only had two cocktails here but they were really amazing! The waitress was really nice and knew the menu in and out. Its a very intimate setting and small too, so get there early. I had the Morning After (bourbon) and A Text from Last Night (mezcal) cocktails. Definitely recommend this place for drinks, I would come back and try the food as well.

Super instagrammable place like all the reviews say! It has some pretty great food and cocktails too - though so not just hype!! It's quite small and they don't seat unless everyone is there, so a) pick a friend who is on time and b) don't try to plan a big event here like I tried to do (I wanted to have my farewell to NYC dinner with 6-8 girls which did not work out so we went to Rosemary's instead which was delicious so it's fine!) however, my friend and I came back here just a week later when I happened to be in the city for a few days and had a very enjoyable and snappable dinner - the cauliflower dish was really good! The portions are not as small as you'd think - we shared 3 dishes and 2 cocktails and we were plenty full!

We stopped by on Pride and my pregnant friend asked to purchase a glass of water after standing in the heat. The waitress rudely responded "we don't do that," eyed my friend's belly, then turned around and walked away. Would not give my service to a restaurant whose staff would deny water to a pregnant woman on a hot day.
No comment

Amazing cocktails and great atmosphere!The guys who work here are so much fun!I laughed my #^^£* off! Especially on a saturday they wore their PJ'sThe food is amazing. 4 stars because its pretty expensive. My fav cocktail is the 'One Night Stand' and ' Punch Drunk Love' well balanced and delicious!
Love this spot. Super cute with great cocktails. Perfect for brunch with girlfriends. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Will be coming back
No comment

I've heard so many people talk about this place and finally made the treck this past weekend.  I ordered an avocado toast, which was like your classic avocado toast but has a porched hard-boiled egg on top - highly recommend if you're an avocado toast person. I also recommend pairing it with the "If you're a bird, I'm a bird" cocktail, which is a sweet drink with a swan glass (view my picture for more information!). The only downfall is that this place is very small and always packed on Friday and Saturday nights but luckily we went on a Sunday morning and were able to sit by the bar without a wait!

Great experience here. Kind staff. It's a small place with spectacular cocktails and small bites. I recommend for a happy hour or a date. The place gets crowded so get there early to guarantee yourself a seat.
Definitely a cute place. We had a couple apps and they were both delicious. Drinks are very pricey but it's good for an initial drink & app before an actual dinner nearby.

This restaurant was extremely disappointing. Their instagram photos captured my attention which made me want to seek this place out. The cocktails were amazing, but the food was a negative. I tried the prawns which smelled very fishy, the avocado was runny and lacked flavor.  Everything that I tried lacked flavor except for the truffle fries. It's is your best bet. The inside is extremely small and the food is pricey. I'll pay a high price for food that tastes good, but paying for high pricey food that does not taste good is truly a sin. This place was definitely a one time thing.
No comment
Really cute spot. The service, food and drinks are good! The space isn't so great though. You feel super cramped. Don't see this place lasting long.

This is my new NYC favorite. I knew I had to finally visit this place after hearing so much about it and I'm glad I did. I went midweek at an off time, so the place was actually empty for once. The workers were all above and beyond. Genuinely nice people who seem to enjoy their job and kept stopping by to check on us and chat. Obviously this place is Instagram worthy on so many levels, so I had a blast taking pics the entire time. I ordered the salmon and a side of truffle fries and everything was delish. Not only was the presentation beautiful and aesthetically pleasing, but the flavor was wonderful. I thought that the portions were excellent and the prices are definitely fair for the city. The location is on a cute little corner and I definitely hope this place stays popular. They deserve all the success they have been receiving.
No comment

This place is the best!! Their food and cocktails are amazing and everyone is super nice inside. This is the ONLY place to go to in the west village if you're looking to have fun and have delicious food/drinks!

This is probably my new favorite restaurant. Everything about this place is 5 stars. I went here for my birthday and I'm so glad I did. It's a small restaurant with the best drinks, food ambiance and waiter staff. The truffle fries and kale chicken and waffles were scrumptious!

Great specialty cocktails and all the food is amazing.  I particularly like both the Brussels sprouts with mustard seed as well as the Brussels sprouts salad.  The theme with the drink names and restaurant is creative too.  It's quite small, but fits as a good date spot.  They have a delicious burger and cauliflower dish as well.
Drink, amazing. Salad, amazing. Workers, amazing! I love it here ! The place is not only insta worthy but delicious which is a rare combo. Usually places are cute but sucky. 10/10
No comment
No comment
Amazing food! Great service! A little expensive and small portions but totally worth it if you're not too hungry or down to order more dishes. Get the gnocchi and the cauliflower tater tots.
Went there for Sunday brunch. I was there before they're open and there's already a line. The space is pretty small, so they tried to fit everyone. The place is super cute, but the food was ok.

A dream if you love pink and marble. My 2 friends and I came here for brunch yesterday around 1130am and the place was almost full except for the window bar, where we sat because we didn't want to wait. The bar by the window is super tiny, the food and drinks barely fit. For drinks, we each got the "one night stand" which was a beautiful watermelon color - and tasted equally as scrumptious. I ordered the avocado toast and truffle fries - $18 EACH which was def pricier than I expected, but it was quite yummy and I left full. The service was really great - our waiter was warm and friendly and took a few pics for us. I'd come back if I were in the neighborhood but definitely would prefer a table over the bar/window.

While We Were Young is probably the most aesthetically pleasing bar I've ever seen! The pink decor, marble countertops, and even the beautiful gold trim on the glasses all add to the aesthetic. I'm a very picky person when it comes to cocktails, but I loved every single cocktail I ordered, and they were all so creative! The "Too Good For You" tasted exactly like my breakfast green juice, and was a perfect balance of all the ingredients. Definitely my favorite drink! The food was absolutely amazing as well. I'm vegetarian and there were so many tasty options for me to try. Everything we tried was delicious! Our bartender Darrow was extremely friendly and kept us entertained during our time there! I would definitely recommend While We Were Young to any friend of mine, and I'll definitely be back soon!

I came here for brunch with my girlfriends on Sunday and found the ambiance to be super cute and definitely lives up to the Instagram hype. I would recommend this place for drinks but unfortunately have to give it a 2 star because the food was very sub par. I got the omelette and could barely eat half of it because it was super bland and did not taste good.

I've been dying to try this trendy spot. Sadly, the food was really disappointing. And being sandwiched against the window in the summer heat didn't help - it was stifling, so hot! Kudos to their photographer who makes the place look much much larger than it is in the Instagram photos.

Check out the latest fashionplate featuring our repurposed customized vintage AC/DC tee at While We Were Young.  One of my girlfriends and me have been wanting to check this place out for a while so we decided on going to brunch at noon in order to snag a table.  It's a super cute spot in the West Village and we love the pink and pastel vibes going on here.  We started with iced coffees and cocktails.  My friend got the While We Were Young and I got the Bradford's Mistress which was not too sweet and slightly smokey.  Both are super gorg shades of pink to boot.  We both got the truffle omelet which was very good.  As expected it was mostly girls, I wouldn't drag my man here.  I think their was one bf who was being a good trooper.  But definitely a girls catchup spot in my book.

Cute spot. Fantastic waiter service (blonde dude with highlights is a dear), but food is unremarkable. I am writing this review specifically to call out the carrots three ways, because that dish is straight bs. It's one carrot, two ways and some janky carrot shavings on top. My friends had fried chix and hamburgers which were quite good, but the carrots put us all in really negative place. We will not be returning. Thanks Debbie.
Cool spot for any female instagramers lol food was well thought through and tasted amazing! Small savory portions!! Highly recommend the burger and fresh watermelon juice !!!

Eh. The pictures look way cuter than in person. The concept seems very trendy pink girly vibe, but in person it seemed a bit older and cheaper, like it wasn't upkept as much as it should be. The place is tiny, and they don't take reservations. They also won't seat you unless your entire party is there. My friend arrived about 2 minutes after the last table for two was taken, so we ended up just sitting at the tiny side bar for Sunday brunch. The menu changes, so my avocado toast definitely looked different than the ones in the pictures on Yelp. The place is pricey: $18 for my avocado toast and ~$15 for the cocktails. Although the food and drinks are definitely "cute" and worth a pic, it's not really worth the price and atmosphere in my opinion. The avocado toast doesn't come with a side although I'd say it still was generally filling. The "While We were Young" cocktail is yummy but small. Service was fine, but overall this place just seems a bit too "try-hard" :/ Like snobby vibe but unwarranted?

LOVE this place. Came here for dinner with 2 friends last Friday and everything was great! The charred octopus was delish!! As was the pasta of the day - but the star was their burger. I don't know what they did, but top 5 burgers of my life!! Truffle fries were great too. Our waiter was amazing - made our night even better! The place is TINY so definitely make a reservation, and be sure to ask for a booth seat. Overall, great spot and will definitely be back!
This place is really small and overrated. The food was only average for the prices. The service was great and very quick, but it's really not all that. I guess it's pretty trendy though
No comment

This is definitely my new favorite place in west village. Great drinks, best chicken and waffles on the planet, cool staff, location, and people. It's cozy but bright given the light and impeccable decor. Great spot for lunch meetings during the day or a prelude to Dionysian debauchery at night. All this and you can actually watch a game on their hidden TV.

Don't take names? And don't take reservations?!? So how are we going to know when the table is ready? The host asked our party of 3 to walk around and comeback and he would "remember us." Ok... so we left the restaurant waiting on the sidewalk right outside, and he gave four connected bar seats, which just opened the moment we left, to two separated couples who literally walked in after us. Excuse me, is this a race thing? Because I am Asian?!?! I wanted to ask the host why and he's nowhere to be found -- so how are you gonna remember my face and give me seats ?!? This place is ridiculous and OVERRATED! Rude, rude, and RUDE!

This place gets one star for their Instagram worthy (and delicious) cocktails. But food and service will always overrule. The service was meh. Not terrible, but not friendly either. Very pretentious. Omg the food. Disgusting. I got the veggie burger...I don't understand why black beans are hard...and was completely bland. Due to starvation I only ate half and all my fries, which were also nothing to write about. My boyfriend got the avocado toast and it was okay..no flavor what so ever to these meals. Lastly, I spent a solid $100+ for lunch and I never got my so called "gummy bears" with my check..

Love the place! Really cute and the service was great! You do have to wait until your entire party is present. Makes sense since the place is tiny. The taste of the food was really salty and quantity was really low for you buck. Just another Instagram place basically.

The only reason I'm rating this 1 star is because the food was decent. Firsts thing first this place is a CATFISH! The pictures look nothing like the restaurant, it's so tiny and tight, super uncomfortable. Secondly, each person on the table is obliged to pay 45$ each for a two course meal and the food options aren't that diverse. Thirdly, flash photography is not allowed, it's an actual joke!!! Lastly only 4 people can split the bill and they only accept credit cards, they don't have a chip reader and they don't let you know that in advance it's a footnote on the menu, who the fuck reads that!
Go for photos if that's what you really want. The 1 star is for the cocktails, but everything else isn't nearly worth you cramming into this space and overpriced food.
Cute little place! Good food, good cocktails, good vibes! Small place so not ideal for large group. Can get packed.
This place is super cute! It's small, but quaint. The waiter was too nice and helpful! I wish I remember his name. Loved him!
No comment
No comment

This is the cutest brunch spot!! Make sure to make reservations or you won't be able to get inn. The hostess was a little snobby but the waiter, food, atmosphere and drinks made up for her attitude. The eggs Benedict was phenomenal and the drinks were trendy and perfect for brunch.

The food was delicious however was completely ruined by the fact we were asked to move 1 hour into our reservation immediately after our entree was cleared to a bar seat because they incorrectly seated walk ins. When we declined and said we would finish our last glass of our purchased bottle of wine and leave, 5 mins later they tried to move us again. We didn't even finish the wine. I'd you want fast dining then enjoy. If not go elsewhere where they respect a reservation and your business. They have a menu that is two courses and so if they cannot accommodate that they should re-think their business model. Unfortunately we would not return.

The drinks are really good however their truffle fries weren't that good. It's a small space so wouldn't recommend big parties. Definitely try their cocktails! If you like taking Instagram pictures this is a great spot for you.

I've visited this place for the first time for my best friend's birthday and the Ambiance was absolutely beautiful we were able to take some amazing photos however the space is a bit tiny and cramped and it was very uncomfortable sitting through brunch elbow-to-elbow with other guests. and it's a bit expensive, our bill for a 4-person brunch came out to  $300+, Which is'nt a normal brunch for us, seeing as how we each had a single order of everything. Overall I do like this place, but it's a once-in-a-lifetime affair for me
Nice place for an intimate date. Decor is outstanding. Area is a bit small. Array of drink options. Went at night, but probably would've been better to go in the day time.
Best new spot in the area -- cute interior and tasty food. Drinks are perfect. Crowd is generally on the upper end of attractive.
Cute, quiet, rather small with a limited menu. Great service (guy with short hair) and the salmon was great. Expensive but loved the drink with mango and rum!

I walked by this place so many times before it opened, and I finally got the chance to visit with a girlfriend. Everything about the decor is a girl's get-together dream come true. Pink velvet, white and gray marble. Yes yes yes! The service was great, the ambiance a perfect 10/10, and the food was very good. The chicken and waffles was delicious and I would get it again. The salmon was honestly just okay. The cauliflower appetizer was tasty but probably a little overpriced. Those drinks....man, so good. I would definitely come back again. Just be careful what food items you order and you should have a great experience.

Wow!  WWWY has super cool vibes to it, quality service, awesome music, chic decor, and the food was amazing!  Dinner and drinks here last night, and we were blown away with the experience (and details) from the moment we walked in.  Each item we had was special- burrata, tuna, Kobe burger (still thinking about this one), chicken and waffles (game changer), and the desserts (mouse and key lime) topped the evening off.  Would highly reco WWWY, and we'll be back soon!

Amazing! Everything that I ate and drank was delicious. The Burrata was a creamy ball of fresh delicate cheese served in candied lemon rind, so refreshing. Tuna tartare was  super fresh and served with smoked avocado and potato crisps. My dining partner had  scallops which were cooked perfectly. I had a sirloin with foie gras that was also cooked to perfection soo good. For dessert, a light chocolate mousse with rich chocolate flavor & a smooth and delightful key lime pie. The cocktails, i had the while we were young it was a nice balance of tart and sweet. The cocktails, Service and atmosphere were all on point and of a high standard.

YES MAM. If you like a cute, pink, Marie Antionette-ish, Instagram heaven type of place, and most importantly, BRUNCH, you will loveee this place! It was simply French press coffee, avocado toast, specialty cocktail, eggs Benedict paradise. The cocktails were delicious and beautifully crafted, and everything I ordered was tasty. Everyone inside was taking pictures for the gram, and the staff is very friendly and will even take your picture for you. We arrived early in case there was a line (they do not take reservations for brunch), as the place is VERY tiny. We got our food and drinks quickly, though, and the overall experience was just a joy. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in the city.

This place is an utter joke of a restaurant. I came here because of the "Instagram worthiness" they brag about and was really disappointed. I read that the place was small which I mentally prepared for but jeez, my elbows kept hitting the place next to me. Okay that's fine...however, the food is TINY and expensive also! I just couldn't believe my eyes and started to wonder if I was eating in a dollhouse. It's not worth the time, money and headache from the types of people that frequent these establishments.

This place is TINY; instagram photos conceal this fact. It's a fine place for a 2 person brunch or if you're getting a drink with a friend, but it's way too small to meet multiple friends at, and very quiet- even on a saturday night around 10 pm!

I don't get all the bad reviews because this place is amazing. The fried chicken and waffles were amazing and the drinks were even better. I stumbled upon his little place one sunny Saturday and i keep coming back!

Wow!!! That all I have for this place are these three letter word W-O-W. When you enter this small boutique restaurant the first thing what catches the eye is the elegant modern decor. The color schemes are soft, mature, and fun to sit in. I was waiting for the other shoe to drop. I must say I was waiting forever. The mixology was something I never experienced before. Well thought out ingredients that I could never imagine on enjoying. My hat off to the mixer. At this point still waiting for the shoe to drop, I mean with a place so beautifully decorated you think that maybe the down fall is the food. NOT AT ALL!!!! People I recommend the tuna tartar, the scallops, and their salmon. Talk about excellent cooking!!! And this is where I'll leave you folks. This is truest New York hidden treasure for foodie people like myself.

Perfect place for a girly brunch, ladies who lunch or just cute cocktails.  The restaurant is a pastel paradise with velvet pale pink tufted bench seating and a baby blue bar with rose petals dropped along the top.  It's really so cute that everyone who came in was taking pictures of every little detail.  It was a little embarrassing but I also did it myself so not here to judge.  You would think the food and alcohol wouldn't be great because the place is so adorable, but the cocktails were on point and picturesque.  The food was  I had the avocado toast with poached egg and pomegranate.  I also split the butternut squash, ricotta, honey and slivered toasted almonds.  So. Good.  Can't stop thinking about the squash.  The only con is that it is so so so small so my tall hubby could barely fit in the bench.  Most restaurants in NYC are small but this one seems teeny tiny so if you don't get here at the ideal time, you won't get a seat.

Most instagrammable place in all the land. Seriously wish I had no bad angles in photos like this place does. Cozy spot, meaning max 12 people sitting at tables, so wouldn't come with too many girlfriends. The burrata with roasted peaches was  and the eggs florentine was done well.  The truffle omelet felt like it was missing something, but maybe that's just me. Service was also great, girl was well versed in having to take photos for diners.
I am just reviewing their cocktails and ambiance! Very cute place and the cocktails were amazing! We only stopped in for a couple drinks before we saw some jazz, and happy we chose here.
This place is impossibly dreamlike. How can I possibly be the first reviewer? Will attend tonight and update. Cheers, xo

Great spot. Small. Intimate. Adorable. Always a spot available. Wish they could liven it up just slightly bit mostly love this spot and hope it doesn't go away. Would love to see more spots like this in the neighborhood.

I went around June 2017, on a massively rainy day but that didn't matter because you enter this place is so cute and GLAM.  They could expand on the space because it is a bit tight but the Ambiance and the food makes up for it.  I ordered the truffle fries and the omelet and it was sooo tasty (I'm a real foodie, lol) my friend ordered the kale waffles which was initially undercooked but when brought to the attention of the chef and the wait staff they were so apologetic and attentive and made sure we were provided another order with drinks on the house.  These guys obviously take pride in their establishment and it shows.  LIKE I said the only change I would make is the tight space, a place like this needs more room for all the people looking to get in.

Nice place to stop during the day to grab a drink with friends. I don't recommend it as a place to eat as the portions looked small and overpriced but the drinks are quite amazing here. My friends and I sat at the bar and had the best time with Darrel taking care of us. He let us try a few different drinks, including one that hasn't yet been added to the menu. I really felt that he was a true mixologist with these concoctions!! It's a cute place but it's super tiny so it will be packed if you go at dinner time. Thank you Darrel for an awesome afternoon and for taking care of us.

Amazing decor and even better tasting food. I felt right at home in this cozy, enchanting gem tucked away in the west village. Everything here is done with love, which is a huge prerequisite for me. :-)

I was in town for the weekend in December. I caught a cab to this place and when I arrived they were closing because it was a slow night despite. Their advertised hours of operation being 1.5 later. If you are a restaurant that do not accept reservations then you should stay open during you posted hours. I wasted money on a round trip cab ride.

Pretty and pink atmosphere with an LA vibe. All the cocktails taste like they are made for Barbies (we tried two). Basically different flavored jolly ranchers. Thick cut fries were great though and we also thoroughly appreciated the mini pack of Haribo gummy bears that came with our check.

Rad, music ,people and cocktail  I have to say best date spot in manhattan if you want hip sexy lush vibes this place is really a gem I also found out they are open for brunch can't wait to see them for that. Best chicken in waffles since roscoes chicken in waffles in Los Angeles

Gorgeous space, perfect service, fresh and delicious ingredients presented so artistically. A sweet little space that makes you feel special. Cocktails made with care and attention not to mention served on top of a rose petal! After a long day working at the Javits this was worth the quick ride downtown for a tiny retreat. Will definitely return.

I finally visited the infamous 'Instagram-able Restaurant' every blogger has been talking about & I wasn't disappointed! When I arrived, I couldn't help but notice the chalkboard message (always good to bump into positive messages). Even the set up for the menu outdoors was cute with the table & flowers. Walking in, I was immediately in awe, both at the decor & the size! The decor was just as what I've seen online but the size was about HALF of what I expected. It is very small so I can only imagine the headache it must be when it's a packed Saturday night and there's a wait. Well, thankfully, it was pretty empty this Friday Afternoon & that's just how I liked it. I was greeted by a Host whom I told I'm here for some drinks & waiting for my Wife to join me. He said "Cool! You can have a seat at the Bar!" I headed to the bar, ordered the 'While We Were Young' which was DELICIOUS!  I was able to take in the atmosphere waiting for my Wife as I enjoyed the cocktail. I'm all for good music playlists so that was a plus as well as the friendly Bartender. My Wife arrived & ordered the cocktail with Kale & how surprisingly delicious it was. We had plans to have lunch somewhere else so we didn't indulge in their food this visit but definitely will during our next visit! Looking forward to it!

The atmosphere, drinks, food, and staff are amazing. The desserts are to die for but will definitely keep you young. If you want a great date spot to enjoy your time and turn it back a little, come here. You will love it.

We only stayed for drinks because the waiter was not friendly, not welcoming, and the door wouldn't close so it was freezing inside so no point in ordering food. The Instagram account was pretty misleading.

The space is really cramped. Like claustrophobic.   The wait is long.  The food is just okay.  What I will say is outstanding, are the drinks.  The service needs to be polished. I went with a group of 5.  We tried to get the manager's attention twice- once to speak to him about the service, and the second time, we were asking him to take a photo of the group of us outside the spot.  He was so busy talking to 2 ladies the Entire time.  1 girl couldn't have been more than 21.  The other looked early 20s as well.  1 girl had on a denim skirt with NO UNDERWEAR, everyone could see her newly waxed private parts.  That is who the manager or the owner, whomever he is- the bootleg looking Bradley Cooper dude with the YSL sneakers that weren't dirty at all, because he was NOT WORKING.  Anyways- he rudely responded that he was "in a meeting".  Sir- you're trying to court a few almost teenagers during what was the peak time of the brunch specials, on a Saturday.   I will not recommend this place to anyone.  I didn't even tag the name of the place in my pics, because I refuse to give them any business.  That's how disgusted I was with the service, the wait, and the manager/owner/playboy who was trying to court the nasty girl with no panties and a bra top.  This man needs to focus on his business, and not run a Tinder in person meet and greet.  That man is gross and he's a pervert.  Even the wait staff and the bartender looked severely annoyed with the "boss" behaving this way.

Pros- Good food, great atmosphere CONS- unfortunately place is very small and can get very unpleasant , Drinks are ok I noticed mine was missing ingredients and are way over priced also Bartender was careles on he's service when placing the drinks . Also It was raInning and noticed how management dismissed people away from the outside sitting area just from standing there...Not impressed.
No comment
Amazing food, amazing service and wonderfully cute atmosphere! I plan on coming back here every time I visit NY!
Cutest little spot for a girls night with amazing drinks.

This is probably the best restaurant to go if you want to smell ass for fifteen hours. The food was not as good as advertised, but the burger man not going to give you false information was very good. The restaurant itself although decorated very well, super tiny, got very claustrophobic. They also forgot to mention the fact that you could only pay with cash after the fact we already ate #notshmoney

Food was just slightly above average, but it was so cute that I'm giving it a 4. Aesthetics boosted it up by one star. Rose petal coasters, roses on every table, marble tables, and the drinks are soooo pretty - lavender, pink, pastels. Gets crowded super fast though. Arrived at 12 (opening time) and it filled up right away. The restaurant is tiny

The decor and place is nice but the drinks are overpriced. They're charging too much for a drink/cocktail menu that's just slightly better than the average bar. This spot is good for the instagram but not great for the stomach or wallet
The cocktails are amazing. Try the Text From Last Night and the Too Good For You. Fantastic mixologists. 100% approve. For dinner you can't go wrong with the roasted squash and cheese.

My friend and I stumbled on this place while visiting the area yesterday and we loved it! The food and drinks were delicious, the staff were all SO kind and helpful, and the atmosphere was so fun! It was awesome and definitely a good place for a photo op!!
No comment

Cutest little restaurant hidden away in the West Village. No lunch reservations and very few tables. Recommend for a week day lunch to avoid waiting. Delicious cocktails and the nicest bar tenders and wait staff!

The restaurant is extremely small but very intimate. Which was fine for our party of three. The drink While we were young is very delicious. The tuna was not to my like but my two amazing friends loved it. The salmon was cooked to perfection. The price was the only reason I took a star off. A dinner for 3 with tip came to a little over $345.00. I would recommend to my other friends just remember to bring your Amex lol
Very cute cozy and chic place. The food and drinks were nice not overwhelming. But the service was great. This places scores two thumbs up for their service.
Pretty drinks! Food presentation great, tasty nah. Place looks prettier and a lot bigger in pictures don't waste your time you'll be disappointed.

Such a cute restaurant I went on a girls day we had brunch there the service was awesome I wish the restaurant was a little bigger it felt tight once more people started showing up but def will be back maybe the summer won't be as crowded! Super girly recommend for girls days
Great little spot - very warm and cozy, great music playing at the right level, beautiful flowers. Chicken and waffles was amazing. Cocktails are delightful. Will be back for sure.

Was not impressed. Unfortunately something "insta-famous" doesn't always live up to the hype. Not only is this place extremely cramped, the pink cushioned seating along the wall was very faded and stained. The food menu was SO basic I couldn't bare to order from it. Drink menu was OK but wasn't impressed with my drink. Seriously unless you want a photo opp, go explore something else!

I am a white millennial female who loves things like yoga and the show Girls and I am not even white enough for this place. I think they probably initially wrote a menu of just avocado toast and rosé and then realized they needed a few other offerings in case some poor sap gets dragged here by his girlfriend. The drinks are really expensive and don't make much sense...the descriptors are basically just words that white girls like such as the butterfly peaflower vanilla puppies Beyoncé lulu lemon cocktail ($16) which is more expensive than some of the entrees. I ordered the chicken and waffles. The waffles were green for some reason (maybe kale? Matcha? Lemongrass? who the hell knows) probably because they were trying to trick my brain into thinking what I was eating was healthy. Like another reviewer, I found a hair in my food but I gave them the benefit of the doubt because we were seated on the windowsill so it could have blown in. The portions were a little on the small side but that probably works here because if you're larger than a size 4 you couldn't fit in the restaurant anyway. In my opinion there are much better brunch options for a better price, and you won't feel like you're trapped in the head of a flywheel-going, Canada Goose-wearing, basic white girl and all her #besties.

I reallyyy enjoyed my brunch here. It's small, so we had to wait outside for a table (not ideal in the cold) but that's pretty standard for NYC. Surprisingly, the wait time on a Saturday afternoon wasn't too bad. And the food and drinks were awesome (and really fast). Definitely not an ideal spot for a group, but was the perfect place for us two girls.
Owner of the bar introduced himself right away and was a gem. Very attentive to our needs and making us comfortable.  Love it here! Just what the neighborhood needed :)

If you're looking for cute a cute place to hang with the girls and get a great pic for social media. I say sure go here the aesthetics are very pleasing although due to the blush pink velvet couch being used the couches are not the pretty pink they once were. They have maybe 4 tables and a half bar as far as the seating go. So this is great for small groups but if you're next to another party you guys might as well get aquatinted because the space is very "intimate". The drinks are AMAZING. Very cute drinks and the mixologist also did her thing! The menu selection although is not impressive to say the least. The menu was very limiting and not very appetizing. I could do without the food, and would rather this just be an extremely pretty bar!

Absolutely IN LOVE this this spot!!!  I went with 7 girlfriends and we sat in the bankett which was perfect!  The location, ambiance and cocktails were all a home run, all the food was perfection but I particularly loved the cauliflower to start and the scallops! Highly recommend and will be back soon!
Great new restaurant in the West Village. Great food and drinks.. Friendly staff, loved the décor and vibe. Had the burger was amazing can't wait to try the rest.

I would like to give this restaurant 5 stars, because it really did live up to its reputation of being a cute, trendy spot, with great food and good cocktails. I went with a friend and we shared the avocado toast, the chicken and waffles, and the truffle fries- all were excellent. The only hitch in our experience was that when we went to pay, I asked for a box for our truffle fries, and was told by the waitress that "they do not offer boxes and people are not allowed to take food to go". If that was the case, it would have been nice to know ahead of ordering so much food because we paid $18 for the truffle fries and barely touched them. It was pretty shocking to be told that you are not allowed to take home food that you paid for and would be able to enjoy later- it is also incredibly wasteful to discard food in this manor when customers are willing to take it home. Other than that it was a nice experience, however because of what happened I doubt I will be back anytime soon.

Came for brunch with friends. It's super cute and definitely a place to take pictures. Nothing wowed me in terms of flavor, it was more so the presentation that took it over the top. I got the avocado toast which was pretty standard and had them make me a purple mocktail. It tasted like a lavender spritzer it was pretty good but def not worth $7. I would come back just because it's so cute but nothing about the food made me think that this place was one of a kind. It was really all the ambiance and presentation. Service was good.

I've been walking by this beautiful jewel box of a restaurant for months and they finally opened tonight!  We were a table of three and all of us loved our drinks and food!  I had a tequila cocktail with prickly pear, steak tartare and fries.  The music was fun and the staff was so welcoming and friendly - I'll be back soon!

The restaurant is really cute. The service doesn't match the decor. The wait staff is oblivious to the fact that the people walking in are either hungry or thirsty, or in some cases, both. My friends and I were famished and ready to drink. Took almost thirty minutes to get served drinks, and we decided to leave once we'd finished our drinks, because by that time, no one had taken our order. Drinks were really tasty, though, if not a bit pricey.

This was the most adorable place we visited while in New York. We found it  by walking just a couple streets down from the famous Carrie Bradshaw apartment. The food was amazing and the drinks were to die for. It has the cutest little interior too. Will definitely revisit next time I'm in New York!

Food was pretty good but not worth the price. The host was very rude and made us wait outside in 37 degree weather until the last person of our party arrived. She wouldn't even let us sit at the bar and wait. This was so annoying because they weren't even busy.

Absolutely love it here! Came with my friend during a week day and the restaurant was empty! It was just us and another group of friends. The staff was fantastic and were so patient as we took pictures of the restaurant and our drinks/food. Everything we ate was great! We had the classic purple drink and it was delicious. We also had the carrot cake for desert and not only was it beautiful to look at it, but it tasted fantastic as well. I truly recommend this spot, but recommend trying to go on a week day if you want to beat the crowd. You will get some amazing Instagram pics and have a fun time!
No comment

The restaurant was undeniably cute, but it was almost immediately ruined by the tiny size and loud noise level. Likewise, the food and drinks were good, but the service wasn't great and it's difficult to eat when you're rubbing elbows with a stranger at every bite. All of this would've been manageable without the astronomical prices. I went with two other people and they wouldn't let us split two pre-fixe options. We were told that every person included in the reservation had to order a $45 meal (this wasn't in any kind of notice when I made the reservation or read the menu). What if someone just wanted drinks? I had a friend with me who just wasn't prepared to pay that amount but there were no exceptions. Then we couldn't even cancel the reservation without them charging us like $60. All of this plus $15 drinks each. We won't be going back or recommending this place to anyone. It's NYC, there are plenty of better pretty restaurants, even just within a two block radius.

The reason why I'm writing this review is because my friend asked me to join her for brunch at this establishment again since we had such a great time last we went... well,  the food is great, I've called it [ the best chicken and waffles I've had in some time] whenever is running their social media accounts is a complete snobbish A*%. I have had brunch/lunch at this restaurant many many times, with my girlfriends, husband and even older son. So apparently they STOLE my photo from Instagram and reposted it on their page. I thanked them for the repost and they decided to delete it instead of giving me the credit for my picture as they do to everyone else that goes to their restaurant. So disrespectful! Specially because all I said was thank you for reposting my image I guess they checked my profile and saw that I was a mom not a thin lifestyle blogger with 10k followers and didn't think I was credit worthy. Well I will let my 4K followers that you guys blow. Thanks for showing people what happens when you get Instagram famous!

Gem in the West Village. We had 3 dishes and they were all delicious. The cauliflower came highly recommended from the patrons sitting next to us and it did not disappoint. The staff is very friendly and the space is inviting.  We ordered two cocktails off the menu and enjoyed them very much - highly recommend stopping by!!
web-celebrity go crazy place. small sitting area, service OK, not so healthy food....well, at least the interior design is cute....that's it.
The bald hot guy Sam at the bar knows how to make the best drink. Stephen is the hot server who was more than accommodating and is the reason I would frequent here

While We Were Young is everything I expected based on their website. The food was delicious and the cocktails were both fun and tasty. I will definitely be going back. It was the perfect place to go for a catch up drink with a friend after work. The space is small but I didn't feel crowded. I feel like the owner(s) really took their time with the design of not only the space but also the food and drinks, making for a lovely experience on a spring evening. I would recommend trying to get a table before the normal dinner rush so that you can take your time and enjoy your drink. Since I was there before 6pm on a weeknight, I was able to relax and know that I was not holding up service and was really able to enjoy the ambience.  I never once felt rushed by the bartender or server.

Amazing space, great atmosphere, fantastic cocktails.. The chef cooked the scallops perfectly and it was a beautiful looking plate! I was very impressed with the professionalism of the staff, and the chef even brought the food to our table and spoke with us for a while. Overall wonderful time and awesome experience, I'll definitely be coming back!

Never have I ever....had cauliflower that was so good it deserved a review.  Order it! The burger is arguably one of the best in the city, the drinks were made to perfection. In true West Village fashion, the decor is beautiful as well as the patrons.

We thought we were having a great time here and thought we were getting great service! They even sent over a free dessert (so we thought). Then the bill came and they charged us each for extra drinks we never ordered and the dessert they "sent us." Honestly shady and unethical behavior.
First, what a beautiful place! The decor is gorgeous. Food is beautiful to look at as well as yummy. I had the chicken and kale waffles. OMG! The staff is cool and fun, definitely coming back.
Great Cocktails food and Décor.  Had the burger and it was Tremendous.  Great addition to the neighborhood.  Looking forward to going again.

a+ people a+ food a+ drinks a+ instagram aesthetic but it's cozy so I wouldn't bring like a bunch of camera equipment to your brunch photoshoot!  definitely buy one of their tee shirts... you'll look supe cool and get tons of compliments trust me. and if you go for dinner get the brussel sprouts!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The service was incredible, I was specific in my request for a table and view for my partner's birthday and got exactly what I wanted. The servers and host were amazing and so kind. However, the restaurant was out of my first two initial choices of entree which was frustrating as it was still very early in the evening and the chocolate layered cake was a bit of a let down. The octopus, bread, mozzarella sticks with the caviar were incredible however and my partner said this was one of the best steaks he has ever had. overall a good place if you get a nice view!

I came on a Friday night (I made a same-day reservation), it was quite busy but the staff were very attentive. Overall, a solid 5/5 for the food and the service. The food was really good. I loved the steak, it was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. Also nice ambiance, great location overlooking the river, I would definitely visit again and try their prime rib.

No comment

If it's a nice day sit outside otherwise the upstairs dining room for dinner is stunning. The service is on point here. And the food with French surprises are simply outstanding. The caviar and sticks are a must order every time. I will definitely come back for this experience again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My second visit and I enjoyed it even more. The service was excellent sat by the window with views of the river drinks were good octopus carpaccio fantastic . The Burrata  was very fresh and delicious.steak well seasoned and tasty the trout was fresh I wasn't particularly fond of the sauce big portions for the dessert lemons sorbet tasty.
No comment

So lovely! My family and a few friends ate here for my birthday dinner. We had a member of our party running late but the staff did not make us feel rushed at all which we appreciated immensely. Such a great and filling dinner! We got so many sides - all delicious. I personally had the Spicy Lobster Spaghetti which I worried would be a bit underwhelming compared to the rest of the restaurant, but paired with all the sides (roasted potatoes, mushrooms, asparagus) it was so wonderful. Would love to eat here again given I have the funds - it's a great splurge! (the mozzarella/caviar stick could definitely be split by two if you're just interested in trying it and are ordering additional appetizers)
No comment

No comment

The wine list is good though a bit pricy. The food was good for the type of place it is -- this isn't a culinary adventure. The atmosphere and service is very nice and it's a good place to go with a 4-5 colleagues for a meal.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went to dinner with my daughter to celebrate her being my daughter. We had a great time. The garlic bread is so fresh and hot and buttery with a great accent of garlic. The oyster mixture was so fresh. We had the mozzarella stick with caviar that had a great mixture of salty cheese and fish eggs. The octopus  dish was just as delicious. We tried the beef tartare and it was surprisingly delicious. We had never had beef tartare before. The spicy lobster  spaghetti was everything people wrote about. So goooooood. We had the broccolini which was seasoned to perfection. We also had the boneless rib eye medium rare and it was cooked to perfection. We finished the night with the 17 layer chocolate cake. What a great way to end the night. The service by Michael was too notch. The host Brooke was kind and gave us a great seat that would allow us to speak together without yelling. And the entire place is beautiful with a great view of the water. I can't wait to celebrate with this restaurant again.
No comment
No comment

Amazing service our wait staff was 10/10 especially our main server he was very nice and patience with us which I love . The food was exceptionally great. Was a wonderful experience and our go to restaurant every time we're in New York can't wait to come back
No comment
No comment

This is an Italian steakhouse in Pier 17. The indoors looked beautiful and the view of the river was really pretty. The service was attentive. Their garlic bread was warm and so yummy. For appetizer, we tried the Mozzarella stick with caviar. The portion was small and not worth it. The entrees were a different story. The ribeye was juicy and yummy, and the lobster pasta had so much lobster in comparison to the price. We also got potato for the side. I would recommend both entrees and would return to try more.

No comment

If you are looking for authentic Italian cuisine, this place would be a winner. I enjoyed each dish that we tried from the Spicy Lobster pasta to the lamb chops, everything was packed with flavor. Location is also a plus as it is by the water so great views. I would definitely return here.

Ioana was an incredible server. One of the best I've ever had. Nice ambience. Good food and drinks. Highly recommend if you are in NYC.

Fantastic dinner with an amazing view. They were so lovely and attentions to us. I highly recommend the meat dishes and chocolate cake.

This was my first visit to Carne Mare. It was a Saturday at noon. I was taken aback with how empty it was considering that the place was overflowing when I passed here during the summer. I took a seat at the bar which is too classy for television viewing. I ordered the AC's Famous Prime Rib Sandwich. I enjoyed my meal while listening to Nu Shooz's "I Can't Wait" and watching foot traffic on the pier. Expect high end service which is unusual for me based on my food choices. The sandwich was so soft and delicious. I did actually savor every bite. It almost got messy but it stayed together well enough.

This restaurant is just perfect in every way possible, great menu items, great service, amazing attention to detail and very professional waitstaff. If you make a reservation it's made online only and make sure you make it for UpStairs... thanks Ben D for the heads up. Great sound tracks while enjoying dinner... Lauryn Hill singing Can't take my eyes off of you and James Brown's version of That's Life. Anyway dishes are prepared deliciously and amazing combinations of spices and condiments. Extensive and expensive wine menu and great signature cocktails to be had here. Highly recommend this restaurant it's been here now for about 8 months or so and they just opened one In Nashville at hotel W.  Ciao

Dining at Carne Mare was absolutely amazing! The staff are so attentive and professional and gave amazing recommendations. The ambiance was beautiful, I sat on the ground floor and the bar and decorations were gorgeous. We had wine and espresso martinis which were delicious, and the burrata crostini was so tasty with smoked trout roe on top. I got the center-cut petite filet which was cooked perfectly,  I also tried the prime boneless strip loin which was also great. The Brussels sprouts and squash were amazing too. For desert we got the carne caramello which was so decadent. Will definitely be back here for dinner again.
No comment

No comment
No comment

The colorful outdoor tables lured us in. The food and service brought us in a second and third time. The food is delicious. The tuna tartare is a must. The Spanish octopus is also delicious. Best of all I was able to enjoy a great summer day outside with a wonderful view and also have my dog join me.

Can't recommend this enough! I have been here twice and ordered the same thing both times and all is phenomenal with consistent quality. We ordered the mozzarella with caviar, Gorgonzola aged steak, lobster spaghetti, mushroom Marsala, and the 12 layer chocolate cake. Pricey but you are getting what you pay for. Tons of lobster in the spaghetti and one of the best steaks I've ever had. The staff is extremely professional with great service. We also loved the sommelier-delicious wine recommendation and he had  a great personality. Will definitely be back.

I came here after multiple recommendations from friends and splurged like no other. The food quality was amazing (personally, even the caviar mozzarella sticks made me smile). The dessert is super fun to watch, like a short show before eating. The servers were all extremely kind and I loved the layout of the restaurant (seating is spaced out perfectly and super comfy). This place is also in Seaport which is just a nice calming environment as a whole adding to the experience.
No comment

Came across this restaurant and it easily was one of the best spots we've been to. Great atmosphere and the food was on another level. The oysters and ribeye were fantastic along with the wagyu striploin
One of my favorite steak houses in NYC. Excellent ambiance and really friendly employees.
The food was delicious. Service was very good if you want the prime ribs . make sure you go  before six. They sold out we were there at 6 PM. Overall, we enjoy the meal and the Ambiance

Awesome meal and was honestly totally unexpected, considering this place is not heavily advertised as best steakhouses in NYC (it should!).  To start, the Italian inspired milk bread is easily the best bread I've had in any NYC restaurant. Soft pillows with crisp and seasoned with Parmesan and butter, we couldn't stop eating it.  Then, we split the prime rib and porterhouse which was served with bone marrow and a salad.  The prime rib with the house made chimichurri was insane, perfectly cooked and addicting.  The porterhouse was also executed well, and was interesting with the bone marrow side and salad to add some richness and freshness to a heavy meal.  The wait staff was also fantastic, very helpful and personable - overall awesome experience and food!
Nice Italia restaurant near by Brooklyn bridge. Strongly recommend spicy lobster spaghetti.

Saw a show in the rooftop and wanted to grab dinner right there. Had Carne Mare on my list so we walked right in. No wait and sat outside. The table area was nice. Service was great and the food was good. Caesar Salad had a non traditional dressing which I wasn't a fan of. My girlfriend had the 8 oz filet and it was delicious. I had the halibut and it had a few big bones but was tasty. The 17 layer (and I counted) chocolate cake was The Bomb. Wish I had a glass of milk with it.
Great restaurant in a beautiful spot in the city, but not only that they have amazing service! 100% recommend

The most hovering service to the point that when a sugar packet was emptied, they leaned over for the empty packet.  Felt they were watching to whisk away the plates as we were almost finished.  No privacy as someone seemed on top of us constantly.  There also seemed to be a language barrier with almost every server which was very frustrating. Prices are high.  too far back from the street with no parking close.  The handicap person in our group had a long walk from the street. Pretty setting on second floor.

Haven't given 5 stars in forever, but this place was excellent from start to finish. The ambiance, the service, the food.. everything was perfect. I had the lobster spaghetti, it was a little spicy but I still enjoyed it, it wasn't overbearing. Definitely plan to return.
Carne mare is by far the best steak house in Manhattan! The Gorgonzola cured wagyu strip loin is to die for ! Polenta is also beyond delicious!
