I came here for a friends birthday in June and have been back two more times since. Lets start with the bread.. so soft and golden w garlic and salt flakes it melts in your mouth. Youll be dreaming about it the next day... Appetizers - u must try the octopus carpaccio it is divine and then the steaks!! My favorite is hands down the gorgonzola waygu but the tomahawk and porterhouse were excellent as well!! This place is pricey but the food and the service is excellent and I plan on going back a few more times. There are a few more items Im excited to try!!

Pros: the food overall was great. We ordered the mozzarella sticks (A+), oysters which were Maine/Mass (A), the gin drink(A+), sparkling water (B), potatoes (B), Brussels sprouts (A+), and the lobster pasta dish (B-).  The decor was amazing as well. This is date night, cool vibes, or business victory dinner.
No comment

Really enjoyed the mozzarella sticks and caviar, along with the lobster spaghetti and prime rib. Best part was this new special they had (double baked potato with cheese and truffles shaved table side). Chocolate cake at the end was a bit disappointing however. Service was good, but almost to the point of being too attentive at times if that makes sense.
Carne Mare is great! A classic steakhouse on the water in the seaport district. Servers are wonderful and food was great. Very classy but not stuffy. Will be retuning soon!
No comment

We celebrated our first anniversary here and it was a home run. The service, the food, the atmosphere, the level of attention and care they give... the seaport itself.... the whole place is an experience that absolutely sucked us in from the beginning. We were so thrilled with the food we will definitely be back. Highly recommend the cowboy veal chop and the wagyu steak. Ordered a drink called the spezia. Another can't miss. Thank you so much for giving us such a memorable and amazing evening.
No comment

Food was excellent. Service was horrible. We waited 35 mins for our cocktails that came out right when appetizers were being dropped. We all ordered the Gorgonzola Wagyu strip and it was delicious. However,  nobody came in and checked with us as we were missing a side dish.  After dinner we waited so long for our desserts and our waiter was nowhere to be found that we couldn't order after dinner drinks. Then it took another 40 mins to waive a waiter over so we could check out.  Third time here and will not be coming back due to our second poor service experience in a row.  Such a shame as we loved everything about the restaurant sans service.
Every single thing we had was excellent! The staff was attentive. Will be going back frequently!

The service was impeccable and the restaurant was beautiful. I was there with a group of girlfriends and we loved the table side options! The Caesar and farm salad, multiple sides and the port of house, which were all phenomenal. I give it 4 stars because spicy lobster pasta was not great - generous portions of lobster but it was was over cooked and flavorless.The mozzarella sticks with caviar and chocolate cake are must haves!

Celebrated my bday here and it was great. The drinks are phenomenal. We got the Sicilian Caesar, Mozzarella sticks with caviar, Halibut, Sea Bass, Brussel sprouts and Marsala mushrooms and finished with the chocolate cake. Food was awesome and super fresh. Best Brussel sprouts I've had in a long time, highly recommend!
Delicious!! Food and the service was exceptional.. I will definitely visit again when in the New York area

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

The food here is delicious. Me and my husband ordered the prime rib ,sweet Corn, potatoes , rainbow trout mozzarella sticks with caviar and the grilled oysters. The complimentary bread is amazing and so it the service. The manage, Jose took good care of us and made sure we were well attended to. The servers here are very attentive. The prime rib is very thick and juicy, made extremely well. The sweet corn pairs well well with the entrees we ordered. We would definitely recommend giving this place a try. The atmosphere is A1 sitting by the pier with the music and lights surrounding us. Perfect place to take your significant other in a date. When you come make sure you greet the manager Jose and let him know this review sent you here ;)

The food here is really good and the views around sunset are also great. The service was fine, we didn't have a bad experience like others have mentioned, although they could've been a bit more prompt (especially with wine - we got the reds we had ordered to have with our steak 10 minutes after the steak came out). Would come back and try some more of the menu, overall a solid place for a date night or special night out.

The appetizers were excellent, Yellowfin tuna, Mozzarella sticks and Caviar and Shrimp cocktail, oh and the fresh bread. I had the spicy lobster spaghetti and it was fresh and hot and delicious.  My nephew had the Filet and it was perfectly cooked (medium rare) and tasty.  Recommend the corn side dish as well.  Dessert - must order the 17 layer chocolate cake.  Service was excellent and professional just a little slow for my liking dinner took 2 hrs.
No comment
Excellent atmosphere, service and food. Sit upstairs. Can walk around Seaport before dinner.

The service and food was absolutely amazing! And I really appreciated that they read all the notes in my reservation, which included some food restrictions and that I was celebrating a birthday. I was really impressed by the entire team and I honestly can't wait to go back!

Absolutely delightful! Lobster pasta, rib eye steaks, and chocolate cake.  Just the right amount of spices and seasonings.  Exquisite.  Excellent customer service. Beautiful decor. Drawback: tres expensive. Portions are kiddie size.  Great place to celebrate special occasions like b day etc.

If you have walked pass this place, you felt the vibes!  Everyone is happy and the presentation of the food sitting in front of them has made you curious AF!  Well I got caught up in the Carne Mare web and almost $400 bucks later, I have no regrets!  1st let talk about the drinks and skilled bartenders.  I'm not a big drinker but I love a creative concoction of flavors.  The waiter said he will surprise me based on my preferences and I ended up drinking 3 cocktails.  The drinks...Alpino, Granita and a pinacolada!  So refreshing on a hot summer day!  Now let's move on to the starters, we had the Sicilian Caesar, spicy crab lettuce cups and Spanish Octopus.  My favorite was the Spanish Octopus!  It's thinly sliced and the flavor is delicious.  I wanted another order but my partner order the Tomahawk Steak and Spicy Lobster Spaghetti therefore, I didn't have room for much more.    That was enough food to add 2 more people so needless to say we had enough to take home.  The steak was so butter soft and perfectly set to medium, like I like it!  The Spaghetti was different but delightful.  I loved the kick of the spices and their spin on the classic dish.  We didn't make it to dessert which is my favorite meal but that just leaves opportunities to come back!  I love dessert and hope their dessert lives up to their drinks and food!  The last thing that stood out for me was the music selection, I had to hold myself back from singing.  The mix and volume was perfect for me.  I can't wait to go back!  I mean...if anyone wants to invite me, I won't say no

Many thanks to Shan and Dani. Shan pampered us and made our anniversary memorable. Dani kept accommodating our reservation without any inconvenience. Thanks to the wine enthusiast that helped us chose the right bottle of wine for our anniversary. The whole staff was very attentive and courteous. I'd recommend it and we'd certainly go back. Great job guys.
Much needed higher end but unpretentious restaurant in the area. Excellent,  professional service. Very tasty steaks. Special deserts.
No comment
No comment
We had the BEST time at Carne Mare. Our service was impeccable (all the staff were great) and the food was divine. We already made reservations to go back!
Great service, even approach to Japanese standards. Great salad and steak, will comeback again.
Our server was amazing. Our guests were above and beyond the wagyu entree. All the salads were delicious and fresh. The view was fantastic! Glad we came!

Expensive? Yes. Worth it? Absolutely. We had a fabulous time at Carne Mare and Nelson was our waiter. Start to finish everything was fantastic from the food to the timing of the service. His recommendations were spot on and it felt like we just ordered enough and not overdue it. Porterhouse, some appetizers and sides are generous in portion sizes. Cocktails are also fun and delightful.

Service is incredible! We ordered the wagyu and the filet, and I would come back for the wagyu. The steak sauces were just ok- better sauces across the city. The rolls are delicious. Their house wedgini salad comes out as leaves, not an iceberg wedge, but still a tasty treat. My party loved the potatoes, and a non-lobster fan now eats lobster after ordering the spicy spaghetti. A wonderful place with a gorgeous view for any special occasion. So glad to have been brought here

I went to Carne Mare before a concert at the rooftop. We were so excited to enjoy a nice meal and drinks. While the restaurant was busy, we did see them accommodate other guests in a reasonable time. Our drinks took 30 minutes. And then a full hour went by with no food. We were probably 70 minutes in when we were getting frustrated. All the parties surrounding us who arrived 30 minutes after us had already received their food. We asked the manager to close our order of drinks so we could eat elsewhere. The manager came to give us our check while the food finally arrived. Rather than try to smoothe it over, he told the waiter to take the food back to the kitchen  and proceeded to give us our check. After seeing our frustration, he ended up canceling our drink charge and we left. Note to staff, accommodate all your guests equally in a reasonable time. Use common sense and your customers will be happy. Bring a high level of customer service to ALL customers.

After reading review after review, I finally stopped here for dinner last night. The Gorgonzola Wagyu is the dish to order, however the other dishes were just so so - the mozzarella sticks with caviar lacked flavor, the Caesar salad didn't have a lot of dressing, the bread wasn't that cheesy and the polenta was more like pooridge and was cold. I am giving 3 stars instead of 2 because the service was very good
Second time here and certainly not the last.  Food is great and service is tip top. Would have given five stars except the Pannacotta was unexpectedly poor
amazing place for brunch. so warm and sunny inside, great service, fresh food, and staff was very friendly to my 4 year old niece. great addition to the neighborhood!

column3: Colonia del Valle Sur, México, D.F., Mexico
column6: No comment

They were out of the prime rib so did the ribeye and it was one of the best steaks I've ever had. Lovely service. Kitchen was really backed up, but Jose was top notch in his customer service. Definitely will be back and recommend to friends.

What a cool area and restaurant! Being able to eat on the water in NYC is a rarity, but being able to eat steak on the water is an anomaly. We ate upstairs, where there was a sexy, sophisticated, and social atmosphere, but you could also eat outside. Drinks 10/10! Bread 100/10, delicious pull-apart garlic bread with parmesan. MUST TRYS: mozzarella sticks with caviar, yellowfin tuna tartar, milanese cowboy veal chop, side of polenta, and the 30-day dry-ages tomahawk, spicy lobster spaghetti. The spaghetti had just the right amount of kick and was prepared in a vodka sauce-like mix. The veal chop was perfectly crisp and not classically thin, which was nice. We also got potatoes rustica with parmesan and the farmer's salad. We ordered the sweet cacio e pepe corn, but it never came, which I was pretty excited about, but forgot about until after the meal. Also, I'm not sure if the meal was space out or the kitchen was backed up, but it was a 3 hour meal. Overall, I would recommend Carne Mare to friends, especially if parents are in town or you want to impress a business partner. Great ambiance that provides an intimate setting in a bigger restaurant.
Awesome service and food. It can be a little pricey but worth every single penny! Will come back for sure

This place is one of a kind, the view from the restaurante to the pier was a delight, and of course the food was amazing, the treat of the staff was friendly and so cordial, I definitely will go again.

Carne Mare was an amazing experience for me and my daughter . They took great care of us . My daughter is now a fan of caviar at 7years old . Boneless rib eye was perfect. Everything was of high quality. The location is stunning , we loved looking at the boats on the water as the sun was setting . 10/10 would highly recommend!

Have had two meals here, both sensational. All three steaks we've tried between them--the Gorgonzola wagyu, prime rib and most recently the tomahawk--have lived up to their considerable price points. The potatoes are excellent, and the polenta is unfairly rich and delicious. Also the complementary garlic pull apart bread, outstanding. Desserts are massive, definitely split, and then take a  nice walk around the pier to call an incredible night out.
Not a real wagyu as advertised .. just an aged sirloin .. overpriced at $110 !!I had better wagyu !!
No comment

If your frame of reference is Longhorn steakhouse and Olive Garden, and you are seeking to spend a lot of money at what you perceive to be a fancy NYC restaurant, this is the place for you. On the other hand If you know anything about true high end NYC steakhouses and/or Italian restaurants, go to one of them.
No comment

I'm sorry. I came here wanting to like this place. Unfortunately; every aspect of the meal was subpar. Particularly when you consider the price. My friends and I have been going out to high-end steakhouses in NYC for the last 20 years or so and this place can't touch Keen's, Old Homestead, Sparks, Gallagher's, or half a dozen others. The porterhouse was cold and overpriced. The veal chop Milanese was mostly fat. The bread tasted like garlic knots from a bad Jersey pizzeria. The coffee was cold. The service was slow.

In love with this new restaurant. Decor and service were impeccable and the food was delicious. It's a wonderful dining experience from start to finish. Highly recommend and looking forward to coming back soon!

Perfect evening from beginning to end! Service and food were exceptional. Servers made outstanding recommendations. Our party of six chose to eat "family style" since there were so many items we wanted to try and the staff made it happen seamlessly for us. Highly recommend!! Atmosphere was lovely and you should take a walk around the pier too.

Excellent dinner and service.  Expensive but worth it for the right occasion.  Ceasar salad was enormous.  Spanish octopus paired beautifully with the buttery rolls provided to the table.  The aromatics of the seabass was amazing.  The 16 oz ribeye was simply perfect.  You can't go wrong with the sweet corn & the mushrooms marsala.  But the show stopper was the 17-layer chocolate cake.  The best thing about the service was that even though the staff was taking care of multiple tables, they somehow managed to make our experience very personal - almost as if we were the only diners in the restaurant.  We really appreciated the personal touch and attention to detail.    Overall, perfect setting for a special occasion.
Expensive but worth the special date night! Staff was amazing. Food was exquisite! Order the chocolate cake

What an incredible place! The space is beautiful, service impeccable, and the steak? Oh my gosh, the steak. Get the Gorgonzola waygu. You will not be disappointed.  Also, maybe the best polenta I've ever had in my life? Can't recommend Carne Mare enough.

The food, the ambience, the service --all amazing. Go before it becomes impossible to book a table ;). Quickly becoming one of my favorite restaurant in the city. Mozzarella sticks & caviar, octopus carpaccio, steak and fish... whatever you order you won't be disappointed.

One of the best steaks we have had in recent memory, the gorgonzola wagyu.  Yes, it is very expensive but we split one steak and, with the great garlic bread, appetizer (tableside salad for two) and side dish (excellent roasted potatoes) there was more than enough food.  The steak was fork tender, on par or better than a prime grade with a nice char and flavor. Save room for the 17 layer chocolate cake, a perfect end to the meal, not too sweet.  Service was prompt and friendly, get the corner table for two upstairs at the far end of the floor, able to look out at the river and ships and also see all the other tables.  Only downside is parking, not much available nearby on the street and potentially a bit of a walk; some of the garages close early, so check that out first.

Don't know where to begin! Came in celebrating a birthday and the staff was lovely and very hospitable without being overbearing. The food was impeccable and the wine list, though not too extensive, featured great wines. While it is not a place one can frequent all of the time, for special occasions Carne Mare is a wonderful place to splurge! 10/10
one of the best diner we ever had. everything was perfect the food the drinks the music the service.

Wow! You must check this place out. I haven't had an experience like this in a while! Everything was incredible, especially the staff. From the hosts that greeted us, to the managers who walked around throughout to check up on us, the hospitality was A+. Especially our server Brit who went above and beyond to explain the menu breakdown, give recommendations, answer any questions and provide us amazing service. The atmosphere is so classy and unique. THE FOOD!?, chefs kiss. I recommend the mozzerella and caviar, gorgonzola wagyu, and spicy lobster pasta. Well done Carne Mare, I will be back often, see you soon

This is a wonderful special occasion restaurant.  Went for my birthday.  Had their signature dishes including the mozzarella sticks with caviar, the Gorgonzola Wagyu steak and the 17 layer chocolate cake.  A member of the group also had a veal chop.  All dishes lived up to the high expectations and were perfection.  Service was also wonderful.  The server was very knowledgeable about the menu and the sommelier was approachable and helped us select an excellent wine.  Highly recommend!!
Every dish was delicious, Gorgonzola wagyu was KILLER. I'd return just for that. Excellent service and beautiful place for a nice dinner date
Excellent service and absolutely delicious food!! We had Steven as our waiter and he was amazing. Attentive and kind. We are definitely coming back! Thank you Steven!
Excellent food. Went for the wagyu steak and didn't regret it. Oysters were great too. Very attentive staff.

Excellent bartenders and cocktails downstairs - surprisingly reasonable prices for cocktails. food was mostly satisfying but pretty expensive. the free pull apart bread rolls are delightful.  i wish there were a few more simple dishes on the menu-  the caviar on mozz sticks and uni on arancini were fun but not sure necessary.  Will definitely keep returning to the bar
Truly an incredible experience from start to finish. This is going to quickly become a can't miss spot in the city!

My friends and I met at Carne Mare for drinks. It was was our first time there and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere was welcoming, drinks menu was creative and Evan, our bartender was very helpful and attentive.  Definitely going back.

Very poor experience and AWFUL SERVICE for what should be a luxury meal. We live in the area and eat at The Fulton and many other high end restaurants. We were excited to try this restaurant and were there for a special occasion. The waiter barely looked us in the eye, never checked on the table, acted dismissive and ignored us all night. Had to ask a host, as she was squeezing behind my chair to get through to another table, to find our waiter so I could order a glass of wine. Worst of all, my $85 steak was gray and well done after I ordered it medium rare. 85 dollars for the wagyu. It may as well have been gray hamburger meat. I very patiently and politely asked to please have a new one and the waiter paused, picked it up, and said "ok" and walked away with a pissy attitude. He had a horrible attitude and made us feel tense and disrespected.  He didn't care at all, never said I'm sorry about that, or anything you'd expect. Very very shitty experience for $300. $300 included 2 drinks and no dessert. I try to support local restaurants, but this was a TERRIBLE experience. The one star is because at least the food is good, when done right, and a manager came out to give a half-ass "sorry your steak wasn't right". I ate my steak with cold sides and obnoxious looks from the staff.  The waiter paid us no attention at all, we never got a water refill in 2 hours, and he treated us like tourists who would never return. We won't. And I will let everyone I know to skip this place and go to The Fulton or the 1000 other steakhouses and better restaurants downtown. It was insulting and they made us very uncomfortable. (Also note there are 3 One Star reviews in ONE NIGHT 9/18/2021...this isn't something you can excuse as a restaurant manager and staff. The stories are horrible).

Was excited to try Chef Carmellini's new chop house - disappointing to say the least. Starting with the best part, the food was just okay, good salads though overdone, followed by so so pasta. Everything else was a disaster. We reserved a table upstairs, were shown to a bar table downstairs. The Maitre'd apologized for not seeing our seating preference and then had a clueless hostess show us to a dark corner table upstairs when there were many open tables at the windows, which we requested. Finally sorting that out, we were approached by an even more clueless "manager" who continually asked if everything was ok but fixed nothing. Drinks? First martini three quarters full, second one half a glass and had to ask the bus boy - the only competent staff - for the second round as the waiter disappeared. As many as six staff in sight, most of them speaking among themselves. A disorganized mess. Andrew, you're better than this...

Stopped by new entry in Chelsea.  Had a cocktail at bar with 2 wonderful appetizers- mushroom empanada and steak taco.  Both so delicious.  The decor, vibe and bartender were outstanding.      Will be back.
We walked by and decided to come in because of the festive decorations they had for Christmas. The cocktails are delicious. Would definitely come back for more.

I was just here and I left because they are extremely racist. Not only did they serve everyone before us they refused to take our orders and actively ignored us when we tried to get the attention of the bartenders. I even complained to the hostess and she was completely okay with the subpar treatment. It was extremely humiliating and degrading. I have never experienced blatant discrimination like this and it's so disappointing especially since it's a place in NYC, an incredibly diverse city. I am appalled. If I could give zero stars I would.
Delicious mushroom empanadas and steak tacos with creative cocktails and beautiful decor. Highly recommend
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This review is for brunch only. If you're looking for a reliable spot that hits all the menu classics (some with a twist) in the WV, this is it. Service is solid, ambience is a combo of old school yet chic, and the food is good. Nothing is over the top or really WOW, but it satisfies the Sunday brunch moment. Could come here every weekend and feel good about it.
No comment
No comment
Super delish. Still fantasizing about the food. Loved our server. They were great. Super accommodating. Espresso martini was awesome
No comment

Come for the "Negroni in Two Acts," stay for the great food. The Negroni is a traditional Negroni on the rocks prepared with Campari paired with a jello Negroni in a coupe glass made with Aperol. This is a unique and fun presentation for a classic cocktail that has become riffed on the global bar scene. Marian's is an attractive new restaurant in the West Village. The food and service are both stellar. Marian's is off to a terrific start, if it can keep it up it will become a classic too.
No comment

Meh. The hostess asked for my Resy info even though I was a walk-in, and asked, "Are you just one?" Can someone please train hosts to not describe people alone as "just" one? I digress. It was fine. A glass of wine and fries was $31.00 including tip. So, overall not a winner. But fine. The decor was nice. Lighting was really good. The music was just a little too loud...meh...not coming back.

Almost everything about Marian's is fine. The food is fine (except for the clam chowder which was very good). The drinks are fine. The atmosphere is fine. The service was friendly and quick but felt somewhat rushed (pet peeve of mine when the server takes both your drink and food order at the same time). That would earn a perfectly adequate three stars in my book, but it's incredibly overpriced. There are far better options nearby. How many times must I learn that if there is a same day dinner reservation available in the West Village there's a good reason?

I really wanted to love this new addition to the neighborhood ... I'm still giving it 4 stars because overall it was great BUT a lot of the food was too salty. The focaccia and the caramelized onion butter was amazing!!!! The ambience is great the staff was superb and the cocktails got me pretty buzzed without being too strong. We had the grilled lettuce salad (like a grilled lettuce Caesar salad) and whoever says grilled lettuce is overrated doesn't appreciate the great taste of a good char. The mushroom cavatelli was delicious but a little salty for my taste and the pappardelle was wayyyyyy salty even for my partner. Def want to go back and try more things and hopefully the salt content was a fluke.... But I'd go just for drinks and the dessert. That Apple fritters were delish with marians espresso
No comment

This place is heaven on a plate. Amazing service, the kindest staff and the focaccia bread is other worldly. The sea bass was cooked to perfection, the steak is beyond tender, salads and cocktails were wonderful. The atmosphere and location are perfect. This was our second time and can't wait to go back. Well done Marians well done!
No comment
No comment

Visiting NYC, Marian's was recommended by a prominent chef from our home town. This place is a gem. Clam chowder--topped with puff pastry--is  exquisite .  Crudo with fennel and citrus  offers a lovely balance of flavors.  Main courses--duck and hake-- cooked to perfection.  Desserts--apple fritters and chocolate tart-- were the perfect finale. Chef-owner Christian made us feel welcome.  This is a lovely place.  Staff are friendly, refined yet casual decor.  We will tell our friends.
No comment
No comment
No comment
The seasonal menu is thoughtfully curated and the staff make this place a 10/10. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The Apple fritters are amazing.
No comment
This place was an absolute pleasure. Service A+. Food was exceptional. Everyone in our group had something different and we all loved our meal. Bathrooms are also super cute. We will be back.
No comment

Great place to chill after long working hours. The best thing in my opinion this place is not loud, chill music on the background. Great customer service and delicious drinks. Bartender Mira makes the best cocktails and entertain you all night) make sure you check this place.
5 stars. Great service. Erick was the sweetest. Steak was cooked perfect. Really welcoming host. Very accommodating staff. I would definitely go back.
No comment
No comment

New favorite brunch spot! Interior is bright and beautifully decorated, good crowd for people watching as well. Ordered the rolled omelette with mushrooms and goat cheese cooked perfectly. Friends ordered Wild Rice Bowl, which looked small but packed with all the deliciousness! I'll be back for dinner soon, especially knowing Christian Rowan is in the kitchen!

Food was decent but we were there for almost 2 hours and it didn't even come out hot. Our server forgot our appetizers, which didn't come out until much later after we finished our entree and had to ask us what we even ordered.  We spent $200 for a very poor experience. Wasn't even offered a second drink at any point during the evening nor did our check get comped for the inconvenience.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We were up from Charlotte visiting our daughter in NYC. Originally from the NYC area and Marian's is a welcome addition to the restaurant scene. The atmosphere is very warm and inviting  - the staff/service - exceptional. We started with the peach/tomato salad and grilled artichokes for appetizer - they will not disappoint. For entrees we had the scallop's, halibut and duck. None of us were disappointed. If you are visiting from out of town or a local, don't miss this gem!
The quality of food was really good but the portions were tiny. We wound up ordering a second round of bread to fill up. Order 2-3 things per person.
Nice interior and friendly staff. Food was just mediocre for brunch. Reminded me of going to a diner.

I can't say enough amazing things about this spot. First of all, its adorable. The decor is inviting with great vibes. We ordered the foccacia bread (DO NOT SKIP ON THIS ONE) that caramelized onion dip is *chefs kiss*. The three dip was fresh and tasty, my hanger steak was cooked to perfection and my friend's roasted chicken looked amazing - she loved it. I dont want to forget to mention the wonderful Adam. He made us feel so welcome and gave us the best recommendations. I really appreciated his service with us. 10/10!!!!

This is a 'new' hidden gem! Had brunch with a friend this weekend. We loved everything about the restaurant and experience. The decor is really quite a lot of fun... exquisite design elements and treasures can be found throughout the restaurant, from the beautiful throw pillows to the elaborate snake mirror and table in the second bathroom with the darker (utterly gorgeous) wallpaper. The food and drinks were outstanding. Mushroom & goat cheese omelettes were absolutely delicious and perfectly prepared.  BEST Bloody Mary recipe I have ever tasted. It is a special recipe of the Chef's, which includes lots of delicious horseradish and pepper, so that the drink has a wonderful texture and meatiness to it. Divine! I was lucky enough to meet the chef / owner, who was humble and very appreciative of the praise. The wait staff and general manager were also really accommodating, friendly and professional. All around great experience! Will definitely be going back. Thank you Marian's !!!

Walking in this place is so cute and I was so excited to try it but the cost just didn't match the food.  Started the night with an expresso martini which was excellent no complaints there. As appetizers my table shared the grilled octopus and blistered Shishido. They were both fine nothing to amazing. For dinner I got the mushroom Cavatelli which was really salty. I will say that it was good size portion though which I can not say the same for some of the meals my friends got. One of my friends got the Salmon and it was truly the smallest piece of salmon I have ever seen served, for 37 dollars I was a little surprised.  The service was really great though our server was really nice and one of the people I was with can't have gluten and she was really mindful of that and made sure to make a note of it on their order even though what they ordered should of been gluten free. The real thing bringing this down for me is just the cost of everything felt really high for what it was.

I can't say enough good things about this place. It is definitely a hot new spot that will be hugely popular in the long run. Incredible brunch , great ambiance, and amazing service. The warm welcome right at the door is so appreciated and not very common nowadays. The cocktails are great , especially espresso martini. The burger was OUTSTANDING- definitely top 10 burgers on the city with delicious fries. I will absolutely be back . I want to try dining at the friendly / local vibes bar next time

Amazing service and Gorgeous decor. Dishes were good. The apple fritters, we're plump, juicy with the slightest bit of tart. Saturday night guests were treated to a sample of a espresso martini which just put everything over the top
No comment
No comment
No comment

Trapizzino is absolutely amazing and I would definitely return again.  The arancini is fantastic depending on which one you get- the cacio e pepe was a bit too dry for my liking but the leeks one was moist and absolutely fantastic.  The trapizzini itself is obviously a must- I got the oxtail and the anchovies + burrata one.  While the oxtail is fantastic and deserves all the praise it gets, the anchovies + burrata one is unique and stood out to me.  Definitely try this place if you haven't already!

My friend and I shared these two dishes which were both incredible! They were very filling snd flavorful. The staff was very accommodating when we requested the one without anchovies. It was not super crowded when we went which was very nice. I would definitely recommend checking this place out!

What a Vibe with amazing flavorful food  We ordered 2 appetizers, the artichokes and broccolini. Both were packed with flavor and would highly recommend. We ordered 3 different Trapazzinos, my personal favorite was the Chicken Cacciatore and 2nd place goes to the oxtail option  Definitely a must try. Staff was excellent!

I cannot wait to go back to this place already.... Everything we ate was insanely amazing, and the atmosphere was so on point. It was relaxing, you could sit and chat while sipping coffee or wine... I'll be back
No comment
Great vibe and even better food! Staff was super helpful and attentive. Such a cool concept, will definitely be back!
No comment
Yummy everything- went with a 3 mix per waiter recommendation. Decent value (kinda small portions), good service & chill / hip environment.  Good option for date night.

I was craving noodles and decided to give Trapizzino a try. The artichokes were delicious but I wish there was one more. I ordered the cacio e pepe which was okay, definitely missing that umph factor. The rigatoni ragu had the same issue. I was still hungry after the meal which blows considering the price, so I had to find another restaurant afterwards.
No comment
The food is good and the setting is cozy and intimate. I would not skip out on those fried risotto balls they because they're excellent
No comment
No comment
No comment

Service was pretty bad tonight. 2 girls served us-both forgot about us multiple times and one would come to the table, leave, and the second server would follow after the girl left and ask us the same question. Pockets were really good. Ox tail, and moroccan meat filled one and a cold cucumber one. Had the artichoke and broccolini. Both were average.
No comment

Me and my boyfriend walked past this place looking for somewhere to eat dinner, and even though they seemingly mainly only took reservations, we were able to just walk in! This is one of the best Italian restaurants in the city, with a very quiet ambiance and delicious food. I can't wait to go back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great little spot. First time and the service, vibe, and food were spot on. Serving team where a delight.
No comment
No comment

This place was cute! The manager was awesome. The staff was all new and forgot a few things very often but my friend and I celebrated their victories. It was a great place for a happy hour wine pour. The 3 for 11 is how to do it with the fried pasta. I got the chickpea appetizer and it was mediocre and needed a lot of seasoning. Overall, not too shabby.

I'll be honest, I here after a mediocre food experience nearby when we just wanted a drink and something to snack on and I could not have been HAPPIER with this find. Trapizzino is a small but super cute and well decorated spot with a menu that in my opinion encourages you to try lots of things. The prices are very fair, and allow a group to do a mix of starters and then get their own trapizzini (filled homemade bread pocket) and not go overboard with spending. Their cocktails were delicious too, I highly recommend the bicicletta which was light and refreshing. Dessert was also delicious and service was great. I will absolutely be back to try more!!
Loved the oxtail trapizzini! Our server was friendly, we were seated quickly and the restaurant had really cozy vibes! Would absolutely recommend and come again!
everything amazing the place is clean unique and delicious especialy FoH is friendly .Come and try doppia panna and  coda alla vaccinara!!!

What a lovely place! The place was lightly dimmed, Very small but rustic and quaint. Our very nice server immediately greets us with a smile and recommendations. I planned on getting a beer but noticed they had an espresso martini so I obliged. Their espresso martini is garnished with a cinnamon which is the extra tang that is needed on the top of the tongue. We shared the kale salad ( just okay, the kale was a little harsh BUT the anchovy breadcrumbs were a hit), the risotto balls (classic I loved and the leek was too dense for my taste), the fried artichokes ( wouldn't recommend not bad but not good). I got the oxtail pizza pocket which was soooooo yummy. The Meat was tender and the star of this dish was the BREAD. The bread melted in your mouth and you can even eat two without being too full. I'll def be back to try a few other items.
Stopped in for lunch - good food and service. Had a meatball trap and a chicken trap. Both were really good - nicely sized for lunch.
No comment

Love their Trapazzinos, sharable snacks (if you carefully use a knife) on crispy light risen pita shaped bread. Light and tasty. Couple this with a salad makes a light afternoon meal. Great way to spend a rainy afternoon.

Fantastic meal and service! Our waiter had great recommendations. We ordered the Salumi, Oxtail Trappizini, Cacio e Pepe and Crispy Artichokes for dinner (sorry we were so hungry and missed some photos). For drinks, I had the frozen limoncello with rosemary. My sister preferred the Negroni over the canned aperol spritz. We finished off with the amazing olive oil cake with a decadent lemon butter.

The food was not good in any way. The fried rice balls (each of the 3 orders we received) were dry. Our pasta was relatively unseasoned (how does Caccio e pepe have no pepe???), and our Trapizzino were equally flavorless. Service was inconsistent and at times confusing. My fig Negroni was the only good thing we had. Cannot recommend.
good service but food isnt the best. Pasta was very very mid. Would not come here again. Extremely small space.

Found this restaurant on Seated and it did not disappoint!! We ordered 4 trapizzinis which are the pocket-style wraps with fillings - our favorite was the Oxtail one. Each was only $9 and they came in a good portion too. Would definitely come back

Stopped in during the weekday for lunch. With so many restaurants in the area closed for lunch during the pandemic, I was happy to spot one open for a bite. The restaurant is small but they do have outdoor dining if you want to sit there. I sat inside and my waiter was friendly and attentive. I had the Cacio e Pepe and the Salted Caramel Budino. Prices were reasonable, food came out quick and the food was also good. The only thing that was bad in my opinion was the bathroom situation. You have to walk down steep stairs to their basement level and use the bathroom. It's not ADA accessible. There's just one toilet for the place and the bathroom wasn't super clean either. The bathroom is also right next to their office or storage room. Not ideal but not a reason to skip this place.

Very few tables on a Friday night and now we know why. The wine was great, but we waited over an hour after ordering and were only served one dish of (very salty) fried potatoes out of the five dishes we ordered. When we flagged down our inattentive server, she let us know that due to "technical difficulties" our food would take even longer to prepare. We left hungry and grabbed slices of pizza across the street. Best part - we were charged for the wine and salty potatoes after waiting over an hour. Avoid at all cost if you enjoy eating actual food in a reasonable window of time.

They opened the big door windows, which I thought would be nice but the young man who worked there decided to sweep right in front of our table on the sidewalk... unreal can't he wait til done eating. I ordered pasta with cheese not dust!!  Plates stayed on my table for a while everyone seemed more interested in there life and phone and not the job. I guess this is the new normal.

Pasta is really good. Portions are tiny. Nobody who orders pasta wants to have five bites. They expect a full plate. And considering how cheap it is to source pasta, it's not cool that they give you so little.
Food was OK, for some reason the burrata had a sweet sauce. The service was awful:  waiter ignored us for the longest time....will not be back
No comment

I want to give this place six stars. It is 100000% amazing every single time you go. The staff is VERY cool and very LES while being incredibly friendly and welcoming. The bartender I've had on the days I go is an absolute G. He introduced me to a mezcal negroni that is to die for. The food is some of the best in the area and will fill you up. I bring guests from out of town here VERY regularly because it lives up to everyone's expectations. If it's crowded see if you can sit at the bar, it's almost like a chef's table experience and is actually my preferred place to sit. Tip the staff well, they have made an incredible experience in the heart of Hell Square.
No comment
Oversold, mediocre food place with terrible service. Waiter did not know their food, did not bring water and forget the last item until we were ready to pay the bill.
No comment

One of the best thing I've eaten in New York. I ordered the meatball and oxtail trapizzino and the oxtail was absolutely amazing. The bread itself was incredible. The outside was crisp and the inside was so soft, it really complemented the filling.
No comment
Found this gem tonight before a Rockwood show. Food was excellent!  And Beatrice, who works there, was fantastic. We will return for sure!
Amazing atmosphere and super affordable for dinner. The trapizzino are all yummy and the caesar salad is to die for

I was excited to eat here. But I think I came here on the hostess's bad day. She was abrupt from then start. And I'd even say rude. We had a nice lunch. Food was good. But when you want to enjoy a meal and get attitude from the hostess it's hard to look past that. I won't return. Only because there are so many options in the city to distract me without the rude hostess.

This place is in Italy and NYC and is famous for its Roman street food pizza pocket and I can confirm, they do live up to the hype. They also have fried Roman style risotto balls called suppli that are really good! I tried the zucchini pizza pocket and the chicken pizza pocket. They just recently launched their brunch menu and it's pretty good! I got the hazelnut bomboloni and they were so fresh. I'm a huge fan of this place and I love that it is so reasonably priced--hard to come by in NYC.
No comment

Really good meal! Got the meatbal trapizzino and the cacio e Pepe and kale salad to share. Everything was very good and very filling. The bread on the trapizzino was very good! In my opinion, if you only get trapizzino for your meal, you need two.

I ate at the location in Rome in 2017.  So glad I can just go to the Lower East Side instead of hopping on a plane to Italy to eat the greatest handheld food in the world. The chicken trapizzino is the greatest bite of food I've ever eaten. This place is not to be missed.
No comment

This place is amazing the atmosphere and the kind,courteous service makes u want to come back not to mention the food mouth watering describes the signature dish hand held piece of heaven known as a trapizzini  I ate it so quick I didn't even get a picture
No comment

Unbelievable! Everything from the service, food and drink were amazing. We did not have reservations on a Saturday night but were in the area celebrating a birthday. They were so kind to be able to accommodate us and we are so grateful. We had a wonderful meal ..I wish we had pics but really you couldn't go wrong with anything they had on the menu. The DRINKS...please do yourself a favor and get the Fig Negroni. Get 2 or 3! I love Negronis and get them wherever I go, but this is easily in my top 5. If they sold a Negroni Kit, I would buy them to hold me over till I get back to NYC (and I'd also gift them to everyone). Our servers, the GM, the cooks, and back of house staff- many thanks for a wonderful birthday dinner for my friend & I...we look forward to seeing you again soon! PS: please think about that Negroni Kit ;)

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
Love the cozy atmosphere and the food was soo delicious!! Loved the broccolini, pollo trapizzini, and the cacio e peppe suppli
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My wife is from Rome, so we had to stop in. The helpful staff explained how to best order and we found the food delicious and the drinks well made. Espresso was cold l, but it's not really a coffee shop.

I love Trapizzino so much. They are open late most nights and have saved me so many times from a hangry dinner meltdown.  The meatball trapizzino can save any bad day.  I also recommend the Bicicleto spritz.  Trapizzino will always have a place in my heart.  They do what they set out to do so so well.  Being there feels like a warm hug.
No comment

Dope spot with *delicious* trapizzinos. Ordered the chicken, oxtail and eggplant. All were great but the chicken and oxtail were exceptionally tasty. The chicken was so tender, juicy and perfectly seasoned. The oxtail ragú was hearty and filled with flavor. The sourdough bread that the trapizzinos come in is also out of this world - crunchy on the outside yet soft and fluffy on the inside. Each one is ~$8 so totally worth it! We also ordered the classic supplí but the trapizzinos are where it's at. Still dreaming about them now...
No comment
No comment

Such a great restaurant and overall experience! The food was delicious and the staff was amazing. My server Nicky was the absolute sweetest, cutest person who went above and beyond to satisfy all of my requests, despite how difficult I can be sometimes. 10/10
No comment
No comment

Oh my God, Trapizzino was actually magnificent. Trapizzino has a positive, relaxed, friendly ambience. I can't recommend Veal Tongue in Salsa Verde - Lingua Trapizzini more. I feel everyone will adore this heavenly food. Whenever I think the crew can not possibly top themselves these guys do. Will definitely come again!

Me and my friends came here around Sunday brunch time, and we loved it! The service was incredible. The servers took the time to explain their menu items to us, and checked in on us to see if we were okay, or needed anything. The arancini balls were so delicious, as were the cocktails. Overall, the ambiance and food quality was great, and I look forward to going back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Fantastic meal. The oxtail and chicken trapizzini were amazing. Our waiter, Harry, was so welcoming, attentive, and helpful. He suggested the perfect wine pairing. Fantastic service from Harry and amazing food at Trapizzino! Thank you! We will be back.
No comment
No comment

After seeing a ton of pictures of this place on Instagram, I decided to try it out.  I ordered the Classico Suppli and the Meatball Polpetta Trapizzini, which was a meatball stuffed inside the bread pocket. Both were delicious and served hot.  The servers were incredibly friendly, but a little slow, so I wouldn't recommend coming here if you're in a rush.  However, the food was very good and I'm looking forward to going back and trying some of the more adventurous Trapizzini's.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had a wonderful time tonight celebrating with my brother and sister. Victor and Harry (I think this was his name?) took the service above and beyond. I know I'll be back for the food and atmosphere-- but especially for that oxtail!! Tell all your friends and family.. or don't because this is the best kept secret in the lower east side.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Padellacia di Maiale. That's a toughie to write, but a yummy one to eat. Essentially, heritage pork with white wine garlic, and sage. So heavenly, succulent, tender. Now imagine that slapped onto a nice rosemary foccacia. Nice resto to sit and eat your sandwiches, or take on the go. In a great location, great price, definitely will wow the palate.

Stumbled upon this gem last night, and we are so impressed. We've never had trapizzinis like this before and we are sold. Had the meatball, eggplant, chicken, and butternut squash, and all of them were delicious. Service was great, as well. 10/10 - will be back soon!!
No comment
No comment

From afar, it seemed too glammed up but I approached when I realized it was an order-at-the-counter spot. I sampled the parmigiana di melanzane and pollo alla cacciatora, but I was set on the coda alla vaccinara trapizzini (oxtail ragu, celery wine). For vegetable balance I got the zucchine alla spapece; do not let the word zucchini scare you, as this unglamorous vegetable was given specatcular support from the cheese (stracciatella di burrata). The oxtail was predictably great but I thought it was more important to mention that the zucchini here shouldn't be associated with the product found in cans at Shop-Rite.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Caught these guys at Panorama Festival and though they had just (sadly) run out of rice balls, I did get a meatball trapizzino. It was delicious and filling with a nice chewiness to the bread - definitely would come back to try more varieties!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was great and they were able to accommodate us ( a party of 9) at the last minute. They are known for their trapizzino's and it did not disappoint.  I only gave it 3 star since the cost was a little too high for italian street food. But it was delicious
No comment
I have never had this type of food and I have to say now it's one of my favorites!! They are very affordable and the restaurant is small and beautiful. Definitely a must if you're in the area:)

Wondered into this place and it was the best decision we could've made that day. AMAZING food. Awesome service. I can't remember the guys name that took care of us but he was awesome. My favorite was the chicken one. I wish we had one of these in Nashville
No comment

I'm a little delayed in leaving this review, but man oh man, was I so happy to find this location here in the US. To sum it up, we had Trapizzino on our last day in Rome and were blown away by it. I did a quick google search to bookmark the place for next time I visit Rome and was shocked to find out that there was a location in NYC! What, my dreams came true?! I can't believe it. So, one day, my husband and I came here for lunch and got the eggplant parm trap and the doppio e pane without the anchovies because we're both vegetarian. Also, the leek and tallegio suppli was DELICIOUS and better than the suppli we had in Rome! So, in short, I'm SO HAPPY this place is here and the food is amazing and it tastes just like it did in Rome. Also, this place has even more vegetarian options than the one in Rome did. That's a win in my book!
No comment
Excellent! Food, service, atmosphere... everything was top notch. Will definitely be going back. Great LES spot!
No comment
No comment
A local favorite! I always bring friends here for a snack. Haven't had a flavor I didn't like yet but I always recommend the oxtail!
No comment
No comment

Very delicious food! I was visiting and my brother and I walked in because we were hungry. I got the oxtail Trappizzino and it was YUMMY! The bread was so yummy and fresh and flakey! My brother got the meatball one and he loved it! I'd def recommend this place
No comment
Yes. Go here, go here now. In fact, I don't know why you're not there already. The food is great and the servers are friendly. Can't wait to go back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for a post graduation meal for my cousin. Their signature dish of course is the Trapizzino, a Roman street food. We Got the chicken, mixed veggie, and oxtail Trapizzinos. Food came to the table reasonably quick. Food left the table even quicker. The food was very delicious and our server was very friendly and accommodating. Food was also very reasonably priced.
No comment
No comment
Pizza balls!  If ya never tried them, you must.  A new spin on pizza, which renders this timeless classic a gourmet.  How the piece are made is still a mystery to me

If you want to go eat something new and Delicious go to this little place in the Lower East side of the Manhattan!!  I ordered a pizza of Rabo de toro I was really surprised it was delicious and the attention is very good you are not going to regret.. I recommend this place with closed eyes

Excellent spot in LES, I would be here once a week when I lived the area. Quick, cheap, and easy meal for lunch and dinner. My two favorite things about this place is they have a yelp check in offer and they have a pickup window so when you order take out you can just swing by the window and grab your food in seconds. One request - bring back the lentil soup!

Delicious, in one word,  that's it.  Everytime I've been here, the staff has been friendly, attentive and inviting but not over bearing or annoying at all. The food is delicious, basically, it's any type of food stuffed in a bread pocket. It's something that has to be experienced to appreciate. Check it out.

So delicious, so fresh and so tasty! We came here as a large group to enjoy a quick meal and I'm so glad I found this place. What you will get is basically a pasta dish on a bread minus the pasta. I had the meatball sauce on bread and I'm still thinking about it today. The bread they provide is so fresh and tasty and so is the sauce. This place is a solid lunch or quick dinner staple.
No comment
No comment
Great place, amazing staff. Highly recommend the braised ox tails. Good wine selection.
No comment
No comment
No comment
I loved this spot!! The food is delicious and it's very intimate... perfect for a date!! Get the oxtail or the rosemary chicken!!! Sooo good !!!

"Doppia Pannna" is my personal favorite. The Burrata core in it tastes amazing. Glad that I gave this one a chance normally I am scared of anchovies but it turned out to be absolutely amazing. Italians know what they are doing in kitchens no fishy taste what so ever. Addictive.

Amazing comfort Italian food/ is a  high quality fast food Italian  with a twist, great bites served with homemade focaccia and you can choose different filings, you can add a glass of wine and be the perfect match. Loved it. Unbelievable price point.

wanted to grab a quick cheap eat and found this place on yelp. I love Italian food so it was a no brainer to go in and check it out. The ambience was really nice with small table candles throughout the place. The staff was really nice. They helped me decide what to order and I was very satisfied with my choices of the eggplant trapizzini and the beef suppli. I stayed a little while after my meal reading a book, and one of the staff members kindly gave me a sampling of their tiramisu gelato which was delicious as well. Definitely would return!

Racist establishment. Not to get too much into detail but the message was clearly understood. Whether the owner or not is present the young white female waiter needs to be trained on being tolerant and business minded. Customer service extremely poor with all that were present behind the counter as they were all informed by the young white female waiter of my constructive criticism nothing that was offensive. Lots to learn...take the blinders off. LES is no place for sheltered and intolerant folks.

Trapizzino is a perfect place for an inexpensive yet delicious meal on the Lower East Side. One trapizzini costs $6.50 (tax included) and suppli is $3.50. I heard there is a happy hour now on weekdays from 4-7 so I'm excited to check that out!

Got the pollo trapizzino and it was surprisingly delicious. Very well seasoned and has a hearty familiar taste to it. The meat to bread ratio was perfect contrary to other reviews. My guess is that they listened to the feedback and I'm glad they did. Great snack. Friendly staff. Will definitely stop by again for this deliciousness and to try the riceball.
No comment

I read about this place a while back and found myself on Rivington St today so I was excited to try it out.  It's a cute little corner place with a comfortable feel.  I had the Pollo Alla Cacciatora (chicken/white wine/garlic/rosemary).  It is served in their signature warm triangle pocket made fresh in the store. Wow!!  I am hooked!  Full of flavor, the chicken was tender and juicy and melds perfectly with the pocket's toasted outside and doughy goodness.  It's the perfect hand-held meal.  Ciao Italy!

Everything here is just fantastic! Order the Campari spritzer with whatever you get. They have a great happy hour! Oh and I wish they were also at the airport so that I could order a bunch to take home right before my flight!

A pizza sandwich shop! It is pretty good and very filling. I tried the meatball one and the eggplant one! The eggplant was really good! They also make these fried balls that has different things in it. If you are a cheese lover, I would suggest trying the different fried balls!

Delicious food but also really impressive customer service. My boyfriend is a Yelp fiend always looking for new things, this place has been open for a couple of weeks and both the server and what appeared to be owner/manager explained everything on the menu. The Trappizzini are served in light and airy warm bread which soaks up all the juices of the filling you choose for this pocket style sandwich. The Suppli (risotto ball) was crisp on the outside and creamy and delicious inside. We had the caccio e peppe and it had a nice kick. Definitely recommend.
No comment

Wow, the service here is unmatched! I asked for wine recommendations and the woman was super informative, helpful, and accommodating. She let me sample the wines until I found one I liked, which was so considerate and I haven't seen that kindness anywhere else. Not sure her name, but she was incredible! Food was amazing (I got the oxtail) and the risotto ball deal is a fun promo. Overall, will be returning!
Amazing. Everything made from scratch. Insanely good, very friendly. Even the sparking soda was memorable. I can't believe it's taken me this long to discover this place.

I've got to admit when I first saw my Coda (braised oxtail, red wine ragu sauce) Trapizzino and broke open my Suppli (fried risotto ball), I was a bit skeptical. They both looked just ok! I'm so happy I'm greedy because both were amazing! The bread for the Coda was crisp on the outside to hold the sauce, yet super warm, buttery and fluffy on the inside. The sauce had the perfect amount of seasoning with hints of the wine in every bite. The risotto ball was also crisp and maintained its saucy texture when you bite into it. Got these from their kiosk in Winter Village and can't wait to have some more! Also appreciated their willingness to give samples to people who had no idea what a trapizzino is. Great food. Great service.
No comment
No comment

This is my second time here-- this time I had the zighini and it was perfect! I loved how flavorful the sauce was; it had a hint of spiciness without it being overpowering. I think the food feels so fresh and I would definitely come again to try other flavors out.

Went in with a group and had a great time, unfortunately when I looked at my credit card the next day, I had been charged $120 for a $30 dollar split bill. We all had been over charged so we called the restaurant and they said that they'd send over the receipt and eventually, begrudgingly, said that they would fix the mistake. They took the $120 charge back and then charged the $30 bill and an additional $70 that shouldn't have been there. Called a few times and never got a hold of anyone so I called my credit card company and disputed the charge. It's a bummer that things ended like this, but even more ridiculous that I'm paying $70 extra dollars for what should have been a $30 dollar bill.

Love this place, their food is so good! I came here for neon coat and I was warmly greeted by Casey, she is so sweet and amazing at her job. I came here once before a while ago but didn't remember what I ordered. I pulled up a picture of it and as soon as I showed her she immediately knew what is was. As for wine, I wasn't sure which to order so I asked for her opinion. She came back and did a brief overview of the wine, and had me do a taste test. The wine was very smooth and it went well with my meal, I love how she paired the two together! Definitely coming back here and 10/10 recommend this place. Shout out to you Casey for the amazing experience.
No comment

I'd never heard of a Trapizzino before so for the similarly uninitiated think italian doner kebab in the sense that you get this triangle of bread, split it into a cone, and stuff delightful italian fillings inside. Mine came with a nice meatball and some accompanying red sauce. The bread has some nice bite while maintaining a soft interior. I like that the menu rotates daily as if give you a reason to poke your head in and see what's new.

A delicious and quick spot to grab a snack or a big bite! The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful in case you can't decide between all of the delicious options. Highly recommend the Coda Alla Vaccinara (Oxtail Ragu) Trapizzino and the Cacio e Pepe Suppli (Fried rice ball with pecorino romano cheese) and anything on the seasonal menu. Also, all of their alcoholic beverages as sodas are imported from Italy. A great spot to sit in, especially when the windows are open and the weather is nice or a cozy spot for colder times.

Skeptical of this new sandwich-like place but my friend insisted this was a perfect snack. While the snack was definitely delicious, it was a bit heavy on the oil and salt. It was yummy but I wouldn't pay $6.50 for it. $4 seems like a more fair price. The suppli (rice ball) was also delicious- it's free if you check in on yelp. It's hard to find places that make risotto al dente but this place got it down perfectly. The food was definitely very authentic but glammed up by the nice decor of the restaurant. The restaurant is very spacious and there weren't many people sitting there when we came on a Sunday afternoon. I don't know if they'll be able to stay in business but the food is good to try once.
No comment

The main flatbread sandwich was amazing. Bread was crunchy yet soft and I had the oxtail filling and it was delicious. The service was good as well. It took some time for them to heat up the bread but it was worth it. On the other hand rice ball was not so good. Too crunchy and there wasn't enough cheese in it. The wine we choose was so so as well. I would come back for quick lunch again though. Pretty empty during the weekday lunch.
Highly recommended! Excellent customer service and delicious concoctions. A new twist on Italian food. Highly recommended!
No comment
No comment

Trapizzino's opening was well-reported long before it actually opened, so I was pretty excited when it finally did. It was so worth the wait! It's located in a surprisingly large corner space for LES, so it can definitely accommodate large groups. The staff was so nice and the food was ready super fast. I ordered the veal tongue and LOVED it. The filling was incredibly flavorful and the bread was crispy and fluffy at the same time. I was a little worried the olives might make it too salty, but I needn't have. The portion size is perfect for me, though those with bigger appetites might want to order 2. At the insanely low price of $6.50 per pocket, it's still great value regardless. I definitely plan to come back as many times as I can!

I went on a Monday around 6pm, and the restaurant was almost empty. Thus being said, my waiter was very helpful with wine recommendations, and also was attentive, without being overbearing! The food was delicious. And while their portion sizes may appear smaller, with a glass of wine, the meal was filling, without making me full to the point of feeling sick. The music being played was also great! Anything from Kendrick Lamar to old school rap was played. Overall I will be returning, as the food and ambiance was a killer combo.
No comment
Cute space that's never too crowded. A little overpriced but great food and wine. Get the oxtail trapizzino! Delicious.
No comment

Walked into this place looking for something quick and tasteful. Was greeted by Joseph behind the bar and he helped us by explaining the food options. We had the Roman lentil & bean soup, pollo alla cacciatora and coda alla caccinara trapizzini's. We were blown away by the flavor!!! Everything was excellent and the staff was me very helpful.

This place is UNREAL. I came in with my heart set on having the zucchini alla scapece but after one taste of the recommended oxtail ragu immediately changed my mind. The sauce was a dark, rich red sauce that carried that deliciously familiar Italian flavor reminiscent of my own grandma's "gravy." You could taste how long it had been allowed to cook. The supplì was also tasty with strong taleggio that oozed out of the rice. Honestly one of the homiest meals I've ever had in the city. I WILL be back!
No comment

Scenario: it's like Nas and Jay-Z had a focaccia bread pizza pocket baby and then that pizza pocket baby had the illest freestyle of all times. And even that doesn't even begin to do it justice. Because this is a brand new type of street food imported all the way from Italy it's hard to not describe it as some kind of cross hybrid. But it's like the best of the borough's got together to mix it up and this is the amazing product that came out of it. Also mine had plenty of filling.  My favorite is the eggplant joint. Also dope they're open to midnight marauding hours :-)
No comment
Great vibes. The price is fair, and the people that work there are very nice. Great for a quick snack, date, or anything casual.
So so so so so GOOD! The servers are very hard working and customer service is excellent. I don't really like pizza but their Trapizzino (parmigiana is the one I got) is soooo good
Loved this place. Just stopped in for a glass of wine. The atmosphere was great and it was very clean and cute.

I wandered into this place after having a couple drinks in the LES, because I was having a craving for Peroni. They had it on tap, much to my delight. the bartender was really cool and asked if I was hungry... I saw something on their menu that piqued my curiosity...an oxtail hot Pocket! This was the most delicious experience I've had in my life. It's like God marinated the oxtails and had Jesus his only son bake the bread. I'm telling you....try it out. Do it.

Delicious food at a reasonable price. The chicken was wonderfully flavored with hints of rosemary. Highly recommend the Pollo alla cacciatora. The restaurant was quiet but had good vibes, staff was sweet and gave me samples of the different meats before I ordered. Great lunch spot with a perfect portion of food for a quick lunch.

We were starving after a long flight from California. We stumbled upon this place looking for another restaurant, but we were excited to see it had high reviews. It is a chain restaurant that started in Rome and was a great spot for a quick snack. It's cool to go to the first US location in LES! We had the eggplant option which was very tasty. How can you go wrong with a combination of a pizza and sandwich pocket? You definitely won't here at Trapizzino!
This place is decadent. Delicious little sandwiches and first class service. Their little Larissa bottled spritzers are to die for. Simple. Wonderful. Can't wait to go back.
I just had a religious experience at Trapizzino. It's a pristine little bubble of Testaccio teleported to New York. Go immediately!
No comment
The perfect place to pop in on a cold day  for a very quick bite of a delicious Trapizzino before a 2:00 museum tour. We will come back! Plenty of seating when we were here sat at 1:00.
This is a new version of what tastes exactly like my father home cooking (I'm Italian). I love it.
No comment

I missed trying trappizino in Rome where it originated. The restaurant here met expectations. Had three different tasty fillings, but I loved the pizza bianco best. So good. Also, vibe was overall chill.
We loved the Roman classics such as the oxtail in the bread pocket (coda) and the risotto ball in cacio e pepe. Would love to come back for the Roman-style tripe or the fried artichokes.
Basically greeted us from the street (doesn't happen a lot in New York), awesome service. Cappuccino and Americano were really good, and a nice atmosphere to sit and relax.

Great pizza, even better price! Love the eggplant one, and their ambience makes for a perfect cheap date night in the center of the party scene of the Lower East Side. The bread pockets are crispy, warm, and delicious, a filling late-night snack to fuel your party-going.
The chicken cacciatore was to die for. This is real cooking served simply. Very friendly and helpful staff too.

Traditional Italian food with a modern twist, just like the trapizzino you can get in Rome. Amazing rice balls (supplì), fresh and super tasty ingredients for a sandwich/pizza impossible to forget. Also the beer is imported from local breweries in Italy. Strongly recommended
I really enjoyed this restaurant. Had chicken milanese, which was served very quickly. It was very good. The bread was also delightful.
No comment

I have to say, this little sandwich blew me away. And while you would be hard pressed to find a genuine Italiano at any Piada location (a midwest based, Italian street food, fast casual joint that is rapidly expanding throughout the east coast), at Trapizzino, the guy who waited on us had the thickest Italian accent I had ever heard in person. Straight off the boot. Yes, boot, not boat. It was a pun, albeit a bad one. I wish it were bigger, but it hit the spot. The bread really makes the whole thing. And at $6.50 right in Manhattan, it's a great value as well. We also ordered a few of the suppli, which were equally delicious. We had the cacio e pepe, which was perfection, and an arrabbiata, which wasn't all too shabby itself. Italian sodas that put San Pellegrino to shame make for a nice thirst quencher. This has franchise potential. Keep it real!

Just tried this in the Bryant park holiday market. The chicken pocket was amazing, so flavorful and herby, the bread was crisp and delicious. My tastebuds were blown away! I highly recommend you stop by here if you're at the holiday market!
Cool atmosphere, awesome food, good drinks! Highly recommend! I got the Classico and it was so tasty.

Very good. Fun menu selections. Unfortunately, a bit expensive. If you are moderately hungry, you need to order minimum 2 trapizzinos, which at $6.95 + tax is already adding up to $15+. You might still be hungry after as well. I don't know, it was fun to try, but not affordable enough to keep wanting to come back!

This place is absolutely fantastic & very reasonably priced. The pockets & suppli are both delicious and you can have one of each for $10 total. And the food is high quality! One of my favorite places.

Mind-blowing sandwiches! Wow! I've never had anything like it. I cant recommend this place enough. Definitely put it at the top of your list of places to eat in NYC. Fairly priced and they have a wonderful staff. I'll definitely be back.
No comment

Authentic Italian but in a different style. Met the owner who was a great guy and is one of those people who exudes his passion for the food he's making. High quality stuff! Plus, it's great to have a quick option that's high quality too, especially in this area. Love this new spot!

I just ate an incredible lunch at Trapizzino! So good that I might go again tomorrow!! I ordered the coda alla vaccinera trapizzini(oxtail), the parmigiana di melanzane trapizzini(eggplant), Classico supli(beef ragu rice ball) and aglio e olio(garlic, olive oil and red pepper rice ball).  I preferred the Classico over the Aglio since I felt the ragu had a better flavor and wasn't dry.  Can't wait to go back!

Not a bad spot, a fairly fun options. Could be a tad expensive for what you get but the staff is friendly and gives samples of the stuffing. It's like an inverted pizza in a open bread pocket. Definitely get dessert too.

This is a relatively new place.  I tried the Eggplant sandwich and the rice ball with ragu, both wonderful, however the filling for the eggplant trapizzo was room temperature and there seemed to be a lot of confusion going on behind the counter - either they were filling a really big take out order or something but it took a while to get the order filled.  Regardless, once they get this down, I am sure all will rock.  The filling was delicious and the rice ball was great. Will definitely come back.  Wish they had more information available about the services though -
New to the neighborhood and hope it's here for a while. So far I'm very impressed with the quality, price and speed. But most of all the food is fantastic.

This place is FIRE I have had the Oxtail, Chicken, Eggplant and Tomato, and Meatball every single one of them was amazing. They have water to your convenience, the owner was the man, music was chill. Risotto balls also bery good

WOW in NYC for 2 days and we ate here twice!!  I can't describe how wonderful the pollo was!  Staying at Hotel on Rivington just a short walk away. Have the rissoto ball it is amazing. Also sampled the ox tail and my husband had the pork, amazing!!!  Food from Rome and supposedly the one place like it.
No comment

It's more of a sandwich than I was expecting.  The photos make the "bread" pocket look more like a dough.  But fillings are tasty as hell!  I would have liked to see more cheese on the menu.  Not sure if it's not usually served with cheese in Rome? But I think it's safe to say us NYers love our melty cheese!
Would love to come back. The chicken is cooked for 6 hours, moist and flavorful. Went twice in one weekend. I want to go back!

We popped in here at around 10 pm, looking for a late night snack/dinner. We then each used the free suppli offer from yelp and the manager surprised us with an extra one, saying it was on the house because they were starting to clean up anyways. Super friendly staff, food was amazing, atmosphere was nice with the open front and bar tables, and free ice cold filtered water you can get yourself from the utensils/glasses area. The trapizzino we tried were 1. eggplant parm 2. beef ball 3. zucchini (I don't recall the exact names but these were the main ingredients of each one). Apparently the oxtail is one of their top ones, but they were out by the time we got there. Each one was super tasty, and the crunchy exterior of the bread "pockets" added to the flavorful filling. The suppli (a fried risotto ball) was my favorite part because of the saucy tomato rice that was packed inside a crispy shell. It was about the size of a small egg. For each person, I would say two trapizzinos to fill you up and it was about 6.50 each. $13 for a meal or snack is not too bad and it's definitely worth a try! Also, the music selection was on point.
Delicious! And helpful and nice, chill staff. Clean and efficient environment and take out window is also great.
I only got their Tiramisu ice cream but it was so delicious. The flavor tasted like a tiramisu in an ice cream form.

The food was tasty. Staff was very attentive and good at explaining all the various dishes. My Italian gf approves so I think that means something. We had the fried dough classic and sandwiches (oxtail,eggplant,chicken,tripe) all were good. Legit.

Love this experience.  We were looking for a quick bite to take off the edge.  I spotted a couple of cops waiting for their order in front of this booth.  I've always heard if you want good food go where the cops go.  Not disappointed.  Delicious and creative presentation.  We got the eggplant parmigiana and deep fried risotto balls.  Perfect to warm up on a cold visit to Bryant Park.  The two guys in the booth were friendly and chatty.  Risotto balls needed a couple of minutes to cook but it was worth it.  Piping hot and delicious.  Nothing greasy.  Just deliciousness.

We went after the pickle festival for some quick nosh. Our first time there AND WE WILL BACK!!!! Absolutely delicious! We had the pockets filled with braised oxtail.... mouth watering yum! And to top off good for the staff was awesome! The chef was  making risotto balls and offered us a sample! Awesome people! We will be back time and time again!

I love this place because I came in not knowing what a trapizzino was and  the lady behind the counter was so good with explaining it. She offered us samples of filling that you can get. I got the eggplant and it was really good. The food was fresh. The place was clean. The water was cold. Good vibes all around. Thank you for amazing food and service.

Pretty delicious sandwiches! Nice size, not too big or small ... wish we knew about this during my trip to Rome. Highly recommend the oxtail and meatball! Could pass on the riceball but worth trying once. Welcome to the neighborhood!
Had the chicken cacciatora and the pumpkin / almond / pecorino romano trapizzini, and a suppli (supplo?) classico. All amazing. Like a portable version of the best Italian meal you've ever had.
No comment
No comment

Three friends and I were in the area and crazing some good, cheap Italian food and we happened to stumble across this place. We are broke high school students, so this place was perfect. Each pocket of deliciousness was only $6.50 and extremely filling, even the vegetarian ones (like pictured here). Cute little location, very clean and modern, fast service.  We all ended our meal by raving about how much we loved our food. Perfect for really good, cheap, filling, fast, flavorful food.

Came here my first weekend living in NYC. Alex made me feel right at home. The food is great and the staff is even better!!! You may come here get too drunk off their amazing wine selection, write a bad review that they don't deserve, wake up in the morning and realized it's still the best restaurant in New York! My heart goes out to this place!
