Had the oxtail, chicken, and eggplant. Oxtail was pretty good chicken was ok. Eggplant ehh not a big fan. Tried 2 rice balls but wasnt so thrilled. The employees seem very nice and attentive but after watching the video ok social media i kinda expected a much better experience.  Conclusion it was my first and pretty sure its my last time
Unbelievable food, very friendly staff. One of the best things I've ever tasted - finally, authentic Italian food in New York

I love this place - I have been to the original location in Rome and am so happy that the NYC location is the same menu and quality. Authentic Roman street food, so good, different and delicious.  I seriously recommend checking it out - and do not be scared to try the more unusual flavors!

These little sandwiches are jam packed with good intricate and evolved tastes. The bread is really good as well. Where I part ways with this joint: The sandwiches are $6.50 each they would be $3.75 in most cities and the drink selection is Beer, Wine or stuck up designer soda. Lower East side people!
No comment
Delicious food, good spot, great value and awesome staff.
Best option on the neighborhood. Very innovative. I loved the chicken stew and the bolonhesa sauce. The risoto was great as well. Cozy place.

That's surprise to find a well known roman Trapizzino restaurant. In this period of my life I'm living in America and I miss my Italian food but particularly I missed the roman super good street food of Trapizzino. So good so authentic from the best of roman street food.

I tried out this spot for the first time today.  I had the pollo alla cacciatora (chicken) which I was informed was one of the most popular items on the menu.  The chicken was tender and the flavors were significant.  The bread itself had the right amount of crunch and tasted fresh.  The staff was friendly too.  I'd like to give a special shout out to the white guy with the pony tail who was super nice and accommodating.  I could tell he really cared about the customer experience.  Additionally, the space was clean and the air well circulated.  I'm not sure if they played music (forget already) but I assume they don't.  If they don't then my only recommendation would be to have some light music.  I always think that is a nice touch but might not be for everybody!

We had two amazing meals here and Alex had us feeling so welcome. He explained to us that the starter used for the bread is from Rome and over 200 years old. The Roman street food sandwiches are delicious, the atmosphere is lovely and the service was beyond what we could have hoped for.

column3: Town of Oyster Bay, Long Island, NY
column6: The Pollo Alla Cacciatora is the most delicious chicken I have ever had (I hate chicken, chicken weirds me out), I could eat this all day, everyday! I love that they use org tomatoes, natural meats and extra virgin olive oil. The service was attentive, helpful, and friendly. My toddler was grumpy but she was given a small cup of gelato that perked her right up. Best experience dining out in such a long time!
This is just like the real deal if you've been to Rome. Delicious lunch, and a real aperitivo on weekdays right in the LES (think happy hour with free Italian bar snacks).
Rice balls like you've never experienced.  Just do it!  Two thumbs up for the oxtail and beef shoulder trapizzinos too.  Fresh bread and tasty fillings!

Testaccio, Rome in New York! Pretty much the same menu too. Pizza crossed with tramezzini to make an amazing sandwich. Supplì is amazing too. If only more authentic Roman food was available to us here in New York. Will definitely be stopping in whenever I'm in the area.

Excellent, crispy bread pockets with wonderful meat fillings. The fried risotto balls with mozzarella are fantastic. Clean store with nice staff. This place is never crowded during lunch hours which is a complete mystery to me!

One word... just try once and you will love it for sure. I tried more than couple times since they came out and I love POLLO ALLA CACCIATORA and fried ball risotto the best! very addictive! I also recommend to try the italian beer they serve. It goes really well with their food.

Love this spot where you can find an authentic Made in Italy masterpiece. The taste is so good from the first bite and prices are very reasonable for the quality. Staff is always welcome and available to give information about the ingredients that belong to the authentic Roman cuisine. RECOMMENDED!

The food is fresh, delicious, authentic, and filling, AND extremely affordable. My 2 year old daughter and I come here often, and she is obsessed by the suppli. I usually get the eggplant parm and a spritz. In my 20s, I would've come here post drinking and smashed a couple traps for sure.

Finally had a chance to try these guys for lunch as they are one of kiosks at the great UrbanSpace spot in Midtown. I love the concept - bread + gooey cheeses with tasty protein/veggies - what's not to love? I got the eggplant one and it was very good. It was a little smaller then I thought it would be but tasted fresh (some people might want to get two to feel completely full). I also like their packaging as it makes what could be a messy meal, easy to eat (no one wants to come back to work with a stain on their pants!). I saw a few other veggie options on their menu but none of these were available at this location so I would LOVE to see some of these show up. They also had a picture of risotto balls that looked delicious, but I got out of there before I made more unhealthy choices. I'll save those for next time =D  Def. a nice addition to the midtown lunch scene or if you're in the area and want something different.
Super tasty. The bread is crispy on the outside and perfectly chewy on the inside. The chicken, meatball, and  oxtail are all delicious.

This random place is my saving grace. I live literally around the corner and it's the perfect stop for a quick bite. They've spruced up the inside and it's a really nice sit down spot as well. I've tried almost all of the trapizzinos now, the oxtail​ and rosemary chicken are my favorites. So good.
No comment
Great place for a quick tasty bite! I head here for dinner when I'm feeling like something fast. Really friendly staff.
The croquette clearly had just come out of the freezer, way too much pepper and the pizza cone was not consistent.
Love this place. Visited for the first time in Tome and finally made it to the NY location. Great for lunch and wine!

Gross. Everything is fried to a crisp. The croquettes were dry. There were bones in the chicken. The best thing on the menu was the cheese and that's because it wasn't deep fried like everything else! Our server was intoxicated and walked into a wall full of wine bottles.

I really liked these unique sandwich style pizzas, and the owner was very friendly and allowed customers to try different sauces before you decide lwhich one you want to go with. The only reason I knocked off a star is because I didn't like the chicken one as much as it was advertised, it was too much meat and not enough sauce. I really loved the eggplant one though! Would still go here again, especially for the eggplant

Delicious! Stopped in for lunch with a friend and was greeted by the chef/owner. Had the Pollo alla Cacciatora, which was outstanding - big chunks of fresh chicken. Highly recommend trying it. Can't wait to go back.
Outstanding experience. The great taste of the food the wine the coffee the desert combined with the kindness of this people make this restaurant great
These sandwiches feel like the work of the divine. If you like bread at all, these sandwiches will send you to the moon. My favorite was the parmigiana. Yummmmm.

This place is great. It recently opened so it hasn't picked up traction yet, which is good for me because no wait, but I also want things to pick up to support the business. It's like a pizza sandwich type thing. The bread is delicious. I like the meatball, chicken, and oxtail. The fried rissoto balls are great too

Me and my boyfriend stumbled upon this place and knew it was going to be amazing. The staff were amazingly friendly and charming. The garlic, seasoned chicken was outstanding and we left feeling full and satisfied.

I had the pleasure of trying Trapizzino at the Bryant Park Winter Village pop up location today for lunch. As i was walking by i was offered a free sample. I tried the Chicken Caccitore and was immediately hooked. I ordered the above and 2 rice balls, one PEPE and one with mortadella, they were both very delicious. The Chicken Trapizzino was the star though, the bread is made fresh daily and you can tell, a sandwich is only as good as the bread used. That being said the chicken was seasoned and a nice compliment to the bread. I'll be coming here often while the pop up exists and I highly recommend you do to. While waiting for the food Chrisitan and TJ also started a convo with me (the people working there) and were very nice and helpful in answering all questions and recommending what to order. A must try!
Innovative delicious Italian food. The Risotto ball and the pita Ragu and eggplant are something to write home about.

Landed at LGA after lunch and needed something to tie me over til dinner - not too heavy, but satisfying. After sampling the zucchini (delicious, but too light), I opted for the Pollo alla Cacciatora. Spot. On. If it wasn't 3 pm, I would have ordered a second. Perfect touch: paper bag-like  envelopes catch the juices and oils. Nothing ran onto my hands or lap. Thank you!

Holy shit i never tasted anything better in my life. No kidding this place is goddamn amazing. The concept is genius and every thing on the menu is legit. Their special rice balls son fuego tambien. Expand and bring something like this west to the bay !!!!

Their oxtail ragu is incredible! The homemade bread had just the right crisp exterior with soft interior.  Service is great - attentive, friendly and personable staff. Had my first Suppli there after a Yelp check-in and will certain be ordering more next time!

If you think cheap and stellar can't go hand in hand, then you clearly haven't been to Trapizzino in the lower East side of NYC. Should you happen to order the eggplant or the chicken version of this conical pizza, you may find that you won't venture anywhere else for the rest of your NYC vacation. Enjoy the 11-generation old recipes for this comfort food... yoh will understand why the secrets have been guarded!

Perfect 1-dish lunch. A delicious hot bread pocket with Italian home-style fillings.  I had and recommend the cold veal tongue with olives and parsley, a sophisticated taste.  Other beef, chicken and veg fillings smelled and tasted very good.  Just enough to eat.  Beverages include Wine, beer, soda and water.  A good place to meet your friends for a chat.

Wow! Effing yes!!! Slow cooked Italian dishes in a doughy pocket of deliciousness. This is probably the most innovative and delicious food I've had in a long long time. I had the chicken stew and the fava bean + mint special, both we're phenomenal all the way to the last juicy gravy-soaked bite. It's delicious, it's an experience, it's a must.

Tremendous flavor, everything was so good! The only reason I didn't give five stars (I would give 4.5) is because I felt the ragus were a bit on the salty side. By far the suppli (rice balls) are the best I've ever had. They're crunchy on the outside and gooey on the inside. My favorite is the leek followed by the classic. The trapizzini is equally good with fresh bread that's crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Favorites are the eggplant and veal tongue. Can't wait to try more and you can't beat the prices especially with the quality of the food you get.

Excellent sandwiches at fast casual prices. My personal favorite is the chicken cacciatore. They're all great though. Probably will need two for a filling meal, but they run about 6$ per sandwich/bread pocket.
No comment
No comment

Really solid japanese tapas spot with delicious small plates and a cool intimate vibe. Loved the agedashi tofu, chicken nanban, salmon sashimi, and addictive cabbage! Will definitely be back since there was more on the menu I would try.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend and I came for a quick dinner. We only got two things to share because we already had some food beforehand. We got one appetizer (the clam) and one entree (mentaiko noodles). Both were soooooo good. The clam was better than I thought and the mentaiko noodles were very interesting. At first I wasn't sure if I liked it but I kept going back for more. Definitely will come back and order more things next time for a full dinner

I came here for quick drinks, and some appetizers but holy shitalki everything was delicious. We got seated right away, and offered sweet potato snack. It was yummy, and we couldn't stop eating. The sushi rolls were fantastic, drink was just right amount of alcohol, and ambience was very cute. I gotta come back for a full dinner.
No comment
Great food, great for casual date or a quick late night bite. Highly recommend the sake clam, nanban chicken, and fried smelt.
No comment

This is an excellent tapas place. If you're looking for small plates, come here vs Boqueria (yes, different cuisines but this one is much more flavorful). My favs/would order again: cucumber, cabbage, sake steamed clams, cream ramen, signature chicken, omelette. Would not order again: salmon and mushroom with miso in foil, eggplant, garlic butter fried rice, the regular fried chicken. Love the small portion size - can try lots of different dishes. Inside is ok, a bit small. Would recommend.
No comment
No comment

My friend and I were food hopping around NYC and we stopped by Izakaya. We ordered two small dishes and they were quite tasty. The Shishito Peppers had a good fry and lightly seasoned with salt. The Smelt Fish had good amount of roe inside and a nice crispness. Izakaya also has Orion beer (Okinawa) on draft. Izakaya is Japanese owned, so they know what they're doing. I'd come back again for their dinner course set.
No comment

A friend of mine and I stopped for a drink here on our NYC food tour. I loved the food and the people that worked here were mostly Japanese which was awesome! Our waitress was very knowledgeable about Sake and you can tell she was on top of everything. The Shishito's were very lightly seasoned and the fried smelt was perfectly fried.
Excellent all round. Charming, delicious food (get the salmon mushroom miso and yellowtail sashimi) and great drinks. Will come again soon.

Cozy, friendly, and delicious.  "Addictive Cabbage" is no joke, and the salmon tartare with guacamole is exquisitely subtle.  The salmon sashimi is also pretty amazing: you really got to know every seam of muscle and fat in that poor, doomed, splendid-tasting fish.  The portions are on the small side, but that's a consequence of wanting more of everything.

Fantastic Japanese restaurant. This was my last restaurant outing with friends pre-Covid. Crazy to think how much time it's been. The dishes are thoroughly well prepared and everything was excellent. Washed down with good quality sake and it's a fantastic meal!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Incredible meal, we ate and drank and lost track of time. Loved it and can't wait to go back.

I came here earlier this year in January with my boyfriend, who had been here before, and left happy and full! This is a small spot but service was quick and the food was excellent. We ordered the chicken nanban, agedashi tofu, addictive cabbage, and salmon truffle flavor with egg. Everything was on point. I had high expectations for this place and it definitely exceeded them. Will definitely come back again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Ive been here twice. The atmosphere is cozy and chill. The food is good too. I recommend making reservation, it's 1.5hour dining time for walk-in.

Love the minimalist decor. Cute little hallway of a restaurant where they serve small dishes to share. Got the sake flight, which I enjoyed tremendously. The chicken nanban was good, and the thick salmon sashimi was actually thick. The corn croquette like some other reviewer said, had very little corn, but it was fried to perfect little balls, so I did like it. The only disappointment was the garlic mushroom butter fried rice, which was just okay. I would come back to try all the other little dishes!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small and cozy restaurant with a very Japanese feel to it. Our servers were great and friendly, always stopping by to fill our waters. For an izakaya, the dishes are reasonably priced. For two people, we ordered the toro (generous portion), curry rice, fried smelt, addictive cabbage, and grilled mackerel. The sake was a bit pricey in my opinion. Nice place, make a reservation!
No comment
Disappointing experience. I ordered two beef sukiyaki they just gave me one. And it's a very long gap waiting for each dish. Taste is average, the weight of food is small and not serving with rice.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Service was alright, waitress wasn't excited to see us but the food came out reasonably quick. The menu was simple so easy to order and generous toppings for around $15 a bowl of ramen. Pretty much a generic ramen place with bamboo walls and tables. Not blown away but a good place to just pick up a bowl of ramen for a casual lunch.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Our favorite Izakaya spot in the city! Nothing fancy but it is everything a perfect izakaya should be that leaves nothing more to be desired. A late night bite after work or weekend strolls with friends for a relaxed meal and a beer, this place never disappoints. Everything we had there was absolutely delicious - the mushroom pasta, the clam broth (which is out of this world! We literally drank the entire broth!!) and a few other appetizers. Waitress is helpful and respectful, gives us time to look over menu yet leaves us some privacy when we need to talk.

The raw scallops were super fresh, the beef tongue was delicious, the addictive cabbage was pretty addictive and everyone must try the mushroom garlic butter fried rice! I will go back here for just that dish! So freaking good. Service was quick and great. Super quaint little place. FYI there's a no tipping policy just like Japan but my wife and I still left $$ for the great time we had.

So delicious!! Good atmosphere and super cute waiter named Kazu who is so sweet & THE BEST  Small portions but super filling!

Nice little cozy restaurant with friendly staffs. We ordered 6 dishes, sake clams & curry beef bowl were our favorite. Skirt steak was alright. Beef tongues were a little overcook & addictive cabbage wasn't that addictive to me. Overall experience: great, will come back again. Some of the tapas are seasonal & ramen is only available during lunch time. P.s. they extended their Japanese culture so they do not take tips.

The restaurant is very racist toward some people. We are an Asian couple. On Saturday night we arrived and were given one empty table outside. After spending ten minutes to get the waitress attention to order, we were actually kicked out so they could give the table to two white guys with no explanation. Just "we need this table back". We were standing there awkwardly. They said they would give us a table soon. But after 15 min they actually gave another empty table to another group of white people. We asked and the waitress just went "you need to wait". Given all their customers sitting at that time were white, it made sense what they were trying to do. But it's funny to see an Asian restaurant not wanting Asian customers. But I guess racism is its philosophy.
Incredible food. Great prices. Loved my experience here. Highly recommend. Get the toro.

The moment you walk in, feels like you're in someone's home. Mind you, it's a cramped environment with very limited seating. The thick salmon sashimi was very juicy and tender. As the description states it's very thick not your typical thin slice sashimi. I would highly recommend ordering this. The Curry Doria was average. It tastes like a home cooked curry meal the one that your mom makes at home. I would still always recommend going to Curry-ya for Japanese curry because it is the best in New York.

Thought all the dishes we got here were delicious. We started with a simple cabbage appetizer (lightly salted with some sesame oil / sesame seeds), which was surprisingly good despite its simplicity. Chicken Nanban was amazing - sweetness of chicken (honey?) coupled with tanginess of the sauce was so addictive. We also had the garlic butter fried rice (was super excited for this and it didn't disappoint)- has little mushrooms in it. The fried scallops were good (great if you like scallops but I don't ha) and had a dipping sauce similar to that on the chicken. The tamago omelette was cute but probably my least favorite (though it wasn't intensely flavorful like the other dishes and provided a good break). The potato salad was standard (nice little crunchy bits of bacon? In there that was a nice touch) as was the salmon sashimi (probably will save sashimi for sushi focused spots in future). My favorite of the night though- definitely the Sukiyaki. The beef in that soup was so tender, and the noodles were fun (potato based like japchae but shape reminded me of ramen). I will say service was a little awkward (server wasn't great at answering our questions but more language barrier than rudeness), but ok overall.

Atmosphere is cozy, music is great, food is excellent, sake sangria is delicious. Literally have no complaints. Highly recommend.

It's a nice place for small parties as it doesn't have too much space for larger parties. The price is kinda reasonable. But the dishes are a bit smaller than I expected.

The bottle of sake we chose was reasonably priced and service was very attentive! The slight inconvenience was they only accepted cash that night but it was minor since we had enough of it. I would definitely come here again for a low key night.

Just get the first menu item on the Meats section, its like chicken H-something. Too buzzed to remember what it was called. Anyway, so insanely good I didn't even offer to let someone eat the last piece, I just took it. You're welcome!

Made a reservation at 6pm today and it was open right on time. Most of the customers are Japanese and almost every table ordered sake or beer. We liked beef tongue best. Wasabi on the side of salmon sashimi was very fresh. Addictive cabbage was a must for each table. Izakaya pudding was sweet w/ a taste of bitter - which was amazing (and the owner said he would definitely recommend this one). No Tips!
AMAZING. The food was excellent and FAST. Whatever the omelette thing is...ORDER IT!  You won't regret it.
It's my first time to write absolutely negative review. Really bad food, they can't do fried chicken well, use one type of sauce to deal with different dishes, almost no chicken In curry chicken.

This is my favorite izakaya in NYC.  Must haves:  Chicken Nanban, grilled Mackerel, mushroom fried rice, addictive cabbage (I make it at home now).  Tip is included in the price of the dishes.  I miss the original owners, but it is still best.  (please bring back the potato salad for the nanban)

Came here with another couple on a Saturday night and enjoyed everything we ate. However, the restaurant seemed to be out of half the menu! Well at first they said they were out of a lot of stuff and then they said their grill wasn't working. Not really sure what was going on. Really loved the Japanese hot pot though.

Really really good place if your feeling like Japanese comfort food of the type you'd find at an izakaya or maybe lower end washoku pkace.  Phenomenal chicken nanban, which is basically fried chicken nuggets with an eggy tartar sauce.  Really good veggie dishes, and katsu dishes as well.  Having lived in Japan I think it's extremely satisfying.  Only deducting a star for relatively high prices and cramped space that typically requires waiting a while to get seated.  If you don't mind that this place is great.

This wasn't the restaurant we intended to go to, but we ended up here. Once we walked in, they asked if we had a reservation. When we said no, they hesitated a bit and then seated us. Weird.. it felt like they didn't want to seat us since we didn't make a reservation. They have a large variety of beverages, especially liquor. After reading all these good reviews about the addictive cabbage, it has to be pretty good. Right? Well.. it was only alright. The fluffy fishcake tasted good, it was definitely fluffy. The salmon rice balls were average, nothing that special. The best dish was the pork belly. It was really tender and flavorful. The sauce was delicious too. Overall, this place wasn't bad, but not a place I would go often.

Has their shio ramen during lunch which was pretty good! The chashu was thicc. My friend ordered the katsu sandwich and the meat was also thicc. Would recommend.

VERY authentic Japanese restauraant and the servers (we had wonderful Yudai) take the time to explain how everything is homemade and imported from the special Japanese pork from Canada to the hard to find Kagua beer which just hit the states and is a Belgium made Japanese inspired beer.  Their take on French fries which leverages the chefs Italian experience and uses Genoan mayonnaise over small tastey potatoes is to die for.  Their cod fish cakes are great.  The tempura chicken dish with 7 herb homemade sauce is also great.  The pork had great flavor but slightly chewy and on the dry side but paired with some white rice and the sauce made up for it.   We went to the panacotta dessert over Japanese red bean.  Definitely an awesome find thanks to yelpers that has only been open for 6 weeks.

I don't know how this place only has 4 stars. This was some of the best Japanese food I've had outside of Japan. The beef tataki, sukiyaki, and curry Doria were all amazing. Yes it's expensive, but all Izakaya are. Do yourself a favor and reserve a spot when you can.
No comment

I loveeee this restaurant. Delicious food, cozy atmosphere, reasonably priced and the dude who runs it is really sweet. The chicken nanban, burdock salad, and salmon sashimi (huge, delectable chunks of raw salmon) are my favorites. They always have great sake recommendations, too. If you like Japanese food, small plates, and are bored with the subpar izakaya options on the lower east side, I promise: you'll love it.

Nice hole-in-the-wall Japanese restaurant. They have limited seats, very personalized service and take reservations even on Fridays! The best dish was the Chicken nanban main dish! If you're going as 2, order a bunch of tapas (we ordered 5) and 1 main course and sake. That should be just about right. Spent $50 ea.
Very tasty food, friendly service. Can literally order anything from the menu - cannot go wrong! The place is cozy.

It takes forever to have the dish on ur table...I will just never eat here again. Seriously，the worst service I have ever had. And the staff should WATCH their attitude. They just made me write my FIRST review on Yelp ：）

Food was pretty good, until I bit into the chicken nanban and I saw blood coming out of the chicken. Bright red blood. The owner told us it was normal and didn't even know what to do with it. Finally we asked if we could maybe get a replacement and he said something and walked away. Then not even 5 minutes later the waiter asked us if we could finish our meal within 15 mins and leave because a party of 4 was scheduled to sit at the table. We told her we could move to a smaller table but she flat out asked if we could just leave. What kind of customer service is this??? We felt so uncomfortable and embarrassed. Is it because we asked about the raw chicken? I wish I could give negative stars
Chicken Nanban, Premium pork are very impressive. The staff are very friendly introducing the dishes and beer choice. Great place so i guess a little pricey is acceptable.

Probably the best Japanese food I've ever had. The addictive cabbage and the addictive fried chicken are a MUST and they really hold true to their "addictive" name. The deduction in stars only has to do with their $28 minimum per person as well as the wait staff. They were not willing to help but instead we were made to feel more of a nuisance.

Delicious food and great service. Loved the agedashi tofu and the medium rare scallops. The chicken nanban was good, I just wish the sauce had been added more last minute so the outside would stay crispy!
Love this place! Always have an exciting menu. Make sure to get the cabbage starter. Vibe is super cozy with dim light- good place for a date

My go to spot for izakaya- just like eating below the ginza bridge without the ambience of the street

My boyfriend and I discovered this place last summer and it has become both of our favorite restaurants for whenever we just want to eat amazing food. I crave their curry doria and chicken nanban--to the point that I've tried recreating at home from recipes I found online. But they're unbeatable. Not to mention, I love their "sour" drinks. It's a highball (shochu, soda water, ice) mixed with fresh citrus juice that they squeeze right in front of you. Nothing could be more refreshing! It's not a cheap meal, but it's not terribly expensive either. Last time I went with three others, we ordered probably 10 dishes, each getting 1-2 drinks, and it was $40 per person.
Agree with the great reviews here. Every dish we had was special. I especially liked the pork, fried tofu and chicken nanban. I will definitely return.

This is the worst Japanese izakaya I have ever been to! First of all,they never told us it was cash only!!! And after we ordered, the salmon avocado app came and the salmon was not fresh and smelled super fishy, we barely touched it bc we didn't want get ill. We told the waitress and she just struck her shoulder like it's too bad, never meant to do anything about it. After we got the bill I was putting my credit card to pay that's when she said it's cash only! Plus they forced a very pregnant lady to stand for 15 minutes even there were open tables because they were "reserved", no one ever came.
Had a very nice dinner. Everything was good, some of it very good. Will be back. Enjoyed the class and their signature dish .... the fried chicken with a nice sauce.

So we were a pretty big obnoxious group. The place is small but they took our reservation and accommodated us with great service! We apologized for our lateness but all they did was continue to offer even better service and more smiles. Service aside, the food was amazing. I would recommend coming with a smaller group so it's easier to split but we  ended up ordering over half the menu so I don't remember exactly what I was eating. All I could say is that everything was so delicious and amazing!! It tasted so good I can't wait to go back to try some more tapas.

We enjoyed a really great meal here the other night. The waiter/owner was so nice and funny in his explanation of the "Addictive Cabbage"- really quite charming. The cabbage passed the test so we stayed and enjoyed several things, including the yam appetizer, the fried salmon, and the Chicken Nan Ban.  The yam appetizer wasn't my favorite, but the fried salmon was delicious and the chicken nan ban positively addicting.  This was a very pleasant, authentic Japanese izakaya experience.

what a ripoff. WAY too pricey for what it is you're getting. simple as that. is the food good? it's OKAY. Not remotely worth the price.

No vegetarian. Being in vegetarian friendly east village, I feel there should really be at least one option other than salad.
No comment
Delicious food, especially the Chicken Nanban. I give three stars though because the portions here are small for the relatively high prices.

my go to izakaya place in east village! loved almost every single dish...cabbage was mediocre ..everything else was amazing...feels like any izakaya in osaka or tokyo...(def more pricey considering its in NYC)...overall...worth to try!
Amazing in everything : cheap price for very good Asian fusion food, excellent cocktails, service is 5 stars
Have no idea why this place is called izakaya. The food was ok but overpriced. The environment and service was just normal. Don't understand why this place is so high rated.
Their house fried chicken was really good. The addicting cabbage was a disappointment. Everything else was good.
Excellent food and service. It is a small place so come early. All solid
No comment

Small place. Really slow. We ordered an appetizer but did not get it till after we asked for the bill. We had dinner and still no app. The food portions are really small as well. The only good pleasant things were the Sapporo and the mushroom garlic fried rice. Not returning

It took me a while to post this review and it's because... I am selfish!  This place cooks up amazing japanese street food and I wish it won't get too popular because the place is small but cozy and nice. Price is decent but the food is amazing. Yes I said it twice, amazing!!! Make sure you make reservation if you ever plan to dine, walk in is close to impossible. Must try!!! Good for dates.

My experience here felt like me going home and eating one of my mom's really good home cooked meals and then having to pay her a lot of money for it. The waitor recommended us several dishes: The Addictive Cabbage, the Nanban chicken, and the neopolitan spaghetti. We got all of those as well as the Omelette. The omelette tasted really good but tasted like something I could make at home if I had proper ingredients. I really liked how there was cod roe in it and was slightly spicy. The Addictive cabbage was very okay. It tasted like a bunch of napa cabbage thrown together with sesame oil, sesame seeds, and salt. It wasn't very addictive for me. I LOVED the nanban chicken. It was very juicy and came with a delicious white sauce and a little bit of soy sauce. I also like how it came with a lemon to give the flavor a bit more of a kick. And by the time I got to the Neopolitan Spaghetti I was already too full to enjoy it but I love the egg on top of the pasta. The pasta itself was a  bit too sour and salty. It had too much ketchup to it in my opinion. I wish they made it less salty and a little bit more cheesy. Overall, it tasted like a really good home cooked meal that we had to pay a lot of money for.
Nice japanese tapa restaurant! The fried tofu, chicken and mentaike tamago were very good. The grilled cheese curry was okay.
No comment
Love this little cozy restaurant.  Excellent menu. Very good prices.  Lovely staff and food is amazing.

I have been coming here since they opened a few years ago. I visited last week to find out that something in their system changed. They used to be a non tipping restaurant (just like in Japan) supposedly paying their employees more than other places. I think that made for a great experience and prices (I thought) were right. A dinner for two, with at least 3 dishes per person, and a couple drinks usually came to 100/120. Now they did away with the non tipping thing. We were surprised to find that after we payed with a card there were three lines to leave a tip and add it up. Prices have stayed the same. So there's something weird here. Initially when they switched to non tipping they raised the prices and it made sense. Now, they did away with that but didn't lower their prices. Maybe this was a mistake or something they've added as an optional? I don't know. Not cool. Unless they change this in any way I won't be coming back. Sad, because I loved this place.

.C.H.I.C.K.E.N. .N.A.B.A.N. !!! (you also can't go wrong with the rest of the menu - each plate is so thoughtfully composed and DELICIOUS. I'm kicking myself for only just coming here now. Already planning my next visit!!!

Amazing food. The Nanbon Chicken lived up to the hype despite an extended wait time. We were totally fine with it as we didn't order it with our first order. Highly recommended. The beef/pork croquette and beef tataki were both great. Meitaiko omelette was decisius with subtle sweetness. Not exactly the most authentic experience for Izakaya, but the food will not let you down.

Hidden gem I guess you can say. Went with my wife and brother in law for a light drink and came out with out tummies full. The staff was friendly and the food was on point. It was as expected according to other reviews, if not more. Definately going back, although I rather keep it on the dl as the space is a bit tight.
The place is quiet and intimate; the cabbage is to die for. The owner prides himself on his creations in a way few young chef/ owner can.
Very nice, tasty, good atmosphere, pleasant place. Food 8-9 out of 10. One problem, be prepared for a long wait.

Some really authentic dishes; people have raved about the addictive cabbage, the chicken nanban, and the delicate, wonderful cold tofu. Seeing as it is an izakaya, I'd recommend a drink: the cassis oolong, a black currant liquer mixed with iced tea, is one of my favorite cocktails, and they do it well. Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything here.

We had the Addictive Cabbage (sic), Chicken Naban, Porkchop, and Ketchup Pasta, as well as one tuna sashimi for future reference. Every single one of the dishes was delicious and felt meticulously performed, despite the laid back atmosphere. If I had to pick a favorite though, it'd be the chicken. Only thing to note is that the dishes aren't too big, so all of the above fed two people - but left us very happy. I bet this place will be a new East Village hotspot in no time. Service is also up to par with what I've experienced in awesome Japan. No liquor license yet, so BYOB - happily one of the best craft beer shops in the neighborhood, Good Beer, is around the corner. Great find, coming back next week.

With many Japanese restaurants in the area, Izakaya got it right.  I tried several dishes and have not found many other restaurants in the area using quality ingredients and a commitment to satisfying customers.  Will definitely make it my go to place.
Honestly one of the best meals I've had in NYC in months. Amazingly good food, attentive staff, all for a shockingly reasonable price. Highly, highly recommended.

My boyfriend and I just came back from Japan and we've been itching to have some japanese comfort food, Izakaya did just that for us! My boyfriend is not a fan of raw fish and was able to find alternative options while we were in Japan. Izakaya does serve raw fish but their menu consists more cooked food such as fried chicken. We ordered every fried chicken dish and loved every single one! The tofu dishes were delicious and the mushroom fried rice is a must try! I highly recommend this place and will be a frequent patron.

frankly a little bit uninspiring. the food is original and has that authentic japanese feel, but the foods fell a little bit flat. the ketchup spaghetti is.. well.. how it sounds. the other dishes were mixed. that being said, their agedashi tofu is very very good.
Simply had the best chicken naban of my life. Also the milk pudding is superb. Still amazed :)
This meal was amazing. I've been to the one in LA but this one was even better. Great small plate options to share. Highly recommend!
Best Japanese food I've ever tried in NYC! Nice service and atmosphere! Totally recommended!!!! Must try chicken nanban!

My friend and I came to Izakaya on a Wednesday night. The small space really gives off a great ambience and feel. The dining experience was good, I think the choices were limited, but the quality of food was amazing. Though there only seems to be 3 people running the show, they make everyone happy and full. I really recommend the curry dish.

Excellent izakaya food in a tiny restaurant near St. Marks. Everything was delicious but our favorites were the broiled eggplant, omelette with mentaiko, and house made chasu. My husband and I enjoyed the chicken nanban, but our friend wasn't that excited about it.
a hidden (literally) gem.  their chef's chicken nanban is a MUST.  highly recommend!
I just have no idea why this store has such a good review. The food is not good at all. Also, the environment seems to be different from other izakaya I have ever been.

Everything here is perfect. The people, the food, the atmosphere - it's all outstanding. Hands down the best Japanese home cooking in the city and my favorite everyday restaurant. Standout dishes include the Chicken Nanban (must try - best chicken in the city), Fluke Carpaccio, Tuna Salad, Horse Mackerel Sashimi, Wagyu Hamburg Steak, Pork Chop, and Butter Curry (best curry I've ever had)... the list goes on.

Holy moly the New York Times wasn't kidding, this was a very delightful hidden gem with incredibly eccentric and delicious food. We ordered fried chicken, fried tofu, the addictive cabbage, the marinated pork belly and the curry Daria. The owners were extremely friendly and helpful, they explained all the ingredients and how they serve dishes that are only found in Japan. If I could give 10 stars I would. Definitely worth the trip!
Addictive cabbage was addictive. Chicken nanban was amazing. Burdock salad was also very refreshing - the taste was very unique. Overall the food and the service were great. I would go there again.

Tiny, lively Japanese pub. Our meal included the wagyu beef sashimi with fresh and aged garlic (delicious) and the garlic-mushroom rice (surprisingly stunning). Only let-down was the sashimi platter (not too interesting and a bit overpriced). Portions are small, so it's necessary to get a variety of dishes. A large selection of sake is available, almost all by the glass.

So good! Recommend splitting dishes with friends. The Chicken Nanban was really good. Kagua beer is really good too. But the waiter was awesome. . Gave detailed explanations on everything. I highly recommend BOTH desserts!

Went here right when they got their liquor license, but can't hold that against them (I was expecting Byob). The fried chicken, ketchup pasta, addictive cabbage were all awesome. The sashimi plate was the real negative, 30 or 35 bucks for 9 pieces of sashimi? And the sashimi was pretty poorly cut and not the best quality fish (didn't finish it, which says a lot for me)... Maybe it was an off night and I'd be willing to try it again, except for the fact that I left my credit card there by accident. Called them and they said they would put it aside for me. I picked it up the next day, and then a few days later get a call from my cc company that it was being used to make fraudulent purchases to buy gift cards....

This restaurant is AMAZING! If you're looking for your new spot, this place is it. You can taste the love that goes into making each dish. We actually met the owner and his girlfriend and that's how we stumbled upon this new place - everything is five stars about this restaurant - the food, the friendly staff, the cute mis-matched decor. Bravo!
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of the more elevated speakeasy experiences I've had in a while. Crowd felt more New York than touristy, the music playlist added to the ambience. Cocktails were strong and the space itself was inviting without feeling stuffy. I wouldn't come here for a full dinner but definitely a pre or post dinner drink.
No comment

1 star for the service and 2 for the food. This place is not worth the hype whatsoever. Not only did my server forget to ever bring my my espresso martini but she also brought out 2 burgers when I only ordered one. I used to work in the industry, I get it, servers get busy - the restaurant was half full. I typically would say something in person rather than writing a review but no one ever came back after dropping the check. As for the food, the burger is good enough, but not for $30. Honestly shake shack, 7th street, and Gotham are much better if you're looking for a good smash burger.

This is my favorite speakeasy in NYC. From the staff to the music to the drinks. They knock it out of the park. I've been able to get a table and a seat at the bar without a reservation, but this spot quickly fills up. I usually go with one of the Mezcal cocktails but have also had the bartenders come up with something of me! If you're looking for a sexy, chic spot for cocktails or a date - this is it.

I came here with a friend for some late night drinks. The  entrance/bar area was tightly packed, but once we got to the dining area it was more spacious. It's a pretty place with red velvet chairs, dim lighting, and a diverse range of  music to please everyone. The kitchen closed at 11 so we couldn't get any food. We didn't stay long since we were in search of food, but we enjoyed the time we spent there. Would come again.

Had the most awful experience at DND this evening. Majority of the staff was extremely rude and required us to order food at our table, despite seating us 45 minutes after our reservation and not requiring any other table to order food. When I raised this point to the servers, they basically told us to go f** ourselves, and continued to charge us a nice 20% tip. Needless to say, we will not be returning, and I highly recommend taking your business to Art Bar or Bathtub Gin instead.

Immaculate vibes here. Definitely a sexy, sultry spot that would be perfect for a date. I was able to get a seat at the bar without a reservation but it was pretty poppin' so if you plan ahead it's probably a good idea to have a reservation. Interesting cocktail list with somthing for everyone. I enjoyed my mezcal based drink "pero like, mejor" which was pretty strong but smooth. Didn't get to try any of the food but I'd be interested in coming back. Would recommend!

The GM was very rude and combative. He rolled his eyes at our party as well as others.. The hostess was extremely sweet and helpful.. As someone who has worked in the industry I found this GM's behavior unprofessional and unnecessary.

Phenomenal night at DND. Des the bartender in the front room is absolutely fantastic. Super on point with drinks and overall great energy. You must get the smash burger and make sure you don't share it with anyone like I did. I almost ordered another. Also yes to the tuna crispy starter. The one thing that threw me off was the different rooms having different vibes. We went right before sundown so the green room was super bright with light. But by the time the sunset, the vibe was great through out the restaurant. Also funny that they were playing such good music and I told my bf that I wished they would crank the vol maybe 1-2 more notches to really get the vibe up and clearly someone knew what I was wanting and it was turned up. All staff interacted with were friendly, warm, and had great fits on. I love it when I'm at a restaurant and can't tell if it's staff or patrons haha. Can't wait to go back again soon.

Utterly superb. Just superb. The kale salad and the ceviche were among the best I have ever had. The texture and the subtle layering a flavor in both dishes indicates a true maestro at work. The setting is sumptuous and the staff are beyond professional and engaging. A perfect evening.
Poor service - since originally going here I have had a poor experience liaising with the staff. I don't recommend going here.
Chef Josh is the #1 young chef in all of downtown Manhattan. He's putting out really impressive food. Drinks are solid. Would recommend.
Awesome decor, great service, very cool drinks. All around cool, low-key swanky vibes.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was walking around waiting for a table at a restaurant nearby and found this place with a short line and had to check it out. It did not disappoint. My friend and I split a pork roast rice roll for 3$. It came out super quick and fresh. Would be making a pit stop here again if I'm in the area!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was pretty disappointed by the chang fen (rice rolls) here after how much people have hyped it up. We ordered the beef, roast pork, and curry fishball rice rolls. The rice rolls did not taste fresh, texture was harder than other chang fen, and had very little flavor so we had to add a ton of hot sauce and soy sauce. Not sure if we just got a bad batch? It's cheap but I'd choose cheong fun cart any day.

Tiny little hole in the wall serving dumplings and rice balls out of a storefront window. The woman at the counter didn't speak any English but we managed to get by with hand gestures. There is no seating available - it's basically just a take out joint or you can stand outside and eat at the spot. I wanted to try the rice with pork and Chinese sausage wrapped in a banana leaf that comes tied with string so got 4 of them to go. Unfortunately they appeared to be rather stale - the rice was hard and the filling was measly and not tasty at all. Would not recommend.
No comment

For the price, these rice rolls were really good. Definitely go early in the day as they tend to sell out of the popular toppings. Rice rolls are a bit light on toppings, but you can't beat the price. The sauces available are also really good. Highly recommend checking out if you're in the area and in the mood for cheap, authentic Chinese food!
No comment

Legit place to get rice rolls -- and I'm so glad I don't have to trek all the way to Flushing to get Joe's. This place is authentic Cantonese (Toisan, to be specific) and they make the rolls on the spot, super quick, at a steal of a price, including the delicious sauces (peanut butter and sweet soy sauce are my favourites). Really, you can't go wrong, please show these aunties some love.

Love that this place opens early to be able to grab something quick under 3 minutes!! The portion they give you is decent for an affordable price. It is a small takeout spot which can be easily missed, but definitely recommend checking it out if you want a quick bite!
No comment
No comment

This place was amazing! Order from the window and take your food to go or eat right on the sidewalk while its hot. For less than $5 you can get a delicious rice roll made to order. We got the dried shrimp and sausage and vegetables, and both were great. My only wish is that there was a little more filling, but the texture and taste and sauces definitely made up for it.
Cash only. Rice noodles are made to order. Great place for a snack/meal. Affordable prices and tastes good. Ordered the curry fish ball rice noodle. They have sauces you can add on the counter.
Suuuper tasty and fresh rice noodles. They came out so hot I almost burned my hand holding the box but they were perfect once I got to try them. Sauces added great flavor too
Fresh rice rolls for a crazy cheap price! Each plate of noodles go from $2-3 with unlimited soy sauce, sweet sauce, and hot sauce. It is super delicious and filling!!
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: The owner should have changed the type of store to a grocery store instead of a restaurant, so he couldn't see the hygienic license. Although it doesn't look very dirty, he thought it was a deception in disguise, because the type of grocery store doesn't need to consider hygiene In this way, no one will supervise whether the hygiene is up to standard. So I still hope that the boss can apply for a health license according to the standard.
No comment

Still as good as I have remembered! These rice noodles are legendary and have the right amount of ingredients. I always add extra scallions and egg to my beef rice noodle rolls.  The lady at the window is very nice and you add your own toppings located on the side.

Came here to try their fish ball rice roll and saw that they had tofu pudding on the menu. This place has sauce bottles at the counter for you to add your own peanut butter soy sauce mix. The tofu pudding here is cold and made ready to serve from a container in the fridge. It is more solidified so not like the ones you get where they scoop it out of a hot pot. But overall both were good and satisfied my cravings for only $5!

This price really can't be beat! Their menu is made up of different filling combinations for their famous freshly made rice noodles. There are sauce bottles on the counter to dress your own noodles. Requires a decent amount of sauce but a very satisfying snack

Fresh made rice rolls!!! Cash only. Always hot and delicious, must visit hole in the wall spot!!! My wife and I always order the plain rice rolls (usually 2-3 orders) and dress it up with the sauces available. In addition to the rice rolls, they sell thicker rice rolls to go in bags along with drinks. A to go spot every time we are in the area!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
The rice rolls are probably some of the best you'll find in New York. They're all freshly made and I highly recommend the soy milk to cool down with!

Super quick, cheap, and tasty rice rolls at this hole-in-the-wall shop right below Manhattan Bridge. Lots of options for rice rolls -- I went with the veggie + chinese sausage and it was delicious! Love that you get to pour your own sauce too!
No comment

Disappointing. I kept seeing this spot on tiktok and went out of my way to try it. Super cheap but just not my favorite. The pork rice roll was alright. I like that the rice roll was super thin. As for the curry fish ball one, the fish balls were cold and thus very unenjoyable. I also do not like that you have to add all the sauces yourself. I like it when they do it for you because they know the ratios better. Overall, if this spot is on your list, I would probably pass.
No comment
No comment
Very delicious pork rice roll.  It took less than 3 mins from the time I ordered to receive the food.  It was really cool to see it made. Highly recommend this place!
The best cheap eats in Chinatown! Can't beat fresh made rice rolls for $2.50. So glad this spot is open again!
Rice rolls are alright.  You get what you pay for. The price is very good tho, and food came out very quickly.  Dont forget to get your sauces before you leave.

Fantastic hidden gem of Chinatown, with the silkiest rolls averaging around $2.50 for freshly made Cheung fun. As always, cash is king and a little goes a long way. Recommend getting the curry fish ball roll, combined with the peanut/hoisin/sriracha sauce it was the perfect in between treat before lunch.

My favorite cheung fun in the city - one of the only ones that truly reminds me of home. A little out of the way but an absolute must try. Everything is under $5 for a pretty big portion of food and the sauces are so nostalgic and reminiscent of childhood memories in Hong Kong. The actual cheung fun is silky smooth and you can get it with various fillings, my favorite being the dried shrimp.
No comment
No comment
What's there to be said? If extremely good, extremely cheap food sounds like something you'd like, this place is for you.
No comment
This place is a gem! Fresh rice noodles made on the spot and customize your own sauces.

So far this is the best rice roll place that I've ever tried in NYC.  $2 for a box of rice roll is very affordable. Flavor is not compromised. Sauces are available to add at your own need. It also has other tasty breakfast items like soft sweet tofu and soy milk, etc. There is no seating area but there is no problem standing and eating
No comment
No comment
No comment
This is best secret in town for the fresh authentic Chinese food, and price very reasonably!

Not worth the hype. They're really really cheap but I can see why. It's all noodles and no fillings unless you get the dried shrimp or fish balls. Everything else is the size of cat food chewed up and spit out by a cat.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I love eating rice rolls! It's one of my favorite things to eat for Chinese food and I found a great one in NYC!  The prices are very cheap and you can get full without breaking your wallet.  Each roll is less than 2 bucks and so I get a few and barely spent anything.  The texture was great and rolls come out quickly.  They also offer sauces at the counter for you to pour into your rolls before you're off.  They also have frozen dumplings for a cheap price too! Such a great find in Chinatown NYC!
No comment

This place is heavenly!!! One of the best places to eat in NYC hands down, such a hidden Chinatown gem. I've been here at least 40+ times and they never miss. This is a classic rice roll / Chang fen that many locals eat. I recommend the char siu (fried pork), add egg + spring onions for only $3! If you're around Chinatown must give this place a try!
No comment

No comment
