No comment
No comment

Certainly NYC Chinatown hidden gem!! When going to NYC, I make it a point to make it my first stop here for the greatest tasting breakfast for $1.75!!!  My fave is the dried shrimps noodles drowned with sauce (let it absorb to the noodles first before eating).  I could eat this freshly made to order steam rice noodles all day long.  No tables or seating, so drive up to the window and dine in your car.  Best eaten on the spot.  I would come back to NYC time after time just for this.
No comment

This place is great for cheap, fresh, Chinese food! Customize your Cheong fun/fresh rolled rice noodle orders with 4 different sauces on the counter. Be sure to grab forks, napkins, and a bag if you need it. There isn't seating bc this joint is just a hole in the wall where they roll open a window and that's it. Which was perfect for me and my 2 friends that day! They made our food very quickly while we waited and came out hot and delicious. 1 of mine was a bit bland before I added sauce but who can complain when it's only $1-$2?!? Cash only!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food for literally a couple bux?! I didn't realize it even exists still lol. Even baos at the bakery can cost more... Totally delicious, quick and easy. We got the roast pork rice roll and dried shrimp with egg. It's all freshly made to order. Both really tasty. I kind of wish we would have tried a couple other things since it was so cheap. Don't forget to put enough sauce that it gets all the way to the bottom rolls too. If only there were more yummy cheap eats like this around. :P
No comment
No comment

Cheap, quick, delicious! I really love the rice noodle rolls and this place knows how to do it right. This place is as casual as it can get, with an order window outside the shop to order the various noodle rolls and soy milk to go. I ordered the dried shrimp noodle roll with chives and egg as well as another one with pork. Both were really delicious and fresh, all noodles made to order. For less than 2 dollars each, one order can definitely fill you for a satisfying savory breakfast. The noodles were nice and soft, with flavors popping from the dried shrimp, scallion and soy sauce that accompany the dish. Overall, a great cheap eats!
Good cheap eats... I recommend the rice noodles and tofu blocks. I tried the cold tofu pudding and grass jelly twice and it was watery and tasteless.
No comment

henry st has been getting lots of columbus-in' folks and becoming "gallery row" driving out the neighborhood residents and staples. this spot was closed during the pandemic but they're back cranking out cheap eats that this side of chinatown is known for. everything on the menu is good!
No comment
No comment

Found this place on Yelp after craving Chines breakfast items. As others have said, it's a true hole in the wall. Prices are amazingly cheap and the rice rolls are made fresh in front of you after you order. The rolls are really soft and delicious with the sauces, but my only issue is that the toppings that you ask for (pork, egg, beef, etc.) are pretty minimal. Not sure I'd come back but glad I tried it
No comment
Real good! Just wish they roll it up haha - can't ask for too much when it's only $2 per serving!

I finally made it here and tried the beef noodle dish for $1.50. It was glorious! The noodles are good, but the real star are all the sauces that make it so good. I put all of them on there and the spicy, salty, sweet, sesame flavors all blended together nicely.

Love, love, love the rice rolls from this place. Just how I remembered it to be from when I was a little kid. I ordered the Pork Rice Rolls w/additional Eggs, and added literally every sauce they had (peanut, sweet oyster sauce, soy sauce, and sriracha) - exactly how it should be. Discovered this place on Yelp. It's a small hole in the wall shop, easy to miss, so keep your eyes out for it!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Love, love this place. They make your order right in front of you. Local place, the ho fun is so fresh and you cannot beat the $2 price. The red bottle has soy and the yellow bottle is peanut sauce. They open early am and makes for a great breakfast.
No comment
No comment

I love my childhood street corner lady but she is not always open.  So I am so glad I found this new spot.  They make the rice noodle right in front of you fresh.  Also there are more customization options and varieties.  They have all the sauce laid out in front for you to put yourself so you can add what you like to your own flavor.  Sometimes with the cart they might add too little or too much sauce.  This little store front also sells other items like fresh hot or cold, sweetened or unsweetened soy milk. They also sell the the sweet soft tofu.  I haven't tried it but I've seen people buy it.
No comment

Delicious, fresh, and dirt CHEAP rice rolls!!! $1.50 per serving and it is made right in front of you. The lady serving me was really sweet and quick with my order of dried shrimp rice rolls. I would definitely come back for a quick meal. There are 3-4 different sauces offered to drizzle over your rolls. I prefer just soy sauce. I grabbed this to go for breakfast before heading for a flight home, and it was boxed perfectly.
No comment
No comment

We stopped by this place cause we we're in the area and we're hungry af. They have the best cheong fun. And it's only $1.50 each. I got it with fishball. My gf got it with Cha siu. If I lived in the area, I'd definitely go back  everyday in the morning. This hole in the wall shop is definitely worth your visit
No comment
No comment
Tasty but the place is filthy... and definitely not as good as the cheung fun cart (see my other review)... We'll just stick to the cart from now on. Thanks.

Located near the bridge is this small dingy place in East Broadway. I was around the area and made it in time before they stopped making the rice noodles. They stop selling at 3:30pm everyday. The rice noodles were made to order fresh. I like that there's many types of rice noodles to order from, whether it be beef, pork, corn, veggies or fishballs. I got the rice noodles with fish balls and egg. The egg was an additional charge of $0.50. The noodles were kind of liquidity. I actually prefer it to be more dense and glutinous. The fishballs were cut in half to be made with the rice noodles. I wished they were the whole fish balls that I'm used to. I've had better. But it's not bad for a quick simple snack for $2.00.
No comment
No comment

Very yummy fresh steamed rice rolls. They r nice as well. A bit far from canal st but definitely worthy to have a try. You can add the peanut sauce soy sauce as much as you like. Their soya is also very nice definitely I would come again.
No comment
Seriously ugly delicious. So glad to have stumbled on this hole in the wall gem. Its seriously cheap too! Definitely coming back for more #trythistho
No comment
No comment

The lady who was making my Chang Fen is really nice and she made sure the order is exact what I want. The food here is authentic Cantonese Chang Fen and the price is really cheap regarding the quality taste.

Love this place! Whenever I am in Chinatown in the morning (which is maybe like once a year), I know I have to come here to get my rice roll fix! They're all so good but my favorite would be the corn rice roll... actually you just really cannot go wrong with any of them. Nothing like getting a customized freshly made rice roll at a little ghetto hole-in-the-wall storefront. No seats, no bathrooms. You just order, get your food, sauce it up to your little heart's content, and go. It makes everything feel extra legit and makes me feel like I am in-the-know. Haha. And SO CHEAP! The fish balls are bomb here too. Dunk everything with their sauces - YUMMY!
No comment

Delicious freshly made cheng fun(rice roll) This is a classic shop that is hard to find in NY.  They make tofu, rice noodles, soy milk, herbal tea, and zhongzi.  There is a large selection of ingredients you can add to your cheng fun.  After the cheng fun is cooked, you can add any sauce(soy sauce, hoisin sauce, peanut sauce, and sriracha).

Decided to try this place out on a Sunday Summer afternoon. Ordered the egg, roast pork, and beef rice noodle rolls. Food was prepped extremely fast which is nice since there's no seating or even going inside this place. The Cheung Fun was very good. The fast and fresh quality combined with the mind blowing cheap prices is why this place is getting 5 stars. If this was priced 3-4x more per dish like at other places, it would get 4 stars. But the ample amount of choices, great service, quality food, and cheap prices makes you want to go out of your way to come here. Cleanliness is another story because I watched a guy go in and out with a lit cigarette without anyone batting an eye which was partly disturbing yet partly hilarious. Overall this is one of my new favorite spots in Chinatown.

Real NYC Chinatown local breakfast spot. I don't really know the whole deal with this place but the kitchen is super busy with something energetic. Rice noodle is freaking fresh, perfectly balanced between soft and springy texture. I always order with egg. The taste is subtly savory with a small joy of garnish(beef, pork, dried shrimp...etc) Although there's only tiny counter at the window and usually a pile of garbage on the street. But that's the whole experience and totally worth it!

Cheap yu dan churn fun to satisfy your cravings! I never knew they sell these at a real location, always thought it's only sold at a cart but now that I know about this place, I will definitely come by again! Since the carts are not always around in Chinatown, this is the place to go.
No comment
No comment

This place makes rice rolls to order and they are so quick! The lady at the front is always so nice. I've had nearly everything on the menu and like them all. My favorite are the dried shrimp rolls and sausage and veggie rolls. Don't forget to bring cash and add egg to everything!
No comment

Fresh rice noodles with scallions and dried shrimp are $1.25 a bag to go.  The steamed rice crepes made to order is also fantastic.  This is your classic Cantonese tofu shop.  Everything is homemade.  Not too many of them still around.
No comment
No comment
If you have a soft spot for food that is absurdly cheap and yet really delicious, go here and get the cheong fun. Cash only. Take-out only. The lady doesn't really speak English, but she's awesome.
No comment

I went there a couple of times already. We tried the chicken + green onions rice roll, beef and BBQ pork rice rolls. My favorite is the BBQ pork roll for $2.25. The pricing is very reasonable, food is tasty, good portion size, and quick service. I used too little soy sauce the first time and then put too much of it the second time. Cash only. Definitely worth going to for a quick bite.
No comment

The dish which I like most here is the mass of rice. The taste of rice with spicy ingredients is marvellous here. The Delivery of your order is very fast here. The staff is very well behaved like an educated person.
No comment
Fresh made rice noodles to order. Always a line in the morning but goes fast. Their sauces are a bit watery so squeeze a lot on!
No comment
No comment

THESE PORTIONS ARE LARGE. Don't be tricked by the cheap prices and assume that it's not that much food. Our group of three ordered 6 different flavors of rice noodles and I felt like a blimp afterwards. It was physically difficult to stand and we didn't even finish all of it. Stand outs were the roast pork and dried shrimp rice noodles, and definitely add the egg for extra savoriness! Make sure you slather TONS of soy sauce, peanut sauce, and sriracha on top. Like way more than you think you need because the bottom rice noodles won't have enough flavor if you don't. It takes them about 2 minutes to steam the rice noodles fresh (they make it right in front of you). Fantastic spot for a quick, cheap bite, and there's a small playground down the street with benches where you can eat.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cheap for quick meal ($2!!!!) and they have this peanut butter drizzle sauce that should be a household condiment.

Still my favorite place to get rice rolls.  It's a mom and pop operation.  It's essentially a take out window in a soybean and noodle factory.   I am upping my star rating to support this place to combat the people who gave it a poor rating for dirty floors. Its not a restaurant it's a factory where they make tofu and noodles.  Stop with the hate. It's a hole in a wall where the food is awesome.  And if you don't like it so much- guess what- they supply half of Chinatown with their product and you will still eat it in your "cleaner" restaurant.

Delicious, simple breakfast. Had the mixed vegetable (corn and bean sprouts) and added egg. Went straight from the steamer into a box. Popped open the lid and added soy, peanut, and hoisin sauces. Ate standing right at the outside counter. So satisfying.
No comment
No comment

This is probably the best pick and go rice noodle locations in Chinatown and all of NYC. It's quick and fresh, very efficient staff and I've never had to wait for too long. I come here on a weekly basis and it's so good!
No comment
No comment

Heavenly! I have to admit that as a non Cantonese chinese, I have not had these made to fresh rice noodle. Made to fresh actually means made from scratch. You can see they pour the rice liquid into a gigantic flat plate and steam it in front of you. I think I can taste the difference of these from those sold in dim sum place. They are more chewy with stronger rice flavor. They do not have ice soymilk so I have to get it in hot and drink it at my office. Very good soy milk - so fresh. The noodle with milk only cost insane 3 dollars. My only complaint is that you HAVE to take out as there is no place to eat unless you walk to a park on Madison street.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I predict big things for this true hole in the wall! They do fun and they do it right! Right means made to Oder on a steam tray covered in sauce and cheap! Go here before it turns into "Vanessa's dumplings"!
No comment
Cheung fun were great and their soy milk is a must get, not too sweet and silky texture. They make their cheung fun fresh to order.
Yummy and inexpensive! Very quick service and the lady in the front is sweet. I've only gotten the rice noodle rolls and soybean milk and they were great. They have a few sauces that you can add.

I saw the good reviews about this place. Finally get the chance to bought take out zong and dried shrimp cheung fun. Because I got the premade one and left it the car for most of the day. It started to change to bad when I eat but  It's still soft . I think it's better when u eat right away.

Made right in front of you, hot and delicious and can't beat the price of $1.50! I got the vegetable rice roll, and it was really good but I think could've used some more corn and stuff mixed in or more of the sauces (which you put on yourself) to keep the taste more interesting.

My favorite go-to place for steamed rice noodles. Don't judge it by it's exterior appearance, it's a hole in the wall spot that is often overlooked. I love the soft texture of these silky smooth steamed rice noodles compared to the street vendor ones. Did I mention they make it FRESH! As soon as you place your order, they make it spot on and afterwards you're able to add as much sauce to your liking. I always drench mines in peanut and hoisin sauce, while topping it off with a little hot sauce. It used to be $1.25 per order but it's still dirt cheap now. For $1.50, you can chose from plain, beef, pork, chicken or dried shrimp and add other ingredients for an additional price. My absolute favorite is the pork steamed rice noodle with egg, cilantro, and fish balls. It's a perfect way to start my day before work!
No comment

Communication was rough even though I understand and can speak Chinese but everything on the left is what you can order, on the right is take home raw things that you can cook on your own later! Anyways, the rice noodles themselves are pretty nice but the toppings are pretty meh. Would recommend staying away from the roast pork cuz you get just a few pieces of completely dehydrated meat product in the filling that tastes pretty odd. The fish balls were actually pretty good, although wish they could have been incorporated a bit more instead of sprinkled on top, but maybe that's just how the dish is eaten. At least it comes piping hot, but when eating this, make sure to drown your rice noodles with toppings like soy sauce or the rice noodles just sponge it up and the whole thing stays relatively bland.

The great thing is that Chinatown offers so much food and variety. This is one of my go-to places for rice noodles and tofu dessert. If I'm passing by, I usually pick up these two goodies. The rice noodles are made fresh when you order and you can add toppings to it. Their tofu dessert is also fresh because every time I buy it, the container is nice and warm! It's a great gem in the neighborhood and very affordable. Great option for a quick lunch.

NOOO, I didn't make it in time to try their rice noodle rolls. They stopped cooking around 3 or 4, I forgot. I just got some "dou fu hua" to try. It wasn't the best I've had. I definitely think the dou fu hua at Fong Inn Too was better (haven't been disappointed). The ones hear are cheaper though for the "big" size. $2 vs $3, but I would still go for the $3 at Fong Inn Too.
The best soybean milk I've had in NYC chinatown. It's so fresh! I also got the dried shrimp rice noodle. Also tasty. This will defin become a regular stop for me.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Been coming here for years, never thought to yelp it. Absolutely love the rice rolls, and definitely a bargain. Shrimp or egg or beef or sausage or pork, tossed together with vegetables, steamed with liquidy-rice which turns into a sort of noodle, costs just a couple bucks, really delicious with their various sauces, and totally satisfying.

I drive out of my way from queens to Chinatown just for these churng fun's!! So fresh, so silky and sooooo damnnnnnn good!!! Price is fairly cheap. Would be perfect if they made iced milk tea or coffee but hey you're in Chinatown and it's everywhere ! Def recommend to everyone !!
No comment
No comment
Fresh, cheap and filling rice rolls, soy bean drink and tofu fa.  Would have love to try their leave wrapped glutinous rice, but they only sell them Sundays.  May be next time.

Hope places like this always exist.  No frills, fast, fresh, hole in the wall place.  Had their rice crepe with fish balls on a cold winter day, hit the spot.  The lady who made my order could tell I was clueless about the sauces, and was sweet about helping with seasoning it with all of the magical sauces.
An excellent example of simple rice rolls for breakfast accompanied by a freshly made cup of soya. Well worth looking for this store. Its located on the fringe of Chinatown.

Came all the way over here to try the rice noodles since I love them and they did not disappoint but were not any better than the ones I've had in Brooklyn, which are also made fresh. I opted only for soy sauce but should have gotten all of them in hindsight.
I stumbled upon this place while wandering around Chinatown. I saw the line outside the window and observed what was being sold. Decided to try it out and loved it! Cheap, delicious, and fast!

My favorite place in Chinatown.. really .. thankfully this is on my street, I go almost everyday :) so fresh, so cheap, so flavorful. I get the veggie rice roll. Love how friendly all the ladies are that work here too. Always a lovely experience.
No comment
No comment

Hard to believe I am just now discovering this hidden little treasure off the beaten track in Chinatown. This is an amazing intersection of price and quality/flavor. They have the most delicious rice rolls because each one is made to order from a simple window. It's street food and incredibly cheap. It's hot and fresh and melts in your mouth.
One of the best breakfasts you can get in Chinatown! $1.50-$2 for fresh Cheong Fun, you can't go wrong. Super fast and delicious. You can also get fresh noodles and frozen dumplings to go.

PS - the woman who normally is stationed at the front window is nice. She makes the cheong fun, serves the food through he window. The man who generally is stationed in the middle of the shop usually handles the orders for refrigerated products: soy milk, tofu, bagged rice noodles, bean sprouts. He's a bit of a cantankerous grump. Might also be because Cantonese people tend to speak loudly and gruffly. I was taken aback at my first experience dealing with him, and on a separate occasion, saw him speak to another customer the same way.  Doesn't affect my rating (I would take off a half star if I could) but just thought people should know.

Yes. This place is just a window with a severely limited English menu on the door and an adorable woman on the inside cooking the rice roll from scratch while you wait only 5 minutes. And it's $1.50. And one is plenty for lunch. I ate two. So judge away. I had never even had a rice roll and now I have to make up for lost time. I had the vegetable rice rolls. I put tons of soy sauce on it and should have out more sriracha. Not because the rice roll needed spice to cover anything up but because it seemed to seep into the rice roll and deepen the flavor. Just go. Order whatever you want. You won't regret it.

I don't have a lot of rice roll experience to compare this to, but this place is what it is.  They serve rice rolls and noodles (though the noodle menu is pretty much all in Chinese so good luck).  It's super cheap and there are no seats unless you count the curb in which case there are plenty of seats.  It's a window behind which a woman has a small oven and assembles your rice roll, which is funny because there's an open door next to it where you can just walk in.  The rolls are made per order so are super fresh with various fillings - vegetables, eggs, chicken, beef, etc.  There are various sauces - Sriracha, soy sauce, and peanut sauce.  While they're probably great at what they do, objectively I can't give this place more than 4 stars because well it's rice rolls.  I'll go there if I'm around Chinatown for a cheap, filling meal, but that's about it.
Finally I had the chance to go to this place to get the rice roll (Cheung Fun). They were delicious! Cheap and yummy. You have to try it.

Fresh Rice Rolls!  Not just any rice roll-- there's like 20 for you to choose from.  The price is right at a buck twenty five an order.  There aren't many places in Chinatown that still make it like this.  Stand in line-- it's worth it.
Solid if not great cheung fan. I prefer to get mine on East Broadway

Nothing like freshly made cheung fun. One can only find little gems like thus in old chinatown. Where else can u get 2 orders of cheung fun and a bottle of freshly made soy milk for $3.75. Just not possible. Cheung fun was silky smooth and delicious and filling. Do not pass this up. I have yet to try poon lee but this is def top of list now.

i enjoy coming here tho it's not super close to where i wanna get my churn fun but it's good. the churn fun is made when you order it. so it's not pre-made like some places. i love that i can add as much sweet sauce and peanut sauce as i want on my churn fun. the only thing i don't like is that the fishballs are in halves instead of a whole fishball. but otherwise i like how it's made and such.

What a wonderful warm welcome into the crown heights neighborhood! Agi's C was warm and sweet. What was more impressive was the staff, welcoming and friendly! Good food and an even better atmosphere. Head there before the winter is over for a cozy and hearty Brunch.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Queer owned, lock five joint with homemade, comfort food. Sporting this, sweet at work, savoring a delicious pastry made with love.
No comment
No comment

Had a great low key dinner here. It's always nice when you can take your time and linger over a lovely $50 bottle of wine and nosh on some chicken liver toast. Don't skip the caraway Caesar, it's aggressively seasoned, in the best possible way, and was a real standout. As was the cheesecake, a fruity, savory NY style cheesecake that was a joy, and not a slog, to finish. The service was warm and the whole place felt so friendly.
No comment
No comment
Tuna sandwich is SO delicious. The baked goods are like nothing I've ever had before. Staff is kind and friendly. A place I love to support.
No comment
This place has been on my list forever. It exceeded my best expectations. We loved the crepes and the latkes. Don't sleep on the Ferdinand buns either!

Such a cute spot and the staff was so attentive and nice throughout the whole meal. I had the Hungarian crepes which were yummy and sweet. My friend and I shared the hash browns which were a very interesting shape. They were very crispy and fell apart when you tried to eat them in any way but they were addictive, like crispy chips and the horseradish sour cream spread under it was such a good pairing. Also had a dirty ovaltine (chocolate, espresso and oat milk hot drink) which was perfect and cozy and not too sweet.

Breakfast/lunch at Agi's is a must - the confit tuna sandwich is delicious, and the little touches like that fennel slaw and the mustard with a kick really make it. The breakfast sandwich is great with or without the speck (and chili oil if you're feelin' spicy) - that biscuit is simply amazing! You may as well have some hashbrowns too and do not skip out on something from the pastry counter!! The coffee cake with prune has a great balance of flavors. Overall, a true gem, taking brunch-y things to the next level!

Cute little cafe in Prospect Heights! My favorite thing was the Ferdinand bun, which was so soft and buttery and utterly delicious. Tried the crepes with strawberry jam, which were yummy, and the hash browns with roe. Wish the hash browns were a bit warmer (they'd already cooled down by the time I got them) but the combination of salty roe, crispy potato, sour cream, and onion made for a great bite. Also had a cappuccino, which was alright.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was amazing and really unique. Service was top tier, our waitress was so kind and amazing. We made reservations so I can't speak on the wait time, but everyone who worked there seemed to be really accommodating. Definitely more of a place to eat then study or work on a computer.
No comment

Excellent coffee, welcoming and friendly baristas/staff, and beautiful decor on the inside. A great new addition to the Crown Heights/Franklin Ave neighborhood, Agi's Counter has been nothing but wonderful in the (multiple times!) I've been here. The pastries are all made in house, and the ones I've tried have been delicious. I'll definitely be back!
No comment
No comment

W.O.W. The atmosphere is so incredible in here and the food is exceptional. We came to Agi's with big expectations after seeing all of the desserts and sweets that looked so great. Any expectations were certainly exceeded and everything, including the service, was above and beyond!! We will 10000% be returning to Agi's!!!
Their breakfast sandwich with dill in it is one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have had. Really solid lunch menu and always a very tasty selection of pastries.

Stop in yesterday and got a freshly made black ice tea and a ferdinand buns. Seriously one of the best pastries I ever tasted!! I've been here for dinner once before too and everything was scrumptious!! Also, perfect for a date night. Their menu changes with the season, so for sure check in for an update menu.
No comment
Walked in for Friday brunch. Cute space and friendly service. The fluffy whipped egg mouse (Duran/Duran) pictured here, the pogacsa egg sandwich, and a linzer tart were all delicious!

Nice cafe and food spot with Eastern European flair and friendly service. I would order the pogatcsa egg sandwich again. We also tried the fruit salad - the potato bread it comes with is really good and baked in house. It was on the pricey side for a few slices of fruit and some dates but tasty. Surprisingly the Savoy cabbage slaw was the star for me - dilly, delicious and healthy! Hope to return to try more savory dishes and baked goods.

my boyfriend and I are regulars here and we love agis counter!!! as you can see from all the photos, we come here A LOT, maybe too much lol. the service is amazing and the food is just as good. order anything and everything, you will want to try it all. you will feel like healthy kings and queens leaving this joint. we love u agis xoxo

It was a very long subway ride from Inwood to this wonderful Eastern European outpost in Brooklyn.   Hands down the Ferdinand Bun was their most satisfying offering.  It's like your cinnamon morning bun on steroids.  Their gerbeaud and coffee cake were tasty as well but not as exulted.  We were a party of four.  So we got to try most brunch items.  I loved the pogacsa biscuit sandwich with added speck.   The paprika sausage was plump and nicely seasoned.   We thought the palacsinta crepes and the ritzy-titzy plate were all right too.    Overall quite a neighborhood gem.

favorite neighborhood restaurant - I've eaten here probably at least 10 times now for brunch/lunch/dinner and every single dish was unique and amazing, so you can't go wrong with whatever you pick. Dinner menu has been my personal favorite so far, and they add new items all the time which makes it fun to go back often. Everything is delicious but some standouts are the chicken liver mousse, anything that's a cheesy/eggy noodle dish, beet dip, and whatever poached chicken dish they have! 10/10 :)

Incredible brunch!!!! This place completely knocked our socks off - everything was so tasty, beautifully made and satisfying. We've lived in the area for years and can't believe we just discovered it! 100% will be back!!
No comment

Wonderful addition to the neighborhood! Went here with my friend and we were greeted with warm smile and friendly recommendations from the staff. We ordered the Lebarkase sandwich and a Gerbaud cake to share. The sandwich was plenty big and it hit every mark so I left feeling very satisfied. Service wise,  we let them know that we were popping in for a quick lunch in the middle of the work day and they made sure to get us in and out quickly to accommodate our schedule, which I really appreciated. I already can't wait to try the rest of the menu and looking forward to bringing some of the baked goods home.

This isn't really Hungarian! The pogacsa/biscuit was the only good thing! Egg and sausage had so much dill that it's all you tasted plus salty sausage! The little cake was dry and had liquor in it which isn't traditional.
No comment
No comment
Friendly staff great service, the food is well executed and feels like home. Nosh plate was delicious!

A really lovely experience front to back. The tuna melt was satisfying and the cabbage on the side was surprisingly fantastic, really fresh. The chicken liver mousse was very smooth and paired well with the accompanying cherry caramel. Overall, all of the menu items seem very thoughtfully considered with great flavor combinations. Great service - welcoming and kind without being overly friendly. As an aside, coffee cups and cutlery were very beautiful and satisfying to use; dining experience was just very pleasant in all aspects.
No comment

Survice was friendly but the food seemed overpriced for what it is, especially for the extra speck on the egg and cheese. Also is not the biggest portion so we went across the street and had a beef patty to go from Golden Crust right after.

Hardly ever write Yelp reviews but feel compelled to for dear Agi's. What a special, unique place! Their creativity knows no bounds, with a rotating menu and such innovative yet authentic dishes. Flavor and quality is unparalleled. Always craving their breakfast sandwiches and my favorite pastry, the Gerbeaud.

I hardly ever write Yelp reviews, but this place is special. Everything -- EVERYTHING -- is good. Go for breakfast and get the egg sandwich. Go for dinner and get whatever they are serving. So happy Agi's is in the neighborhood.

My husband and I came here about 3 weeks ago on a Thursday night visiting from LA. I never leave Yelp reviews, but I just wanted to express what a lovely dinner and what wonderfully welcoming service we had. The food was super thoughtful, fresh and delicious, and beautifully plated. The wine recs were great. The restaurant it's self was super cozy and elegant. I wish we lived nearby - would definitely be a regular.

Had dinner there - food was amazing. Unbelievably fresh, loved all the herbs, semolina dumplings tasty af, salad delightful, tongue tender, asparagus and lardo spectacular. Service so friendly and relaxed. Very reasonably priced. Charming interior. 15/10 would visit again, so glad it's in the neighbourhood.

The most surprising and gratifying lunch find we have experienced for years. We were welcomed warmly by Charles who expressed disappointment when we said that out order was to go. He reassured us that they check for vaccinations, so we stayed.  We ordered the jammy egg mousse, cracked beets, and a piece cranberry upside down cake. I can't describe how delicious they were. The egg mousse was creamy, savory and subtle. The cracked beets were sweet/salty and maybe garlicky. The cake was beautifully carmelized. The staff was attentive, professional, and friendly, The total bill, Including tip came to less than $45.. We will be back!
The staff is incredibly considerate and thoughtful. The space is very cute and comfy. And the food! The food is drool-worthy. So may great treats - especially the grapefruit!
The food was good, but there was a unique coffee drink that was the real standout. Unfortunately, I don't remember the name!

Such a cute space with beautiful wallpaper and a true European lunch counter vibe. The food was absolutely delicious, and will be going back soon! Unfortunately, their breakfast menu is only available until 10am and 11am on weekdays and weekends, respectfully. I hope they expand their hours once they get more comfortable and established!!
Outstanding!! Perfect for breakfast and lunch.  Open only 2 months.  Friendly, pretty, comfortable, and absolutely great food.  Creative ingredient combinations, fresh, delicious.  100% 5 star !
Super cute spot, staff is great, dinner was amazing - can't wait to check out brunch.

Incredible coffee service and pastries meets a really accessible but exciting sit-down menu. Great meetup or date spot just as much as it is grab-and-go coffee on the way to the train, Botanic Garden, Brooklyn Museum, or Prospect Park.
Excellent place with great service. We enjoyed the chicken toast and the crepes. Would definitely come again
Incredible sandwiches and pastries, fantastic service. Favorite new spot, will 100% visit every time I'm in NY!

Made a date to have breakfast here early Friday morning. It was nearly empty at 8:30 am but a few more people showed up for the counter service. We ordered the BLT, egg sandwich with speck and a slice of the orange cardamom loaf. We grabbed the far corner by the front window for some great people watching. It's a very relaxed atmosphere, perfect for a leisurely weekday morning. The egg sandwich consists of a perfectly cooked fried egg, cheddar and fried speck on a freshly baked biscuit. It was the best egg sandwich I've ever eaten! The biscuit was light and not greasy or overpoweringly dense or too big. The egg was just a tiny bit runny inside, the perfect consistency to soak into the biscuit. I didn't try my bf's BLT but he said it was very tasty. The loaf was tasty as well, similar to a pound cake with a hint of orange. It was a perfect breakfast, not too heavy to slow you down but supremely satisfying.
This place is super cute and the food is delicious! Def try scollops and fish. And this ambiance is great for a couple of cocktails. I'll take my date here next time
No comment
No comment

Having been open only for 3 months, Nerea managed to make it to be my favorite restaurant in the city, and I've been there many times already. Food is delicious and inventive, something that's missing from so many restaurants in NYC at this price point. Quality of food is like in a fine dining restaurant, but it's not as pricy ($100-$150 per person with wine, while NYC fine dining starts at $200-$250 with wine). Service (Andrea, Stefano and Mario) is fantastic, very attentive and welcoming. Wine selection is spot on, with one of my favorite $20 whites on the list. While the preparation has been changing, my favorites stayed the same: appetizer - scallops; filled pasta; main - the beef dish. Regardless of some updates to these dishes, they have always been amazing. Smoked margarita is the go-to cocktail.
Food and ambiance are amazing. They have a very solid choice of wines. The bar bites are accurately paired with their cocktails. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves good food.
No comment

Ambiance and the Korean dishes were delicious. My boyfriend and I did the tasting menu, I think the quality of the meat was lacking for price/portion but the dishes  that came with the tasting menu really shined. I would visit again. The som, waiter and all the staff were delightful.

Went on grand opening night, had an amazing experience. Lovely staffs who were all very knowledgeable about the menu listings and Ju the sommelier was really great at helping us pick out the best wine pairing for the evening. Great ambience and even better food, will definitely be visiting again!

I recently had the pleasure of dining here for a private event that truly exceeded all of my expectations. From the moment I stepped through the doors, I was impressed by the elegant ambiance and attentive service. The menu featured a diverse selection of dishes, each one crafted with the utmost care and attention to detail. From the appetizers to the entrees, everything was cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor. What really set this restaurant apart, however, was the service. The waiters were incredibly knowledgeable about the menu, offering thoughtful recommendations, and answering any questions we had. They were attentive without being intrusive, ensuring that our glasses were always filled and our plates cleared in a timely manner. Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an upscale dining experience. The combination of delicious food and outstanding service truly made for a memorable evening. I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Date night approved!!!!! Can't wait to go back!. The restaurant is located on the first floor of the public hotel. We had reservations, were seated right away. The food was so good, I was left dreaming about their fried rice. I can't remember the exact name but it was so good. It's Peruvian style fried rice. We also had the lomo Saltado and octopus! So delicious. The drinks were delicious as well. Everything was exquisite. The place is super beautiful, surrounded by tons of greenery and they had a live band playing. And of course the service was great, no problems there. Did I mention we'll be back? Must visit!
No comment

Food is okay but this is a fun place to come with friends! Interior is beautiful, and there was live music playing all night. I was able to try the classic ceviche, sticky prawns, and roasted chicken. I was not blown away by the food, the intentionally hard chow mein that came with the prawns was an interesting choice. They also never brought the fries I ordered. I would come back here to chill and drink but not for the food.

This restaurant is inside the public hotel and was super pretty but I thought the food, service and people were all very odd. The ceviche was fresh and delicious but our waiter constantly kept giving us really weird comments about the menu and pushed us to order more when we weren't hungry. The pisco sour was the perfect level of sweet and we ordered the octopus, fish, rice noodles, ceviche and salad. The house nuts were yummy but the food was all small portions.

Omg I absolutely loved this place! The food the service and the ambiance were all amazing. This place is gorgeous! Definitely come here. More than anything, the service was top tier. I loved it here

The BEST CEVICHE of my life I love this place. The drinks are amazing the atmosphere is everything & the waiter was very pleasant
No comment

Popular is a Peruvian restaurant on the ground floor of the Public Hotel. Ceviche is the Peruvian national dish, but Popular serves up much more than that. Popular also has an array of creative pisco cocktails. Service is spotty and the wine list is poor, but overall a good experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
The family style dinner is not good at all. They brought out very minimal food and expensive for what was offered. Nice spot tho

The bacon was the best part of brunch. The pancakes were good. The burger was mediocre. And the ceviche was disappointing. Only giving a three star for the bacon and pancake. If not I would have given it a 1 star. I will try to come here again to try the dinner menu. But will be a while before I drop by there again.
No comment

Went here for one of my bestie's bdays and the food was banging!!! The music was great and the place was just a whole vibe. I rly enjoyed their lobsters! We ordered a bunch of things and I'd def wanna go again. Even the waiter was super nice!!

The first thing you see when walking in to Popular is an abundance of greenery and lush plants. The restaurant is in a really cool hotel with a modern and sleek interior. Our server was extremely friendly and efficient. He gave great recommendations as well. As I do not drink, he recommended a delicious purple, cinnamony, virgin cocktail type drink with lime which was incredible. Definitely try this. As for the food we got the sticky shrimp, sweet potato, yucca fries, gem salad, and octopus. All amazing. Some standouts were definitely the shrimp and the yucca fries. We also got this chocolate mousse type thing with ice cream for dessert that was delicious. The chocolate was super rich and satisfying. Can't really go wrong with anything on the menu here. One of the best Peruvian spots I have been to. Overall great vibes, super trendy, and pleasant dining experience.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful restaurant, interesting menu (although not executed perfectly), very spotty service. We were told that none of the bottles of wine under a $100 were available. Also, the server kept trying to upsell things. And the server, as nice as he was, didn't possess the personality of the person who should be selling you a $50 plate of Lomo Saltado. It felt like a restaurant was trying to make a weekly payroll while sacrificing their image and a possibility of repeat business in process.

Came here for my birthday with friends and this place exceeded my expectations. It's inside the public hotel and the entrance got my attention from across the street. Beautiful place. I walked in and a live band was playing Spanish and Brazilian music, and as we were guided to our table I was blown away by the ambiance. The food came in small portions but it was so flavorful. The only thing we didn't like was the three flavored sorbet desert. Warning: the mint sorbet tastes exactly like real mint. This is the perfect spot for a classy, upscale girls night out, a date, or a birthday!
No comment
No comment
Super pricey for just okay food - BUT I must say ALL of the ceviche dishes were BEYOND delicious! Go for a ceviche tasting ONLY.
No comment
No comment

Popular has a fun lively atmosphere, it's tucked away behind the golden escalators and the front cantina bar. We were welcomed with Latin music from a live band for our Saturday night excursion. The drinks were quite tasty from the extensive options of the pisco bar. The la rojita was light and refreshing and the pisco sour light frothy with a little sour bite. I got the ceviche Classico which was very fresh and delicious. My main was the tortellini, it's served Al Dente which means the pasta isn't fully cooked. I thought it was yummy but it was a little too undercooked for my taste as there were some hard parts. If you are looking for a fun night out or a birthday I'd recommend and they have the club upstairs.
No comment
No comment
Definitely recommend this place! Such a cool vibe and food was amazing!! Our server was so nice and personable too!
Beautiful restaurant and amazing food. The shrimp rice was crispy and the duck leg melted in my mouth. I tried lucuma for the first time. It's an eye opener
No comment
No comment

I like the restaurant! It's modern Peruvian food with a lot of creativity. We ordered a bunch of main courses to share and everything was excellent. I especially liked Lomo Saltado. It was so good and very different from what you usually see. My friend ordered a cocktail that she had in Peru and it was so good. The dining environment is amazing. Service was solid too. Overall it's a pretty cool place.

Great service, awesome ceviche, awesome Carrots, delicious wine, pretty good atmosphere, but scallops were EXTREMELY underwhelming. $34 for "two" scallops which actually weren't two scallops, but an amalgamation of tinier ones? Not sure if an off Friday night or what, but highly disappointing.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great food, lovely ambience, but service was uneven. The wait staff are very friendly, but our server kept making mistakes, bring out an incorrectly ordered entree, screwing up a coffee order, and accidentally adding incorrect items to our bill. Recommend the place, but it requires alertness and patience. BTW, I loved the filet mignon.
No comment
The pomegranate salad was wonderful. We tried three different ceviches and they were all delicious. My only complaint is that the dishes were small compared to the price we paid.

First time dining for Peruvian food! Tasty food I like Filet mignon! And enjoying the environment surrounded by the plants

Food was amazing. Ambiance was amazing. Even our server was amazing - shoutout to Bowie! We got the calamari and ceviche to share and it was able to kick-start our meal and start it on such a good, high note. It was also such a vibe - at around 9pm, there was live salsa music playing in the lounge area (cantina/pisco bar area).

Such a disappointing experience. Came with my husband to celebrate our anniversary. Overpriced food, minuscule - not even small, tiny! - portions, rude service. The waiter was far more interested in upselling and showing his indifference rather than trying to provide a memorable service. I was so surprised to read all the positive reviews. Where was the manager Rachel mentioned in some other reviews? Nobody bothered to come to us and ask how we were doing. Such a waste of our time and money.
No comment
This place was probably one of, if not the best, dining experiences I've ever had. We had a wonderful, charismatic waiter. The food was absolutely to die for, and the atmosphere was well executed.

I saw that the photos were beautiful on Yelp but this place is absolutely gorgeous beyond the expectations set. Tucked away in an oasis on Christie street, past a secret garden, then behind these two impressive escalator space portals to the hotel above. Both the bar/lounge and restaurant have plentiful, beautifully designed seating. And the entire establishment is adorned in greenery. It's like the rainforest cafe for sophisticated adults and unsophisticated foodies like me. I had to get the Popular Pisco Sour because when in Lima... one of the best cocktails I've ever had. I also had to try the classic ceviche which honestly blew my mind - the broth? Was so delicious and almost had a delicate chorizo flavor. The dish itself, all the dishes are absolutely beautiful. For entrees we got the shrimp rice which comes served in skillet, the sticky prawns (bigger than photos suggest! Definitely entree sized), the swordfish, and the market fish (striped bass with micro green salad and delicious sauce). We also got an order of yucca for the table (served two ways, fried and boiled? With another delicious sauce). The swordfish was my favorite entree - out of all the swordfish I've had, this somehow packed double the flavor. And since the fish plates come with just the fish (and a lot of garnish) - I would definitely recommend ordering some carbohydrates off the veggie section of the menu, and I do highly recommend the yucca which is just melt in your mouth. For dessert we tried the Neapolitan ice cream - my father in law is the number one ice cream fanatic and he was losing it at how good this flag of ice cream was. I tried it, it was pretty darn good and served really cool (in a rectangle). My boyfriend and I shared the baked Alaska which also blew my mind - covered in edible flowers and a graham-ish cracker cookie crumble, the meringue was marshmallowy and soft, piped kind of comically like the coronavirus (big spiky ball). Inside the ice cream was two flavors I couldn't identify but they were in the honey, graham-y world and almost cookie dough textured. It's a huge dessert, and I highly recommend getting it whether or not you have other people to share it with. Blown away by this magical place. It's expensive, but it's worth it! Also... not pretentious at all and very kind staff. I wish I had taken photos but I was too mesmerized. Excellent place to take a good friend for a birthday surprise :D
No comment

I have a lot of Peruvian friends who have come here and loved this place so I finally decided to go ahead and try it. At the door hostess was nice and greeted us. Comfortable booth seat , server came right over and was attentive and prompt. Pisco Sours and capitan were delicious , the drink over ice with cumbers was a bit sweet and difficult to drink. Server switched it right out for us. classic ceviche is out of this world and like nothing I've ever tried from before. Tuna tradito needed more flavor but tuna was very fresh. Anticuchos were made from mushroom and were a nice twist from the traditional cow heart. Entrees were all delicious, portions on the smaller side except for the lomo saltado but we left full. The hazelnut tres leches was delicious. Definitely recommend this place. Amazing experience.

While visiting in the area , stopped in to give this place a try and it was delicious. Freindly staff, tables /seating  clean and sanitized between customers . We enjoyed the Peruvian dishes and sampled 4 to share and they were delicious and filling . Great server . Moderately priced .

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
Two hours for food and it never showed. Server and manager did not offer anything in compensation. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE
No comment
No comment

Delicious food and great ambiance with vibrant energy! Thoughtfully curated dishes with high quality ingredients, so things are on the pricier side. But great for a special occasion or just a fun night out. Plates are great for sharing so you can order more and try everything!

This is a really good place but be prepared to spend money this place is pricey. Other than the price the food is really good I had the Lomo Saltado and the Ceviche. Both were phenomenal. The prices from the menu online is different in person. The prices is $10 more in person. Overall a good experience. The ambiance, jungle vibes, and the staff were great. Our waiter was really good with his recommendations. A great place and a great eat!

This place needs to be more popular. The inside is feels like a Costa Rica forest, quite lush looking. I would consider it the classier bar at the hotel, as the rooftop is definitely not, and is a hot mess and a breeding ground for Omicron. The pisco sours were good (classic + strawberry) and I quite enjoyed them, but not quite as flavorful as the one I had in Lisbon at A Cevicherria. I detected a slight smokiness like mezcal in the classic one. Service was decent. Bathroom is approximately the most lux one I have ever been in.
No comment

I had trouble finding a place that would take a party of 12 in within 2 weeks and was happy to come across popular. It was my wife's birthday and she really likes aesthetically pleasing restaurants, and this place certainly was. Lots of greenery and trees reminded me of Miami. I requested our tables be close together but due to  the layout they couldn't do it. Luckily 2 people bailed last minute and we were able to cut down our party size and sit next to each other. They were very friendly and accommodating on the matter, especially with bringing the cake to the back ($10 cut fee pp). We all started off with some drinks, I got the pisco sour. It was one of the best I've had in nyc tbh. Additionally we tried two of the ceviches, one traditional and I forgot the second. Also very good, with just the right amount of cream and lemon flavor. For my entree I had the sticky prawn. My friends adjacent to me ordered the scallops and duck leg. All three dishes were amazing. I wish the scallops were a little bigger but that's just my want overall at restaurants. Overall great good, music, services, and vibes. It was busy for a Tuesday night. I would 100% recommend this place as a fun option for food and drinks. I would've posted more pictures but I was on baby duty.

Popular is located inside the PUBLIC hotel and the vibes are immaculate. Went here for my 21st bday and it was definitely the place to be. Everything tasted heavenly, especially the ceviche (extremely flavorful and fresh). The only reason why I'm not giving it a full 5 is because of the portion size. The apps and entrees seem to be the same size or even smaller which was a bit disappointing. The quality and taste is definitely unbeatable though. Would revisit!! P.S. the espresso martini is made with Pisco and it is BOMB!
This place is like visiting an island I love the authenticity. The food, service, drinks, ambiance everything amazing.

Beautiful ambiance and serving staff are extremely warm and friendly. For a large group, hard to do family style and the portions are a bit small for the price (understandable in the city). The food itself was very tasty. Drinks were delicious and overall a lovely experience.

Went there for my birthday. I ended up ordering two drinks, Infalible and La Rojita, and absolutely loved both. The drinks were pretty strong in alcohol content, so worth the price. Had to get two ceviches: the clasico and elegante. Both looked gorgeous and were delicious. I like the clasico slightly more for the variety of seafood and the complementary sweet potato and crunchy corn. For mains we ordered the mushroom and the sticky prawn. Both were yummy but not as outstanding as the drinks and ceviche, and a bit pricy. The server was very nice to give us a Peruvian Chocolate for my birthday.
No comment
Love the public hotel and it's established restaurant,,, the food is great , I love the ceviche and the sea bass is so delicious. I was celebrating my friend's birthday and we both had a great time !
No comment

Worst NYC restaurant experience ever. 0 stars. I was staying at the Public for a staycation and decided to have breakfast at the hotel before going home. The server and busser/runner working were absolutely lovely! The person I'm guessing was managing was THE WORST. I was there last Sunday (11/13) around 10:30am. Everything started out fine with the server. I ordered the bread and pastry basket and a side of eggs. When the runner dropped off the food, I was surprised by the bread and pastry basket (picture attached). I was underwhelmed and wanted to ask if I could get something else instead. I tried to get the runner/busser's attention but I figured someone would be back to check on me and I was hungry so I started eating the eggs (they were not warm but as I mentioned, I was hungry). I didn't see the server and the runner was busy but someone else came out on the floor who seemed to be the manager (I'll be referring to him as the manager) so I tried to get his attention. He was focused on a couple who had seated themselves (it wasn't very busy but the staff was struggling to manage the flow of guests). He told them "I see you've seated yourselves." They responded by asking if they could have coffees and he told them "if you want coffees you can go over there. This is a full breakfast menu." They responded by saying "yes. This is where the hotel breakfast is?" They had two packages of unopened cookies they had set on the table and he said "this is a full breakfast menu and you can't have outside food in here." Their response "oh sorry." They put the cookie packages away as the manager walked away from them. The runner came back and took their order. I was able to get the runner's attention and explain to him that I'd like something else. He took the bread and pastry basket away. The manager immediately came over and said "We don't just order things and decide that we don't want them so I'm not going to be able to take this off your check. I can't resell this." I hadn't asked him to and he didn't ask me what the issue was. I told him "I understand it's wasteful and a hassle to send this back but I had expected something else. I feel like it was misrepresented on the menu and I would have sent it back right away had someone checked in but I was having difficulty getting anyone's attention." He said "Yes. It is wasteful and a hassle." We went back and forth a bit and he ended by telling me "I'll take it off the bill but just for YOUR future reference, we don't order things and decide we don't want them." I have never encountered such a rude person in the service industry. I worked in NYC restaurants for about 8 years as a server, bartender, and manager. I know working the breakfast/brunch shift can be terrible but this guy was so rude to the couple next to me and to me. Also having worked in the industry, I know that "we" do send things back when they are not what "we" expected or wanted. I also know that it's pretty awful customer service to berate the customers. Having worked in the industry, I try to give everyone the benefit of the doubt but this guy was BEYOND. He was so rude that I created this yelp account and felt the need to write my first review ever. Avoid this place for breakfast.
This place is very fun, the interior design is really lovely and the food is excellent. It gets a little loud, just in case that's not the vibe you're looking for, but we had a great evening here.

We walked in to Cantina and got a table right away. I had the pisco del dia, which was peppermint and super tasty. I wasn't sure what to expect. My husband got the coffee cocktail at the end and it was super yummy. The huancaina was unlike any I've ever had and highly recommended. We were given a ceviche clasico by mistake, and I definitely recommend that one. We ordered the elegante and it was too creamy and heavy. It almost seemed like mayo, which is not what I want in my ceviche. It's a cool spot and we'd love to go back to Popular and sit outside.

I genuinely don't think I've ever waited so long for food in my entire life. Not to mention, the waiter was serving and checking up on every single table except ours. 5 stars because the food was great, just wish the wait time was less than 3 hours. I got seated at 9:30, I was not eating until 11 pm, I wanted dessert but unfortunately could not get because I know that would have taken me another hour to get. I work in hospitality so I know the struggle, but it's definitely something that should be fixed now for future customers.

Awful, the food gave me a headache and I also threw up after I got home. I didn't drink, just had water and I was completely fine beforehand. Something was rotten or off with the fish. I have never thrown up after eating out in my life.

Food was great! Drinks too! It was an amazing experience made all that much more amazing with our great waiter Ricardo that added that warm ambience and Latin love to our dinner. I'd be back just to enjoy his service and care with his clients
I'd give it a zero if possible. Everyone here is a terrible person with no skills whatsoever. Please respond and give your point of view so I can go even further into how much u suck.

My wife and I went here for dinner and loved it. Very cool vibe, amazing food, creative cocktails, and excellent service. The ceviches are in my opinion the best in the city (try the Elegante) and the bar is a great place for a pre-dinner drink or night cap. Could not recommend this place more.

Booked a reservation for Friday night and was seated immediately. The restaurant is in the back of a hotel lobby and coffee shop/bar. The ambiance is very photo-worthy with all the fake plant literally everywhere. I got the scallops, ceviche, and duck. The pisco sours were very tasy and well made. Scallops and ceviche were awesome - a blast of interesting flavors and textures. Very fresh. The duck was just eh for me, the rice complemented the meat well and was stood out more. The lomo saltado is only offered for 2 servings so I passed on it. The wait staff is attentive. Definitely worth trying, but the price point is steeeeep.

Listen, this place was great! The food was delicious and vibe was fabulous. However, be prepared to drop some casssshhhhhhh!!! One glass of white wine is $22  and the Lomo saltado was $50.. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but i was definitely not prepared to spend that much on random thursday night. After dessert, splitting the bill between 2 people came out to about 100 each... Like i said, delicious food and great service, but a shit ton of money lmao

The ambience was great - surrounded by trees. It felt like you were in an outdoor rainforest. The food presentation along with the food itself was delicious. The ceviche was great. The pisco sour was excellent. Highly recommend.

I was a little over 15 minutes late. This is NY... c'mon now. Tried calling multiple times to let the restaurant know and there was no answer. Hostess said that I canceled the reservation on my end and that was not the case. I strictly made this reservation to be seated at the restaurant, not the cantina bar. I do not appreciate being told that I did something that I did not do.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: From start to finish; Popular impressed with impeccable service, drinks, and food. A must whether you are staying at the Public or not. Give it a try, you won't regret it.

The decor of the place is beautiful, but don't let it fool you. The food is mediocre. Came here for a friend's birthday celebration and was more than disappointed when we had to share all the entrees, especially since we were not alluded to this in prior communication. Furthermore, we were told there would be a separate menu for our vegetarian friend. There was not a pre-fixed menu and they just modified the dishes we were already having to cater as "vegetarian friendly". Again, it seems like they were not very transparent in their communication prior to the reservation, would not recommend.
No comment

Service was good, food was mediocre .. would not recommend this place to any vegetarians or vegans unless you'd like to be served carrots and lettuce. Overall a pretty expensive spot that did not meet my expectations.
No comment

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: This place is amazing. My husband and I went here Friday night. We ordered 4 dishes, everything was so good. Duck Liver, blown my mind, one of the best I have ever tried in NYC. Beef Tenderlion, highly recommended. Cheese Soufflé is also recommended, I have never tried a soufflé like this. Will definitely come back.

Excellent experience. Service was top notch. Food was delicious and perfect prepared. We went for brunch and had a bottle of Austrian Riesling recommended by their Somm. She was so lovely and killed with every rec. finished with an Austrian dessert wine. We highly recommend this establishment. Executive chef was preset and making sure the whole restaurant was perfect. Only negative was I wish my chair was more comfortable. Great comfortable ambiance with highly executed comfort food. By the way, everything bread related was phenomenal.

Had a great brunch here. Ordered the duck parfait which was delicious. The smoked salmon and bagel was really good and not your typical platter with a really good bagel texture, flavorful fluffy cream cheese, and of course high quality salmon. Also got the pork schnitzel which was wonderful - very thin piece of breaded pork with lingonberry sauce and some cucumbers.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Excellent restaurant ! Initially I was intimidated by the menu and I wasn't sure if I would like it but everything was so good! We started with gougeres which was cheesy and delicious. I didn't love the sauce that went with it (friend did). Then we had the cheese soufflé (so soft!) and the beets (my least favorite but still good). I had the salmon en croute which was really excellent. My friends had the risotto and fennel tagliatelle both also really good. We ended with creme brulee and cheesecake excellent. Our server was so nice and helpful. Ambiance was nice as well - I just didn't love that you have to walk through a hotel to go to the bathroom and had a totally different feel. Would highly recommend
No comment
