On the second visit, a much-improved Koloman.  The standouts were the fluke, the chicken -- like a bresse chicken only with two beautiful pieces of foie gras on top, both souffle (for the middle course and desert) and the Oysters. The bread course with butter was fresh and butter flavorful. Cocktails original and interesting, particularly the Bitter Truth, Edelweiss and Karo.   Service was excellent.  Would go back in a minute.

Made an unplanned stop here on a Thursday night and was highly impressed! We just sat at the bar a got one round of drinks. The cocktails were very unique and tasted amazing!! Will be coming back to try the dining menu and more cocktails!
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of the best meals I've had in a while. Service was personal and excellent. The food was really delicious.  The wine and the cocktails were also great. Solid presentation of the food. Will definitely come again!!

Arrived early for 6:15 reservation. Reception very accommodating and seated me before the other diner arrived. It was suggested by our waiter that we order 3 to 4 courses each since servings were small.  Once we ordered it took a long time between courses - we asked about our order and patiently waited.  Quite a while after submitting credit cards for payment waiter returned and apologized for delay due to system not working properly.  Finally our cards were returned and when we signed our checks it was now almost 8:30. Quite a long experience due to restaurant issues.   Food was lovely, Waiter and bus staff were great AND THEN .....  THE MANAGER APPROACHED OUR TABLE AND TOLD US TO LEAVE AS HE NEEDED THE TABLE AS THERE WERE PEOPLE WAITING  -  WHAT???  Destroyed the whole experience
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

Woo hoo!  Fun night in a nice new restaurant.  Awesome buzz at this place.  Friends assured me that the decor is authentically Austrian.  It was a bit dark, but nice.  The waitstaff were excellent and very attentive, as one would expect in a new restaurant run by big name chefs.  They have a sommelier!  An excellent one, who did not immediately push super expensive bottles of wine.  We drank an excellent bottle of gruner veltliner and I had my first Austrian Chardonnay.  The bread was excellent and hot- the poppy seed rolls were awesome.  We sampled an assortment of appetizers.  The gougeres were awesome and served as a delivery vehicle for some ethereal truffle butter.  We also tried the crudo, celery root tartare, souffle and tagliatelle.  They were all excellent.  Our table was evenly split between the salmon and the fluke.  The salmon was awesome.  The pastry crust was rich and delicious.  Our table mates were equally happy with the fluke.  Awesome restaurant experience.  One very minor complaint- they don't serve decaf coffee!
Koloman is the latest creation of chef Markus Glocker. Every element of this dining experience is an achievement in the finest anyone could hope for. Hats off to the team at Koloman
Everything is perfect in here! Love the medium rare beef tenderloin and salmon en croute!
No comment

Friendly service who gave us good recommendations. For instance, we wouldn't have known that the boeuf was prepared in 3 different ways, but we definitely appreciated the dish's variety of textures. The salmon en croute was also melt-in-your-mouth tender. I do wish we had opted for a dessert that is more of a Viennese specialty since the caramelized milk bread tasted a little lackluster compared to the savory parts of dinner, but overall, a lovely and interesting dinner.
One of the best dinners I've had in NYC. Food was so fantastic, service was great! The restaurant is really beautiful. Highly recommend!

I enjoyed but did not love Koloman, and this is not an inexpensive restaurant. We split the beets "linzer" and the Short Rib Tafelspitz Terrine. Both were very good. The beets were fairly basic, with a bit of linzer crumble strewn in, and some creme fraiche lining the plate. The terrine was a bit more interesting, and the flavors were nice. For mains, my pal got the Schnitzel (I found this a little greasy) and I had the beautiful -- and very tasty --  Salmon En Croute. The Salmon was faultless, but not thrilling. For dessert we split the soufflé with rum and lingonberries, and it was very good, but I was a little disappointed (am I being too picky) that it wasn't served in a soufflé ramekin but a shallow dish. The flavors were there, but the presentation was blah. I would be more disposed to love this place if it wasn't so pricey, but much like Frenchette (which I think is a more interesting and better restaurant) it's not a place I will visit regularly.

Came for dessert late Saturday night and had the greatest experience. It was lively but they were still able to accommodate my party of 6 and we had some of the best desserts I've ever had. The soufle, lava cake, and marzipan were SO GOOD!!! Loved! Thank you!

Fantastic little place attached to the Ace Hotel. We went for brunch, a group of 4, got a reservation ahead of time. We got seated promptly, they checked our coats (which I SO appreciate), service was excellent and the food and drinks were all delicious. Jazz was playing in the background, yet it was intimate enough for a conversation or a date. We can't wait to go back.
No comment

Best dining experience since the pandemic! At first we found the noise level and very close tables to other diners daunting but loved the great design of this special place. The restaurant is named after Moses Koloman and incorporates his design and light fixtures circa 1900 Vienna. We loved the cheese soufflé and corn scallop soup and pork rib terrine. The dessert soufflé was a great finale to our meal and was so light and perfect!  Our waiter Joe was great and Chef Marcus came to our table to say hi. It is a very special and unique evening and we can't wait to go back again!

I was very excited to try Koloman and it exceeded expectations. The service - from front of house to the servers and wine professionals - everyone was knowledgeable and friendly. The food was exceptional and inventive. The celery root tartar was a surprise hit, cheese soufflé is a must-have. Really enjoyed it and looking forward to going back.

Wow. Just an amazing experience start to finish. Fantastic service and even better food, somehow. Definitely recommend the boeuf and butternut squash soup appetizers and roast chicken for dinner but everything was amazing. Some affordable wines too, really good Austrian ones. This place is set to be one of the best french restaurants in NY already.
No comment

We came to this restaurant because it was advertised as Viennese. We loved what we saw on the website for the menu. However, when we arrived at 1 o'clock on a Saturday, it was in fact, just a normal hotel breakfast. Eggs and that type of thing there was nothing Austrian about it. So disappointing.

Delicious, heavy, perhaps overrated. We had high expectations based on NYT review. The food was lovely but definitely VERY rich. We were seated upstairs, less than amazing ambiance especially given the price of the food. Memorable meal but not sure I'd return anytime soon.

Food is good. However, there is a thing that happens of many restaurants which is nobody asks me how was the food, but they ask the white people around me. They is the daily life of being Asian in America. I really don't wanna say it is micro aggressive but it's happened so many times in this state.
Ridiculous restaurant. Food took forever wait staff was clumsy. Front of house generally didn't have a clue. If you are going to charge those prices it amounts to fraud.

This was one of the best NYC restaurants in terms of food that I have tried in recent memory.  The warm poppyseed rolls alone with were the trip.  We had the short rib terrine and snapper crudo to start.  Both were excellent and the terrine was such a delight especially compared to the same the standard boring starters at so many places.  The duck and beef as mains were both outstanding.  Service was very attentive but laid back and friendly, not stuffy.  The decor was lovely.  The only slight negative was how very expensive most the wine list was (even the wines by the glass).  We each had a cocktail to start, both of which were really well made, but passed on the wine.

The food was excellent -- expensive but where isn't? -- but the service was a bit chaotic and slow. There are tons of staff but they seemed a bit frazzled. You shouldn't have to wait for everyone to arrive before being seated and then have to wait for a drink...

The review by Pete Wells which awarded three stars to Koloman is incomplete.  A mention that the restaurant serves brunch prompted me to invite 3 guests to join me at this lauded restaurant on Sunday, Dec.11th.  My interaction with the hostess should have been a warning that this place was not ready for prime time.  She looked at my Open Table confirmation when she could not find my reservation and noted the 12:30PM time.  She was kind enough to point  out that 12:30 PM is dinner, not brunch, and I was kind enough to tell her that 12:30 PM is noon.  I should also note that Koloman had my credit card as security.  Finally crowded into a booth for four, we perused the menu and made our selections.  We opted for the simple  bacon and eggs, omelet and salads.  The scrambled eggs with bacon turned out to be a flat pancake with some bacon beneath the flattened eggs.  The other egg order received the same treatment; the bit of bacon buried beneath the eggs.  Along with the eggs, we were served a tiny portion of diced potatoes of no particular flavor  to A confusing join the no taste egg dishes.  Butter and jam were provided when requested.  The overall brunch was someone's idea of a Viennese repast, but failed on al counts.  Bacon was hard to find, meager, and hard to taste.  Eggs , adequate but tasteless, and no way scrambled in any cuisine.  The space, crowded and noisy, was hardly a 3 star experience.  Perhaps that is why Mr. wells did not explore or sample the brunch menu.  But we did and do not recommend it to anyone.
Decided to grab a very late dinner here. Really nice vibes and an amazing wait staff. The beet salad and beef tenderloin was delicious!! Thank you for such a wonderful dinner!!

Everything, from start to finish, was near-perfect; even the bread service was outstanding. Celery root tartare, short rib and tafelspitz terrine, roasted duck with oranges, lingonberry soufflé: all superlative. If there was one weak link, it was the schnitzel; very good, but ordinary compared to the fireworks of the other dishes. There were long-ish waits for the first round of drinks, and between appetizer and entree courses; but the service itself was smooth, professional and attentive. The decor is beautiful, too, but the layout of the room is such that some diners will only get a view of a blank wall. Noise level can be very loud, but if you snag a booth or corner banquette, you're buffered somewhat. All in all, a terrific meal and one which I felt justified the price tag (which, honestly, was quite reasonable given the quality -- I've paid a lot more for much less). I'm already anticipating a return visit to try the cheese soufflé and Brune Landaise chicken for two.
Delicious and elegant. Perfect spot for my one-on-one catch-up with my girl friend. Lovely martinis and oysters!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Good good, good cocktails- horrible service, expect to wait 40-50 minutes for each drink and appetizer.
Loved our valentines dinner at Casino. Started with the crudo and bread which were both great. Great cocktails as well but don't skip out on the wine list.

NYE Dinner review: formerly known as Mission Chinese now is a new establishment called Casino, the interior and ambiance is perfect for date night or just dinner with friends. They have front bar room and dining room in the back. I booked a last minute reservation for NEY and they were able to accommodate. Their staffs were friendly, start off with their appetizer crudo and fries, then we also hard 3 meals to split between, the clams pasta and the seafood lobster dish was my favorite, however the duck was overcooked but the flavor was good. Overall, I would still recommend this place.

The food was okay! Our server was very nice and service and food were relatively fast. On many of the dishes the sauces were a 4/5 but for instance the duck pate i had on the TOURNEDOS ROSSINI (2/5) wasn't the best i've had. My husband had the pasta with clam (3/5) and it was meh also. The NDUJA BREAD is a must! The ambiance was perfect for date night tho! Bottom line would I come again? Probably not, but it was a nice ambiance

I made a reservation here for dinner with friends who were in town. I wanted us to have dinner somewhere where the food was good and the atmosphere was fun and Casino hit the mark on both points. The food was high quality and the menu was a little different than what I've come to expect at NYC Italian restaurants. The service was incredible. Very attentive and friendly. It all felt like a modern take on old school New York. Can't wait to return!
Love the ambience here. The waitstaff was so accommodating and friendly. Love the cheese appetizer and Butter lettuce salad!
Food was great;,every dish was perfectly executed. Service was professional though a bit rushed.  Quentin was the bestest

The host is terrible, classist and mean. Will only let you in if he thinks you're "worth it" meaning chic and rich looking. He refused to take names down on list but immediately did for others. The food is mediocre at best. Don't waste your time and money here.

Absolutely beautiful room; so tastefully done. Great execution on the food and the inclusion of some large format options is awesome for group dinners. There is this caramel custard dessert with orange peel I keep thinking about. I went back just for that after a dinner nearby one night actually.
No comment

Horrible costumer service and food! All of our dishes were super spicy to the point that they were barely edible... Then the server demanded that we give him a 20% tip. We explained that we were not happy with the food and service. When we checked our credit card statements the following day, we realized that the staff had tampered with our tip and charged us more money. When we reached out to confront them about it, instead of apologizing for their behavior they claimed that they did a mistake when entering the tip amount in their system (Mistake on both credit cards?? SKETCHY.....) Also they kept repeating that all customers leave for them a "20% tip"... Since when is tip mandatory for crappy food and service?? Do yourself a favor and avoid this place....
Super delicious.  I like the garlic beef with rice and a fried egg.
No comment

I've been to lots of Esan/ Lao/ Thai restaurant and let me tell you. This place did not disappoint. Every dish was a HIT. The flavors are very authentic. Definitely get their larb, fried chicken and papaya salad. My thai/ Laotian fiancé lovessss this place. Will be coming by very often!
No comment

A little off the beaten path deep into red Hook but worth a trip if you are a fan of authentic boldly flavored Thai food.The grilled coconut rice papaya salad and all the dishes were fantastic. Definitely get the lemongrass drink, sublime and very refreshing.

If you come here for lunch on the weekday, get the fried chicken lunch special. Their fried chicken is one of the best I've had in the city (well seasoned, crispy, juicy) and the papaya salad is fresh and packed with heat and flavor.
No comment
Food was absolutely delicious. We walked in and grabbed a table relatively quickly. Great service too!
No comment

Four stars just for the peace I felt walking into this place on a weekday afternoon, I was seated right away as there wasn't a lot of people inside the restaurant. It was a sunny day and I chose to sit in the backyard alone. Water and the menu was bought to the table immediately and the specials were explained . I ordered the lunch special and it was amazing, full of spice and flavor. I loved the additional of peanuts to the di

Very friendly servers in back patio surprisingly comfortable a lot of seating area with umbrellas . I guess it was lunch time so it took sometime to get food.Lunch special good prices but my beef was to chewy. Hopefully comeback and get some more food to try.
Most authentic tasting Thai I've had since being in the states! Lived in Thailand for years, Samut Sakhon to be exact. So happy we found this place, will definitely be coming back.
Very good food!!! Service was great as well!!! A lot of distinct flavors that I'm not used to but definitely enjoyed! 10/10 experience. Food was very fresh as well

Food was great, especially Tum Yang Kung was very different from what I'de been eating, in a good way. This place is worth the hype. However, probably it didn't look like a dine-in place - the dining room was so cold that food got cold very very fast...
No comment

I love the food and the service at Somtum Der! I go here weekly and always dine-in because it's so cozy and warm. My favorites are the papaya salad (Tum Thai) and the catfish soup (Tom Klong Pla Dook Yang). I always get sticky rice to. The warm coconut taro desert is yummy.
No comment
Excellent traditional dishes not watered down to American western tastes. The food is well portioned and delicious.
The taste of the food is very good.  But I think the amount of food is a bit less for the standard price of Thai food.
No comment
No comment

Awesome spot with equally delicious food. This is a spot to go when you are not going for the usual phad Thai but something unique and spicy and memorable. The outdoor seating under the canopy of ref umbrellas is a must. The seats are a bit basic but you're here for the food and it does not disappoint. Servers are prompt and food comes quickly . We chose mild spice with added chili oil on the side snd the spice was perfect, not incendiary but very flavorful . We had a side of noodles which helps to reduce the spice and if you are timid to Thai spicing, I'd suggest that. We had two salads, which come to share, crispy fish over fried rice, and chopped mushrooms and mint, which comes quite hot and then another of the chopped delicious salads, your sever can help guide you. We do not eat pork and it was a breeze navigating the menu which actually was fish and pork forward.  They also have a great drink menu, which is a great way to start. Make this a destination for a meal you will never forget.
I've had plenty of Spicy Pad Thai with Shrimp and Papaya Salad but Somtum Der does it the best. Ingredients always fresh and flavor consistently yummy since they've opened.

Such good Thai food. Be warned that everything is very spicy in the best way. The papaya salads are all delicious and super funky. And the prices are really reasonable for the quality and inventiveness. We order takeout regularly and the quality is incredibly consistent.

Went here on a rainy evening with a friend. We skipped lunch so we were on the hungrier side. We ordered quiet a few things to share: papaya salad, Thai prawn sashimi, catfish soup, pad kee mao (asked for a veggie option), sticky rice and rosella beverages. Everything was delicious! Keep in mind the food is spicy and even mild is pretty spicy so if you don't want to have your mouth on fire the mild is more that enough. I loved the fish soup! Raw shrimp is so good with the sauce and papaya salad is perfectly seasoned. The only thing for me, the noodles were a bit salty but were still tasty.
Awesome food. Like, very special and delicious and better here than any other Isaan resto outside of Queens - and possibly overall. Wonderful outdoor heated seating and kind amazing staff.
No comment
Damn! Some of the best Thai food I've had in New York. The pad thai in particular was delicious. I wish there veggie options had more vegetables, but this is my new go to spot.
No comment

I wanted to like this place, but it ended up being a disappointing experience, overall. We had a larger party and sat on the outdoor patio in the back. The aesthetic was super cute and fun, with beautiful stringed lights and nice patio furniture. We started off, or tried to, with an appetizer of the Crab Fried Rice. It didn't end up coming out until all of the other food did, but it was really good. Everyone enjoyed the fresh crab meat on top, and overall, I wish I had gotten just that as my meal. For the meal itself, myself and several others got the Spicy Pad Thai with Shrimp. Our main compliant here is that the wait staff said they couldn't tone down the spice level whatsoever for some of our friends with more sensitive palates. Additionally, our meals all came out at separate times, which was not great since the meals were all hot, so we couldn't end up eating together as a group. This restaurant is also decently new and don't have their liquor license yet, so it was BYOB, but this wasn't advertised until we sat down. Thankfully we did have some wine from a local winery, and the restaurant provided a wine opener and glasses. Also important to note, the service was very slow. We felt bad as there was only 1 server for all of the outdoor tables, but this led to an overall not great dining experience. I wouldn't return in person, but would consider getting the Crab Fried Rice for take out again.
Fried chicken was very good and spicy sauce was the prefect match with it.  Pad Thai was a bit too sticky and dry.  Thai tea was great.  Recommend lunch special.

So good!  Wowzers.  Very impressed.  Real Thai food, taking me back to when I used to travel to Thailand.  It's hard to match the authentic local flavors and aromas of Southeast Asia but these guys come close.  Excellent preparation of food, nicely packed for delivery, accommodated my special requests too.  And they have some rare/exotic items on the menu.  Five stars.
The food here is so good. Everything my wife and I tried was fresh, delicious, and spicy! We will definitely be back. I also loved the design of the restaurant. And the staff was helpful and nice.
No comment
Super super good spot- total random walk in off the street- catfish lamb was perfectly lite and flakey and oh so Larby!!!!
Fantastic food. Spicy, fresh, totally delicious. Staff are very friendly and service is efficient. Great garden with big umbrellas for rain: ideal for social distancing.

Excellent authentic new Thai restaurant that recently opened up in Red Hook. Cozy intimate atmosphere. Great staff - all very friendly and attentive. Cute decor, especially in their bathroom. The food is seriously amazing. They don't have their liquor license yet. My husband went right across the street into Wet Whistle Wines and got a great bottle that complimented our dish well. The dishes that we had were flavorful and had just the right amount of spice. The Khao Pad Goong (fried rice with prawns and eggs) was very good. Kuay Tieo Pad See Eiw Nue (flat noodles with beef) was excellent. The beef was so juicy and flavored well. This was my favorite dish of the night. Pad Thai Mun Poo (Pad Thai with crab meat) was good and very spicy. We ended our meal with the Thai Panna Cotta. It was good and reminded me of Thai Bubble tea. I love this place and highly recommend it. We will definitely return.

First time visiting here and it was amazing! The place is kinda small but very cozy. Service was very attentive, friendly and patience. Pricing and portions are reasonable. The flavors we're spot on! Everything was seasoned and cooked perfectly. I will definitely be back again.

I really like this place because they are so nice. I've been a few times and even sat out back with the heaters, which was really cute. This Thai food has a flavor I've never had before, I believe it's because they are from a different region. I really enjoyed the fried chicken thigh, the rice and noodles.

Love this place! This is our favorite Thai place in Brooklyn, and we order often. We also went to the store once, and we were seated in their really nice back patio. Waiters wore masks and were very friendly.
We're obsessed! After the first time we ate here we came back the next day. Now we're there constantly. The food is just SO good. I dream about the grilled sticky rice. Can't wait to go back!
Nice little pub and decent bar food. Service was good and atmosphere was nice. Would return to while away some time.
No comment
always filled with screaming drunks at night.  a nuisance in the neighborhood.  rats spotted under outdoor seating.

Bar is n Greenpoin. Can I say worst place for food in the neighborhood maybe just for drinks nothing else. Very very dry calamari , coating is hard and no flavor. Chicken sandwich worst that I tried so dry and chicken so over cooked that's actually it's not eatable. Beer was way to warm. How about service 0stars and wait time " forever"
No comment
A solid go-to spot in the neighborhood. Everything I've tried here has been very tasty and the kitchen is open late!
No comment
Drinks were so yummy! Our server was amazing. Very attentive and kind. Thank you Grace!
I love this place! Great decor, music, vibes and service

A friend and i couldn't find a place to eat after 4 of July fireworks and this spot was open. The popcorn chicken is so good. Fries are always fresh and crispy. I've been back twice since then and do not live in New York. Recommend for a quick bar bite snack.
Had a delicious low carb burger here. Seats are comfy, ambience is cozy, and service is swift. I will return soon!
No comment
It's a nice little bar with decent bar food and ambiance. I don't really like most bars because I don't know. This one's pleasant.
Stopped in for the first time and loved everything. The food and cocktails were amazing and the service was excellent. Very cute atmosphere and great music. Will definitely be back.

We stopped by after a condo showing. Staff was friendly and the vibe was awesome for a late lunch. We ordered the wedge salad add grilled chicken and an impossible burger. The wedge salad was hands down the best wedge salad I've had in years. I would eat it 4 times a week. Recently closed on a condo in the area and our goal is to be a regular here lol
No comment
Got the Buffalo cauliflower, was pretty good, spicyness level was on point. Service was pretty slow even with anyone barely though.

Cozy neighborhood spot to have a good catch-up with friends without feeling rushed or drowned out by noise. Had brunch here yesterday. It quickly filled up over the course of the two hours we were there. I had the soft scrambled eggs and sausage sandwich and hash browns. The eggs were perfectly cooked and delicious. I didn't care for the brioche bun (too big and fluffy) but the insides were great. Enjoyed the side salad and the hash browns were just as I remembered as a kid. I'd definitely go again. The atmosphere was really comfortable.

My friends and I wandered in here after a night of drinking. The place was really low lit and quiet and I loved the atmosphere. I had a great sandwich and a very good beer. It was the perfect place for a nightcap!
I only tried the Chicken Caesar Salad, it was delicious. The waitress was super sweet to me. They have outside and inside seating. I look forward to going again.
No comment

I stop by after finding this place on Yelp, during COVID-19 for take-out. Had sandwiches, wings, and frozen drinks to go. The wait for the food didn't take more than 15-20minutes or less. The food was filling and I honestly couldn't finish it all. The Frosé I had was really good, I'd definitely come back for more!

Just moved to greenpoint and already have been to elder green at least once a week!  The goat cheese flat bread is my favorite with the buffalo cauliflower a strong second.  The spicy marg or "get in the ring" really good also! Strong and tasty!

I ordered a wedge "salad" and they brought me half a lettuce (literally the whole thing without cutting it or anything) with blue cheese dressing on top of it. They call that a salad! And the worst part is that they did not clean it properly! I got a very bad food poisoning because of it. Not recommended at all.
Been here twice and both times it was an amazing experience, second time I got proposed to here! Staff is always super sweet

2 stars for night service, and 5 stars for day service, thanks Brian.  We love coming here.  Their blackened chicken sandwich is pretty good.  Not to mention their buffalo cauliflower, yum.  We normally go in the day time.  We sit at the bar, and Brian takes care of us.  Do we need this, or do we need that.  I don't know, like it's suppose to be?????   At night, well, I guess since it's dark customers don't need service.  If your in the food industry, YOU HAVE TO SERVE PEOPLE.  A tip about the device that takes your orders.  I asked for the check, the waitress showed me the device and said $64.  I looked at her, and she said I will get the check, LIKE I ASKED FOR.  Well, the check was $58.91?????  WTF????  How do you show us one price and then give us another, what is this the democratic party?????  Can't wait to for our next visit...

Very cute spot! Sunny and gorgeous outdoor seating, you can bring your dog! We sat indoors in a cute corner booth. The music was good throw backs and they have a long cocktail/beer list. Also would recommend the Buffalo cauliflower

Great music inside. Good tater totes, nice sour dough but there is where it ends.  Cheese sandwich with little cheese. Wedge salad weak. Cocktail watered down. Expected more for sure but will explains other places.  Also please note the service is very good.
No comment

Really enjoyed this place... good music, bartenders, and vibes. Food smells and looks appealing so I will be back to try food. However they have a happy hour menu, which includes apps. Nicely lit decor as well. Would def recommend to locals and whoever's in the neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

Good, but average sandwich (turkey). Waitress generously allowed us to upgrade from chips to fries (which were a teeny bit undercooked) for the same $. Prices are extremely affordable for the neighborhood. Nice people watching!
No comment

I'm sad to give bad review in these times, but... going out is a gift I give myself not often lately, and this was an expensive and disappointing dinner (included drinks). Negroni is one of the easiest drinks to make, either they didn't do the right measures of the three different alcoholic parts or they have very cheap liquor. The burger had a very sad frozen patty, the flatbrad was ugly, covered in maple syrup. Good fries. Too expensive for cheap bar quality food.

We walked in and every single person seated and standing, stared the soul out of every single one of my party and myself, and yet nobody, not even the bartender working not even 10 feet away from me, tended to us or greeted us at all for that matter and just continued to stare at us even while we were walking around looking  for a waiter or hostess to let us know whether or not we could be seated or not. and while were outside looking for a different place to go instead  after being ignored for 10 solid minutes, another party walks past me into this restaurant and is greeted almost  instantly that they walk in. racism at its finest in "beautiful" gentrified brooklyn.

Cool new bar in Brooklyn with great frozen margs and happy hour specials. The outdoor seating was nice to enjoy on this hot day with our frozen drinks as well. It was quite busy on this Thursday evening, and there was only one bartender but she did well at accommodating us.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Good cocktails and nice atmosphere. Server was inattentive and unfriendly, seriously never smiled and seemed annoyed from the get go. She forgot the coffee, didn't bring water, and gave a horrible recommendation for the sourdough and eggs that was barely a meal for 6'5" man.

The cocktails and food are excellent SO GOOD but honestly the staff makes it - they could not be kinder or more welcoming. pass on every other Greenpoint hot spot, this one is worth it, great for groups, you will not regret.

Hands down the best spot in Greenpoint for cocktails and/or food. I was bummed when Mrs Kim's closed down but I'm so happy that EG took its place. The staff is super dope, friendly and down to earth. Strong drinks, great food and just a really great vibe all around. Highly recommended!

This place is really cute, well decorated and lit, has plenty of seating, and has vegan options. The bartenders and waiters are very friendly and hardworking. Unfortunately, the servers were extremely busy and forgot items we had ordered twice (a drink and a side). They were also out of the Impossible burger, so I ordered their other vegan item which was the bowl with chickpeas and quinoa. Man! There was no sauce, seasoning, or flavoring to be found. I ordered hummus to put on top to give it some flavor but it was equally as flavorless. I finally asked for salt and pepper which ended up helping out. Please season your food! Just because I'm vegan doesn't mean I don't have tastebuds. My girlfriend ordered a sandwich and said it was just ok.
No comment
Good bar - 30+ crowd. Great cocktails and good music, plus a very friendly bartender. Haven't tried the food but it was the perfect level of busy on a Saturday at midnight
The kitchen is open late and the food is good considering the hour. The bar tender  tender super super nice. Good classic music. Relax vibe. And it is one block away from my apt ;)
No comment
Been here a few times. The Buffalo cauliflower bites and the veggie burger are both excellent. Service has been really friendly on both visits.
Great bar, broccoli i is AMAZING. Super friendly bartenders and their kitchen hours are amazing! Love stopping by when I'm in the neighborhood
Cute ambiance. I really liked the happy hour drinks. The buffalo cauliflower was great. It was crispy and had a nice little kick. The cast iron mac & cheese was good, but nothing special.
This place is an amazing vibe with great food and killer drinks. Also great date spot
So great to find a bar that serves food so late in greenpoint!! Bartender on a Wednesday is super handsome, and makes a delicious 'You ain't the first' cocktail.
No comment
Didn't try the drinks so the one star is for the 45 mins wait for an extremely average avocado toast and extremely average breakfast burger. I've never waited for this long for an avocado toast.
First visit stumbled upon this place..very good service, attention upon entry to business..acknowledged immediately...

Drinks yes, food no. You can sit outside with your pup which is terrific. We ordered a cheeseburger and fries, caesar salad and nachos. The burger was small and the fries were undercooked, tasted slightly like freezer burned. The nacho toppings were very underwhelming. The salad was good but small. I wouldn't eat here again based on this experience. Too many other places around where the food is the same price but really good. Service is friendly but slow.

Had a blackened chicken sandwich with a refreshing side of brocollini which was delicious.  If you're not in the mood for dinner at least order the tater tots to snack on while you put back Bells Two Hearted IPA on draft (among other solid craft staples)

Great new bar! Thoughtfully and tastefully designed, it feels like it has been in the neighborhood for years. Simon (owner) is really friendly and clearly very passionate about the business that he has built. At the time of writing, the bar was newly opened so the kitchen is available yet, but if the same attention to detail is applied to that then it will be fantastic. In the meantime, it's a great spot for a few drinks.

This is a lovely new place in the neighborhood. I recently came here for the first time with a friend for happy hour and loved it. The food was excellent and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. It was nice to be able to sit and chat over drinks and snacks for a few hours without feeling rushed out or abandoned by the staff at the same time. It's a perfect place to have a relaxing drink and a bite to eat. Please post a menu online! I was able to find a photo of the menu on Foursquare, but it would be much easier to persuade friends to meet me here if they could see a menu first. :)

I love this bar it has this interesting cabana/brooklyn vibe and the drinks are great! It reminds me of a place in a movie. The service is always on point and Helena was a dream. Also the manager Sara Louise was so helpful with some questions I had. Would go back in an instant, soon to be a greenpoint institution!

OMG I hope this place lasts forever. (This location has seen a lot of restaurants and bars in the last decade. I'm happy to see Mrs.Kim's is finally gone.) I love this place! Love the seating at the bar. So much fun! The happy hour is good. The cocktails are yummy. The bartender was also really nice. We had the fried and they were delicious. I recommend this place!
Great service Sunny corner.  Good selection of beers very good bartender.  Did not try food.  Will be back ...often!!

Just got up and walked out after the server repeatedly ignored me and my friends. We were happy to spend some time and money but clearly she was having none of that. She managed to ask if we had a tab at the bar and that was her only question despite our requests for menus and water. Thanks for the attitude. Sorry you have to work on a holiday. We would have been happy to tip well for reasonable service.
No comment
Great food and happy hour options! The Night-train is a must try cocktail. Staff is super friendly, this bar is a great addition to the neighborhood!
$14 for a totally average burger that's almost the size of a slider. Lettuce and tomato are a dollar extra LOL. When it comes to food options GP is super saturated with this bull.

Solid food and good service, the atmosphere is quite nice and relaxed some outdoor seating on the street is nice too.  The beer menu was a bit the poor side so I would suggest eating here then going somewhere else for a drink.

First of all: WOW! We ordered such a delectable assortment of foods-- both fresh and fried. Wonderful employee Kaye really set us straight when we looked into our menus, spellbound by the many alluring options. The Bloody Mary was absolutely to die for. The grilled cheese had me on cloud nine. Tabasco was 10/10. We will be back, Elder Greene! Thanks Kay!

My girlfriends and I love coming here for brunch! They have a fairly good mimosa and I really enjoyed their grain bowl . My boyfriend has had their chicken sandwich before and he loved it. It's a cute place and I recommend it for a chill brunch or even for a chill evening with your friends.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great happy hour selection. Ordered a Dan Dan noodle and beef dry hot pot. Decor is nice and love the bar. The Dan Dan noodle was not bad but definitely not the best I've had. It was relatively small for an appetizer. The dry hot pot has a lot of different ingredients but way too much msg and spicy. We had two bowls of rice to pair with the hot pot or else it would have been hard to eat.

High end Szechuan restaurant haha. We came with a party of 5 for dinner. I loved every dish. The Stewed Fish Fillet in Hot Chili Soup amazing. The fish was tender and flavor so well. Mapo tofu and shredded beef with pepper both had a kick and went well with rice. The pea shot was refreshing. The xiao long boa came in only 4. Wish there was more but quality over quantity. Service was good. The bus boy introduced every dish when placing them on our table. Our server was always around and kept refilling our water even after we were done. I would definitely come back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was good BUT DO NOT ORDER A DRINK WITH A MIXER. We paid $12 for what he thought was a gin and tonic. The charge came to $16; $12 for the gin and $4 for the tonic. Has anyone ever heard of that. And after complaining the restaurant did nothing at all. Never again; too many other places to eat.
No comment
No comment

Had the worst won ton soup of my life yesterday: mushy noodles, skimpy, mushy tasteless filling & watery, flavorless broth, 1/2 a pea green leaf.  I ordered take-out and the bag was stapled shut so I didn't see the size.  The price was $12 and I expected it to be a quart size container for that price.  It was a small container.  What a rip off!!  The staff had zero personality, and no initiative or authority to right a wrong.  I will never go back even though some of the other dishes looked good & bountiful.
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: shan is a place. to some, it's a trendy sichuan restaurant between boerum hill and cobble hill, tucked away from the craziness of downtown brooklyn but still right in the middle of the action. but to me, shan is a refuge tucked away in the fog surrounding mount éméi shan near where i was born. a gong rings faintly in the background, as a door opens, and a warm smile of spices incites me inside

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Overall, it's a cute restaurant. Waiters are friendly and helpful!  We also ordered a duck dish, but I forgot to take a picture of it.. drypot is very tasty wish it has a bigger portion.
No comment
delicious, great attentive service, ambiance and good music too. it's on the quieter side and surprised it wasn't crowded bc the food was amazing!

Had been wanting to try this out- I live a good sit-down Chinese restaurant! went on a whim one evening, solo, mainly because I was at the light, hungry, and there was an open parking spot right there. So I went. I didn't really like the selections that much. Plus, I typically like some heat in my food, but my dish was so spicy that it was unenjoyable. Wonton soup was pretty good. Check. Won't go back

So thankful to have a super yummy Szechuan restaurant without having to go to Chinatown or Flushing. We got the scallion pancakes (recommend - so crispy!!!), the dry pot cauliflower, the spicy braised whole fish, and the drunken duck. The food was a bit salty though so be warned. You can ask for less salt but it was still pretty salty. Next time I'll ask for less less salt :)
One of the few Chinese restaurants I've been to around this part of Brooklyn that feels authentic and not undeservedly overpriced. Portion sizes are decent and the atmosphere is warm and relaxed.

Solid Sichuan spot in the neighborhood - and there aren't many! Their dan dan noodles are delicious, hot and sour soup is on point and their dry pot and hot sauce/chili oil fish are my go-tos! Definitely worth checking out if you're in the neighborhood! I've only ever gotten delivery so can't speak for the atmosphere :) but seems great!

i have now done delivery and ate at the restaurant the chinese is really good and a great addition to our neighborhood because this is something we were most definitely lacking. Would recommend. Dumplings are great:)

Attentive service, complex flavors with lots of heat and BYOB! Great new Szechuan place that opened up on Smith Street. I've been here multiple times and have enjoyed everything I've had. The steamed fish, mung bean noodles, fried tofu, pork belly as well as the pea shoots were tasty and fresh. I look forward to returning and trying more of your other entrees!
No comment
No comment

Delicious food, great service, and nice vibes! I recommend the cold mung bean noodles, the duck fried rice, and the double cooked pork. They don't hold back on the spice so it's packed with flavor (but nothing that even me with my low spice tolerance couldn't handle). Granted, I didn't get any of the classic spicy szechuan dishes because I was scared, but I'm sure they'd be equally delicious. Service was great, they constantly refilled the water in my glass so I never had to think about (which is important when the place is known for spicy food!!) Will definitely go back if I'm in the area again.
Delicious, delicious, delicious! Great dishes with incredible flavor, creative cocktails and excellent service. Great addition to the neighborhood!

Everything I tried here was excellent. I would say that this restaurant has the best mapo tofu in NYC. I wouldn't miss the eggplant or any of their dumplings. I would just keep going back and ordering different rotations of things on this perfect menu. Use my pics as reference. Head chef knows what he is doing. Make this family-owned joint go viral! It's so good!
No comment
No comment

Fantastic dining experience at this new Sichuan restaurant on Smith Street! Happy to have them in the neighborhood. Really delicious Soup Dumplings. My favorite dish was the Beef Dry Pot, it tasted incredibly fresh. Don't forget to order dessert, the Matcha Green Tea Ice Cream is perfect after a spicy entree. Wonderful service!

We've only eaten here once but I was very pleased and will come back again. The food was very good, and the scallion pancakes may be the best I've ever had. I was a tiny bit disappointed in the soup dumplings because they all stuck to the steamer basket and broke, but the filling was delicious. We also got dumplings in chili oil- yummy; eggplant in a sort of sweet and sour sauce; and dry cooked prawns with ground pork- loved the pork with the hot peppers but I thought the prawns were just okay. It's a small place and tables are close together, so it was fun seeing what other people had and making notes for future orders. The night we went, they were slammed and orders came out haphazardly, but I won't hold that against them because there were only 2 servers. Hopefully that will change in the future.
No comment
The food is authentic  and delicious! I'm so glad there's another Sichuan restaurant in the neighborhood
No comment
Great food and service though slightly pricey. Will come again to try other things on the menu as well
Excellent addition to the hood. No longer need to drive to Sunset Park for authentic Szechuan fare.  Everything was great with welcoming service. BYOB. Will happily return.
This place is so underrated! Three Pepper Fried Tofu was the showstopper. Great cocktails too!
We got the Spicy braised whole fish which was really fresh. Also recommend the scallion pancakes - super crispy and light

Nice new place in the neighborhood. I've been twice and will be coming back. The service was excellent, and everything was prepared very quickly. Food was high quality and delicious, and we liked every single dish that we tried. The spice level is just right and they are flexible with accommodating with requests.
Excellent. The beef noodle soup, fried duck, and mapp tofu are all terrific. Amazing addition to a neighborhood I never thought would have legit Chinese food!
No comment
Great Szechuan food in Carroll Gardens.  It's nice to have a legitimate Schezuan restaurant in this part of Brooklyn, rather than to have to travel to Queens.  Definitely recommend.

Fantastic addition to the neighborhood! They do Schezuan cuisine right and the service was impeccable. We got the pork dumplings in chili oil, the chungking spicy chicken, and the chicken wing dry pot. The first two items were perfect and the dry pot had a nice Sichuan peppercorn flavor. I'd definitely recommend stopping by.

We were looking for some delicious lunch and based on the reviews came here. It did not disappoint. We had the lunch special King Pao Chicken and shredded beef with hot peppers, everything was fantastic. Service was great and drink specials were great too! Will definitely be coming back again, highly recommended
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small bagel and coffee spot near NYU with an extensive bagel/sandwich menu. I got an everything bagel with egg, salmon, avocado and onion and it was pretty good overall. The bagel was chewy and soft and there was a generous amount of toppings inside. There was a line when we went but the service was fast and efficient. Even though it was expensive (13 for my bagel) I would return and try other menu options.
NYC bagels  YUMMMMY  I love this place. Better than Timothee Chalamet's Tompkins Square.
No comment
No comment

Amongst New York bagel chains, Brooklyn Bagel Co is my favorite! Their bagels are huge, chewy, and freshly baked. I love their everything bagel sandwich with sausage, egg, and pepper jack cheese. This visit my friend opted for the everything bagel with tuna salad, and said it was fresh and delicious (no one wants an old deli counter tuna salad...) I usually get my bagels to-go, as there is limited seating (~6 two-person tables). The line can be out the door during weekend brunch time, but it moves quickly and service is fast and efficient.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Brooklyn Bagel lived up to they hype!! I ordered the Villager because I couldn't decide between an egg and cheese or a lox bagel so this was the best of both worlds (plus it comes with avocado!) There was definitely quite a line so on the future would probably order online for pickup as many people seemed to be doing that. After missing out on NYC bagels for a while this hit the spot.

Very good place with excellent bagels full of flavor and at a good price. The place is a little small but has some seating and the service was very fast and friendly. This was my favorite bagel that I've ever had!
No comment
No comment
I wanted a delicious NY bagel, and I got a delicious NY bagel. It was a busy weekend, but the line was fast and the service was efficient! Highly recommend!
No comment
Best bagels in NYC! Perfect amount of everything bagel seasoning and they're never burnt. The egg & cheese sandwiches are always perfect with just the right amount of egg and cheese.
No comment
I love the bagels here come here often to grab and bite with my kids and it's a good place for them p study and I read.

Very solid bagel sandwich. They have multiple types of vegan cream cheeses (tofu based - plain, scallion, veggie, and strawberry) and very fluffy bagels. I've heard good things about this place for a long and I'm glad I finally made it. The service was pretty quick despite it being a crowded Saturday morning, and they were very efficient about the ordering and payment process.
No comment
Great Bagels!  Soft, best that I have ever had. They are busy but keep things moving.

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: No comment

Pretty good gluten free breakfast sandwich! The gluten free bagel itself wasn't anything special so I wouldn't get it with just cream cheese but as a sandwich it was a pretty good substitute to the regular bagel. The regular bagels all looked amazing. Went at 1pm on a Sunday and it was super busy, probably waited 15-20 min for the bagel but I didn't have anywhere to be so it was worth it!
No comment

Delicious, huge bagels. I had the sesame toasted with cream cheese, with a large fresh squeezed OJ. Kept me going the whole day till dinner. Service was quick and efficient. Some seating area but lots of people working on laptops, reading the paper, etc, so I just went across the street and ate at the steps.

Great and east local place for fresh bagels and more. Service from the staff was great for a first timer.  We had no idea there was a bagel line and drink coffee/drink line.  All good and helped along the way to a delicious Bagel, OJ and Coffee Breakfast.  A local bagel shop with a local NYC ambiance to go.
No comment
The most delicious breakfast bagel I've ever had. My friend and I both had a bagel and some coffee. The staff was very sweet and gave excellent service.
No comment

Delicious bagel spot. My partner and I visited on a Sunday morning and shared two everything bagels -- one with cream cheese and one sausage egg and cheese. Both were amazing and IMO reasonably priced given their size...I believe it was about $12 for both. I was full for hours afterwards. It was easy to find seating to enjoy our bagels as well. Definitely recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: No comment
No comment

column3: Traffic Circle Area, Long Beach, CA
column6: I used to come here everyday until today. I found something that looked like fish in my bagel(i'm vegan). I politely asked the guy to remake my bagel with vegan cream cheese and he full on yelled at me and said: "it's a carrot" to the point where people in the store looked. I'm really frustrated because i'm a regular, but i can't deal with being yelled at, especially when i asked respectfully for them to remake the bagel.

I had the sesame bagel, regular sized with the jalapeño asiago cream cheese spread and it was simply melting in my mouth! The bread was baked perfectly and the flavour in the spread was also spot on! Will definitely recommend to vegans as most of their bagels are eggless :)

Local resident here. We only hit this place up as a last resort, it's a tourist / NYU student trap that's overhyped. Long waits for weak shmears and the bagels are okay but too large and don't have enough exterior crunch (when untoasted). Locals tend towards Bagel Bob's or Thompkins Square if it's not a zoo. Not trying to throw too much shade, I think they know what they are and they have a place in the market, but if you want a true NYC bagel for locals, try elsewhere.
No comment
One of the best bagels I've had in NYC... got the "classic" (toasted everything with lox and all the fixings... capers, tomatoes, onion, cream cheese).
Great bagels and very fast service. Went here every morning while here on our trip. Highly recommend for a quick breakfast. Very tasty!

We usually hit up R&D whenever we get into NYC, but they were closed today, so Brooklyn Bagel it was. Honestly, it didn't disappoint. I actually think their bagel is superior to R&D, as it has a better chew. Obviously, the smoked salmon and schmear do not compare, but for about $10-12, you get a pretty tasty bagel sandwich. Would come back for sure.

Solid bagel place in the East Village, usually pretty crowded during mornings and middle of the day. The first time I went, I ordered their signature lox bagel sandwich which, to my dismay, turned out to be $16+ with all the added extras. Undoubtedly a good sandwich, but not filling enough or good enough for me to be spending that much money. Not gonna lie, I vowed to never go back but of course I did, and I'm now realizing the prices aren't actually bad at all for an NY bagel spot. Overall, solid place to get a quick bagel fix, but just be prepared that if you get any toppings they will quickly add up on the receipt :P
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I've been searching for the best bagel in the area & here it is. The prices are a little high but the bagels are huge and my sandwich is perfect every time. Their coffee is also super good!

I think this is the best bagel I have had in nyc. Warning it is chaotic inside and very crowded on a Sunday morning. I had an everything bagel with scallion cream cheese, egg and bacon such a good combo!! Bagel was perfect
Great value. Bagels are big and tasty.  Crisp exterior and soft inside.  Tad sweet but all in all a solid bagel that I would buy more of.

The bagels are amazing!! If you get a bagel with cream they shove soooo much cream in between those buns. Never seen so much shoved into a bagel before. I bet you could guess how it tastes too? Yep, that's right it's shoved with sooooo much flavor
Truly some of the best bagels in the city. Always fresh and always delicious. The prices aren't bad either!
No comment
Great spot for quick breakfast! All kinds of bagels, wrap, bakery items with eggs and meats. Good portion for the price!

Like I said in my other review (for the Chelsea location), this is my favorite NY bagel place. I got a blueberry bagel with blueberry cream cheese, and it was absolutely amazing. The blueberry cream cheese was light and fluffy and tasted like cheesecake batter, and it matched perfectly with the bagel.
Amazing sesame bagel with jalapeño cream cheese. It was pretty crowded but I got my toasted bagel quickly. They had some interesting cream cheese, will surely go back for more!

Worst bagel spot in Lower Manhattan. Their bagels are terrible, they're ridiculously overpriced for their university location as if these students are making millions already and on top of that the service is abhorring. Cashiers are literally trying to scam you for an extra $0.50 or a $1, $2... They're charging however they feel like thar morning I literally got 3 different prices for the same sandwich I order EVERY day. It's actually so bad that my hands are shaking from frustration while I'm writing this out... Do not visit - my sincerest recommendation, I'd give them less than 1 star if I could.
No comment
Huge and delicious bagels! Highly recommend for an authentic bagel while in NYC. I only wish I would've snapped a photo.
amazing bagels, classic NYC option. Order ahead because it's super busy. The sandwiches are smaller but the bagel itself is ridiculously good

Okay so the sandwich I ordered ended up being WAY bigger than I was expecting. Got the lox sandwich with scallion cream cheese on an everything bagel, which made for a super delicious and filling breakfast. Bagels are soft and chewy, which is how I like them. I docked a star because the latte I ordered tasted kind of watery and they forgot to put avocado on my sandwich D: (didn't realize until much later when I sat down to eat, so I wasn't able to ask them to fix it).
No comment
I love these classic big chewy New York bagels. They have toppings on both the top and bottom and they put the perfect amount of cream cheese on. Go get one, they're cheap and delicious.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: Love this place! I find their bagels to be the best in the neighborhood and I use them as a benchmark for rating other bagel establishments. The bagels are delicious all the toppings are fresh and tasty and the staff is friendly and efficient.
Beautiful amazing bagel. Perfect bacon egg and cheese. Cooked to perfection, runny yoke, fresh ingredients, %100 returning
No comment
No comment
Great breakfast wrap. Tried the Third Rail is was tasty and not heavy. Perfect combo of flavors and textures. Bagels are delicious and schmears are eclectic.
No comment
No comment

The bagel is bomb. The cream cheese is pretty good too. The bagel is not for the faint heart, Its massive..I came here after a hard workout and was ravenous, but couldn't finish the bagel. The cold brew with oat was everything that I needed on a hot summer afternoon.

$15 for a lox bagel but super worth it! The lox was incredibly fresh and my sesame bagel was toasted to perfection. We came here on a Saturday morning and as expected, it was quite crowded. There is plenty of seating inside but if you come here during the weekend during rush hour you may not be able to grab a table. Worth mentioning their ordering system is kind of strange. You place your order right when you walk in but you don't pay where you order. Once you order, the worker gives you a slip and you have to walk down the end of the store to pay. Then after you pay, those workers who just processed your transaction will call out the number on your slip once your order is ready.

Amazing bagels, online ordering, delicious sandwiches and drinkable coffee. Was very happy with the bagels we got - the everything with a BEC was the ideal breakfast sando. Also got  "mini" cinnamon raisin which was huge lol and delicious. Hash browns aren't great they get soggy so eat them fresh.
No comment
I tried many bagel shops in the city. This is one of the best. They are also pretty quick so lines move fast. They have a restroom. Not good amount of seating though.
Fresh, delicious, and quick. Cannot think of a single reason to not give it 5 stars. Bit on the pricier end but you ultimately get what you pay for.
No comment

This bagel shop is EXCELLENT. It's the best bagel I have had in the city. I ordered a fresh squeezed Orange juice with a sesame bagel with cucumber-dill cream cheese and lox. I'm almost speechless because of how good each ingredient was. While we were there I watched them take fresh bagels out of the oven. This is a must try.

The bagels are great. The spreads are also very good. The reason for the 3 stars is that for some reason they can't seem to figure out how to toast a bagel. It either comes out warm with no crunch, or burnt with a crunch. I asked them to redo my last bagel and they said they couldnt do anything inbetween. They redid it once and it came out black. The guy said he could scrape it but those were my only options.   It makes no sense. They have an adjustable toaster.
Fantastic bagels, delicious schmears, fresh-squeezed oj, and fast delivery, make this a go-to neighborhood bagel spot.

Awesome bagels! I love getting a sesame bagel here. They are pretty big though so great for sharing. The staff are wearing masks and there are tables outside. This location is close to Washington Square Park.
Decided to stop by for breakfast. Perfect bagels. Blue berry cream cheese was awesome! Coffee was also good. My new go to place for breakfast if i am looking for Bagels
Brooklyn Bagel has the BEST bagels and egg sandwiches!!! The bagels are so soft and chewy. I could eat these bagels every day! Follow on insta @cravings.club for more food pics!
Yum! Bagels were perfectly chewy and they were not stingy at all with the schmear. There is no bathroom here for customers.
No comment

Very popular bagel spot and there was quite a crowd when we got here but the line moves quickly. The sandwiches are a bit pricey so I ordered a sesame bagel with scallion cream cheese. The bagel was very tasty, not the freshest but still had a great flavor and texture. There was a generous serving of the scallion cream cheese and it also had a nice balance of scallions. Would definitely come back.
No comment
No comment

A pretty solid bagel for me in the Queens area. The bagels themselves cooked right to where you don't need to fight to rip a piece off. Lox bagel was also pretty good, Salmon did not much of a fishy taste as it shouldn't be. Would highly highly recommend the danish! A must get! Overall pretty good place and I would come back.
No comment
No comment

This place is my go to bagel shop in NYC. I love all of the options they have. My girlfriend is gluten free so having a great spot to pick up a bagel that fits our dietary needs makes breakfast in NYC a bit easier! They also have vegan cream cheese options that taste great. Highly recommend!
No comment

The Brooklyn bagel and coffee close to NYU does not skimp. They put plenty of cream cheese, loc, and everything that you want on your bagel.  It's fresh and it's good. Don't worry if there's a line, it moves fast.
No comment

Line was super long but it was Sunday morning so it's expected. Extremely crowded. What I didn't like is that they gave me the choice to add all different types of meat. Turkey, salmon, chicken, etc. Is there any other protein I can add that's not meat? No. It's either you eat meat or nothing. As a vegetarian this was not as fun

I ordered a salt bagel and was given a sesame seed bagel and didn't realize till I opened it at home. Sesame seed bagel was terrible and cold. I would not recommend this place since they can't seem to tell the difference between sesame and salt.
Fresh hot tasty bagels and great cream cheese options. Good start to a walk around Washington Square Park.

Nothing like bagels in NY.  My husband had the pumpernickel bagel with smoked salmon with onions and I had the plain bagel with lox.  Bagels were soft and adequately toasted.  They were huge!  The lox spread were made from scratch and had salmon in it ( not sure if that is supposed to be the case but it was good).  My husband enjoyed his bagel as well.  It was a small place so we just ate our bagel on the steps of the commercial building across the street.  That added to the NYC experience.  We will definitely come back.
I don't really get the hype, the food was good but tasted like every other bagel shop I went to in Manhattan. The coffee was great!
As a small town girl in the big city ~ looking for the best bites to be had ~ this is right up there on the top of the list .. fast , friendly & efficient service !
No comment
Solid clean bagel shop.  Good selection of fresh, I store made bagels and smears.  Small area to sit.

Went here for a simple bagel & cream cheese and coffee, waited over 25 mins for my order and nothing, ask the counter girl and just told me to wait. Checked my receipt twice walked away and continued helping other customers. After 30 mins I asked for a refund and left. Will never go there again. Poor customer service. Did witness other customers complaining about their food as well.
No comment
No comment

Wow this place was crowded when I stopped by. Must be a Sunday ritual for NYU kids (that's what it looked like on the Sunday afternoon I visited). I ordered for pick up so was in and out in under a minute. Bagels are fresh! I recommend ordering pick-up for those on the go!
What you'd expect when you think of a NY bagel. I had an egg bagel was cream cheese. It was delicious, service was quick, and it was a clean spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great bagel with almost no line. Really disorganized ordering system but bagel was worth it
Don't come with kids, they do t let customer use the bathroom.  Bagels are good, too bad they can't do the basics.
No comment

Ordered an everything bagel with scallion amd bacon xream cheese, orange juice, and xhai latte ... you can order a mini bagel which is slightly smaller than the regular bagel. Scallion and bacon cream cheese is just delish, our go to . The chai latte was very light, and would be better stronger, but that's me.
The regular size Original bagel w/ lox was actually big enough to split for 2 people! We bought 2, but gave one away. 2 bagels and 2 bananas were $37. It was very good and filled us up for hours.

Oh. My. God. My nephew went to New York and asked me what I would like from there. First I said pizza and he nixed that idea so I said bagels. Then bagels it was. He brought me 4 everything bagels! They were (notice I said were, because they have now been devoured) theeee best bagels I've ever had in my life. I almost want to hop on a plane to get more- they're that good. I am now spoiled. I don't think I can ever get another bagel that good in California!
No comment

favorite bagel in the city. huge and with a big selection of cc. staff at the location are all kind and will remember you if you're a regular. nice spot to hang and work while eating but limited seating as it is often packed
No comment
No comment
No comment

Oh my god. My new go-to bagel place in New York City! This location had the most impressive selection of spreads I've ever seen! Examples include red velvet, scallion and lox, veggie, bacon sriracha! They had samples out of gingerbread bagels - to die for! I ordered the Cooper sandwich on an everything bagel. Pro tip: it does not include cream cheese so I added that on the side. The bagel was perfect! It was not dry nor hard. The sandwich had structural integrity and did not fall apart. I went around noon on a Sunday and did not have to wait. I am literally already plotting for when I can go back! Do yourself a favor and grab these five star bagels!
No comment
No comment

Brooklyn Bagel is my go to bagel place in the city! Everything is absolutely delicious! And I highly recommend their delivery as well - it always comes so fast even if it's way before the expect by date!

It was ok. Not so sure I would order again. The egg sandwich and the turkey sandwich were just ok. It wasn't bad at all but it wasn't out of the ordinary. I found the bagels also just ok. The next day, the onion bagels were actually a bit moist which was odd. The muffin was good but small. I did like the container of chicken salad. On the fence if I would order again....probably not.

Best egg bagel that I've had in the city - it is obvious that the bagels are super fresh. The cream cheese could be better - it tastes pretty typical - though I only tried the plain. I can't wait to try more of the cream cheese flavors, but the bagels themselves are incredibly soft, fresh, and delicious. Also, they were super quick despite a line! They have a great system going.

Wow I didn't want to believe the hype at first but this place really has amazing bagels. I tried a breakfast bagel with egg cheese and bacon yesterday and it was about one of the best bagel I've ever had in the city. The line was long but moved along quickly on a Saturday around lunch time. Highly recommend. I'll def be back to try other signatures bagels. They also have so many cream cheese even the sweet ones like cannoli and chocolate chips!

This is my preferred bagel location.  I don't think I've had a bad bagel sandwich here.  Anything with lox is a favorite.  There's always a line on the weekend, get the app and order ahead to save yourself some wait time.  If you eat your bagel in Washington Square Park, watch out for the pigeons, they're aggressive.

mmm this place was BUSTLIN when we went in but even still the cashier was nice enough to talk to me about how their tofu spread was the best vegan cream cheese shes had and she recommended the scallion flavor so ofc i got it bc any sort of kindness from a stranger in this city is enough to sell me on anything at this point . bagel was very well made & the todu scallion spread was amazing and so freshhh tasting (& also never wouldve guessed it was tofu!!!) . service was fast considering the huge line ! woo
No comment
No comment

I love their bagels so before leaving the city, I decided to go back to buy a dozen to take home.  I ordered for pick up through ChowNow and put specific comments as to which types of bagels. The order was packed for me when I arrived but I checked and saw that the order was wrong.  When I went up to the counter I was given the worst attitude. They reluctantly corrected my order and made rude comments as if they didn't get it wrong in the first place and tossed the bag at me. Horrible service and they should check orders more carefully.
No comment
Not sure if it's my absolute favorite bagel in the city, but the Cooper is maybe my ideal pre-designed bagel sandwich. Would love to try the pumpernickel everything at some point.
No comment
Despite being very crowded, staff member made sure to check on our online order when we asked. Bagels were great, and a huge selection of cream cheese.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Perfect. I always come and visit this place when I'm in the city. I came around 2 pm and it luckily was almost empty. I got to sit down and enjoy my blueberry bagel with tofu cream cheese, which was slightly overdone but I didn't mind. This place has the best, fluffiest bagels and they're ready for you if you order in advance. Also great location that I love coming back to. Can't beat it.
No comment
A-mazing! Bagels are thick & filled. Service is fast & friendly! Delicious gem of a place - will definitely be back!!
No comment

column3: North of the Panhandle, San Francisco, CA
column6: It was my first time here and all I can say is wow! Great bagels, fresh bagels/ ingredients, and good customer service. I got an everything bagel with egg, pepper jack cheese, onion, tomato, and avocado. Would definitely recommend and would definitely come back if I was in the area.
No comment

Delicious bagels! Great assortment and tasty cream cheese options as well. My fiancé and I always get the Green' wich, cinnamon walnut raisin cream cheese and at least a 1/2 dozen mix of bagels to go. We usually pick up since we live in Greenwich village, but delivery is also super fast and efficient. Highly recommend!
Made my own sandwich with whole wheat everything bagel, honey bacon sriracha, sausage and egg. The bagels are top quality and the staff is really friendly. Will certainly return really soon

New favorite bagel spot! I ordered this on Uber eats and they listened to all the comments (and provided perfectly crispy bacon) and got here very fast. The bagel was great and truly a real NYC bagel. All at affordable prices!!

New York over EVERYTHING! An everything bagel that is! Seriously though, if I was gearing up to get zapped in the electric chair this sandwich would DEFINITELY be on my last meal list! Ready to order? Dial up @ubereats and select The egg, honey bacon Sriracha cream cheese sandwich from @bkbagelny #yourewelcome Tip: toast lightly, add cheese and sausage for a true religious experience

Definitely the New York vibe: Fast! YOU NEED TO KNOW WHAT YOU WANT! There is a long enough time for you to make a decision -- but the line goes fast. They aren't strangers to giving you a sample if you want to try how a bagel tastes -- but understand, you have to ask for it. I can't stress enough how you need to know what you want when you get to the counter to order and to the register (two different points of the line you'll be in during rush hour time). Whatever you get, include lox! You won't be sorry! Fresh bagels and very good.
No comment
No comment

A lovely bagel spot in East Village. There's typically less of a wait time here than at Tompkins, and the bagels are just as good. I ordered a whole wheat bagel with blueberry cream cheese. When I picked it up, it felt heavy and full. The amount of cream cheese is slightly too much for my liking, and the blueberry cream cheese was quite tasty. The bagel itself was chewy and thick. The woman at the counter was very friendly and helpful, which I appreciated. I love the white tiles of the interior, especially how the menu is directly written on them. I'd love to come back here and try all the cream cheese flavors (there are so many), like strawberry or tofu.
No comment

A fine establishment. I think I could eat here everyday. They offer a damn good vegan cream cheese. And by jov those lox are good. Three different styles. Not to mention the fixings, all different types of veggies and salsas. We had to go twice during our brief stay in NYC. Very well done. I had an everything bagel with vegan scallion cream cheese, tomato and onion salsa, and smoked pepper lox. Need I say more!? Cheers.

I'm super picky when it comes to bagels (Long Island native here-home of the best bagels) but Brooklyn Bagel gets it just right. I got an everything bagel toasted with veggie crispy. It was fluffy on the inside, crispy on the outside, and seasoning just right.
No comment

This could possibly be the best bagel in New York! I had countless bagels during my visit and this one was the perfect blend of crunchy, chewy and soft. Plus, the bacon was cooked perfectly. I've been searching for anything that can compare back home in Kentucky and I truly don't think I'll find anything that comes close. I know exactly where I'll be getting my morning bagels on my next trip to NYC.

Ummmmm yes! I'm not typically a bagel person, but when I am in New York, I've heard it is a must try. I can truly say that  my love for lox and bagels is only here in NYC. I got the Everything bagel which had a nice savory crunch and the bagel bread was soft and chewy. I got the bagel as a lox sandwich and it was very delicious. I'll be back to try more bagels!

One of the best bagel places in NY! Bagels and cream cheese are fresh and there are so many flavors to pick from. The bagels have such a nice crunchy crust with a fluffy soft inside. My blueberry bagel had the toasty aroma of a million baked blueberries on a cozy Christmas day. I'm a sweet savory type of person so I ended up getting my bagel with lox and scallion cream cheese. The combination was phenomenal. The cream cheese was rich and filled with large chunks of lox and scallion. Another perk about this place is the relative abundance of bar seats and tables unlike many other bagel places. Highly recommend if you're looking for a good NY bagel!
No comment
No comment

I got an everything bagel with the lox spread and was very disappointed. In my eyes, I basically bought a bagel with plain cream cheese that had about 2-3 crumbs of smoked salmon in it for nearly $7 so that was pretty annoying as you can imagine.
No comment
Tasty bagels! lot of options and great service. If you are tourist and want to taste the best bagels in the city - maybe this is them!
Delicious bagels make delicious breakfast sandwiches! Hot,  fresh out of the oven huge bagels in the afternoon. Yum!
Just ok.  A reminder that not all New York bagels are special.  Not bad, but not special.  Coffee was just ok too, but that shouldn't be a surprise. Coffee also not bad, but not great.
So delicious!!! Big line out the door but they are relatively quick of getting people in and out.

Dare I say it... Best bagels in NYC! This is our Saturday morning go to and I can genuinely say I look forward to it every single week. I also love that they have such a variety of bagels and spreads. Something for everyone.

Very good bagel place in NY. Had Lox on everything bagel, good coffee, family had egg with avocado and other toppings. All very good but not the beat. Seating a bit limited. We have had better. But if in the area, would go there again. If less than a mile :)

We were in the area for haircuts and I had an aggressive bagel craving. Yelp came in handy as this place has great reviews and it was around the corner. We arrived around 11:30 on a Saturday and the  restaurant had a reasonable amount of people waiting for their bagels. Taking orders is organized. You give your order to someone and then pay at a different counter. This is also where you can get your coffees. Their coffee is super hot and very tasty. I appreciated the fact that they have hazelnut syrup and cane syrup in pumps along with the other sweetener options. There are plenty of homemade cream cheeses to choose from as well as sandwich combos. We chose the Cooper - smoked salmon, red onion, capers, avocado, and lemon juice on an everything bagel. It was fantastic. The bagel was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. It wasn't too doughy which to me is the sign of a great bagel. We will absolutely be back to try the other offerings!
No comment
Nothing life changing but It's everything you expect from a bagel. Well toasted. Pretty good. Fast service.
No comment

Tasty bagels nearby NYC University!! Lots of choices and nice service, so kind stuff! Difficult to find place to sit but you can take it take away and enjoy it at washinghton square!! Great location with nice people around!! Delicious bagels!

Really good! I got the jalapeño Asiago cream cheese on an egg white plain bagel with tomato! It was delicious. I'm definitely going to try their tuna sometime, that's what my coworker always gets and she loves it! Definitely also want to try the other cream cheese flavors!!

I will start that I am not from New York and I only travel there for work, but this is the best bagel I have ever had!  I usually go to places and get the breakfast sandwich, but here, all you need is a fresh bagel with cream cheese.  It is simple, good, and fast.  They even email you a recipt (great when doing company expenses).

Wish this place was closer to my apartment or my office, because the bagels here are some of my favorite in NYC. The last time I was here I had an everything bagel with lox, plain cream cheese, tomato, and onion -- little too much cream cheese for me, which I had to scrape off, but otherwise delicious.
