My boyfriend had the BEC which looked really good as well. I've also tried their flavored cream cheeses before, and they are SO good, especially the jalepeno! The line here went by pretty fast, especially for a Sunday morning.
OMG this egg and gouda bagel - I would die for it. The fresh squeezed orange juice? Be my wife. Love this place!
Cool that you're trendy and all, but when i ask for a bagel toasted with american cheese, usually that means the cheese comes melted...not a brick of cheese on toasted bread.

I LOVE Brooklyn Bagel! Perhaps my favorite bagel place in the city. Vegan cream cheese options - like the tofu strawberry, yum! And also great weekly special cream cheeses. They have a few tables outside due to COVID, and normally there are some tables for indoor dining as well. Coffee is decent as well, and close to Washington Square Park!

Best bagels ever!! I had a bacon egg and cheese on a bialy. The sandwich was bursting with flavor! I love coming here during break, or at any time of day really. It was very busy in there, but line moved quickly and efficiently. The staff was very friendly an patient. Despite the crowd, my food was out super fast! You can never go wrong with this cafe!

Bagels are pretty hyped up in NYC, and the bagels from this place definitely lived up to the hype. I heard that there normally is a long line for this place, but we went on Sunday morning and we were pleasantly surprised to find no line. However, the seating inside does fill up quickly. The bagels are fluffy, crunchy and fresh; there were so many flavors and spreads to choose from. Honey bacon sriracha cream cheese is savory and has a bit of a kick to it, which complements the plain bagel really well so I definitely recommend trying it out.
Bagels are great. No restroom to wash your hands. That's a bummer considering bagels are something you eat with your hands. Rude cashiers are also an issue.
No comment
Yum. Just what I needed on my quick stop off in NYC. There really isn't anything like this in Los Angeles... perfect.

Fast, friendly, and tasty. I had the pumpernickel bagel with veggie cream cheese; the flavor was great, and they definitely didn't skimp on anything. It was hearty enough that I ended up skipping lunch. Would definitely go back.

Soooooo good!  Crusty, chewy, perfection!  I had the breakfast bagel and it was everything I remembered and loved about NY bagels.  I think it's the best, better than Ess-a-bagel, and without the insane tourist waits

The new Brooklyn Bagel & Co location in Greenwich Village is a real treat. It's off the 8th Street subway station, few minutes walking. Once you get inside, you can see how well the interior with tables as well as the long bench is well designed to make it feel as a bagel cafe. I ordered the pumpernickel bagel with tofu cream cheese and tomato. It was really delicious how fresh and big portion the bagels are. Definitely bigger bagels than most bagel shops I've been to, though not as big prob then Murray's bagels. This bagel shop is worth visiting if you're looking for a good bagel shop

AMAZING bagels. Very large in size and perfectly gooey on the inside and firm outside. They also have a smaller size which is honestly still big so get the small one if it's for one person. Great white fish, good coffee. If you're in the neighborhood you should definitely grab a bagel from here. Can't go wrong!!

This place has been a solid choice for lox and bagels while I've been visiting NYC. The energy isn't warm and fuzzy but I think their work product is very solid. They have reasonable seating which isn't a given in Manhattan spots like Russ & Daughters. They make the bagels onsite and they have every smear you could desire including a chocolate chip one, really who orders that one? Everyone knows sugar is bad right ;)? They process the line with efficiency, so with a couple visits under my belt I can wholeheartedly say I'm a fan.

SO overpriced. I got a bacon, egg, and american cheese. It was $7.78. They only put two pieces of bacon and 1 slice of cheese so not worth the price at all. So disspointed because it's close to work. I wouldn't mind paying that price if I got a lot of bacon but two small pieces is nothing.
I had the everything bagel and it was better than another nearby shop that had come highly recommended.

I stopped by for a quick breakfast. I got an everything bagel toasted with chive cream cheese based off a recommendation and popular cream cheese spread. I also got some avocado slices on it. The bagel was large, fresh, delicious and certainly filling. However, I don't recommend their chai lattes. It was very watered down. I asked them to add more chai mix and they were really nice about it but it still tasted very watered down. I'll probably come back for a bagel but not a drink.
Great bagels, terrible customer experience. Manager on shift (1/17 11am) dismisses customer with social distancing/ health safety concerns. Brushed customer out of the store with a threat.

Quick service, super friendly, and a nice quick bite for breakfast! It's in a convenient location and easy to get to. There's a bunch of seats by the windows and the place is very clean and welcoming. Nice stop in for all your breakfast and sandwich needs. They also serve coffee and tea of course!
This is the best bagel I've ever had. The bagels are made fresh, they have many options of cream cheese, and the service is quick! Highly recommend. Reasonably priced as well.
Everything bagel is just that- everything. It was so good. Kept it Simple with butter and toasted and it was delicious
One of the best lox bagels I've ever had! Also, a very solid hazelnut latte.

Came here on a Sunday morning and they were of course packed! They have a good system of ordering, paying, and picking up your food so the long line moves quickly. Prices were pretty normal for a nice bagel place. They have a gluten free plain bagel that was pretty good! My friend had a non gluten free bagel and loved it. Definitely  going back!
No comment
Their  customer service  Sucks they don't know how to talk to people , unprofessional staff , bagel  are always burnt at the bottom , overall i had a bad experience will never be going back
No comment

This shop had the best bagels we found in Manhattan.  They are huge and come with a generous amount of cream cheese.  We tried the blueberry, everything, plain, cinnamon raisin, and French toast bagels as well as the cucumber dill, strawberry, scallion bacon, and low fat scallion cream cheeses.  All were amazing!  Originally we were going to go to a different place each day were were visiting, but we ended up coming back here because it was so good.  The seating was limited, so getting it to go was a great option.

So glad a good bagel spot has finally arrived to the heart of NYU campus. The bagels here are fresh and HUGE. Eating one fills me for hours and sometimes I even end up only eating half and saving half for later. Good selection of bagels and cream cheeses. My friends and I have become regulars

I used to like the one in Chelsea so being an avid Bagel Bob fan I reluctantly decided to give this new location a try.  What the bagels offer in size they lack in flavor and texture.  The tuna and cream cheese selections are good but the bagels are lackluster.  The separate ordering and pickup system where you pay after you order is also a cluster to be avoided.  Happy to crown Bagel Bob as the reigning BEST bagel in NYC champion.

Awesome bagels. So chewy and fresh and perfect. They also vary in size and some are ginormous. Loved it so much! Their lox sandwich with scallion cream cheese and their bacon egg and cheese sandwich were both great. Their everything bagels were especially great. They had a gingerbread special for Christmas when we went and that was amazing. Such nice people too!
No comment

This review is only for the gluten-free options. I ordered an egg sandwich on a gf bagel this morning and could not believe how small the bagel was. The bagel could barely hold the eggs, and so the entire sandwich fell apart as soon as I picked it up. Definitely not worth the $$.
Everything about this place deserves 10 stars. The bagels and coffee are to die for!!! They let you customize and it's so much food for the price
Without a doubt my favorite bagel shop in lower Manhattan. Every aspect of their bagel game is on point
No comment

This is a real find.  Bagels are fresh tasty and they do the perfect ratio of the innards. Not too much smear. Just right. The everything were so tasty and the egg is perfect. I like they are made in house   Good seating and were open for Christmas. How perfect for us travelers.  The special gingerbread bagel even won some applause from the bagel mavens
No comment
No comment

I was first turned on to Brooklyn Bagel by a friend who lives near their 8th Ave location in Chelsea. He spoke of the bagels highly and when I tried a bagel I couldn't agree more. Now they've opened on 8th St. in Greenwich Village close to where I live and it has become my go to bagel shop. There bagels are made the tradition way, great dough, boiled in water and baked in a large oven. You get a crisp exterior and very soft interior. They are just the right size with many flavors. There are now 2 solid bagel shops to go to in Central Village and Brooklyn is now my number 1.

Great bagels.      Good size made fresh.  It is a great addition to the neighborhood.  Very friendly staff!   A pleasure to be a customer !   Extremely Clean too!   Highly recommend!   Pati and Richie

Beautifully designed, modern bagel shop! Everyone working was super friendly and prompt.  I got an everything bagel with scallion cream cheese and Nova.  It was probably the freshest and best bagel I've had in NYC after having lived here for 10 years and trying many bagel shops...hands down! Definitely recommend Brooklyn Bagel!!!
Get the Greenich everything bagel sandwich with the JALEPEÑO ASIAGO CREAM CHEESE! game changer, people!!! #noragrets

My favorite bagel spot so far! The vegan tofu cream cheese is so amazing. I wasn't sure how I would like it but it's so good and a great alternative if you can't have dairy cream cheese. When I order online it's so simple and fast and both times my order has been ready within minutes ! Love this spot so much highly recommend.
Perfect every time. Best bagels in NYC. Warm service. Top quality. Long lines, but worth it. Great add to the neighborhood
Everything bagel with plain cream cheese--simply perfect. This is my new favorite bagel place.
Bagels are huge and the amount of cream cheese was impressive! There is a wide variety of cream cheeses to choose from so if you are someone who is indecisive be aware.

What a delightful place. 1) Quality food. Yummy loaded bagels. They have freshly squeezed orange juice. You could see how your food is prepared. 2) Quality service. Staff were knowledgeable, helpful and accommodating. 3) Quality place. There were ample tables and seats. The eating, counter and back areas were clean. I will go back again and again.

These bagels are just okay. They taste like generic store bought bagels, and are pretty chewy. They do have some unique cream cheese flavors, like cannoli and sriracha bacon, but otherwise there's nothing special about this place. I did enjoy the draft latte. The food wasn't bad, I just wouldn't go back for the price when there are so many amazing bagel places in New York City.
Delicious egg sandwiches and sizable portions; good value for price. Quick service and delicious coffee! Heads up, no bathroom at this location.

Best bagels in the neighborhood, my husband and I waited what seemed like an eternity for this place to open and when they finally did, they did not disappoint.  The bagels are fresh and delicious, they have fresh squeezed orange juice and awesome coffee and tea - couldn't ask for anything more.

Bagel place is awesome. Lines are long but there is a wide selection of bagels, sandwiches, and spreads. I Gave it a 4 because not a lot of options for vegetarian, like eggs with veggies and too have to pay for each veggie topping. So there isn't really a veggie option sandwich. I just got the salmon bagel which was fabulous. The staff is polite and they work hard and fast. I'll definitely go back here anyways.
Amazing doughy yet crunchy bagels. We NEEDED this in our hood! Staff is friendly and accommodating.

While I was in New York, I knew I wanted to try a good bagel, and found this shop a 5-minute walk from my lodgings at NYU. My goodness...we have good bagels in California, but I have never experienced a bagel quite like this! The bagels had a wide variety of flavors, and no exaggeration, were about 6-7 inches in circumference, 5-7 inches in height. I've never seen bagels that size! I ordered the onion bagel, with bacon-scallion cream cheese, and that led to another surprise. The cream cheese had actual pieces of cooked bacon and green onion in it (I was honestly expecting Philadelphia cream cheese or something)! The people making my bagel also smeared a good two inches of that stuff on each half, which made me happy. It's a wonderful place for a quick and cheap breakfast: I spent $7 for a coffee, and this wonderful piece of bagel art that kept me full until around 3 that afternoon. Definitely recommend, and will return myself next time I come to New York!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with my brother and was instantly pleased by the interior of this place. It's a cozy spot with artistic and imaginative decor; even the menus are really beautiful. Both my brother and I ordered the chicken ramen. While both of us loved the thick, wavy noodles, we weren't as enamored by the broth. It was slightly lacking in flavor, and in general I was expecting a lot more. However, the service was amazing. The waiters were very attentive, and our food came out really quick. I still recommend this spot to anybody looking for some decent ramen and doesn't want to wait a long time for seating.
No comment

We stopped into Kin Ramen for my birthday dinner last night. There wasn't an open seat in the house and they still found us a spot for 6 fairly quickly. We were impressed. Everyone's food was really yummy and the drinks, while a bit pricey, were strong and visually stunning. You could definitely tell everyone was working well together to make sure finished dishes were taken away asap as to get a more efficient turn over on tables, but we never felt rushed. There was a birthday song and lava cake involved that was rich and creamy! The street themed bathroom caught me way off guard, but it was super cool and ended up adding to my overall experience. If we are nitpicking, it was potentially too fast? We were served our food before our drinks came out, but we were alright with that! We thoroughly enjoyed this little stop and would return.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Orders the spicy kind man and it was really great. Everything was tasty from their dumplings to the salmon Sashimi Salad. Sadly, although very tasty it was greasier than i'm used to and upset my stomach.
Incredible ramen! The smell was amazing and it was so refreshing to have ramen broth that tasted like there was real thought and effort put into it, and to have an egg that was actually marinated.
No comment
No comment
No comment

So good!!! Found this gem because it was next to my hotel when staying in NYC. Ordered pickup off of Yelp and it was ready very quickly. When I picked it up the place looked small, but popping and busy. It was such a cute atmosphere! The food was also DELICIOUS!!! Highly recommend, some of the best ramen I've ever had.
No comment

I came here for lunch based off other Yelp reviews, and overall I'd say it was good but not amazing. I was sat right away and the staff was all extremely friendly and quick to drop off a menu and get water over to me. The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is the portion was pretty small, I was still a little hungry when I left. The ramen had good flavor and was presented very well, but again the portion was pretty small, especially when you're paying $21 for a bowl.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best ramen ever. The flavor of the seafood ramen is to die for. The spicy sauce on the side is a nice touch. So incredibly amazing.
Highly Recommend this Ramen place the food is amazing .. Small unique and very cute restaurant
No comment
No comment
The setting and the tables were so cute. The food in itself was not to heavy and was mouthwatering. It was very delicious !
The veggie ramen was out of this world. Beautiful restaurant with contemporary vibes. Fantastic art and huge portions.
No comment
No comment
Got the soft shell crab nikuman (bun) and kaisen (seafood) ramen takeout. The bun was delicious but the broth was a little bland - tho the seafood was plentiful. Will get the spicy sauce next time.
No comment
No comment

Walked down the steps into a small but cozy restaurant with lots of fun decor. The drink menu read like an anime comic book which was a fun detail. I loved the chicken ramen I got, and we split the gyoza appetizer which was also tasty. Lots of flavor in the ramen, I would definitely go  back. If you're in the neighborhood I'd check it out. Only getting 4 stars because the drink I got was a little odd- I think it had gelatin in it (although I didn't see that in the menu) so it felt like I was drinking jello. Strange mouth feel in my opinion. Otherwise great!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow- what a sweet little find this was! I love small spaces- and this place is tiny. Super cute vibe inside. You could think you were transported to the Orient! We both had ramen of some sort and shared little buns of goodness- one pork- the best and one with fried chicken. Draft beers were super cold. I highly recommend checking this place out. Make sure you use the restroom! ;)
Super delicious ramen! I loved the vegan ramen which came with a variety of tasty vegetables including kabocha, my personal favorite!
No comment

This place is a hidden gem!!! Amazing ambiance that makes you feel like you're in Japan having authentic ramen which I felt was pretty solid. The sake and ramen pairing was honestly top notch! I highly recommend getting both, and to skip on the gyoza.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Solid ramen place. I got the spicy miso ramen and it was pretty spicy! Really liked the broth flavor and the noodle texture. A good size bowl as well. I'd recommend this place!
Everything you want in a ramen shop! Amazing service, fantastic ambiance, reasonable prices, abut mostly excellent  ramen!
No comment

This place had one of the best decorations in both their menu and their restaurant itself that I have seen in a while. There is beautiful Japanese decorations and unique drawing on the menu to describe how each of their drinks are and how they are made. Their bathroom was also a very unique experience because of how they decorated it. While the decoration holds to be very unique and beautiful, everything else matters as well. Their service was top notch. The whole restaurant often greets the customers when they walk in and they are very friendly with everything to make yourself feel like home. However, the price seemed a bit higher in few items more than other restaurants around the area. I ordered ramen and to be honest, I wasn't really fond of it. My ramen came in a semi cold broth which also had no flavors, I had to add extra seasoning and make it edible. The noodles also lacked flavors and were kinda stretchy. Not really my type I guess. Maybe I should've picked a different both, something more popular but it didn't really hit the spot for me. I did love their appetizers, their takoyaki was one of favs.

If you're looking for spicy good ramen bowls, this is the spot! See Bo, he welcomed us in at the bar area because the tables were all taken. He was quick, friendly and attentive, providing us the best service! Their current spot is quite small but he mentioned they will be expanding. Drop by and visit Bo! The food was awesome!!
Incredible food, drink and service. The staff are very helpful, kind and attentive. Thank you
No comment

my bf and I randomly found this place once and OMG this place is a true gem. we got lucky and were able to get a table without a reservation but I think you need one if you come on a busy day because after a few minutes this place got packed. the food and atmosphere in general was amazing! it's very pretty inside even though a restaurant itself is small. separately, I want to note their restroom, I honestly didn't want to leave it just looking at a really cool painting there. definitely 5 stars will always come back!

Staff was very friendly. The food was delicious. The ramen had a piece of an edible gold flake in the bowl which was a nice touch. The Tori Tori Don was very tasty. The Sashimi Salad was fresh and the dressing paired well in the dish. Overall atmosphere was nice and would definitely go back again.
No comment
No comment

Food was absolutely delicious. Atmosphere was awesome. It was all but that's just a consequence of breeding in that neighborhood. What I would suggest for them is during the winter there's no need to put on the heat because it's so small and cramped.
Amazing vibe with phenomenal food and service.  Their Ramen was delicious.   We loved the cozy feel to ot.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was just kind of okay for me. Soup was very flavorful but almost overseasoned. Noodles were the big chunky kind. Not my fav, would visit a different place next time. I also got it as take out so that def changes the quality, so am giving it 4 stars instead of 3.
Really good Ramen!!! I thought the reviews was BS but they wasn't lying! ...this is top 3 best ramens i ever had! ..the broth was amazing and the noodles were so nice! Def coming back

Place absolutely rocks beyond measure. The environment is small, yes, but that's also part of the charm and a testament to the quality of the food because you'll always be willing to wait. Always. Staff is not only warm and inviting, they're wildly gracious and appreciate every person who walks through the door. The food and drinks are spectacular, too. Definitely recommend the Kara Miso and Kara Kin and pork buns. We can't wait to come back and try even more.
No comment

Great hole in the wall ramen place. Easy to miss and such a gem to find. Super small dining area but they make the most of every inch. They have craft drinks with comic book styled stories behind them. We ordered the pork goyzo and the kin ramen. Very flavorful and amazing. Highly recommend checking this place out
No comment

Had a date night with the husband and we thoroughly enjoyed both the food and the service. Accompanies by perfectly jammy eggs and succulent char siu was a perfect bowl of toothsome ramen. The broth was nice and rich without feeling heavy and the bits of minced pork and corn gave the dish even more flavor and texture. We were also really pleased and impressed with the ube tempura and gyoza. Both fried appetizers came out piping hot and greaseless. The ube tempura was just sweet enough to counter all 3 dipping sauces (spicy Mayo, wasabi Mayo, and sweet soy) and the gyoza was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. I also like that the filling was really well balanced - not too much chives where you can't taste the freshness of meat. All in all, we loved our meal and can't wait to go back.

I am staying at the Hilton Midtown and this was a short walk. I went on a Wednesday night and sat by myself at the bar/counter on the side of the restaurant. I had the soy vegan ramen and it was delicious! The staff was very attentive and friendly. The food came quickly, but they did not rush me to finish. I would highly recommend.
Kin Ramen is the best ramen I've ever had! The best ramen in Nyc! I love the broth is so delicious . The service is friendly and helpful. Lisa is our server and she is the nicest person!
No comment
Great hole in the wall, amazing drinks and delicious Ramen. The Kirei drink is a mixture of Aperol Spritz with a Lychee type concoction. The Kin Ramen is the signature dish.
Wow wow wow. Vegan ramen and gyoza. Great service and atmosphere. Can't get back soon enough!
Ramen was good, soup base was rich and flavorful. I was a little disappointed they charge extra for egg in ramen, and service was a bit cold (not bad) just distance.
No comment
I would literally fly to NYC just to have their Ramen. Literally  all around. Great ambiance, great staff, and incredible food!

The location is kinda hidden and has a modern appearance. Once you get inside you find a really cozy Japanese aesthetic l, similar to an izakaya. The menu prices are REALLY good for the quality of food. The Noodles and broth are both flavorful and delicious and salmon Don is fresh. The wait staff are really attentive and the bathroom is REALLY REALLY clean and decorated cool. I would recommend eating here.

The place was small but the food was good and arrived quickly. We got the spicy miso ramen, miso ramen, kin ramen, gyudon, edamame, and yam tempura. All the food was delicious and flavorful. Only complaint I have is that the gyudon portion was really small IMO. The atmosphere has a nice chill vibe and it was a great experience. Will definitely come again.

Once again Yelp reviews steered us to the right place. Small venue with good use of space. More Japanese clientele than others (us), so probably in the right place for ramen. Shared a large salad with seared tofu to start and finished every bite. Several ramen choices and both of our - chicken for me and vegan for my wife were outstanding. They showed us the hot sake dispenser (we didn't have any because it was lunch for us), and the decor is fun. Must visit the restroom! On our list for next time in NYC!
I have only good things to say about this place.  Great food, service and atmosphere.
Short distance walk from hotel for ramen. They do closes at 10 pm. Ramen soup is flavorful.
Def will come back again! Seafood ramen is bomb so many seafood and flavorful! I would skip karaage it's not crispy but soft texture which I don't like.
Every person working here that we interacted with was very kind. The food is great! We actually came back for a second time during our stay. The food was fresh and tasted great.

Super cute ramen place in midtown west NYC with unique decor and thoughtful touches everywhere. The fried chicken was amazing with 3 dif types of dipping sauces. We also ordered the pork dumpling and Kin ramen with their really tasty hot sauce on the side (very spicy). Also loved their green tea ice cream with hot lava cake. Their drink menu is quite extensive and we sat at the bar for our dinner
No comment
One of the best ramen places hand down. As a vegan it is often hard to have really good ramen due to lack of flavor, but their kara soy vegan ramen was so bomb
Delicious ramen, great service and my drink was so good I keep thinking about going back for it
Really tiny little place with not much room. Amazing ramen! Perfect portion size, not too big. Service is pretty fast.

My family of six went here for my 45th birthday dinner while visiting the city. The staff is super friendly and accommodating and they are all HUSTLING at all times to provide quality service. The ramen was delicious and our appetizers were perfect. I am plant based and there were multiple options for me on the app list and the vegan ramen was very flavorful which isn't always the case when you order the plant based ramen.

Really cute and relatively new ramen spot. Called before arriving and was informed they had a table available.  We were a party of 3 and ended up seating in the wall high seats. Service was quick and efficient.  The absolute best thing we ordered was the crab bao appetizer. Absolutely delicious and blew me away. The kin ramen was good but not memorable.
Such a great tiny place that helpfully doesn't take reservations so you can wait with everyone else. A  mid town gem!
It's good. The location is small and it's a bit pricey but worth it!! I got chicken and pork buns Togo. The order was made fast and fresh and I will go back.
Amazing flavorful powerful food & insane drinks! Enjoyed our experience, felt like we were back in Japan!

Super cute little spot. Unassuming from the outside. The decor is kitchy and cute. We got a table quickly and after a quick menu scan, we got the shoyu and spicy kaisen ramen bowls. The food came out quickly and was a good we could have set a record with how quickly we ate. I would stop in again.

Tiny place but powerful!! Staff members are efficient, food is phenomenal, service is fast, music is loud and awesome!! don't need a reservation as tables are quickly turnover but May need to wait a bit if there aren't tables available. You will not be disappointed!
Solid Ramen place in NYC. Good food and fun Japanese inspired cocktails. Recommend sitting at the bar to get the best experience.
Small gem with very good food and people. If you like a small friendly place and tasty ramen you'll like Kin Ramen.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Amazing place, I had some other ramens in NY, this one is definitely the best!. Also the place is pretty good with all the ambience of a Japanese izakaya.
No comment

Ramen is one of our go to meals in the city and over the past couple of years the competition for the best ramen in upper west side has stiffened. In my opinion Kin Ramen is the new winner. The food was amazing as were the drinks and the service.
No comment

Place is always packed, but it's worth the wait! Food is so amazingly delicious. I forgot the name of the dish but it had seafood in it. Huge shrimp, scallops, mussels and squid that is so yummy. If you can be patient or call ahead, you will see and taste what I'm talking about.

Cool ramen place. Such a great vibe. The staff were very kind and respectful. Our server lisa is the best! The gyoza was delicious along with the chicken bumps. The miso ramen was phenomenal! The egg cooks perfectly. Must try matcha lava cake as well. Definitely be back!!!
No comment

Came here on a whim and left amazed. We had the Kin Ramen and the Miso Ramen with an egg. Both broths were extremely flavorful, the perfect texture, and robust. Noodles tasted very fresh and cooked to perfection. Loved the bar options (especially since a drink had the same name as me!) I will definitely be returning plenty more times.
No comment
No comment
Best ramen in this area!!!! I love Kara Kin and skin fried chicken the most!!!! Cocktail is the most must try!!!!!
No comment

I love this ramen spot. It has great food, lisa is nice service. You can go either solo or with group. If you're looking for nice ramen spot for this winter, here is your first choice. I'm glad I found this spot.
Staff are all very friendly! The Kara Kin and Kara Miso  are superb, but the pan fried Gyoza dumplings are by far the best item on the menu!

This is a new ramen place in the neighborhood and the staff told me this is their 11th day since they opened. The ramen is delicious, I tried the Kara Kin and I look forward the try the rest in the near future. A lot of the ramen place closed down during the pandemic and I am so happy that there is a solid place in the neighborhood.

I love the ambience and atmosphere of the restaurant. It's small but the decorations, music, and even the menus really add character. I got the kirei drink and at first it just tasted like juice with proseco but there were small jelly bits in it that made the drink so unique and fun! We got the corn cheese as an appetizer and it was good but nothing special. I ordered the Kara kaisen and made the mistake of making it spicy when it was already spicy. Out the 3 ramens we got this one definitely had the best broth. It was so delicious with the umami flavor from the seafood. Someone else ordered the regular kin ramen and the portion looked so much smaller than the kaisen. The Kin was good but just not as good as the kaisen. Someone else ordered the soy vegan ramen and one the the more unique vegan ramens I've had but I prefer more of a savory broth than something thick and creamy from purée. The ramen is pretty pricey and you have to pay extra just for simple things like an egg. Not sure if it's worth the price but worth checking out at least once.

Kin Ramen is a new Americanized Japanese restaurant on 56th Street in Midtown. The shoyu ramen was modest and satisfying. The karaage donburi was just okay: I liked the fried chicken but there were only 5 small pieces for the entire bowl. I felt the prices were high for what you get but the food and drinks were fine.
Great place, great service, excellent food. They were willing to accommodate us even though they were close to closing time for lunch
Food and service were 5 stars.  I have eaten ramen all over the world and this is top notch.  I am very picky and loved this place.
Delicious!! The spicy chicken and soy base were both fantastic. Great service! Fun environment.
No comment

This is a perfectly cozy spot for ramen. I loved the spicy Kin Ramen. It looked small at first, but it ended up being very filling. The broth was rich and flavorful and the noodles were the perfect texture. They also had very fun and unique cocktails. Definitely give it a try!

This is a small Ramen restaurant with a great local atmosphere. The Ramen was outstanding and their house broth was very good. I had the spicy version which was not so spicy that it took away from the taste, but rather added a lot of flavor. The service was also excellent and will definitely return here.

This place had such good reviews we hAd to try it! We were not disappointed we had the chicken with cilantro and fish broth really delicious chicken with noodles and mung bean shoots! Small place but great food and service plus less expensive then most places!

Deserves every 5 star review. The space is immaculately detailed, the food is delicious and beautifully plated (torched char shu!), the drinks are creative, the service is fast and polite, and the bathroom is a whole experience. 10/10.

Besides RamenShack when they're around, this spot is one of the best ramen spots in NYC. The ambiance, food, and service were all top notch. Everything we ordered was incredible and filled with authentic flavor. They also make really delicious cocktails as well! Kudos to the staff there and definitely check this spot out. We must do all we can do keep this place open. It's like transporting to Japan within NY.

This place is definitely a must try when in NYC. The ramen was so flavorful and amazing! Amazing is a understatement. I rate it 11/10. The drinks and the vibes we're immaculate. The restroom was so cute and the mirror almost gives you an illusion.  MUST TRY!

The food and service here was amazing! cocktail excellent  and unique it was delicious and was full of jelly which was a good surprise! Very sweet as well. The ramen was very filling and some of the best I've had!
No comment
Great ambience, excellent service and delicious food! Love everything about Kin Ramen!

Ramen was okay. Ambiance is great, as was the service. They have gold in the ramen :) Honestly, I prefer the izakaya and cocktails here. Had the Kirei cocktail. The squid karage and chicken karage were very good!
If you want Ramen in NYC, This place is a true gem. Unique cocktails (Must try) and the best Ramen ever. Highly recommend the spicy seafood Ramen, but everything is so delicious.
No comment

Look like a very traditional ramen place when you walk in. I love the decor and the low dim lights. The workers are every nice and are very alert to your needs like refilling the water and asking how the food is. However, I had the kin ramen(pork broth ) and also the miso ramen (chicken broth ) and they were both underwhelming flavors. Even after adding additional spicy sauce the flabbier just wasn't totally there, I expected better from a place with such high reviews. I eat ramen a lot but this isn't a place I would return to.

We love the vegetarian and non vegetarian options at this cozy ramen spot near Carnegie Hall. Great service too. Super cramped but we don't mind, given the delicious and affordable menu. Highly recommended.
Good ramen. Drink menu was manga themed which was neat. Food came out relatively fast & waitstaff was nice :)
Positive experience all the way around. Food and atmosphere are great. Everyone is fun and welcoming. Highly recommend!!
Nice ramen! I'm not a ramen master or anything like that, but being an Asian I feel it's pretty authentic.

We stumbled upon this gem of a restaurant while in NYC. Kids were hungry for ramen and this place did not disappoint! Everything was fantastic - the food, the service, the ambiance, etc. I cannot wait to be back in the city so we can visit again!
This restaurant is amazing. All the foods were delicious. All the server are also friendly and nice!! Recommended place to visit in new york

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: A dear friend of me took me here.  I am totally in love.  The food was superb.  The best ramen chashu I have had.  The broth was just perfect.  The cocktails were smartly and thoughtfully crafted.
Love this place! Cute menu and ramen tastes good!I tried shio and miso based! would come again!
No comment

This was absolutely delicious!  I can't remember the last time I had Ramen that tasted so good!  Worth returning to try something else (but their basic ramen was so good, I don't know if I'll be able ti order anything else!). Not fancy, but cozy atmosphere.  Service was very good.
No comment
Delicious everything, unique cocktail menu, and incredibly fast service. Vibes are cozy and interesting from the artwork to the broth spoons.
First off the Food was Fantastic! Ramen was served HOT and full of flavor. The staff was great! The other items on the menu were also fantastic! We will be returned here again for sure!
Great food. Loved the drinks and matcha lava cake!!!ShishitoShoyu RamenSoy Vegan RamenGyoza Dumplings
No comment

This place is UNREAL!! Had the best dinner here tonight. Started with the veggie gyoza and will be dreaming of that for a long, long time. Excellent dipping sauce. Then onto the main course. Spicy miso for me and kin (pork) miso for my date. The broth was excellent, the noodles were fresh, the add-on hard boiled egg was cooked to absolute perfection. A generous serving of corn, ground pork, and scallion added to the mix, accompanied by 3 beautiful slices of pork. I couldn't eat it all, so I'll be looking forward to leftovers tomorrow. Dreamy! WILL be back and WILL bring friends!!
All time favorite ramen and service! Flawlessly carried out from the second you step into the restaurant to out of it. Must Try! The people there work so hard to make sure every bowl is memorable.
Great Ramen spot.  Must get the appetizers (fried chicken skins)   the Ramen is delicious and spicy.

Super delicious new Japanese Ramen place in Midtown West.  So glad they open as there is no good Ramen nearby and this one is delicious and fun.  Appetizers are amazing and one can make a meal with just that, but the Ramen itself is very hearty and delicious.  Highly recommend it.

LOVE the ramen. Flavor is on point. Texture is on point. I also love the drinks here omg so pretty and innovative imo. The cha su pork is soooo well made I mean I literally pick the fat off usually in most ramen spots bc it's never cooked in a way that doesn't make me feel like it's just actual fat. Here it's caramelized to the gods and given a nice sear/char which makes it all melt together very pleasantly. It comes with a lil gold flake too lol so pretty for pics. It is a bit higher in price so be aware that this will be a well over $20 bowl accompanied by a $15 drink (you may need 2/3 LOL) but if you're down to splurge that's fine. Lastly the only part I really didn't love was the seating. The crate seats are really not comfortable at all and sitting in the middle definitely feels too crowded and like you're kind of just in the way. Wish I could call to reserve the window table (I've tried and when I arrived it was still taken by another party) :( either way tho the ramen is good and I do love the decorations and the vibe of the place. Will return anyway lol
By far the best meal I've had in NYC while on a trip. Great location, adorable inside as well. The food is absolutely amazing, and the service is just as good.

This place is amazing and definitely hits the spot if you're craving good Japanese food. It's definitely a  very thoughtfully decorated and modern. The cocktail is so refreshing . The appetizers are delicious and huge, I really liked the soft shell crab buns. And the ramen itself was awesome and packed with flavor. I got the spicy one and didn't think it was overly spicy. We will definitely be back!!
Great place! Awesome ramen and apps. Had one of the best bourbon drinks ever there!  If u like bourbon drinks, it's a must have.

Ramen was delicious, the broth is one of the best I've tried. The place is small, but it has a great Japanese ramen shop to it. We visited with our two year old, and the staff was very attentive, friendly and quickly accommodated our needs. They have storage boxes that fit besides your table or underneath your seat. Great idea.

Delicious ramen with bomb appetizers. The soft shell crab bun were super tasty. There were some good cocktails options as well, I liked my Umai plum margarita , paired nicely with all the fried/greasy food.

Beautiful restaurant. Great familial ambiance. Bo is the man and a attentive waiter and operator. Food is beyond good, they use great produce and everything looks amazing. Also the cocktails are delicious and the sake fruit bowl is endless. Also, really cool fucking bathroom.

Delicious, cozy, friendly spot midtown with authentic atmosphere and ramen. Got their signature pork ramen which melted in my mouth. The staff is amazing and warm and welcoming and the sake perfect. Highly recommend.

Very cute new ramen spot in midtown. They have so many great appetizers and ramen! Crispy chicken skin and Kin ramen were my favorite. Must try their original cocktails too! So good! I love the store decor too.

Some of the best ramen I've ever had, and I've had a lot over the years. The takoyaki was top notch as well, clearly fresh and hand-made unlike so many places that use frozen or other pre-made. Great atmosphere, excellent service, great cocktail menu (both in terms of drinks and the manga presentation).
Service and food was spectacular! They were so kind and accommodating. I came from next door cause the server was SO RUDE. I just walked out and came here. Go here if it's between the two!

Outstanding food and service. The place is really a Michelin star restaurant and has unbelievable quality drinks and ramen. I am in love with Kin Ramen and would fly from San Diego monthly for this place!
Ramen was so great and service was amazing fried chicken skin must try. Will definitely be coming back for ramen again!
Seafood ramen was great also soft shell crab bun was good. Plum margarita so amazing. Would go back again.

This place was definitely a hidden gem! The vibe and atmosphere was dope. From the trapanese music to the anime inspired menus, everything just felt so unique and original. Most important of all though, the food was super oishii (delicious in japanese). We ordered the fried chicken skin, shumai, fried squid and ebi fry shrimp. Everything went SO well with the drinks we ordered! Very unique and amazingly designed alcoholic beverages! Theyre pretty strong too lol. Classy, professional but very casual at the same time. Haven't been to a place as unique as this in a while. If you go, ask for T.K. He was our bartender and he was so nice and accommodating!. He gave us a free dish as well as recommendations for other great restaurants. The whole staff was suuuper nice and accommodating. They really make you feel welcomed there! 100% recommend!
Worthy of all 5 stars! Everything was great! Loved the spicy pork belly! Fantastic, authentic, and great tasting! My new Ramen spot!!

Came here on a whim while in the city looking for lunch. The atmosphere was very fun and cozy and all the servers were extremely nice. I got the shoyu ramen which was probably the best I've had, along with definitely the best chashu pork I've ever had. Food came out quick as well.
Very original soup. Not so MSG taste like the San Francisco ramen soup. You should try this place when you land in New York City west side.

Had a really great experience eating here. The service was awesome and I liked how they greeted you in Japanese and spoke Japanese to you. Felt authentic, and that manga drink menu really seals the deal. The ramen was delicious, super rich broth and the toppings were amazing. Loved how they added a bit of gold "kin" to top off the ramen. Definitely recommended.
Amazing went back for seconds !! Had spicy pork ramen and gyoza! So good!! Plus the cocktails were amazing!
Excellent ramen. Softshell crab buns are superb. It's a tiny restaurant with tasteful and humorous decor.
my go to place in the area.   authentic menus.   Good food.
Some of the best ramen I've had in New York (maybe the best?), and with great service, too!
Fantastic homemade goodness, a must have, even for takeout! Had the kin Raman and iced oolong tea.
Best ramen I have ever had. Went back two nights later. I do not know the owner or have any affiliation with the place. Go!

This restaurant is amazing. The quality and depth of taste in the ramen is probably the best I've had outside of Japan, and the cocktails are creative and delicious too. On top of it, our waitress was fantastic. Good quality and location next to Carnegie hall, this place is an all around win.
Best food and service ever in Manhattan!! Recommended to everyone !! Will be back for sure
Been there 2 times now and it was amazing. Great service and awesome ramen. Brought some friends the second time and they loved it too. Will be back.
Really rude staff unfortunately. I was hoping for this place to be awesome and well, it fell short. I will go somewhere else. I was so excited too.

Definitely recommend this gem tucked into the heart of Midtown. We stopped in for a late bite on a Friday night and had a lovely experience, from the gracious server to the fresh and delicious ramen. Will definitely be back!
The apps were delish but the ramen is severely lacking.  Soup base was flavorless and the ramen noodle itself was over cooked

This place is REALLY GOOD I liked the ramen and the chicken but after I got takeout AND tipped they told me I couldn't stay and eat and he said it so rude the service was terrible but the food is good so I'll let back the lady server idk if she was having a bad day or what but she did not want to help me and it was my first time there don't know what was up with that

This place is amazing! My boyfriend and I were brought there by such great reviews. The reviews are well deserved! I had the chicken ramen and it was very tasty! I do recommend adding the spice to it. We also had the lava cake dessert and that was just so amazing! I drank the sesame old fashioned and it was just so tasty. In addition to the good food and drinks the staff was so kind and warm. Really had a great dinner here 10/10 would recommend.
Amazing ramen, amazing fried chicken, and even better service - highly recommended. We'll be back for sure
Broth is so rich and creamy. It might be heavy for some audiences, but the flavors are so savory and the cocktails are so cute. Make sure to visit the bathroom before leaving!
Awesome ramen place! The place is small but has decent amount of seats. The service was great! The ramen was very good. Everything was fantastic.
Amazing place and a great experience. Felt like we were in a ramen place in Japan smack in the middle of NYC

Nice oasis tucked away in midtown west. It wasn't too crowded, which is rare in this neighborhood. And the decor was super cute and laid back - very transportive, like we'd entered a portal to an underground Japanese dive. The food hit the spot. But I confess wasn't all that memorable, in both good and bad ways.
They have many great option of appetizers, i recommend should try with drink. And they have ramen name "Kin Ramen" super good. By the way servers are so Nice and friendly
No comment
The signature breakfast sandwich is awesome. Totally worth the infatuation recommendation. High marks for decor, ambiance, and service too.

I've had this place bookmarked for a while and finally got a chance to check it out! I took my food to go but there's limited seating in the small cafe and based on the time you might get lucky and snag a seat. I'll start by saying this place is super cute and I love the way they decorated the place. The line moves fast and depending what you order you'll wait about 10-15min for your meal. I started with a $7 salted caramel latte which I immediately regretted because it tasted more salty than I expected so I guess that was an acquired taste. I then got the falafel burger and a side of spiced home fries. These two were absolutely delicious and I would definitely get both again. Portions were filling, seasonings were on point, and everything complimented each other very well. I finished it off with a mixed berry scone that was super tasty and not overly sweet. I gave this place a 4 instead of 5 because the prices were too high in my opinion. I spent like $40 which seems steep for what I got. However, I would go back to try some other items on their menu.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food was good if overpriced. But they played lady gaga the 2 hours I was there so 5 stars (and intriguingly just one lana del rey song...)
Good coffee. REALLY FLUFFY eggs. Beautifully plated. Fresh ingredients. Intense flavors. I loved my grain bowl. My friend didn't love her sandwich and was a little astonished at the price.
No comment
Literal definition of gentrification. Incredibly overpriced for small portions. The food tastes fine but 18-20 for a breakfast sandwich? Come on...so many better options in the neighborhood.
No comment

Not sure what changed but the food is no way near as good as it used to be, I was hesitant to write this but after my recent second try I'm not convinced. Menemen used to be my fave dish of all time but now there's a strong mustard sauce and an overwhelming amount of tomato.
Breakfast here is so good.  Cant go wrong.  Pricy but worth it  got all the egg sandwich and latte varieties.  Pastries are also great!

I visited Golda in the early afternoon and it was not too busy, which was a plus since it's a very small place. I wish the space was bigger because seating would get very limited during the rushes. I got the breakfast sandwich with chicken sausage which was delicious! I kind of wish it came with a side. I also got a cold brew which hit the spot (didn't blow my mind or anything - just fine). I'd say if you're nearby you should definitely stop in but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow. I thought I was stepping into a coffee, pastry shop. Instead I had one of the best breakfasts ever! The flavors and textured spice on the avocado toast, carrots with roasted pistachios was amazing.

The fried chicken sandwich. It makes all other fried chicken sandwiches look bad. The bun is amazing and the option to add an egg makes this a good brunch choice. The hummus is amazing and the honey almond pancakes are mouth watering. I've also loved the farro bowl on days where I need something lighter. This is a great spot that I've loved ordering brunch from as well as dining in for a great experience.

Indoor dining is now available, in addition to outdoor dining. Seating inside is limited but if you're lucky enough like we were to snag a table before the weekend brunch crowd, you'll be in for a treat. Lovely interior with plants and cute decor, even their coffee cups add nice flair. Nice options for breakfast. Seems small but our food was hearty and perfectly filling. Pastries look yummy, was tempted by their bread pudding from banana foster bread. Everything we had was yummy. Service was great. Star of the show was whiskey latte, I will say  can't go wrong with anything here. Central location off Fulton St but still has a chill, quaint, out of city vibes.

I have lived in Clinton Hill for YEARS and this was my first time here. I always see a line outside so I decided to pop in. A nice bright July sunny Monday & I was in the mood for avocado toast. I ordered that without the corn salsa. Once I got my meal ToGo I checked it to make sure it was correct. It looked yummy but I just wanted some crushed red pepper for flavor. So I asked the young lady behind the counter for chilli pepper. She rudely responded, "WE DON'T have any". I didn't think she understood me so I repeated "may I have some crushed pepper?" She replied, "the chef is busy and we don't have crushed pepper." I was appalled at her rude response and won't be going back. Honey it was 11am, if you are in a bad mood you should not be interacting with guests. The toast was good but for $13 and a nasty attitude from the staff I could make this at home.

The food here is delicious and it's a great place to just hang out and catch up with a friend. I would definitely return even though the service was not so great. I'm giving the rude waitress a pass cause life can happen and everyone can have an off day. I gave it four stars because of the waitress, she messed up my and my friend's order and then said she's going to have them redo it and 25 minutes later we never heard back from her. If my friend hadn't gone to inquire I don't think we'd ever get our food. Later on in our stay, she was replaced by a lovely gentleman, so him and the food were the saving grace for this place. Hopefully if you do go your experience starts with the pleasant gentleman as your waiter.
No comment
Golda is a gem within Bedstuy! The various dishes allows the customers to try simple dishes with a twist. Pastries, drinks and breakfast items are delicious. Def a must try in the area.

This little cafe is so inviting. The menu has great variety and Mediterranean favours that most people enjoy such as hummus, kebabs and couscous just to name a few. The dishes are flavourful and decadent. With every bite you have no choice but to finish the entire plate. Like many restaurants/cafes during the time of COVID, Golda is following covid requirements and ensuring safety to all customers. I would definitely stop by again as it's walking distance from my house. Thank you for having me!

Had the tahini latte today - tastes great, could use a bit more cardamom, but my problem was that the tahini paste clumps if you get it iced, so maybe get it hot to avoid gloops of tahini in your mouth heh

Bed-Stuy has a lot of excellent fried chicken sandwich places, but Golda might have by far the best. The fried chicken shell is so crispy and yet the chicken inside melts in your mouth. Love the slaw and delicious sauce. Always get the egg on top. This sandwich is out of this world.

Best fried chicken sandwich ever!! Chicken is so soft and tender, it melts in your mouth while the batter is crunchy and crispy! Everything else on the menu was super delicious and they had great selection of organic wines. Other favorites were the flatbread w. hummus and stuffed flank steak. Overall, I was happy with the service and the quality of food. I would highly recommend!

Golda forgot to send one of my items and when I called they refused to refund me the service fees and tip. They offered to refund me but told me to call Seamless and take care of it myself.
No comment
No comment

Wish this was a better experience. Went with a friend. We both ordered sandwiches. Her the fried chicken and me the trout sandwich. Both were weird. Hers was hard to eat and came on the tiniest plate. Her egg was also still gelatin and gooey on top. My trout dish was just weird. The bun was too soft to hold the soft insides. The weird sweet spread didn't go with the salty trout roe at all. It needed some texture and maybe some greens. I couldn't finish it. Fortunately the coffee was good. Overall I was pretty disappointed. Service was friendly though so at least there was that!
No comment

Oof. Not sure why this place has one of the highest reviews for brunch in the area. Not sure if they were having a bad day, but the service was very dismissive and seemed annoyed by any type of interaction. I ordered the Fried Chicken Sandwich and Yuzu vodka drink, my total came out to $35 before tip. Ok, that's fine if it were a banging sandwich and not a McDonald's size chicken sandwich with no sides and just... not good. I didn't finish despite my hunger because it just tasted like a lot of crunch dumped with seasoning. My vegan friend got the tabbouli salad -- which she also felt was lacking and overpriced. We were both bitter from this experience.
No comment
No comment

Just fine. Nothing to rave home about especially when a sandwich is $16 and another one is $12. Small intimate space that serves many options but the costs are just a little too high. Will not be returning.
No comment

Ordered doordash delivery from here. Garbage food - had the chicken sausage egg sandwich which was overly salty and creamy to the point where I couldn't enjoy the sausage and egg. Impossible burger was mediocre. Patty was hardly even done - almost still frozen. The Babaganoush was 5/10.
No comment
$18 for a mediocre vegetarian burger without any sides. I know it's Ny but that's just crazy.
No comment
Great food and a friendly environment!  Loved the Chicken sandwich and my wife loved the Kabab's!  Definitive going back every week.

during our visit, we unfortunately met counter staff who could benefit from training on how to engage disabled customers and how to be respectful towards trans customers. Unfortunate that this otherwise cute spot with a thoughtful menu is represented by this bitter person. Having worked in all aspects of the hospitality industry from front to back of house, we recognized that while a cafe is only as good as its staff, the kitchen deserved a chance, so we stayed. Brunch fare consisted of Israeli standards and favourites; mostly pleasant but unremarkable. The bizarre behaviour of the counterperson made more of an impression. It's quite snug inside; seating approximately 15 people on small stools. Clientele are majority gen Z and hipster aspiring, giving the place a high-school-cafeteria-in-a-shoebox vibe. Not a brunch destination, more a tasty to-go counter if you're already nearby.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This spot is a gem. Great coffee and tea. The chicken sandwich was delicious juicy yet crunchy and so flavorful. The watermelon schrub drink is very refreshing. The bacon and egg sandwich taste amazing with fluffy eggs and crispy bacon.

I am impressed, Golda was actually terrific. Great for a group of friends. My friend bought Brioche, which I tried and also liked. It was so flavorful. Not to mention, the service was very good and the staff was super pleasant. Golda - We will be back!
No comment

No comment
No comment
Everything is fantastic here, great service and fresh ingredients. Have only been for breakfast and brunch--their breakfast sandwich is awesome and I dream about the eggplant menemen!!!
No comment
No comment

Great coffee, the coffee was the best part of the meal 42.00 plus 6 dollar tip for two lattes,two sandwiches and a stale danish. The bacon egg cheese had burnt bacon. How the hell do let something inedible come out of your kitchen? I will recommend the sausage egg and cheese. What I will not recommend is the service, when I asked the gentleman behind the counter to pickup some dirty plates from the table in the window he gave me a dirty look for interrupting his conversation. I didn't really appreciate his pretentious tone and facial expressions.  I would like my tip refunded can't believe how angry i left!

I was excited to try this place but after checking it out,I've decided it was over-hyped. My sweet tahini oat milk latte, one of their specialties, was boring. I tasted no cardamom and any tahini flavor was lost to the oat milk...a waste of SIX DOLLARS. The brew Parlor coffee, whose retail shop  I enjoy going into when it's open to customers, their coffeess never wow me. Golda serves the same pastries as Konditori and the made to order food I saw was lackluster in presentation...we can all take half an avocado slice it and sprinkle chili flakes on top. One and done. Back to the unpretentious and reliably good, Daily Press across the street.
No comment

Not a super huge place for seating but the food is REALLY good! I got the Trout Egg Sandwich which was really well made. The fish eggs make it feel better than a basic egg sandwich. I also HIGHLY recommend the eggplant plate! I would've ordered two of those if I had the chance. My only note is that bread is hard. Like make my gum bleed hard, but I guess some people like that. Lol overall great place
No comment
No comment
This place is great but - how do you have only one person working the register AND making coffee during peak morning time? Makes wait time so long. Silly.

I was shocked by how small Golda is! Unfortunately it is extremely cramped, we were practically sitting on top of the people next to us. The food was great! We ordered the Cauliflower and the Chicken Sandwich. Both were delicious, but perhaps they could have added some spice to the food. Presentation was good.

This is more of a coffee shop rather than a restaurant. It's pretty small inside so be prepared to be a little squished in if you're planning to sit down and grab a bit to eat. Me and my friend got the breakfast plate which is $12.50. The food wasn't anything special. The best thing about the meal was the potatoes and bread. I rated it 3 stars because of price of the food and lack luster for taste. The coffee isn't anything special either. I can put this on my list of places I won't be returning too. Don't ask for ketchup because they don't have any.  The only reason I didn't give them 1 star is because their service is good.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

THE BEST HOLY moly. The wine selection is 10/10. The hummus and flatbread and israeli dips translate to the word perfect in culinary cuisine. Never ripped off regarding the specials (oysters sometimes) and main dishes. Everything on the menu is so warm (including the restaurant and servers) and what I expect when I want to spend money out on food.
No comment
No comment

Hidden gem in Brooklyn. Food and service were top notch. We tried almost everything on the menu including fried chicken sandwich, matbucha hummus and stuffed flank steak all of which were delicious. The organic wine selection was great as well. Would love to revisit soon!
Tasty. Kind and friendly staff. A great part of my morning. Ben and John went above and beyond excellent service
This is my favorite place in the neighborhood. Sun drenched, top notch cappuccino and amazing dishes. This place is heaven!

Yummmmmm the egg sandwich is perfect. The flat white is excellent. The space and ceramics beautiful. I love that there is a made to order served all day as well as pastries. So happy to have this spot in the neighborhood. Although it really does get busy even on a weekday morning.

I'm in love! Walked in here without any expectations, and was blown away by the quality and taste of the food. Had the eggplant Menemen for lunch, and wanted to lick the plate! All of the flavors were so clear and distinct; there must have been 4-5 in that one dish. Then tried a unique, very gourmet sweet roll with anise and buckwheat. It was SO good, and not too sweet. Again, it had so many flavors going. All of the baked goods looked amazing. Can't wait to go back to try more. As other reviewers have noted, it is a TINY place with little seating, but boy was it good. Truly a treat.
No comment

Super lovely little place - great iced tea and coffee. And then the food. Wow. I've never had cauliflower done so well that I felt like it was an actual meal. And it was beautiful to boot. Will definitely be back to try all the other interesting dishes!
No comment

Do not order from this place! They only delivered half my order, food is horrible (eggs were microwaved/bread was hard) and customer service when I called to let them know about all of this was not the best. Spend your money elsewhere that can give you at least basic quality food and service.

Super tasty food, simple but delicious ingredients. It's a bright and charming little spot. There are a few tables and some bar/counter-seating. I'd say the prices are a tad high, but definitely worth if you want a delicious quick grub.
No comment

While in the area on a Sunday, Yelp guided me to Golda. The picture of the smoked trout sandwich looked mouthwatering. It did not disappoint when served. It looks even better for real and tastes absolutely delicious. Scrambled egg, smoked trout and caviar on a brioche bun. Coming back.

Love this little cafe. The pastries are delicious (I've tried most of them!). Such creative recipes, with ingredients I'd never think of enjoying with my coffee (squash? eggplant? leeks?!). The sandwiches are also tasty and pretty filling. (I've had the fried chicken sandwich and the bacon and egg -- both delish.) The prices are on the high end so I go here when I want to treat myself. The owner and staff are lovely. They even added a hook outside to tie up your dog and pop inside. Keep it up, Golda!
So glad to see Danny back in the neighborhood! Great ambience, delicious coffee, super cute decor. Just what the neighborhood needs- we plan to be regulars!

Favorite new place on the block. The staff is so nice and always greet us with a smile. Everything on the brunch menu is delicious and comes out even more beautiful than I expect. The dishes can be pricy, but the taste and quality of the food delivers. For brunch, get the classic egg sando - for dinner service (thank god they're open for dinner now!), get anything with mushrooms.
You think you have had a breakfast sandwich....but you haven't! The food here was awesome (and worth the $13 sandwich special I had). Better though, was the friendly service. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
It was good, came here in a sweatshirt with the bae, no problem getting past the bouncer. Great hummus

I'm still assessing what just happened to my taste buds. I got the spinach and yam moussaka, which is nothing like the mushy mess my mother used to make. Every bite brought some new joy to my mouth...zesty, creamy...is that lavender?! Lord. I cannot emphasize how good this was. Just, go see for yourself.
I really liked their egg,salmon roe and avocado burger. It was fresh and tasty. Their iced latte was also very good. I will definitely come back soon.

Golda is insanely good! Everything they sell is beautiful, flavorful, and well portioned. I highly recommend their egg sandwich. The owner works the register and oversees everything that goes on so quality is unmatched. I just wish there was more seating because this place gets busy! One of my favorite breakfast spots in Brooklyn and maybe even all of NYC. Highly recommend!

Have been here many times for brunch, pastries, coffee, etc. but won't be returning. Arrived at 4:01pm to an open door but was refused a coffee to go because the shop closed at 4. I asked if the shop had coffee left - the barista said yes but he was unable to serve me after 4pm. I explained that he was currently pouring someone else a coffee and it was after 4pm, and asked if he could simply make another. He said he had to get going right after and the if he poured me a coffee after 4, a never ending line of people would continue to stream in. There was nobody on the street or outside the cafe. What a ridiculous way to run a business - pour one more coffee and make a sale (and don't lose a regular customer) then lock the door. And save your bad logic.

I had a great time. The place is small, however it was worth of waiting. The coffee is great!!! And, Chicken burger is awesome!!! Nice environment and cozy.  It was the taste that I never faced before. It is defiantly a place where Im going to come as much as possible.
Most delicious coffee and food and the staff is extremely friendly! Great addition to the neighborhood! I will definitely be back!
Amazing culinary combinations, twists on the norms, fresh ingredients, and masters with spices!
No comment

Honestly, I have never been somewhere where they bring out our meals at completely different times. We went for late lunch, ordered our respective dishes, one came out.... we waited for the other, it wasn't coming out, so I picked at my husbands food , asked where the second dish was, they said it was coming out,.... My husband was done eating for some time, so I was finally going to cancel our order when they brought my dish out. Totally unapologetic, to be honest they were pretty oblivious. And it wasn't even busy, it was 3:30pm. For food that's at manahattan prices ... and pretty out of the way. I would not come back.

Found this spot walking around and was pleasantly surprised! Ordered a coffee with two eggs and potatoes. The potatoes were delicious, seasoned with a nice cigarette, and the coffee and service was delightful!

Small and busy so grab a seat as soon as you see one! Had a delicious, low key brunch here with a friend. Food was creative, beautifully prepared and tasty. Love it and will definitely be back, great addition to the neighborhood.
Really good! Very imaginative and flavorful food. I had smoked trout sandwich on brioche bun. Yum

Incredibly pleasant morning coffee experience. They took time to describe their menu, describing their pastries and ingredients in detail. The pistachio rose was incredible - not too sweet and very flavorful. You won't regret stopping by!

I live in the neighborhood and was so excited to see this cafe. This review is purely for the frittata - for $17, I expected a little bit more than what I got. The dish lacked some kind of seasoning - maybe some salt would have been good - and there was no side salad, no bread, nothing else. If I'm going to pay $17 for a frittata that was mostly greens and not very filling, I'd expect a little something on the side to tide me over. I did try some of my friends bread that came with the hummus dish, and it was really good. Overall, the place is cute and has good ambience, but this dish was lacking.

This place is a necessary addition to our little piece of Franklin Ave. Went in initially just curious about what they sold, and left appropriately full from a delicious egg sandwich and s pastry. This place has a simple menu with some unique ingredients that add just the right amount of flare. Highly, highly recommend.
With friendly staff, an outside-the-box breakfast menu and superb coffee, Golda is a welcome addition to an otherwise (gastronomically) barren Bed-Stuy neighborhood.
Great food. I had the trout sandwich and it was amazing. The owner and staff are super nice.
Great new addition to the hood. Great food and coffee and it won't break the bank. Lunch for 2 is around $30.

Small place dedicated to quality of food and personal attention to customers.  I had the Turkish breakfast, which seems pricey at first blush, but it was a very generous portion of a wide assortment, kind of like a substantial graze on two plates.  Very creative and tasty.  They have been up and running for about a month.  They do all of their own baking in the basement.  I was given a custard cardamom bun gratis to finish my meal.  Owner Danny is genuinely friendly.  If they continue to deliver with the service and food, they will need more space

stopped in the other day after hearing rave reviews everywhere and I must say this is the best breakfast joint in town. service was impeccable and place was decorated nicely     shout out to danny for recommending insanely delicious pastries and pecan latte.  will be back very soon and will be sure to spread the word. a+
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Took my daughter to skirt steak as it was on our list of places to try. Service was quick, and efficient food was cooked as asked. Good place for a quick meal with friends. There is not a lot to choose from, but that is the point.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Skirt Steak, a restaurant that gets straight to to point. Their menu consist of skirt steak, bearnaise sauce, field greens salad, and unlimited fries. All for just $35. Located in Chelsea/ NoMad Manhattan, this place is a casual, quick dining experience. Fun Fact: The boast about this restaurant went live on TicToc. Since then there has been a line outside daily. How was it:  OK! For the price and volume of people they did a good job. Skirt steak is not my favorite, period. But the sauce was good and the service I received was excellent. I requested a medium steak and received one that was medium well. The exchange was done with no push back and the effort to please
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The prix fixe steak and the unlimited fries are delicious but the salad needs improvement. The steak can be rare, medium or well. There's a dessert cart which was pushed around in a clear box which is good presentation. The staff were friendly. The ambiance is phenomenal! Would come here again!
No comment

Food is good but not worth the price increase. Previously it was $28, right now it's $39 for salad, steak and unlimited fries. Had a party of 3, waited about an hour in line on a Saturday night and ended up sitting at the bar. We added the cheesy potatos which was delicious! Super cheesy and not too salty. The steak was cooked a perfect medium rare and the fries were hot and fresh. I'm personally not a fan of the salad. I'd recommend coming here at least once for the experience
The menu is pre fixed. The steak and béarnaise sauce is amazing, and you can't beat unlimited fries. The service was what stood out the most-fantastic and friendly staff! Would definitely recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
It's a set price that consists of steak your way, a salad, unlimited fries, for the price it's fair

Came here due to alll the hype from TikTok. The concept is there but the execution in terms of how well the food taste fell flat for me. You definitely get served a good portion of food that'll leave you full and I feel like most people come here for the $35 price point, However, the steak was a little bland and lacked flavor. Not to mention, the cuts we received were chewy. The fries were okay, a little cold & needed salt (they give when you ask) -- the drinks were also pretty okay.

Wow! 39 per person what a great deal and so delicious. All the staff was so helpful and nice. By far, the best dinner we had .
