column3: Central Fort Lauderdale, Fort Lauderdale, FL
column6: No comment

This place has a limited menu, but what they provide is cooked well.  The service was good, but a little slow even though there wasn't a full house. Overall I felt there wasn't great enough selection and nothing special enough for me to recommend coming here more than once.  For the price, I didn't see value, but at least the place is good to meet friends and have a conversation.

Came here for Valentine's Day. It was an hour and a half wait to get it. They had a pre-fix special for $115, 2 glass of champagne, 2 salad, 2 skirt steak, fries, potato puffs, and a slice of cake. They food was well cooked and very tasty. The staff was polite and didn't rush us through the meal which was very nice considering the long line to get it. I'd recommend this restaurant, but don't think it's worth that long of a wait.

Great experience...  When a place only offers basically one thing on their menu, I definitely give it a try, expecting them to do it right, and this place will not disappoint.  Starts off with a light salad (which was very good), then the main event of skirt steak with gravy on the side, bottomless fries  (which I didn't really need).  We also tried some items off their dessert cart, which was pretty good.  Nice setting, and attentive staff, so overall a great experience.  They do not offer reservations though, so you have to wait in line.  We got there shortly after opening though, so it wasn't too bad a wait.

Really enjoyed skirt steak and their prefix menu. For appetizers we had the salad and ordered the garlic bread to share. The entree of skirt steak was delicious and the portion size is definitely bigger than I expected. The french fries were delicious and crispy. We did have to wait around 30-40mins but the wait was definitely worth it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Prix fixe skirt steak, salads & unlimited fries. Desserts were add-ons, hazelnut choux was better than the coconut chocolate cake. They changed their price tag recently... it was $28 back in July, but now it was stated as $35. The watermelon pickle drink (Not sure about the name) was quite special. Overall the portion of the skirt steak was quite small imo, the hospitality was amazing tho!
No comment
The steak was delicious and perfectly cooked. The fries hot and fresh. The salad issa no for me. The cauliflower was sooo good. I think about that dish and will be back because of it.

The food was mediocre at best. Service was fast. The staff were nice.  Good ambiance. Tiny table and uncomfortable chairs. Salad tasted like onions.  Steak size was petite. The french fries remind me of school lunch. The bread and sweet potato sides were good. The desserts were great. We had the chocolate cake and some type of hazelnut cream pastry. The blackberry spritz cocktail was good! I'd say this might be a good place for a quick lunch IF you're already in the area. I would come back and go to the bar. It's disappointing, because my best friend and I have been talking about coming to this restaurant for a while now. It did not meet our expectations, sadly. My friend ordered her steak well done. It was a bad decision. My medium steak was much better. I wish they offered another sauce besides bearnaise. A chimichurri sauce would have been better.

Average steak tbh. For $34 I guess you can't go wrong. Fries were very good however menu was confusing. They wrote " all sides $12" which could be interpreted as all sides for $12 instead of working "each side $12". Also we wanted to upgrade our fries to truffle fries not ADD truffle fries ontop if the fries included. Just meh. Definitely would not have waited for this place like some people did. Luckily we walked in on a Sunday at 6pm without any wait.

I work in the area and have noticed the long lines for this steakhouse. Did a little research and was intrigued by the unlimited fries offer. Went for midweek lunch at open, got a table and the $30 steak, fries, and salad deal. I think it went up from $28 just a month or two ago. Inflation? The steak was prepared well, not a fan of the steak sauce side, the salad was very good. The fries were very good as well. Good concept well executed.

This is a popular place for a reason. The service is top notch with constant care and general kindness. We went all out: garlic bread, a regular steak meal for me and the wagyu upgrade for my husband. Both our meals included an appetizer salad plus some seriously delicious fries to accompany the steaks. The cooks here know how to cook meat. This is among the best we've had in a restaurant. Then there is the dessert. There is a dessert cart that abounds with sweet wonders. I had to choose two: the Paris-Brest and the Black Forest Cake. Oh my. What a brilliant finish for the meal.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Friendly service, good food, and a nice atmosphere -- overall, a good experience at Skirt Steak! The unlimited fries are truly unlimited, they will keep 'em coming!
No comment

At first you think you will be in line for a long time until your seated. But there is virtually no wait if you select bar seating. Skirt steak is a bustling place, people are consistently going in and out. The food is served quickly, being that the menu is super limited. You are mainly going for  a salad, skirt steak and fries. They do serve you water and delicious toasty bread. That was the best bread that I've had in a long time. I had the perfect spicy marg, the fields green salad  I wasn't crazy about,  but the steak and endless fries were amazingly good. The service was superb, the atmosphere was light. They were pushing around a dessert trolly. I had the hazelnut pastry

The fries and steak were great. It is the typical type of place though where you are constantly asked if you want any add-ons to the pre fixed price or to add any sauces. Tough to find your waiter when requesting more fries. Overall a good experience and kind of what we expected from the service.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really good wagu steak for under $30. The steak is cooked to your preference. It comes with a salad, and unlimited fries. The fries were a bit to salty for me so, I only had one helping. I passed on a second. The steak is really good. The almond cake dessert is about $12 but it is absolutely delicious. They have indoor & outdoor seating. It was a summer night and early afternoon, so I opted for outdoor seating. The staff is really nice & efficient. The bathrooms are very clean. The lines can be a bit overwhelming but we opted for out door seating, & we were seated in less than  10 mins.
No comment

Always love trying a new steakhouse. This one seemed to have a bunch of hype behind it through social medial and the deal of steak, salad and unlimited fries for $30. We ordered cocktails (martinis and old fashioned) to start, both not great. You can pay an extra fee for waygu beef which we did for one of them to try. I thought it was gonna be more steak, but not the biggest order. The steak literally came warm and even closer on the cold side. Cooked it to our liking, but honestly, I'd rather pay double for a great steak. Wouldn't come back here at all with the other options in NYC.
No comment

This has to be one of my FAVORITE places from our visit to nyc. I wish they would bring this concept to Phoenix. It's very simple. There's really no menu here. They will ask you if you want garlic bread or regular bread, you have to go garlic. Don't mess around. And then they will ask each person if they want their steak rare, medium or well. I traditional order a medium rare and the medium was right on temp of what I enjoy. They bring a peppercorn sauce with the steak but to be honest the steak was better without it. They also bring you unlimited fries to go with. The price per person is about $35 when we went. I tried some of the extra cost sides and would just stick to the included fries in the future. The dessert cart is also amazing. The one thing you have to try is the pumpkin cheesecake. I don't like pumpkin flavored items but this was really light and wouldn't know it was pumpkin unless they told me. It was one of the best desserts I've ever had.

The best deal. This is a pre-fix menu so you'll get salad, steak, and endless fries!! I believe it's $30-$40 and totally worth it. There was a line at the time we should up mid-day but we got in after roughly 10 minutes. Staff was super friendly and the manager was walking around asking how everything went. Can't wait to go back!

I came here for dinner on a Thursday night with a friend. Everyone says this place has a good deal for $28 since you get skirt steak (2 portions), unlimited French fries, and a butter lettuce salad. I decided to come early at 5pm when it opened to avoid waiting on a long line. The wait wasn't too bad, got seated after 20 minute wait. I ordered the steak medium but I feel like I should've ordered rare since it was so burnt. It was also super salty. The French fries were okay, many of the fries were overly fried so definitely ask for more refills so you get a fresh batch. The butter lettuce salad was decent but it's just lettuce. They could've added some croutons or a topping at least. Would I come back? Probably not. I don't think it's worth the hype.
No comment
No comment

Solid dinner spot if you're craving dinner. Came for dinner on a Monday evening. I think my group waited for about an hour, maybe even more, before we got seated. I thought the medium steak was great and you know I jumped on those endless fries. One thing I noticed was that the servers seemed a little all over the place. They would forget things and we were practically done with our steaks by the time our final side came out. They were all nice though, so maybe it was just a particularly busy night. Overall, glad I got to try this place out.
No comment

This place definitely delivers on quality when it comes to their steak and fries. The salad needs improvement since it was NOT great at all. I was surprised they charged us for the table bread but it tasted lovely. We actually witnessed a staff member bring over the desserts from next door on a cart which wasn't covered properly. Unfortunately all the desserts were exposed to the NYC Covid air. Definitely a turn off please be mindful of how you handle your food as this is concerning.
No comment

0 menu variety so unless everyone is comfortable with steak and fries, don't come here. Steak was good quality and fries were very fresh. My main complaint was that the restaurant was freezing inside!

Steak and fries were decent quality for the price, but it wasn't a lot of steak hence the low price. The salad that came with the steak was pretty bland and I would say the dessert cart isn't really worth it. I might consider coming back here if a friend really wanted to, but I'd rather cook a steak at home if I had a real craving for one.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Salad, skirt steak, and unlimited fries for $39. You can only get the steak rare, medium, or well. If you want a waygu steak it's an extra $30. I got the steak medium and it was really chewy. I usually like medium well but that wasn't an option. Spinach, garlic bread, and cheesy potatoes are an extra $10. You cannot make reservations unless it's a group of 7 or more. I arrived around 6:15pm and there was a line outside but we were seated quickly; only had about a 15 min wait.

Great restaurant concept. Get there super early because the line starts forming at 4:30pm for the 5pm seating. Fries were absolutely delicious, crispy, and truly unlimited. Steak was cooked perfectly but was a very small portion, which makes sense given the $28 price point.
Food was reallyyyyyyyyy goooood. Classic martini so yum. Had the cauliflower and cheese. So delicious.

I got here right when it opened, which I recommend, because a line does form! I would say this is an OK place. I think their marketing on TIK TOK & unlimited fries have got it pretty popular, but overall the food its self was mediocre. If you like crispy fries, like myself then this is a place for you, as you can get an unlimited quantity of them...hehe. The host was very sweet and I want to give a 5 for the host who seated us, but for the quality of food and its service there wasn't anything significant worth raving really. My party was most concerned about the cook of the steak as they only offer two options: Medium or Rare & in previous reviews a lot of people shared that Medium is more close to being well done and rare is TOO rare. I think they cooked our steaks close to Medium, so we got lucky.
No comment

Gregory and all the staff were amazing. Fine fine eating at a great price. Their concept is straight forward and everything on the menu is yummy! And the salad can be a bit elevated if you ask for oil and vinegar. Honest for the price, atmosphere and the service the salad is the least of your worries. Would highly recommend for a date night or just for some GREAT STEAK !! 10/10
No comment

This place was good, the steak had a good taste, it had endless fries, but there was just something missing. I don't know what was, but it just felt that way. The service was great, the drinks were good. I definitely recommend this place, because over all the food was good. Come try it out, it was a great experience. The lines are long, so get there early.
No comment
No comment

Great place for a delish meal that doesn't require much thought! Only 3 things on the menu (greens, skirt steak and fries!) so all you need to do is know the temperature of the steak and you are all set. Bread and butter is given for the table but they offer garlic bread for a charge. At $10 I was ok with the bread provided but was still very tasty. The greens came with a vinaigrette and the steak and fries is presented together. Delicious. Steak was tender and charred so well. It is served with a peppercorn/herb sauce that adds another layer of flavor. The fries that are bottomless are served hot and crispy. The perfect accompaniment. I am a big fan of steak frites and this is one of the best! Nice ambiance, clean, modern and bright unfinished look but modern rustic feel. Friendly staff and great location, parking steps away at icon. Will definitely be back for more!
No comment

Holy hell! There is a line to this place and there's a reason! It's so friggin good. Even the salad is good. And wow, the béarnaise sauce? It's the best, Jerry, the best. Steak were cooks perfectly (we ordered one rare. one medium). And by the second round a fries, I couldn't remember when i has a better, simple dinner. So good

Limited menu but that shouldn't be a surprise.  The food is really flavorful.   The steak is tender and cooked correctly.   This isn't a place to go if you're trying to watch calories.   The service is fair ( maybe a bit stiff ) but the place is new so I expect the staff will get more comfortable.   The ambiance is rustic unfinished walls and sparse decorations.
No comment

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner a while ago. We had high hopes for this restaurant because we had a good experience with another steak and fries place but our experience was not very pleasant. I ordered well done steak and my boyfriend ordered medium. My steak (pictured) was uneven so one side of the steak was fully cooked and the other side was more medium rare. It felt very tough and we didn't end up finishing our steak. I also found a HAIR in my fries (which were basically cold). They didn't apologize but they did bring me another portion. We attempted to call for the bill for 10-ish minutes maybe but the waiters walked right past us. I wish the waiters were a bit more attentive because they seemed nice. I would 100% recommended Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecôte but I think they may have closed their locations.

Unreal.  Got there 4:30. Walked in and asked if we are able to sit at a bar and share since we were not so hungry. They said no problem. We wait for 45 min to be seated at the bar. Once seated. They say each person has to order and can't share. It is stated on the site. Asked for a manger. He didn't have a clue and asked the person telling us it is not possible if it is written at the site.
No comment

Both times I came were at 7pm Friday/Saturday. Line was long but moved fairly quickly. No complaints about the wait. The fries, hot and crispy! The steak, made to your liking and juicy never a dull dry piece. Paid $30 more for the wagyu. Unfortunately mine was under cooked although it wasn't done to our liking they did re fire it for us and offered free dessert. So no offense taken. The skirt manhattan was a great drink.

We did have to wait in line for 45 minutes for this spot but it was sooooo worth it! Reminded me of the steak frites only concept in Paris. Only $35 for a an amazing dinner in NYC is so rare! We opted for the upgrade to Wagyu steak ($30 more) and it was delicious. Also, they made me the most perfect martini. I was too full to try dessert but can't wait until my next trip to NYC to try this place again!

I was hoping to give it a 2.5 star rating but since I can't, I'll round up to 3 stars. Unfortunately this place is overhyped and not worth the hour plus wait in line. It took us 1 hour and 30 minutes to get into the restaurant and the service was great, however the food was decent. In my opinion this place is popular because of Tik tok, but the food is not very tasty. The steak is tender which is nice, but it was bland and had an overpowering burnt taste. The fries were delicious and unlimited so I can't complain about that. The salad was drenched in dressing which took away from its natural crisp, and the garlic bread was simply just hard bread with butter. The complimentary bread and butter weren't any better. I've had a better steak dinner at Applebee's for a much cheaper price. I wouldn't recommend this as your first choice in a steakhouse.
No comment

Wasn't a huge fan of the food itself, but the cost is unbeatable. Felt the steak was overly charred and we asked for Medium and it came out Rare (suuuper pink). Normally like a charred, smokey taste but this was just too burnt. The sauce they pair the steak with is similar to a Hollandaise sauce, definitely has an egg yolk-base. The salad and service were both great. And how the fries are unlimited is a nice offering. But probably wouldn't come again for the steak itself. As for the wait, friend and I came on a Sat at around 1-2pm and we were seated within 20 min or so which wasn't bad at all considering how the line wraps around the block sometimes, especially for dinner.

Love this place it has unlimited fries and easy menu to follow which is salad french fries and steak. Definitely perfect for a date night or just hanging out with friends. It opens up at 5 o'clock so get there early because the line tends to wrap around the block. Side note do you have a choice of the traditional skirt steak or you can pay a little extra and get a different cut, which was amazing.
No comment
No comment
They don't actually close at 10:30 they refuse to serve people after 10. Stop the false advertisement. It's truly annoying and shit service to turn away paying customers.

The food was really good but the service was a bit chaotic. The food came really quickly after we were seated which was great but we asked for medium and rare (which they write on the table cloth) and received two rares. Between us and the couple next to us, we're asked 8-10 times if we want dessert which was a bit annoying. We did wait about 45-50 minutes to get in but the line moved consistently. Overall I'd go again but definitely good to be aware of the wait.

We tried out this place for my boyfriends birthday. The lines get long so we opted to go early at 5pm and we were able to get seated within 20 minutes. The steak deal is decent for the money although I personally think mine was a bit too charred. Definitely worth trying once for the "tik tok craze" but otherwise I'm not sure if the lines are worth it!

I came here because of the huge buzz this place has on instagram. The wait was rather long but it gave you a chance to people watch and build up an appetite. Once inside there decor is pretty simple, exposed wood,multiple lights and the tables are covered with what appears to be butcher paper.  The waitress was super energetic and friendly. The complimentary bread was a nice snack followed by the house salad.  The menu is pretty much set at steak and fries and the salad has only the house dressing.  I ordered the blackberry spritz and my steak medium. The drink looked good but was truly lacking in the alcohol department so much so i forgot to take a picture of it lol. When the steak came out it looked amazing and smelled even better. There was a sauce on the side that i don't quite know what it was,but i was dipping every bite into it.  The fries were plentiful and hot and really good. This place has a huge buzz and for 28-30$ for steak a salad and unlimited fries it is quite a good deal. I would suggest maybe drinking elsewhere before you come here to avoid the added expense of their cocktails, which were not very strong at all but packed a huge price punch of 15$ a piece.  In all i would definitely come back here, the food was very good and  the price cant be beat. I would definitely drink elsewhere next time but in all it was a great experience.
No comment
No comment

What's there to say about Skirt Steak? On a Friday night we waited 25 minutes and a server sat us before a few others since we had a table of 3 and everyone else a head of us were couples.  Everyone eats the same thing unless you want their garlic bread or sides. For $28 you get salad, a very good portion of skirt steak and unlimited fries. The fries and steak pair well together. Overall, a great meal without having to think bout what to order. Would come back for sure!

We went around 6:25pm and were seated by 6:57. Service was fast the menu was simple. The salad was fresh and full of different lettuce, fresh herbs, onions and a creamy vinegarette.. the steak was perfect! So tender and juciy. The fries were slightly overdone and I feel like the oil needed to be changed. However, they have potential to be perfect. For dessert we had the Black Forrest cake and it was delicious. The ambiance was great the staff was friendly. Overall an awesome experience. I will dream about the steak.
No comment

Skirt will become one of your "go to" spots to satisfy your steak and frites cravings. You can afford to return again and again; though, the basic price point has risen ten dollars or so since it opened. At the current price of $38 or $39, you get 8 ounces of skirt steak and all you can eat fries, with a salad to start things. The salad has become perceptibly smaller over the last year (and there were green or red peppers, cucumbers, tomatoes or some kind of other veggies in there when I started visiting, but they are missing now), but you will appreciate the endives and vinaigrette dressing, with cracked pepper upon request that pops nicely. The bread is good too, but the garlic bread, an extra not in the basic price, is the real deal. The steak is only made to order rare, medium and well done. My preference here is rare, given I usually order medium rare. Ask them to go easy with the salt if you are sodium sensitive and I would not recommend a temperature over medium at any place anyway, but particularly here. Beware of the peppercorn sauce, for it can be occasionally too salty for my tastes depending on the day. The fries are excellent and, if you have a thing for fries, the all you can eat fries will fix that. They have good desserts, but I rarely experience them. The waiters will ask the ladies if they would like dessert, not the guy. The service is quite good and I never have a complaint. The atmosphere reminds me of ski lodges and is quite welcome. For value (where in Midtown are you going to find this?), service and atmosphere, you will return again and again as I do.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

A great deal, which is why there's always a line out the door. I went right when they opened and there was already a line forming, though I was seated right away. Definitely arrive between 5-6 before it gets super busy. They only specialize in one thing - steak frites for $30. And I thoroughly enjoyed it. Steak came out hot, tender and juicy. I got the medium which was cooked well, just a little bit underdone in a few small areas. Fries were thin and crispy - maybe a little too crispy and not salted enough (McDonald's fries are better IMO) but still delicious, and they're unlimited. The bernaise sauce was delicious on the steak and the fries, I didn't need anything more. Got the blackberry spritz which was delicious. Had I gone with a friend I might've gotten one of their sides or the garlic bread, but I couldn't justify $10 for garlic bread on my own. All in all, would definitely return for an affordable and satisfying steak dinner.

good but just good - for $40/person w/o tip we got a medium amount of steak, trendy decor/made-for-tourist vibes, and felt a little rushed by staff. Steak and sauce are solid but nothing to write home about. seems like you could get a better vibe and bigger and better steak and side for the same price somewhere else

This is an interesting restaurant experience. There is essentially only 1 thing on the menu and that's a salad, skirt steak and unlimited fries. I was initially very excited after seeing the long line there was to get in . I'll say that a 10oz or so steak (can only be prepared rare, medium, or we'll done-- nothing in the middle),  a bitter salad that no one in my family but me could eat and fries that are mainly cold and overcooked is not worth 30 bucks. The service was also spotty at best. I kind of like the idea, but I think it's not executed very well here. The shining star of the evening was the Froze wine drink (but even that was 17 bucks). It's a no for me.
No comment
No comment
Overpriced mediocre food. Charged me 30 dollars more then the menu price. Don't go here, it's fraud.
No comment
No comment

The skirt steak here is delicious!! However, you do have to come early in order to secure a table unfortunately. I had both the regular skirt and the Wagyu, definitely get the Wagyu. Its worth the price difference. Unfortunately I feel like the sizes of the steaks could be bigger. The two times I came here I still left feeling hungry as I didn't want more fries but needed more protein. They wont let you order another steak unless you order the prefix and pay full price again. Wish they had an option to just add on the price of the steak. Wouldve been 5 stars if it wasnt for those few things. Service is good.
Other options but come for the salad, steak and unlimited fries. Great price! Service was good, we enjoyed it here.

Saw all the social media hype and it looked amazing. To be honest not worth the trip to the city for it. Overpriced steak and not the best tasting, unless you really want unlimited fries then I guess. Extremely charred tasting steak order medium and outside was burnt like.
No comment

I soooo wanted to give 5 stars. The steak was a-ma-zing! Dessert was spectacular.  The only flaw I had with the restaurant was that my waiter only asked me once if I was ok and asked others he waited on if they were ok multiple times. The fries were a bit hard also. Other than that this place is a must visit.
No comment
No comment

Great experience here! My friend and I ate outside. Come early because the line fills quickly! We didn't have a long wait because we came right after 5. The food is good! Especially the fries and the sauce that comes with the steak. The drinks were great too! We had the blackberry spritz. Very tasty. Only con is the steak is very small but it's $30 for the pre fixe so don't expect a large steak! Also our waiter was trying to rush us out but I understand because there was a line. Overall nice time!

First visit to this wonderfully simple restaurant. Greens, Skirt Steak and fries-simple and very good. Prepare to wait 30 or more minutes for a table. The food was worth the wait. Also, try the mixed drinks-excellent.
No comment
Steak frites has never been so easy. Unique spot in NY for all you can eat fries and a tender and delicious steak.

I mean if you don't want to spend an astronomical amount on steak go here it's decently priced, the steak was small but good quality. If your looking for a no frills quick meal go here, the Black Forest cake was really Good

Long club like wait in the winter people will stare at you like if you are getting into the most posh club in nyc not knowing it's a cozy little steak house. I recently saw and was sent the best places in NYC that serve fries...This was not there? Epic fail. Not only is this the best French fries I've ever had, they are unlimited! Oh and they have a kick ass Skirt Steak as the house name implies. Run and enjoy nuff said!

Got here at @ 9:45 and they are closed but it say's open until 10:30pm drove all the Brooklyn which was an hour closed for no reason pissed off

We got there around 4:40 (they open at 5) and the line was already stretched around the storefront. We got in in the first round and the food was pretty good! My partner and I both got a rare steaks and garlic bread. The fries were also yummy, crisp and hot. It's good food for the value.

Love the steak!!! Fries can improve but overall it's delicious. Friendly staff!!! Not having reservation system is a flaw.

Honestly the wait was not worth it. The steak was delicious and the service was amazing don't get me wrong. But the sides and desserts were basic. The hen of the woods mushroom side was not worth the price. Definitely over hyped.

Honestly utterly disappointed with the quality of the food. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The service in general is very organized, and quick. However, the food was below average. The garlic bread takes a jaw workout to get through, the salad is a salty mess, and the fries are just about okay. The steaks tops it off by being burnt and rubbery. Even though we cooked it to medium rare, it was hard to chew and unmanageable. It was beyond charred and just tasted like charcoal. It's definitely not worth the hype, and wouldn't recommend.

The salad , stake and desert were delicious. Of course, fries too! Highly recommend this place.

This is such a big hype on tictok and insta that my friend and I decided check it out. Since they don't do reservations for people under 7 or more, you do have to get there early if you want to try this spot. My friend got there at 6pm and we didn't get a table until 7:30 on a Friday.... Yeah that was a little crazy. Once you in, you have a simple menu and there are a few upgrades for extra charge. We started with the garlic bread with cheese which was an extra charge... but it was delicious. Salad was okay... I personally didn't like the fact it was large pieces of iceberg lettuce but the dressing was pretty good. For the mains, the French fries were good but could have been a little more crunchy, and the steak (which I asked well done) was a little burnt and the pieces were inconsistent. Dessert was amazing! They went around with a dessert cart where you and pick out whatever you want for an additional 10 bucks. I got the pastry with the hazelnut spread ... it was delicious and very satisfying. Would I come back? Maybe.... But definitely during Monday-Thursday and hope the wait isn't that long

Mediocre food at this price point. Selling one of the cheapest cuts available while serving up $12 wine bottles and up charging x4 is not fun. Would usually turn a blind eye, but food and experience just was lackluster. Low in flavor, tough texture, not even full afterwards.

Worth the hype!!! If you go here you know exactly what your going to get: great steak and endless crispy fries. The medium rare was perfectly cooked and the staff was very friendly. No reservations so be prepared to wait in line.
No comment
I ordered the Wagyu steak (upgraded) wow so good. The Paris-Brest dessert was very tasty. I really recommend this place.

It's was aiites I don't get why the fuss & long lines guess cuz only 30bux but c'mon it's just skirt steak ppl giving this place 5 stars have never been to a tru steakhouse.... Not impressed but service was on point & my boyz did get a 2nd servings of fries!!

Waited too long then when seated asked about allergens as I have a nut allergy - they cook everything in peanut oil. This isn't said anywhere on the menu or clearly within the restaurant so not helpful for those with life threatening allergies. Also looked gross so I didn't feel bad leaving before I ordered!

Came here with my girls for a ladies night on a Friday night! If you are coming with a party less than 7, expect wait.. ON A LINE!  waited over an hour! Last time I waited on a line was for the club, which is why I stop going to them decades ago lol! So you know I'm like, this food better BOMB! Needless to say, it was! It's a prefix menu- comes with salad, steak, & unlimited fries! My girls and I love eating so we also had one of each side ! Sides were low carb friendly! To start, salad could be better! Medium steak was juicy, flavorful, and sauce complimented well! Had the cauli Mac n cheese! Bomb AF! The dessert tray selection was vast! One of each was ordered lol...Lemon cheesecake was my go to and great! The chocolate cakes were dense - def not for me! Overall, despite the wait (why I couldn't give it 5 stars), the experience was great for a ladies night!

This place was cool. Obviously seen the epic tik tok video and it lived up to their potential. Steak was great. Fries were great service was great. Drinks were good but the line to get in. Not cute. They need a reservation service because I waited a hour and still just agreed to sit at the bar because it was the only thing that was gonna get me inside quick.

The salad to start was horrible, the vegetables were bitter. The fries was not bad and the steak was alright. I did not like the sauce as much. The servers were not the best. Would definitely not come back againz

The food here is very delicious and very reasonably priced for how good it is. However, I took off a star because it's very difficult to get a table. They don't do reservations. I arrived 4:45pm on a Sunday. I thought it would be early enough to not have much trouble. However, there was already a line down the block when I arrived. We were able to get seated within 30 minutes because we were a party of 2 and were ok with sitting at the bar. For the prix-fixe menu, it is skirt steak in 1 of 3 temperatures (rare, medium rare and well done), endless fries and mixed greens, all for $28. The dessert cart was incredible too.
No comment

The steak was burnt. It tasted bitter. This is after standing in line for an hour... service was okay for NYC standard. Save the money and go elsewhere for quality steak... not this carcinogenic meat. Not worth the hype.

This was by far, the biggest waste of money and time. I have never in my lifetime been so disappointed by a restaurant. The steak was disgustingly chewy, no seasoning. The best part of the the steak was the sauce they gave to you onSteak FritesRare SteakFields Green Salad the side. Might I add that there was ALSO NO RESTROOM! The waiter told us to use the bathroom at McDonald's across the street. The stuffed mushrooms was so bland and had the texture of baby food, I could not even get a FORK in the Brussels sprouts. It was not worth the money even though this establishment is marketed to be of good value. The best thing was the garlic bread. Service was great but the food was horrible. Do not recommend. Had a better meal at Burger King last night while sitting next to a crackhead in the middle of herald square.

Came here for dinner right after they opened, was decently full and they had only been open for 15 minutes but I didn't have to wait. Actually very impressed by how good the service was at this place. My waiter was very courteous throughout my entire meal however I did find it quite annoying how two other workers kept approaching my table and asked whether or not I was finished with my salad. They kept walked around in circles and every time they passed by my table they HAD to ask whether or not I was finished. In total I was asked around 5 times and even the couple who sat next to me laughed and thought it was rather strange how they were rushing me to finish my salad. The steak, fries and the salad were all great but the garlic bread was rather hard to chew ( would not recommend especially for 9$) . Overall, good experience would come again :)

They do what they do... and they do it well.  The salad was crisp and fresh, although the dressing could have had a bit more kick.  The steak was.  seasoned and cooked perfectly, allowing me to use the bearnaise for the fries (a perfect match). My only complaint is $28 for a cauliflower steak with no sauce (our vegan doesn't do bearnaise.). Still, I'll be back.

Rustic look, friendly service and excellent food. The bread with sea salted butter, delicious greens salad with great seasoning that is perfectly dressed.  The steak is flavorful served with bernaise sauce that is all great. The French fries are served hot, crispy with the right amount of salt. The dessert cart has a lot of terrific choices, but the Paris Brest is different and wonderful. We will be back soon.

I had learned about the restaurant via Tik Tok and decided to check it out and it was definitely a great treat. Staff was very helpful, friendly and accommodating. You have to definitely come as close to 5 as possible or else you risk being in a very long line to get in. Once your in you will get seated relatively quick. The entree is a fixed meal which consists of a salad, steak and fries.. all very nicely made and delicious. Any additional sides were 9 dollars which we chose the garlic bread and cauliflower w/ cheese carousel both were simply amazing...  We ended our dinner with a Chocolate mousse and a key lime pie which are an addition 9 dollars each... both were great options and very good. Great job guys!

This place is definitely overhyped but not a bad price for salad, steak and unlimited fries. Cocktails are pricey but quite strong. I would say if you're in the area just try it but do not go out of your way for this restaurant.

The food was good but not worth to wait for 25m outside. They should get rid of the unlimited fries and just charge 24.99 for the meal instead if $30. The portion of the meat is small i guess the unlimited fries is to supplement. The desserts are mediocre. However the service is extremely fast.

This such a delicious meal for a very reasonable price. Everything was really high quality. The service was excellent and the endless fries and dessert cart made it really fun. All around a great experience and worth the wait!

Got here for my friend's recommendation and it was pretty good. Everyone gets same menu bread, salad, steak, and unlimited fries. But anything else is extra such as desserts, more bread, and side dishes. Usually there is a huge line in nyc and wait is long.
I stopped in for a glass of wine and ordered garlic bread just for a snack as I have a salad to eat later at the hotel- I ate the WHOLE garlic bread- it was absolutely amazing! Order it if you go!

The fries were crispy, slightly salty, and always hot. The froze was delicious and refreshing. DO NOT get the wagyu from here. It's an extra $30 for the char parts to taste burnt. The Arawak portion is maybe 4 oz. To pay $60 for 4 oz portion for wagyu and fries was not worth it. Maybe youre paying for ambiance? Its beautifully decorated. Servers were friendly and attentive. I would probably give this 4 stars if they didn't convince me to pay an extra $30 for burnt wagyu. There's a difference in burnt and charred..definitely burnt. Did not send it back, cause times are tough and a loss of a plate would probably Hirt restaurant more than it would hurt me. Ill be back to sit at the bar and drink froze though. At $14 each, they aren't cheap, but good.

No comment

Worth the wait! We loves coming here, the menu is limited but the steak and sauce was really good. This place has been on my list for a while so I was happy to check it off. I didn't catch her name, but the girl pushing the dessert cart (had on leather pants, turtleneck) was SUPER sweet and made the experience great!

Excellent steak and unlimited fries! What more could you ask for?? The steak was perfectly seasoned, tender, the sauce was rich and creamy. Also ordered the blackberry spritz which was refreshing. The garlic bread and salad were nothing special. The only downside was that we waited in line for over an hour. But definitely a must try!

Only one set menu of salad, skirt steak and unlimited fries for $28. Wine list has a big room to improve. Convenient for quick local lunch spot.

I was so sad Le Relias de Venise L'entrecote closed down, but was so excited to try out this place in replacement! The steak and fries is amazing!!! The sauce is delicious and the quality of the food overall is amazing, especially for $28 per head. The meat is cooked perfectly (i got medium and it was actually medium, not over done). The service is friendly, relatively quick (especially considering they were understaffed when i was there). I will say the drinks are overpriced for what they are along with the dessert. The quality of the sides & desserts isn't on par with the quality of the mains. One thing that i really don't like is that the desserts go around on a cart. The cart is clunky, it's very impractical that they push it around the whole restaurant, and it's also unsanitary because the entire pie/cake is exposed at each table it goes to. Overall though, super impressed with this place and I'll definitely be back.
The steak was delicious! We also got the garlic bread and cheesy potatoes with bacon. Such an interesting concept for a restaurant. The service was amazing as well!
No comment

My friend and I were super excited to try this place. We knew there would be a wait and got there around 530 to beat it. Ourselves, along with the huge line waited 1.5-2 hours in the cold while we saw that open tables were just being left there and unseated, and no heat lamps were turned on outside for people waiting. Many people just straight up left the line. During the meal, the dessert cart constantly rammed into my chair and it was generally a not great experience. The food was 6.5/10 and I would not wait more than 15 mins to eat here if I had to. This restaurant needs to do better about serving its customer that are obviously really excited to try it as we were, or think about implementing a reservation system for everyone, not just parties of 7. Will not be returning, which is a shame.
Nothing but amazing food, drinks, and deserts. Love the ambiance, amazing and friendly service.

Great experience.  No reservations so no drama about tables sitting empty. Simple idea: you get salad and bread.  Then they ask how you want your steak cooked. Then they bring the steak and fries. That's it. Simple. Great steak. Endless fries. Great service. Always attentive.  Server (forgot his name) totally on it.  Manager walking around to double check everything. Even splurged for desert.

It's true to it's name, green, steak and fries. Everything was good but not enough to bring me back. The customer service is great and the decor is simplistic. It's a place you go to if you just want basic steak and fries without the bells and whistles
It was $35 course meal Steak was good , salad had a funky taste like sweet & sour and it also comes with fries

worth the hour in line, everything was perfect. They forgot our salads but said the desert was on them. Great service and great food. Best tip would be get here early when they open or you're in for the wait if your life.

Verrryyy disappointed. First of all you have to salt everyyythhhingggg. The salad was decent, the fries were fried and the steak was cooked nicely...but again there was minimal if any seasoning on everything. There was a server who was being extremely unsanitary I saw him using his fingers to help pick up a customers cake and put it in a box  then, he grabbed the spoon used to serve whipped cream to scoop out crumbs then used his finger to take the whipped cream off the spoon. Theeennn this same person was grabbing utensils for a customer, and instead of holding them by the handle he held them by the part you serve yourself. I seldom write a bad review but this was definitely not worth what you're paying.

Went in on a Monday night not expecting a huge line. Arrived at 7:30 and was seated by 8:10. Not a bad wait at all. My server Felix was very hands on and knowledgeable. I made it clear I had a nut allergy and he let me know the fries were cooked in peanut oil. Peanut is 1/4 nuts I can have. Overall the food was good and I would come again. The salad is cut way too big. The steak and fries are good. The blackberry spritz is my new favorite drink. The strawberry tart was amazing.

Went last Friday (4/8/22) with my best friend and everything was amazing. The pre-fixed menu of salad, steak, and unlimited fries were amazing. You do have to wait online, the do not take reservations but it is worth the wait. Even the dessert was delicious freshly made trifle AMAZING!!!! Definitely need to go again

I was so hyped to tried try this spot...walked in happy...then that when everything changed...i was seated with my spouse at the end of a table wit a large group...while others who walked in after me got to sit in a table meant for two people or couples...then our waiter Digeo was basically rushing me to make our order when we explained to his that we needed a minute to review the drink menu...also told him we wanted to have a drink 1st before orderin our meal...it made me and my spouse very uncomfortable to be orderin right away when we just got out of the rain while tryin to focus on the aspshere ur establishment was providing...then I'm lookin around and no one else is get the treatment to speed up there orders...skip the salad...not worth it...fries are extra crispy...the steak was well done and good...nothing special in the juiciness or taste...desserts look good and yummy...hopefully this review doesn't turn people off to attend this spot...may have to return at a different time to try a different table with a different waiter...last the spicy margarita was okay...lol

I was truly disappointed. The salads were okay, we were served literally the entire piece of lettuce that was pretty much uncut, so we had to cut it ourselves. I payed extra to try the Wagyu but it was literally the same if not worse that the normal cut. Our food took forever to come out and was actually delayed for whatever reason. only reason why im giving this place 2 stars is because of our waiter. He was Super cool and kept us as happy as he could, and also the dessert was pretty good too.
This was a 60$ dinner. Definitely wasn't 8 oz steak. Fries were cold when we asked for 2nds ( a fresh batch) like 3 waiters came to ask if we really wanted more. So awkward.

The portions are so small. I am a lean individual, but they were not enough for me. The review off with the unlimited fries deal... Fries are a very cheap option. The salad was just lettuce and a vinaigrette, I was very disappointed. the ambience is weird. The inside of the restaurant looks like a Home Depot.

The skirt Steak is so good could not stop eating it, the meat the use top of the line I am steak eater I could tell, it is place I could back for seconds and thirds that how good the skirt steak is I eat my steak rare eating any other way is crime to steak please do not be mad steak taste so much better that way to another thing which fair the everyone no reservations allowed everyone waits on line outside the good thing the manger take you phone number and name and you wait in hotel lounge you cannot do that unless he takes you in there that policy you cannot wait by yourself in there. It was great thing for me husband is rollater and use electric wheelchair standing outside is tough for us it made the night so much better it made want eat there more because they did for us 5 star place to me there is line for there place and worth it.

Food was good. Experience was great and deserts was amazing. Wish you get a little bit more food but Overall great experience staff are welcoming and cater to your needs and very nice for a NYC restaurant.

I came her for Mother's Day. The menu is set, with a few options of different sides. I definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a quick bite. Very fulfilling as well. The desert was good as well, I had the chocolate cake. Oh, and the sauce they provide for the steak, to die for.
This place is nothing extraordinary, but the staff sucks. Bartenders are friendly but hosts/hostess are very rude  and unprofessional. What a big deal just skirt steak!
No comment
This was a great experience. The salad and steak were terrific as was the apple pie.

Ambiance is nice, good lighting. The food is mediocre anyone could make the same steak or better. The service is good but they try to consistently scam you with extras which are overpriced. The line is either really long 45 min plus or really short. I would not eat here again. I would go somewhere better and get a better meal for the same price.
No comment
Pretty pricey once you add appetizers but steak and fries were really good. Service is kind of iffy but understandable because of how busy it can get

Overhypeddd. And BEWARE. The fries are cooked in peanut oil. When asking the manager what's in the sauce that comes with the steak after having an allergic reaction I couldn't put my finger on what was bothering me. Then he tells us the fries are cooked in peanut oil. That's no where on the menu. It should be written like chick fil a and five guys. His response was "you should have asked" This NEEDS to be taken more serious!!

Steak was cooked rare but couldn't be finished, even though small, because of how charred it was. To me, the fries were overcooked. I had the strawberry cream dessert and it was divine! If you don't want anything too heavy after dinner, this is your best bet. FYI, my friend and I arrived around 5pm on a Monday and there was no line and we were promptly seated. We had the spinach cream gratin, delicious; wouldn't say it's worth the $10 but it was really creamy and rich. Last note, I had a vodka tonic and it came up to $17 and some change. I didn't ask for top shelf so I hope that wasn't the price of well!

We went on MLK day and waited about 30-35 minutes. Place was pretty packed but service was quick. Everything tasted amazing. Salad was tasty, fries were hot and well seasoned, steak was so good especially with the sauce on top. Definitely get the garlic bread. It was hot, buttery, crusty deliciousness. I loved that they had a dessert cart. Never seen that before! They had a good selection from carrot cake to flan, chocolate mousse, etc. I had an almond pastry with hazelnut cream. Sooooo good. Worth it. I would definitely come here again but maybe for lunch during the week, I wouldn't stand outside again for it. There's no list to put your name on, you just wait on line until it's your turn to be seated. Some heated lamps would be great. Probably the only downside of the experience but the food and quick service made up for it.

Came across SS from my TikTok/ and we ended up doing a collaboration together. Masks are required if not seated and prod of Vaccination ID. I figured the line would have been long but people were waiting outside for hours! I couldn't believe it. The ambience inside had awesome vibes. The cocktail list was limited but was actually really good. They also have non alcoholic drinks as well. Lots of different ages there. Was cool to see a mix of young kids and their parents, couples on dates, birthday party's or just a night out with your girlfriends! They have a fixed price for $28, salad, Steak and unlimited fries! The service was amazing. Our waitress Val went ABOVE and beyond. They owners and managers were extremely outgoing and made sure everything went well during our visit. Don't fill up on the unlimited fries though because for $9 they bring around a dessert cart. Every dessert looked insane and each were only $9 a piece. Totally worth the price for $28 and the food was actually really good. (Also get the garlic bread. Was delish!) thanks for having us!

Likely one of the most mediocre steaks I've ever had.  It's unremarkable. I will only remember jt because of the tik tok craze last year. I am sorry that I waited on line to eat here. Even for the price point, I think you can find a better steak. This is the type of place where the only "seasoning" they have is salt. The fries are SO salty. As is typical on tik tok, this place was overhyped.

Perfect location for dinner after frolicking around NYC! They took my friend's gluten allergy very seriously and everything was absolutely delicious. The steaks were cooked beautifully, salads were fresh and the fries were some of the best I've eaten. We opted out on dessert but the cart was loaded with so many goodies that we'll probably try something the next time we find ourselves in the city

I was really hoping for more from this restaurant but unfortunately was extremely let down me and my gf tried this spot out recently cause if all the hype going around. I can say the fries and peppercorn sauce where great but the steak and cocktails where a huge let down. I was brought out two burnt medium steaks and a watered down drink I can understand a little grill char on a steak but these where so burnt and bitter I couldn't finish. After receiving one burnt steak after another I just gave up on asking for a a new one and just ate fries and sauce those where the only things that saved my meal otherwise my review would of been lower. As of now I'd only come back for the fries and sauce cause I can say I did enjoy those a lot but I'd definitely pass on the steak for sure

First of all, there is no reservations unless you're a big party 6+. I went for dinner arriving around 6:20pm and the wait was nearly hour and 45 minutes. I got the salad, steak and unlimited fries set. Food was good but didn't feel like it was anything special. The steak was banging... and that's really it. Salad is okay, fries weren't consistent. The first round was extraaaaa crispy and the second was soggy??

No comment

Came here after seeing this on tik tok too. I don't know why I was surprised to see a long ass line which we stood on for 2 hours! The food was good, could've have been better, steak portion was very small but cooked well and it was tasty . I was mad and surprised to learn after the fact that they charge $9 for the bread, a tiny shriveled burnt loaf!! They also charge extra for the peppercorn sauce for a littlest bit. Overall not impressed.

Don't go here. They don't care about your experience and treat the restaurant like a factory. Rush you the entire time. Especially don't go here for a birthday dinner with a large group. They make you feel uncomfortable for being there more than an hour because of the line outside. I told them it was a birthday, they forgot and just stuck a candle in a piece of cake that was the wrong order. We decided to eat the wrong cake because we didn't feel like waiting for them to come back to order the right one. Finally we were able to tell them it was the wrong one and they gave us the one we originally ordered. The manager took the half eaten wrong cake from under us while we were eating and said "you're not paying for it so I'm taking it"... and they were the ones that messed up the order! They just threw it out anyway... do yourself a favor, pick up some skirt steaks from Whole Foods and cook it yourself. It tastes better. And on top of that, they auto add 20% gratuity when the restaurant has one dish...

Got there at 5 when they opened, there was a line (which we expected), and eventually waited about 2hr for a table (regrettably). We got our food really quickly, but it seems that after you get your food you're completely forgotten about... "bottomless fries" more like if you want more fries be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes, bc once you've gotten your food you are no longer important to your server. The food itself was ok; the salad was terrible though. It was bitter and not in like a vinegar kinda way but like in a gross and inedible kinda way. The steak itself was decent, but have definitely had better arrachera steak elsewhere (like ay a family bbq). We got the brussel sprouts which were tasty and the garlic bread that was bland and hard as a rock. I wanted dessert but decided I didn't want to spend more time and money at this place. Super disappointed with the experience because I was so looking forward to it, but oh well. Save yourself the time and don't bother waiting for this place, there's definitely better food in the area. Super yummy KBBQ spots are just around the corner.
Great concept. Great food. Loved it. Perfect for those who struggle to make a decision.
No comment

Food is good but they take no reservations unless you are a 7 plus party (I could be wrong) or you know someone in management to get a favor!   The line to get in PEOPLE is absolutely frustrating. Never experienced this in my life. It's like you're in line at an amusement park. If the line was going fairly, it would be OK,   When we were finally at the front of the line, we actually waited the longest just to be next. We must've waited 45 minutes at the front of the line simply because their management would pluck other people out of the line behind us that were either a couple or a party of three just to fill their restaurant seating blueprint when they could've accommodated our party of four by adding an extra seat or putting two tables together.  They also had ceiling heat lamps that they could have turned on to keep us outside people warm while waiting 1plus hr.    Not nice Customer Courtesy is number one in my book and their management had none !!

The steak and salad were absolutely delicious. The fries could have been a little more crispy and they didnt refill them super often however the portion sizes were generous! I would definitely go back
No comment
No comment

It was good food and a cool vibe. They give you the option of rare, medium or well. We chose medium and prob should have gone with rare. Honestly- it seemed like the temperature depended on the thickness of the steak. We were a 4 top and all 4 servings were very different in thickness and temperature even though all were ordered the same. Fries are thin and crispy. Salad is simple but good. It's a great spot for something unique. We walked here from the Chelsea market via the High-line and then across several blocks. It was a long walk but then again- everything is in NYC.

We waited in line for about 15 minutes and decided to sit at the bar. We were a party of two and it was the easiest option. T was our bartender and was super friendly and personable. He totally made our experience. The food was really good but the service was amazing. We will be back again because of him. Btw there was a patron that came in around 9:50, when they close at 10:30 and was upset that they wouldn't serve him all you can eat service. They treated him respectfully and he said I enjoy my 1 star rating. Forget that guy and his 1 star review!!! He didn't even eat here!!!

Simplicity & functionality at it's finest. we snagged seats at the bar. Never received bread which produced an envy of my partner at the time. Nevertheless, it was all incredibly delicious. It's business model really does propel the flavor of steak to an atomic level.

First off ! I'd like to give a shout-out to our waiter Diego ! Adorable & sweetest person! Even though I asked him for a thing or two & he forgot about us lol however he was very nice & attentive to us throughout our visit. In fact the whole entire staff was very very nice! The hype of this restaurant is you get a skirt steak cooked to your liking, starting off with a salad & unlimited French fries for only $28. Everything you order outside of that is $10. My guest & I were very pleased with the flavor of the steak!!! This place does not take any reservations unless you have a party of 7+ people. When you arrive, there is a massive long line outside but the line was moving relatively fast. We did wait 45 minutes to go inside but it was worth the wait. Luckily for us it wasn't that cold out last night :) our waiter Diego did explain that us that you could order the steak either medium or well done. (No I'm between!) so we ordered medium. Little on the chewy side but the sauce that came with it was beyond delicious . Jalapeño mash was really good! Not at all spicy but definitely had the jalapeño taste/flavor (hint taste) Only thing I wasn't too happy about were the French fries. They weren't fresh off the fryer :( & we got a lot of little burned ones. Really wish that wasn't the case. Overall we had a great time , the person serving the desert was a gem also! Young black guy, I didn't get his name! & I forgot to take a picture of the desert! Shoutout to him too! For having such an awesome & inviting personality! Definitely would recommend & go again

We asked by this location during our visit to New York. My wife asked to to take a chance so I did. We were sat next to the dessert cart and our waiter was Eddie. He was energetic, funny, and kept the lunch experience light. The food was good ( two choices - burger sandwich or skirt steak meal), cooked as requested, and we left full and satisfied. I recommend this location while heartily.
SO simple and done right!!! Yummy prix fix with an outstanding salad, delicious bread and butter, all the fries you can eat and perfectly cooked skirt steak!!!!
Very good skirt steak and fries. Only negative is that it is a fixed menu and price. We had a 12 year old granddaughter with us and had to pay the full $38.00 for her.

To the point. Prixe fix menu of salad, steak and fries. Everyday! Perfect after mini golf and the food was served straight away. Very much enjoyed the dessert cart presentation at the end. Yes you do have room for dessert. Banana cream pie - yes please

I was craving a simple steak and a quick google search showed me that I was nearby. I had heard about this place on tik tok - first highly rated, then many reviews came after stating it was over hyped. I was by myself on a Thursday afternoon, and arrived about 15 min before opening; there was a short line at that time but there were still many seats available when I left. I sat at the bar and service was prompt and friendly. I opted for just the set menu and was very happy with what I received - salad was dressed with a shallot vinaigrette, steak was seasoned well and cooked to my desired temp, fries were crispy and unlimited though, I couldn't eat more than what I was initially given. Very similar to Le Relais de Venise L'entrecote. It was exactly what I was looking for - a quick and easy steak frites. This might not be the place I return to when I'm with a group of friends looking to indulge but would certainly come back again the mood strikes and when I want to spend only $28 + tax/tip.

The $28 prixe fix sounded like a good deal so we came for our anniversary. The salad, steak and fries were good, but when the bill came we were surprised. They had charged us $10 for water and $10 for the garlic bread they brought out when we sat down. When we were being seated they asked still or sparkling for water and typically I've only experienced being charged for it in Europe so I didn't think I had to ask if they would charge. I especially didn't think a small glass bottle of water would be $10. The garlic bread was good but it was an absurdly small portion, none of these prices are listed anywhere one could fine as they only give you a small menu for drinks when you sit down. It was pretty disappointing to leave feeling a little conned so just be aware of this I'm advance before going.

We just happened to pass this restaurant last night. There was a line waiting to go in. We knew we had to try it. The staff warmly greeted us as we entered. The service of food and drinks was impeccable. Now to the food. My steak was perfectly cooked. The steak melted in my mouth like butter! My family could not stop raving about it! The best part was the memory that was made. We will never forget this meal or the time spent enjoying it. Thank you. Please stop by and try. I promise you will not be disappointed.
Steak was good. Not impressed with the fries (go figure they're unlimited). A trendy place with an interesting concept. Don't think I will return...
Over priced and honestly not worth it. Could go anywhere else. Nothing special tbh. Service was great tho

Being a New Yorker and after seeing this on a morning show, of course I had to try it.  I was not disappointed ~ luckily the line was not long and we only waited 20 minutes.   The serving staff was courteous and accommodating.  The salad was delicious and perfectly dressed.  Steak was just as I ordered it (rare) and the fries were delicious.  I don't know where these other reviewers ate but it wasn't at Skirt Steak.  Would definitely go back if I am in the neighborhood :)
Everything was good but don't expect a regular size skirt portion size pretty small for the price but overall good spot
This place is dog shit! If you like eating dog shit you should 100% go here. If you like eating food you should not go here. Keanu I'm looking at you brother
No comment

Decent food for the price but their service has seriously been on the decline. If you can get in without a wait, it is usually worth the price. But if you end up waiting in line, you ought to expect that the kitchen and servers are overwhelmed as well. Expect to spend 1.5+ hours all-in to get your food.

Salad was sandy and tasteless. Garlic bread was dry and needed butter. Steak was underwhelming, small portion and needed salt. Steak sauce was bland. Fries were ok. Very disappointed in this meal. Would not recommend this restaurant.
Perfect price for good food. Wear comfortable shoes on a nice day totally worth the wait !!!

One of the worst steaks I have ever had... We waited an hour to be seated then received stale bread, extremely slow service (waitress checked in ONE time during the entire meal), and one normal steak plus one charcoal steak that was past medium well i.e. completely burnt making one of us physically ill. The manager was kind enough to take the entree and side off of the bill, however, we proceeded to wait 45 more minutes for the check.... Very interesting concept but the service and food lacks consistency.
Delicious steak cooked to perfection. Also they have amazing French fries! Fast service as well

Just left this place! My daughter started eating and the food started to bother her. She thought it was the steak sauce .She ask the host what was in it . Then she ask about the fries and he said peanut oil. OMG ! She has a nut allergy and I started to panic! I was told by the manager we should of ask before we ate! No they should have that on the menu! Not hard you only have one entrée!  These restaurants need to take this seriously!
If I could save even one person the time..don't wait on that line. It's not worth it.
Horrible service, long wait and honestly the food was as good quality as red lobster. Not impressed
Alright -- if you're close to the restaurant but not close you're not in. Got here at 455 it's 620 and we thought we're moving but still waiting. There's better spots

The line is not worth the wait. We got seated at a 6 person table with another couple at our table. There was an empty space between us but the seating arrangement was a little awkward. The deal that goes on is two people receive a shared steak with unlimited fries with a salad for $28 each. They brought us the salad to start which were chunks of uncut lettuce drenched in a lemon vinaigrette dressing. The steak amount was small for two and came VERY charred/ burned. Almost unable to eat. The unlimited fries were EXTREMELY salted and not fresh. Our dining experience was rushed and lasted maybe 30 minutes. This place is not worth waiting for to be rushed out. In addition, we ordered desert and it tasted as if it were out all day. A disappointing experience. This restaurant values quantity of people over quality of food.

Got in line at 5:30p on a Friday and waited exactly an hour to be seated. Everything we ordered was top quality, fresh and tasted excellent. Perfect steak, crispy hot fries, salad with fresh herbs, and we got extras of garlic bread, sautéed spinach (a good size serving for 4 of us!) and chocolate tart. Also tried both of the shrubs -- cranberry and blood orange -- which were tasty. Service was genuinely friendly and attentive. Very good value for a steakhouse in New York City and a very pleasant experience. Only wish there was a more extensive wine list, but my Cabernet was fine. Vaccine cards were checked at the door.

Overrated! Elementary school level steakhouse for tik tok twenty year olds. They're making bank off the social media crowd. Dinner for 2 with two sides is ~$80. Go to a real steakhouse instead, share a ribeye and two sides and it's about the same price.

Yikes. Always busy so my fiancé and I thought we would give it a try. After an hour wait, highly disappointed. Even if we were able to walk in I would have been very dissatisfied. Salad was extremely bitter, although some might like that. I ordered my steak medium, my fiancé ordered hers rare. Hers was more cooked on the outside than mine, and when i say cooked i mean charred to a crisp. The only way to get a steak that burnt on the outside and that rare inside is to not clean pans between steaks. Hers tasted like absolute dirt. Mine was almost edible. Would not recommend to anyone

born and raised in manhattan over 60 years ago. Ive seen these places come and go. This should go. Its a tik tok scam to attract the naive.  Not worth the wait.  A plain salad, no big deal steak.  They should improve the steak and salad and skip the free fries.  What a waste of our time.  Sad. I rarely write negative anywhere but my word the owners are laughing. Less than a tourist trap
This place is the best !! Good food , food price and good desserts! Simple but Good . I cannot wait to come back.  I would love to see another location in the city with an outdoor area !

Not at all what I was expecting. The steak portion was soooooo small I couldn't believe it  :( I've been to steakhouses and paid the same amount and received a full skirt steak! Overall I was not pleased.

I do not understand the hype about this place. The fries & bread were very good. The steak was not that good.A small portion..it was chewy & not even the Bernaise sauce could save it. I was very disappointed. If you like quality steaks..this is not the place for you.

Skirt Steak was a top notch restaurant. The food was delicious and the prices were very reasonable. The line outside seems reasonable in the context of how good the food was. The staff was personable and efficient and I felt they did a good job. I'd happily go back.

I heard others complain about this place and I couldn't find what they were talking about. The place is not that big in size. It's has a rustic look for a French theme restaurant. However, the rule of thumb is all about the food and this place will not disappoint you or your date. Even though the menu is limited but they give you fresh unlimited fries. The steaks are cooked to your likens, the drinks are good, salads are on point for a person that don't care for greens. I ate em all. The deserts looks very appealing but if I may make one suggestion, don't bring out the deserts out in the street from one building to the next. Especially in NYC without it being covered. Anything is liable to happen to the frosted cakes within seconds from the open street air unto those cakes. Including people germs in this day and time.

Sadly, I believed the online craze. The steak and baguette were both tasty in my opinion. However, the food was very salty. The salad had this odd dressing that tasted high in sodium. The fries were drenched in salt. Thankfully, my company and I asked for non-salted fries. The service was subpar. We were checked on once. Our server seemed annoyed at the whole situation. At no fault of their own, waiting 2 hours in the cold did not elevate the experience. Overall, I would say, "Don't believe the hype" The food is nothing special. I would say avoid coming here until the weather is warmer.

I highly recommend Skirt Steak. The food is excellent. As the name says, they serve skirt steak, but don't leave your vegetarian/vegan friends at home, because they also have an option of cauliflower steak that was absolutely delicious. The cauliflower steak was a large portion, excellently cooked with a bearnaise sauce, mushrooms, watercress, and seasoned well to bring all the flavors together (you can ask to have it without the bearnaise if you are vegan). This comes with bread, a green salad that had a delightful dressing, as well as bottomless shoestring fries. The servers come around with fresh fries all the time and you can have as much as you want. All of this for $28. Sides, drinks, and desserts are extra. I opted for the sauteed spinach, which was also very good. The desserts looked beautiful, but I was so full that I didn't get any this time.

The Skirt Steak is the star and if your looking for more forget about it..Its about the Skirt and it was amazing and worth it...No wait on Thursday around 9pm... Iceberg Salad boring , Garlic Bread nice...Cocktails good....But again the star was Skirt and Fries and it was awesome...Need more sauce otherwise will be back
I loved everything about this place!! The interior design, the food and most importantly the amazing service!!! Definitely worth the wait. Love it
Had a fantastic dinner here last night! Walter took great care of us, and our steak was delicious. The sauce that they serve on the side is so tasty! Can't wait to come back again soon!

Really cool place and atmosphere, just need to learn how to deal with the line a little better and inform customers that they're going to be waiting 2 hours like we did outside. But all together great food.
found this on tiktok but is way overhyped - salad is just lettuce with too much dressing, steak is salty as oily. Wouldn't recommend

This is an imaginative new concept which is great for steak and salad lovers.  (The fries, bread, and dessert were also very good.)  The one-entree menu lets them hold down prices (at least for Manhattan).  If they gave the choice of a slightly better cut of steak for a little more money, the concept would be perfect.  Of course, they'd have to change their name.  Free suggestion:  Steak & Salad.

Skirt Steak operations seem to be very smooth and calculated. The dining experience was smooth as can be, with the timing of each dish. Steak portion was healthy and satisfactory for sure. Loved the salad, simple but perfectly done. The bread and butter was also fantastic. The meal was so simple but just hit the spot. Only thing I would say is I didn't love the fries. They weren't really salted enough for my taste and seemed a bit whatever. They were very thin and not very greasy but would still love for the fries to be a bit more flavorful. Overall though, definitely pleased. Certainly worth a visit.
A great concept, with outstanding food, and very good service. The staff clearly worked as a team and it showed. The quality of the food is amazing. Will definitely go back.

This was my warning to never try a Tiktok viral restaurant again. I should have known when I saw how young their servers were that it wasn't gonna be good. One, we had to wait 30 mins to be seated and we couldn't wait outside because we would lose our spot which sucked, we just wanted to get fresh air tbh. Two, the salad was super bitter like pretty much inedible. My friend and I got sprite as our beverage and we were charged $10 for both even though it came in a small glass with lots of ice. The charged as $9 for the garlic bread which was tiny, we actually thought it was free because the server said that it came with the water. The steak itself was very char with no flavor. Tasted like plain cow meat tbh which I hated because I don't want my meat to taste and smell like the actual animal it came from. The fries were actually good however no one came around to give as a refill since it's unlimited until the very end of our meal. Overall, I won't be going back and don't recommend. Save yourself for a restaurant that actually worth it.

I can't believe I've only been here once! I came for the Valentine's Day special and it was so great! The vibe of this spot remind me of the Grand Budapest Hotel (the movie), it's very enchanting. There's a warm reddish/pink glow that lights up the main dining room. And this place has a lot to offer, not only is it a fantastic restaurant they also have The Sultan room which is a music venue (must check out while waiting for a table or after dinner). And a take out spot right next door. The Valentines day special was a lovely 5 course dinner that started with freshly baked bread and dips like hummus and eggplant. Next we got a beet salad with lamb meatballs. The meatballs were so good, especially when eaten in tandem with the dips and bread. There was a drink pairing that was optional with each course and boy am I glad we did that! I was feeling it in the best possible way by the end of the dinner and I loved that the waiter was able to explain each course and drink pairing and how the flavors match. Last we had duck prepared two different ways. My favorite was the crispy leg. It came with roasted broccolini and potatoes in a bright orange turmeric based sauce.Fantastic service, great food and really fun vibes. 10/10. Oh and there was a burlesque show while we ate. Talk ab out dinner and a show!
No comment
No comment

So fun. I had tickets to a show in the adjoining music venue and decided to eat while I waited for the doors to open. I'm a lazy vegan- got the relish tray that they adapted to take away the yogurt, and the "Dew Drop Cabbage" as my entree which did have a little yogurt, along with sunflower sprouts which tasted like little noodles. The cabbage tasted like smoked turkey (pun not intended), and the sun chokes were just perfect. Had a few cocktails- The Margie is a winner- coconut and cucumber with a splash of tequila. The atmosphere is great- low colorful lighting, fun glassware, offbeat music (at least for me) that was modern but fitting. Service was stellar. Actually will be coming back tomorrow for another show and dinner. Oh- dessert- White Chocolate Budino- not sure what it is other than it is dairy (lazy vegan) it had pistachio and rose, light but hit the spot.
No comment

I left my iphone headphones here Thursday, since then I've called the pce 4 times (no one ever picks up), email them 3 times and even made a reservation only to explain the situation in the "reservation notes" field. Despite all my efforts over the last 6 days I've been unable to get any reply from them, I'm not sure if they rather keep my headphones or just don't believe in costumer service.
