Thats my $450 headphones lost for no reason!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
This place is super cute and fun. They have a really good dinner menu - the lamb burger is great. And also great drinks. The atmosphere and rooftop area is our favorite spot to eat.
Incredible. I loved everything about this place.  Owner is a beautiful person.  Food is great.
Hands down the best food in Bushwick. Cocktails are amazing and the music venue is one of the best in nyc. Highly recommend.
No comment

So cute they're food doesn't have to be good, but then it is. The drinks also slap. And then you've got music in the back and on the roof. Love love love. I've had birthdays here in the past and just booked another Turks Inn bday dinner for this weekend.
No comment
No comment
No comment
This place is magical. Great bar, unique and delicious food and cocktails. And then you can head to the music venue on-site after dinner! What a great find!
No comment
They tried to charge us $50 to go in for the last hour and the bouncers acted like they were too good for us. Ridiculous and all for bad music.
definitely A good vibe an would recommend anybody too come an party party when they throwing a party cuss it's super
No comment
No comment

We came to celebrate a birthday. There is a venue next door, so we also came to see a show. The food was stellar. Everything tastes amazing, cabbage, steak and fish. All three entrees we're stand outs. The wedge salad, calamari and labbeh were so flavorful and elevated. According to the party, the cocktails were great, and I'd have to agree judging by the non alcoholic drink I got. Hgreat for any occasion, especially groups.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Incredible decor coupled with decadent food that makes me feel just like home! I've been to Turk's Inn several times over the last year, and look forward to their reopening so I may dip my finger in the pistachio sprinkled Labneh once again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Totally love this place. Great food, decor, atmosphere, customer service! Nothing bad to say about this place. It's a must try!

We had a wonderful experience last night. We started with appetizers which were just perfect. Chef Alberto brought us a caprese that blew our pallets away. The entrees were unbelievably savory and perfectly well balanced. Through out the whole night the service was incredible! Our waiter Alfonso was not only attentive and charming but also extremely knowledgeable and spot on. Highly recommend for anyone looking for an intimate/ posh place to enjoy themselves with an extraordinary Chef!

Came here with my boyfriend and a friend. We told the bartender who took our order in full discussion about our table allergies. The sandwich came out with sesame seeds which was our main concern. The bartender apologized and told us she put a rush on a new order. She also said she had never had the sandwich before... as if that helped in her defense. 25 mins later I went inside to ask about the order, she said it would be out soon..We then sat for 25 mins more and watched about 6 orders go out in front of us. We called her over and her response was "the restaurant is taking a cut on this. Well have it out soon" Who says that?!?! Irresponsible uneducated and unprofessional. Such a shame because the food is actually good.

10 out of 10 for this spot! The staff was so lovely, and we felt safe eating outside/on their covered terrace during COVID. As a vegan, I really appreciated how knowledgeable and accommodating our server and the kitchen were, as they were able to tweak/recommend many DELICIOUS dishes. The cabbage entree was delicious, as were the apps. I ate with three non-vegans and they loved everything we ordered. Also points for the quirky decor - would definitely go back!
No comment

This place is amazing!  Varun Kataria resurrected this old fashioned supper club from his childhood summers in Wisconsin.  That's where my family first experienced it years ago.  He brought it back bigger and better with memorabilia from the original location.  You can spend all night here enjoying the delicious food(try the eggplant) first then moving through the Backdoor to the live music stage and finally up to the rooftop bar for a nightcap!

The food here was DELICIOUS! Literally everything was superb... from the steak to the shish kabobs to the sides to the desserts... all amazing. Try the sweet potatoes, they were my fave. Lamb meatballs- a close second. The vibe here was really cool. Good music. Great service.
Great little gem with delicious food, drinks and a cozy atmosphere! Would definitely come back again and check out their roof in the summer time.
Came with 2 other friends, we all spent around $60 and left hungry. Portions are incredibly small for what you pay and the food was OK, not amazing. Decor is pretty cool, but not worth the money IMO.

I was just here last night for dinner and a show. I would say if you're going to see a show here, you can come here for drinks but I would recommend somewhere else for the food. The music was amazing but it was almost impossible to find out from the club beforehand when the music would start. This made me get there much earlier than I would have liked to. Overall an A+ music experience and a "B" restaurant experience. Please get a new chef.

This place is a total novelty restaurant. The setting is cool and totally over the top but the food and drinks are mediocre at best, way overpriced, and small portions (even the drinks!). We felt like there was nothing authentic or "special" on the menu. Looks and tastes like it belongs in Times Square. If you want to experience it, go for a drink and snacks and skip the meal.

Stellar! This place has a great back-story and food to match. An amazing addition to the neighborhood (long time-resident here). Not only did our group of 6 enjoy everything, the staff was extremely accommodating (one of us had lots of food allergies). And they invited us to the roof afterwards! Cant wait to come back.

Charming interior and excellent food. We tried a variety of things, including beet carpaccio, root veggie slaw, lamb meatballs, rice pilaf and various skewers. All were tasty and made for sharing. Service was friendly and efficient. I would go back next time we visit Brooklyn.
love this place, the space, the drinks... can't wait to try the food, I've been telling al my friends about it. Definitely worth a visit and the rooftop in the summer is great

this is the worst place i've ever been to in my entire life. they are racist. how do you stare me in the eye and watch us stand in the rain for 40 minutes and then tell us we're not getting in? the manager is a racist woman with an awful orange outfit and does not care about her patrons. how does it feel to be a terrible person? avoid this place and the sultan room at all costs.
Definitely worth it! Great space, great food, cool space! Finally something different. No reclaimed wood!!!

I love this place. Get there early to get the best service. If you hit it at 8 chances are your best friend will be the food runner as servers can get overwhelmed. The host and hostess are lovely and attentive. The food is adventurous and pretty darn good. Sharing small plates can add up so it is not a cheap date. But honestly go for it and have the smurf juice

A well deserved five stars.  It captures a certain joie de vivre in a way that so many attempt but so few actually accomplish.  The food is very good and the whole experience is just fun all around.  Can't wait to go back.

Only giving 4 stars because the vegetarian options were limited to appetizers and salads but 5 stars for flavor and decor! Definitely try the eggplant appetizer- the almonds were a wonderful surprise.
Got some drinks here which were all amazing, and was impressed with how good the food was as well! Its kind of a hidden gem. Would recommend checking out, I love it!

What a fun place! Visually amazing. The food was delicious, not Turkish strictly speaking. Turkish via the midwest. I loved the 2 cocktails I tasted: I had a rose-fizz thing-can't remember the name, and my friend had the velvet negroni.

Everyone should eat here at least once. It's super weird and kitschy and has a cool history. The decor is fabulous, and it feels spacious in there. Service is good, but they do kind of rush you without trying to seem like it. I especially enjoyed the random people in red vests solomnley bringing dishes to our table without saying a word and then scurrying off. It's unique. But here's the thing - the food is just not that shit hot. I feel like if there were an iron chef competition between me and the Turks Inn chef using the same ingredients, I might win. The haloumi cheddar bites were good, but the breading tasted slightly off and for fried cheese at a cheaper price point I'd be okay with Arby's. The steak was seasoned with a paprika rub that just kind of distracted from it and made it less 'steaky'. It also needed salt, which they do not put on the table. The pork chop was tasty, but for 28.00 I could easily make a better one at home ( well, I mean, mine would cost maybe 8.00, tops) the crispy potatoes were okay, but just kind of weird - more like breakfast potatoes with some skins thrown in. If I made those for guests I'd be like "sorry I fucked up the potatoes, guys..." even though they were okay. In fact everything was fair to middlin', it's just that if you stripped away the cool ambiance and vibe of the interior decor and decent service, were sitting in just a blank white room, and got a check for two people with tip and tax that was just short of $200.00, you might feel somewhat... assaulted. (whereas there are some foods I could sit in a blank room eating and die of happiness - (I'm looking at you Izzies cheesesteaks!))  The cocktails were fantastic though. I got the smurfs blood or whatever it was called, and it was sheer delight crushing that strawberry caviar in my mouth. And  a great negroni. The place has some magical qualities for sure. If there were a lower budget version I'd go there all the time. Just realize you aren't going for the food really. I should have checked out the Sultan Room, maybe that is where it all comes together. It looked cool. But if friends from out of town are visiting, they'd dig this if you want to spend a lot of money. Also, good place for sharing small dishes beings as everything is ala carte. It also took all the willpower I had not to steal the cool little plate  my napkin was resting on when we first came in. When they took it away, I was like "NOOOOOOOOOOO"...

I find this place very pricy for the size of portions. For example 3 small pieces of falafel costs $13 and 1/4 of a sweet potato is $14. Flavors are great but after spending $66 + tips for 4 dishes smaller than an appetizer (not including drinks) you leave place feeling hungry. Good service.

Turks is an art installation with a broad, imaginative, delicious menu. It feels as homey as a Midwest supper club but yet exotic. An amazing blend of delights for all the senses. We were pleased about the many  vegetarian options as well as savory meat and fish. We were a large group but got excellent service and moved next door to the Sultan Room after dinner to see two popular girl bands. It was a night to remember!

Dinner was Impeccably served while maintaining an easy pace for a birthday party for 14. We arrived early to hang around the tasseled bar for their unique drinks ( loved the " Margie"), and stayed late to hit the live music in the Sultan Room.  Thank you, Turk's for a memorable night! Over the top.

Fantastic recreation of a classic northern Wisconsin supper club in Brooklyn NYC. As a frequent visitor to the original Turks Inn in Hayward Wisconsin, I can truly say that the owners spared no expense in transporting many of the original effects (including the bar) to the new location in an effort to recreate the same welcoming feel. Very friendly staff, good food and a spacious rooftop bar make this a great place to hang out and enjoy a warm summer evening.

Everything in this place is impeccable. The decor, lighting, music, menu, etc - all clearly designed with careful thought. It is actually four business in one - a semi-formal dining room, a takeout shop, a roof deck bar, and a music club. The boldness to pull off something this innovative in Brooklyn is quite remarkable. To boot - the food, drinks, and service were excellent. Five stars.

Do love this place! Incredible bartender/server--Michelin star service (forget his name but had glasses and tattoos but maybe that's not very helpful, went on a Monday...). Amazing atmosphere and the food was both considerate of the time period the restaurant came from (1950s Supper club) while being more sophisticated and contemporary. Only disappointment was the bar upstairs--not a great wine selection (had a chilled red after tasting two other wines that weren't so hot, but then again I have high wine expectations) and just let everyone else have it because I couldn't drink it. My boyfriend's on-draft negroni was supposed to be "really good" and tasted like bubble gum :(. Disappointed because the bartender on Monday was so professional, gave great recommendations and felt like I found a restaurant in bushwick that wasn't just trying to be a tourist/hipster park. Hope maybe a manager might read this and make some changes! Really had such a wonderful time the first time I came, and want this place have the high expectations it fulfilled the first time I went!

I got this as late-night takeout on a Sunday, having passed by it many times from the train station. All in all, I was impressed by the quantity & quality of the options. While there is only 1 veggie patty (which is 75 cents more than regular, which struck me as peculiar), the options for toppings were plentiful and all sounded fun! I opted for the Philly, which was cheese, mushrooms, peppers, and onions. They certainly did not skimp on patty size and toppings, as they were spilling out of my burger. The fries are a bit expensive on the side of an already $10 burger alone, but if there was some spicy mayo on the burger, it would have been even better. Overall, quite a tasty option & made very quickly. I'd come back again to try some more of the toppings!
No comment

I order the Texas burger, it was really good I enjoyed it. I have no complaints. as you can see I took a big bite of it before taking the picture because it was smelling really good and it was very Delicious.

Came here last Friday when I was in Manhattan and this burger is LEGIT and I'm from the home of burgers ..pleasantly surprised And if they were in LA would be one of the best burgers in the city..not a fan of the curly fries but that's a preference I can live with that lol

Solid burger! Order takeout for me and a friend, actually got the Beyond burger and halfway through got nervous I had accidentally grabbed the beef patty. Also had onion rings which were perfect. Zero disappointments.
"Once you go black you never go back" ... At least they got that right! The food was very mid tier. Portion sizes are tiny considering the pricing. The curly fries had a nice crisp.
No comment

Food was great. It's a tiny space so we sat inside but if you gave more than 2 people you can't really do that. Our food was made fresh in front of us and it was delicious. Great prices. You won't be disappointed.
No comment
Bacon Black was a good burger I was definitely happy with it. Conveniently close to the job I'm working at too
Great food, great helpful service. Veggie friendly. Mostly a takeout place, but there are two tables outside.  Limited barstools and counter space inside.

I had high hopes for this place, since I always pass by it on my work to work. I came in to try out a burger and immediately the price sky rocketed, with a burger, fries and a soda, you're looking at around $15-$16 not counting tip. It's ridiculous that these little places charge so much for something that isn't remotely decent. The soda fountain wasn't working, all the drinks were stale. I went for the coke and it was flat, the Dr.pepper same thing, then the fries taste like cheap deli selection, the burger was okay but I wouldn't order anything else besides that.
No comment
No comment

I placed an order online and my food was ready quicker than I expected. Your burger can be customized to your liking, from different options of cheese, meat and toppings. Besides beef, Black Burger has turkey, chicken and vegan patty options. I enjoyed my loaded double stacked burger. It was fresh, juicy and very filling.
No comment
No comment
Maybe you should rebrand- slogan is a little suss especially because this is not black owned
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
They got my order wrong and sent a burger with mushrooms which I'm allergic and then I had to call 7x for them to replace my order.
The curly fries are a little greasy. The turkey burger is delicious,  also try the avocado shake, so good. The vegan burger is tasty as well.  The staff is very attentive.
Would give zero stars. Closed with no notice on their website or door. Walked here to get a burger while I was hungry. Bye

column3: Central City, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: The customer service was phenomenal - they were patient with all our questions. The burgers are DELICIOUS. And most importantly they asked us how we wanted our burgers done - they're not frozen, they're fresh. YUM. Definitely coming back.

A small corner burgers and shake hangout serving up the basics and some specialties. I got the Mexicali. The patty had amazing flavor and came out pretty fast. Everything was proportioned well. If you're looking for a sweeter bun on your burger, this is the place. I would've paid about $7.50 but it was $9. WARNING: there is an extra charge if you use credit card. The best way to pay here is cash!

Ho man. What a solid choice for a well prepared, tasty burger in the late hours after a night out. The Jack Black, full of bacon, pepper jack, and onion rings, figuratively knocked my proverbial socks off. They cooked it medium per my request and the whole sandwich was a succulent indulgence. When can I go back to Tribeca!
No comment

I thought this place was really good. I ordered the jalapeno burger with pepper jack cheese. My burger was cooked exactly as I ordered. This was my first time at this restaurant and I recommend people give it a try. They have these really great curly fries and the portion is pretty big. I could not finish all of them. My order with a drink came to around $13 but for a freshly cooked burger and hot fries it's worth it lol.
No comment
No comment

Delicious burgers and a terrific staff!  The lady who helped us as so kind to my grandson.  He was watching her prep to make a shake, she noticed him, and gave him an oreo just because.  She made a 5 year old's day with her simple, generous gesture! Thanks!

Second time ordering through Grub Hub via Yelp and had issues both times. The recent one being that my food was ready for pick up but it wasn't updated in the app (waited longer for no reason and I was F#*ng hungry lol). I ordered the Burger salad which was decent.Definitely a try once kind of meal. I may return to try an actual burger but with my bad luck with online orders, I will order in store.

Small place and few seats which is ok for a quick bite. I order online during my short lunch time, although my order was ready I had to wait over 8 mins to be able to tell the cashier I just need to pick up my order. The place is a bit under staff since they only have one cashier. My food got a bit cold and maybe would have taste better hot. I was hoping to eat something hot since getting there was so windy because is nearby the water.
Friendly staff, juicy burgers and extremely tasty fries! If I will ever be back in NYC for sure I will visit again "Black Burger ". Highly recommended!

Although the food quality is great, it has not been consistent. The service is terrible for a pickup burger joint that you pay more than $10. I was largely disappointed by the quality of my fries when I got my curly fries with the chicken cutlet that took more than 25mins. Not only were the food cold by the time I got the food but the fries were little tiny pieces(hardly curly) making them look like leftovers. When it was brought up to the cashier she just shrugged and denied my request for it to be exchanged to a fresh batch.
No comment
No comment

Yum!!  No frills burger joint serving fresh cooked to order burgers and curly fries.  As others have said I would compare this to Shake Shack or Five Guys in terms of burger size and quality.  And the prices are super reasonable for NYC burgers - you can score a combo meal for around $10 which is a great deal.  Open until 2am so a great place to finish off a night of drinking with a great burger.  Highly recommend.
Extremely juicy and flavorful burger. Curly fries were also really good and the food was made very timely. Definitely one of the highlights for food in the Canal St area.

Definitely good burgers for the price point. Also got the curly fries and mozz sticks which were on the better side. Delivery came quite fast as well. Had a small issue with a promo code and they were really accommodating about it as well, so good customer service on top.

Not bad! The location is pretty easy to get to, especially if you work anywhere in either FiDi or even Midtown. It is a great place to get dinner when you do not feel like cooking or going out to a traditional restaurant. The only couple of issues I have are with the price and the shake. Perhaps I should have gotten the combo meal, but instead, I got a classic Black Burger with Cheese, pickles, ketchup, and mustard. Along with a side of fries and a chocolate shake. In total, the meal was almost $20 including tip, which seems a little bit ridiculous for a burger joint. The shake was also a bit icy, and I could tell it had not been mixed all the way, but it was not a big deal and still tasted delicious! The burger itself was great, cooked really nicely, and seasoned well, the bun also served as a delicious addition to the meat. The fries weren't bad either! Seasoned, and great when paired with some ketchup. Overall, I do plan to go back, but I wouldn't go so far as to say this is the best burger joint in NYC. But it is still good!
No comment
No comment

Burger is good and fresh tasting.  I'm not a fan of curly fries so hard for me to judge that (I wish they had a regular fries option too).  Reasonably priced ($9 or so for burger fries and soda).  Seating is pretty limited (9 countertop seats in total).  Overall, better than most fast food joints and about the same price.

OMG, Black Burger is actually rather darn cool. I only had very high expectations only because I've heard so much about Black Burger. Hawaiian Burger = yummy. The team was really pleasant and service is great. Found Black Burger with the help of yelp and would return at any time.

Came to this spot because it's next to my job and I'm usually getting poke bowl. I asked for the Monday blues special which is a blue burger with fries and a drink the only person behind the counter charges me for fries and a soda only then I asked him why didn't he charge me for the burger he said sorry I didn't hear you. I look at the receipt instead of him charging me for the special I get charges $8 for the burger and $8 for the fries and soda I bring it up to him he tells me he's sorry he didn't hear me I'm like I'm the only person here no one else is here? he gives me $2 in cash like that was going to fix the issue. Never again.
No comment

I was just looking for a quick bite in TriBeCa, and I stumbled into Black Burger.  The basic hamburger here is five stars. When you order a $5 buck burger, and they ask you how you want it cooked--you know you are getting something better than average.  I don't know if this is a chain or a one off, but it is fantastic.  I will come all the way down here regularly just for lunch.
No comment
No comment

Nothing super innovative, just solid burgers/shakes/sides.  This isn't the place you go out of your way to come to try, but if you're in the neighborhood and looking for some good eats, give it a shot.

Unfortunately I used to frequent this spot 1-2 times a week for work lunches, but recently I got food poisoning from eating here. The turkey burger meat was undercooked relative to the other times I have eaten here. I was on the go for work so sadly I ate it. It is too bad because I enjoyed coming here, as the location is close to my office.
No comment
So simple but yet so delicious! When a burger and curly fries are what you are hungry for come to this place. Quick service for walk ins or ordering online plus friendly staff.
No comment

I don't really eat burgers so it's kind of hard to judge a burger place but I got a grilled cheese and cheesy curly fries. The grilled cheese was alright, good for the price. The cheese fries were delicious.

As a west coast transplant, moving to the city meant mad In N Out withdrawals, and I mean, seriously. I tried Shake Shack, I tried Bareburger, I went to random pubs, I searched for any spot I thought might be able to make me a damn good, inexpensive burger, and for months, I was sorely disappointed... until (*dramatic music crescendos*) I found Black Burger. To be fair, it's not as cheap as In N Out, but I appreciate the quality. I wandered into the small joint out of a rainstorm, shivering cold, desperate for a solid burger, and they delivered. Without question, I'll definitely be back.
No comment

We stopped here after a long day in NY didn't know what to expect but it was pretty good. We got a Wednesday special and for the price the food you get is just enough. Ate better burgers but over all a good quick burger, better then some Wendy's ha
No comment
No comment
Such a good burger spot, it's small but don't be deceived. The burger might look basic but trust me when I tell you, it's heavenly.

I was in the area completing a continuing legal education course and had to grab a quick bite to-go before getting on the bus. Thanks to my handy dandy yelp app ;-)  I found this place right around the corner from the law school. I came on a Sunday night around 6 pm. It was mostly empty. I ordered the black burger with cheese.  It was a single patty and came with lettuce and tomato. I also added mushrooms and jalapeños. So good! The sauce was so flavorful i didn't even need ketchup. I also had the curly fries which were good also. The cashier was awesome. He was so friendly and personable. My food took about 10 minutes or so and was packed in a convenient box. Definitely a quality burger spot.
No comment
One of the best burgers I've had in Tribeca area. Especially the ranch black angus burger is my favorite. The curly fries are one of the specialties and a must have whenever you visit.
No comment
No comment

Splendid service, brilliant milkshakes and amazing burgers. Curled fries are great also. It is an affordable and nice diner/lunch place. Milkshakes are thick and tasty, burgers are also flavorfull. Would certainly recommend.
Worst burger I've had in NYC (I got the Swiss + Mushroom burger), coupled with extremely unpleasant service

I was excited to go black burger since the last time I was there about a year ago. I brought my friends to eat there and what was supposed to be a great day turned into a health fiasco. I asked for my burger well done and as you can see in the picture below it was not well done. As a matter of fact it was so undercooked and raw that I could hear the cow mooing. This has not only left a bad impression on me, but the fact that I got food poisoning from this has solidified that this place is not for me.

This place was just okay. I place my order in Ritual and scored my burger for just $1 plus tax during Eats week. I requested medium but the burger was well done-kind if expected that. None the less I probably won't be buying here again, they have great deals but the burger lacked flavor and was a bit hard. The curly fries were about 1 inch long bits and quite cold despite the 10 minute wait. Perhaps the chicken sandwich  is better.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of the few spots open late thru the night - if you crave for a hot burger and a mess of fries. Hardly a spot where you would sit down and eat, since it appears to be 99% carry out, I noticed plenty of Uber eats in & out of the place. I tried the regular black burger with curly fries and a soda. It was was overall not bad at all. A tad on the greasy side, but at 11pm, perhaps that is what you want. I should have checked their special (tacked on the wall away from the main menu). When I am in the area again will visit one more time.
No comment
Wow! Such a good find. First time & won't be last time. Best burgers than a lot of other places. Jerry & H were very kind and were working hard. The food was delicious

Literally searched for a place on Canal St. on Yelp and this was #1 so my boyfriend and I just decided to spontaneously try it. Their burgers are delicious and they ask you how you want your burger done. Paid $19 for the black burger w/ cheese, the chipotle burger, curly fries (yum!), and refillable soda! Also surprised we found seating inside.

That's a damn good burger. Simple high quality not tryin to be anything it's not. I went for the bacon double cheeseburger, rare. A little more bread then I like but spot on otherwise. Came out in about five minutes. Added in the chocolate shake and that was proper as well. I'll make a point of coming back.

Greasy burger done right. I drove past with a urge for a good burger sitting on my palate so I decided to give Black Burger a shot and it was worth it! I ordered a turkey burger done with mushroom and Swiss. Keep up the yummy job.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I really wanted to like this place. But the reality fell short. Unlike the other hamburger close by with a name that also starts with "black", this place aims for the affordable, high volume output. The main problem I had with this burger was that they claim they're never frozen, but that's what the burger patty tasted like.  It was dense and not cumbly.  So kind of more like a fastfood burger.  The color was more grayish than anything.  And it hardly had any taste in my opinion.  There was nothing special about the bun either.  Overall, it reminded me almost of my elementary school lunch burger.  Not a pleasant memory.  Their fries (curly, seasoned) were good and there was a good amount.  I'm always pulling for the small, underdog places that put out solid, affordable food so I'll try this place again to see maybe if it were just an off day.  Note the place is really small (e.g., ~5 stools) and so much more suitable for takeaway (especially in the summer since it's all open air with no AC).
No comment

If you want a decent hamburger this is your place. Just decent. I was staying nearby and got in late so I walked around to get a bite. The guy at the counter lacked any ability to properly interact with another human being in a service situation. Probably won't be back. The non-cash discount can be his tip. Curly fries were hot at least.

Stopped in for a bite after visiting a neighborhood high school. The food was hot, fresh, made to order very quickly and simply delicious! My son said we need to trek back into the city to eat there again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Just had black burger for the first time and it was so delicious. Their shakes are amazing and we didn't even wait long for our food. Would definitely love to try all their burgers so more reason to come back !

So here's the deal - burger meat was meh - but the amount of bacon, crispness of the lettuce, and the rest of the toppings in this chipotle party made the burger yum. Had the Chipotle Thursday special - includes drink and curly fries for $9.99 cannot be beat - worth hitting this place up if you're in the vicinity and wanting a sloppy burger. Curly fries were also very yummy crispy on the outside - balanced by the soft inside. Staff was pleasant, courteous and helpful. All in all a good experience. I'll be back.
No comment
I went back recently and found the food to be much improved. My burger was made exactly to order, the veg was fresh, and a fried egg is now an option. Worthy of another star.

The Dependable burger and fries joint that's made anyway you want it fast. They have beef, turkey, veggie and chicken "burgers". The curly fries are pretty awesome and they give you plenty. The shakes are thick and delicious.
No comment
Again this place still sucks .  Ask for a regular burger it comes with bacon on it.  Said I didn't ask for bacon they pull they bacon off and try to give it back !!
Really good burger at a really good price!! It doesn't make u feel guilty after cuz it's not greasy. Also pretty fast delivery. No complaints
No comment
No comment
I tried a Black Burger with extra mushrooms and it didn't disappoint. Super satisfying lunch spot if you're in the area.
No comment

Walked past on a rainy day, and the smells coming out brought me in. I had the Ranch Burger with a veggie patty with curly fries. I did t realize how hungry I was till I looked down & saw the burger & half the fries had disappeared!   Each bite was better than the rest! I wish I would have found this place sooner!

Incredible food all around and a fun atmosphere. I really loved their fries and Reese's shake. Veggie burger was just okay, but the options of toppings made it a great meal. My girlfriend said the burger was "really excellent." You'll just have to take her word for it since I'm a vegetarian.

When I say loveeeee.... I couldn't even get a proper picture of the burger without tearing into it first. It's really good, I order the bacon Black with sautéed onions and I'm very happy with my decision. It's delicious! If you're in the soho area I definitely suggest stopping by for a bite. It's tiny but you can eat in or take out.
They have their good days and bad days. I eat here pretty frequently cause I'm in the area alot  but yea . I hope you catch them on a good day.
No comment
A great quick and delicious burger make sure you come here before you hurt your pockets on a mediocre burger!
No comment
Great burgers, delicious curly fries. I will recommend this place and will definitely come back.

We were heading to Chinatown and saw Black Burger on our way. It's a little joint with a few seats, really great for on the go. There were 8 of us and they were quick! We had the black burger, the veggie burger, a Hawaiian veggie burger, curly fries. It was delicious!! Our group of high school kids were pleased. Definitely recommend this place. Staff was on top of it:)
Has the best shakes and burgers in town! My favorite is the strawberry milkshake. Would come again :)
No comment
Really good burger and very filling :) had the philly burger with curly fries - definitely recommend

Nothing to special about their burger. I thought it was going to be a burger joint that had a unique taste. It was a normal burger. Fortunately, pricing was fair, so I didn't have to waste much money to find out
Big, greasy, somewhat-uninspired burgers that won't break the bank. The service was smooth and friendly (contrary to some reviews) but the food won't have you rushing back.

Solid burger. It's not the juiciest or the most flavorful burger, but I've had worse burgers than this, but also much better burgers.  For the price point, it's pretty decent value and the curly fries were on point if that means anything.
Came here for late night dinner. I got the chipotle burger with curly fries and it was bomb. Good food, good price, recommend it.

So I'm a vegetarian, came in starving and late for my next client all the way uptown. Ordered the veggi burger with a soda and fries. Was super excited cause again I'm starving. As I'm watching the burger being made as we all do when starving, I noticed a beef burger being grilled up also. Look I don't mind them together but what gets my bees in my bonnet is using the same spatula on a veggi burger as a meat burger. Man of you would of cleaned it I would be eating that beautifulburger in this damn cab. Instead of eating fries
No comment
Great quick bite to eat. Burgers & fries are amazing!! Wouldn't go here for dinner but a quick bite. Only downside is that the location is very small.
No comment
The breakroom burger is in one word...Fire! The pork belly confit is just was the doc ordered on this dish and I love me some eggs on the bun as well. A real class act.
This place is amazing. Best burgers in the city. Highly recommended. The onion rings and philly burger are amazing!! Def recommend.

During my long wait* (may have been dramatized because I was near hangry when I walked in and definitely full on hangry by the time my food came) I thought 4 stars at best. Then I bit into one of best turkey burgers I've had in my entire life and curly fries to be remembered and all my troubles were washed away. Portion size is huge! I mostly ate fries while in the restaurant and saved the burger for later, which was still good on my flight back to Chicago!

Had their burgers delivered to my house so I can't speak about customer service but the food is incredible! My go to place when I'm craving burgers and a milkshake. Their mozzarella sticks are also amazing
No comment
Great quality burger and customer service. Comparable to some of the best NYC has to offer. Definitely try their fries as well!!
No comment

I'm really disappointed. After years going to this restaurant I went with my senior friend who bought a bacon burger. After pay, my friend saw the add offering the same product she ordered, but cheaper. She asked for the cashier, but the lady was really rude with her. We asked her name so we could complain with the manager, but she refused to answer and said she is the manager. Really disappointed, what kind of manager is so rude with costumers?
No comment

Great place to grab some quick curly fries and a veggie burger. A bit small so I wouldn't recommend it for a full group, but if you're travelling along chinatown this is usually my first stop before the arduous adventure.
No comment
My burger was soooo amazing and Caleb was so friendly and insightful with his recommendations . Great place to go before or after a fun night at VIP .
DELICIOUS, DELICIOUS, DELICIOUS!! They're open late and they're so cheap it's a crime not to indulge late night after drinking and before passing out! ;)
No comment
This place is amazing! The staff are so nice and the food is amazing. Every time i want a burger in this area I come straight here. The curly fries are delicious too!
No comment

I would recommend this place. It's not too far from the train station and it is also right on Canal street in the middle of everything. Very easy to get to. The workers are not the friendliest but they're not mean either. So no real complaints there. The speedy service is something that is greatly appreciated. I, generally, only come here on my 30 minute lunch breaks. It takes 5 minutes to walk there and 5 minutes to walk back. It takes about 5-8 minutes to wait for the food so I get about 12-15 minutes to eat which is alright with me.

This is my go to burger joint! Right around the corner from my office, they offer a variety of burgers sauces and sides. Their shakes are bomb too! If you're looking for a quick burger this is the spot for you.
No comment
No comment
Must say one of the best burgers I've had in the city. Also for the price it's unbeatable. Might I add I love seasoner curly fries and thats what they include with the meal combo.

This tiny, trendy, high energy burger joint offers quality burgers, served in cute little boxes; with instructions on how to convert them into a plate.  Opens Sunday after 11:00, sometime.  Has Uber delivery...
No comment

First gained knowledge of this place from reading reviews, then A few weeks ago while driving on my way Uptown via West Side HGWY I spotted the establishment. So today while in The City, figured I would try them out on my never ending quest of hitting as much as possible Burger Joints!!! I ordered the Black w/cheese well well done lettuce tomato onions pickles mayo & ketchup. Fries & Strawberry Shake.  Your order comes packaged in small little neat box, in which they suggest you use as A plate, by folding diwn the sides. The shake was THICK & Tasty, fries very good and plentiful. The burger while Very G00D was on the small side. Speaking of small, the spot is very SMALL & seating is very cramped and limited. All in all it cost me A little over $16, the experience was worthwhile. When you think of Canal St A raised eyebrow normally follows.......... but this burger joint is Authentic and definitely worth patronizing, like their  borrowed motto, once you go black.............
No comment

Similar but also different to McDonald's burger, I will like to take the burger here instead of McDonald. But just like other restaurants price here is also expensive than McDonald, So 4 star, checked!

Good burger at a reasonable price. I had the Swiss burger and the mushrooms and the cheese made a really good combination. I liked the patty as well. The bread, however, was sub par. I paid 7.61 (on the menu as 6.99) after taxes for just the burger.
No comment

Best burger in NYC! Here on vacation and stopped in craving a quick greasy cheeseburger, but boy was I pleasantly surprised. This place is definitely quick and definitely greasy BUT the burgers are fresh never frozen, cooked to order however you'd like (well, medium, etc). I ordered a double bacon with cheese and it came with lettuce, tomato, pickle. I also ordered curly fries which were cooked to order as well, everything was super hot and fresh. There was ketchup and some other sauce out for use, the orange sauce was delicious! Would recommend trying this place!!!
Food is great! But please ask them to place a the regular size cup next to the large. There isn't a huge difference. Same goes for large fries. There is no incentive to upsize your combo.
No comment
The curly fries were really good and crispy. I have a chocolate milkshake also that was not too sweet or too watered down. The fires portion was also generous enough. I think I would return!
A good quality burger with a good variety of toppings. The curly fries and shakes are really good too.
Really good burger and curly fries. I could take or leave the shakes but with a consistently good burger its hard to complain about anything.
No comment

I used UberEATS to order lunch from Black Burger as I was in the mood for a burger. I ordered the Chipotle turkey burger and curly fries. The burger was great, although I didn't realize there would be onions. Either way, it was cooked perfectly and it really hit the spot. I was impressed that it didn't get soggy by the time it arrived. The curly fries on the other hand were just ok... they were a little softer than I was expecting and I didn't feel it was seasoned enough. Not a bad lunch option overall though!
No comment

Great Burgers. This place is located at a nice location on canal street. Not far from the train station. If you review them on yelp, you are eligible for 3 free mozzarella sticks. Great with your burger. The burger is really yummy but the seating is really tight.
It was good but it wasn't as flavorful as I expected it to be. I also had the mozzarella sticks but they were blah.

When you walk in the place is no bigger than a studio apartment but the scene is intimate. Cute for a date. The prices  are amazing for Tribeca. The food choices are endless here.  The wait was short. The burger is amazing!!! A must have while in the city
Good customer service. The philly burger is really good (add jalapenos). My hubby likes the hawiian

Special, nothing off with coupon! No really get. Combo with burger, fries and a drink for $6.95 for a buck more large size drink and fries.  Great burgers 100% Angus beef cooked to order and nice crispy fries. Order to go or sit on a stool and chow down. This is a no frills place. Also serving turkey and veggie burgers.   Rated "A" by NYC.
Great food at a good price. Recommend coming here.  Friendly service. Convenient location in the soho area
Great little spot in TriBeCa. Lots of different options, for all kinds of diets and tastes.  Take out to my hotel was super fast.  They also do delivery and Uber eats.
This burger was FIRE. Must try if in downtown Manhattan. Chipotle burger and fries were amazing.
Ordered from uber eats and the burger was extremely dry. I had to drench it with ketchup to add some moisture to it. Absolutely terrible. Reminded me of school lunches
Typical fast food joint in a tiny sliver of a triangle storefront. Nothing special and so many people there's not really room to sit and eat.

Got the Black Burger w/ cheese and jalapeño. It's a delicious burger with a thick patty, fluffy buns, and shredded lettuce. They also have Bottle Boylan Soda. Curly fries are nice a crispy too. This place doesn't fit more than 7 people so prepare to stand if you want to eat here.

Great burger, very fast service and people who works here is very friendly. Prices are low compare the tasty burger and amazing curly fries. There are sitting inside and outside. Open 7 days you must try if you haven't so far.

I ordered a double black burger and decided to eat it without the bun. Good choice, found a hair on the first patty. Threw that one away and Benares on eating the second patty. Never mind hair on that one too. Waste of $10 bucks, and my time.
super solid burger, good price. The curly fries are pretty top notch.

Just got the ranch burger, and it was amazing!! Medium well, was spot on NOT BURNT and it hit the spot perfectly! Im at the perfect point of full just from the burger and im bigger then majority of people.
Service is great and the food is delicious! Always love coming to Black Burger when I'm in the area!
I love the burgers here. I ordered Phili, the meat is juicy and tasty. The vegetables are fresh. You have many choices here. Good place to grasp something to eat.
Amazing place, best burger and fries in TriBeCa. The mozzarella sticks are to die for. Open till late!
Nasty burger with weird meat. Doesn't even taste like meat actually.  Took a few bites and tossed it. Fries were pretty good though.

Stumbled into Black Burger one evening while visiting New York. It was the only thing that had an open kitchen. We weren't disappointed though. Great burgers and fries. The staff was really friendly. If I lived in New York, I would go back.
Good food. Good burger ! Looking forward to coming back soon! Right off of canal street next to borough Pizza. One of the best burgers around nyc!
Milkshake: a fantasmic flavor of delicate chocolate with a cool, silky flow of cream. Can't wait for the burger to be ready.

This little place is so convenient. Servers are quick and efficient. I came here on my lunch break and even with a line, I was able to order and receive my order no more than fifteen minutes. Not to mention, their burger is is juicy to the perfection because it's never frozen. A must try especially if you got that burger crave!

I went to the Black Burger location at 362 Broadway and got the Swiss Burger (with beef) and curly fries and paid $9.78: $5.99 for the burger and $2.99 for the fries. The fries were good, but the beef burger was horrible, made of low quality beef. The mushrooms that came with the burger were from the can. Altogether, I can say the meal was not worth $9.78. Arome Café and even burger King and McDonalds have similar quality burger meals, if not better, but for less. My suggestion to the owner is stick with what you know, i.e., $1 dollar pizza.
One of the best burger spots downtown. Fresh, fast, and made to order at a fair price. Sounds like a commercial haha but that's exactly what it is. Get the "black burger combo with cheese."
Yum! Really good quick food with great options. The burger was a little messy but I like burgers like that.
Gross. Filthy. A colleague of mine got food poisoning and was hospitalized from eating there.

Ordered on Seamless 3 times, and never again. First 2 times forgot my extra drink; when I asked in the instructions to please include my drink, I got my order (without my drink of course) with a USED BABY PACIFIER IN THE BAG. When I called to complain whoever was on the other line hung up. Worst customer service and delivery experience ever.

Solid cheap burger with a surprising amount of flavor. I had the Hawaiian burger with curly fries, and it was a much bigger portion for the price than I'm used to in Manhattan. Great food and a great value.

I was headed on a road trip late night and was starving. I was skeptical for some reason to eat here but odor anyway and what a good decision that was. The burger was crazy good and my curly fries were sick too. Def grab a burger here. The menu has a burger for everyone.
Great customer service, fries are really good !! Fast and efficient, right around soho so come when you're tired of shopping for a quick bite!
No comment
Love this place!! Great service, Good food. Only thing I would complain about is the price. Then again its located in downtown Manhattan, expensive is the norm around here.
Pretty good philly burger, and it was only $6.50. The buns were good, but fell apart easily. As previous reviews said, it's a good quick bit. Friendly staff, which is always appreciated.

Go here, don't wait in a line at Black Tap Burger. Around $10 you get a great burger, curly fries and a drink (they have bottled soda too). Their milkshakes are on point too. The only thing I will say is when you order any of the specialty burgers/chicken sandwiches, ask for extra sauce, you'll need it to really get the flavor the cook is going for.

This is the BEST burger in NYC (way better than Shake shack) and the special sauce is amazing! They also always have speedy service and the best customer service - their manager even delivered me a chocolate milkshake personally after it was forgotten. I LOVE BLACK BURGER!
Amazing burgers and amazing curly fries. The service was amazing! The shakes are a delicious and the food is great for the price point. I would recommend for anyone to come here!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really great veggie burgers--they actually have really vegetables in them instead of frozen, pulverized soy like most places. Get the Philly burger; it'll melt your face off with ooey-gooey deliciousness.
No comment
When there for lunch today, heard their burger was good. Their attitude was so bad, never going there again. Doesn't matter how good the food is when their attitude is so bad.
No comment

The place was tiny but had a great look so I decided to grab an early dinner. Because I'm a vegetarian--and I didn't see that they have veggie burgers until after I ordered--I got the tomato and spinach grilled cheese. BIG MISTAKE. The spinach is not fresh. It's basically thawed out birdseye frozen crap. It tasted awful and did not go with the sandwich, which improved a lot once I scraped off the clumps of spinach. I'm willing to try the veggie burger and fries and shake, but before I do I had to leave this negative review because why would you do that to a grilled cheese? What a baffling choice.
Really nice and juicy burgers and the curly fires are great too. They have veggie options which can be combined with any burger.
Quick easy and delicious. Obviously not the best burger in nyc but for a quick greasy fix it definitely did the job. Got the chipotle burger and a shake. Nom.
No comment
Great tasty burger for cheap! I got the extra egg addon for 1.50. Place is small but the burgers are quite juicy. Definitely give it a try.
No comment
Great for a quick burger bite. Try the fries, that are awesome. This place is much better that the over hyped In 'N Out burger on the west coast.
No comment
I love this place! Amazing burgers and even better curly fries! It's super quick and easy to get on a lunch break.
No comment

This place is great. The burgers were juicy, the chicken patty was juicy, the curly fries were good and the service was great. My friends and I drove from Brooklyn to Manhattan (deep in Brooklyn) just to get it, on 2 separate occasions. It's a great late night spot.
I've had a lot of veggie burgers before...this one was good. Definitely not the greatest, but definitely good. Whatever it lacked they made up for in the curly fries. Delish!
If u are in tribeca, u really must try the black burger. The service is great and the burger pretty good, although its not my favorite.

Very delicious and good prices!! Enjoyed the burger (the bacon black) and the chocolate milkshake was literally the best thing in my entire life! I would come back a million jillion times. The fries are on point too!

Asked for a bacon cheeseburger medium well, no tomatoes or pickles. It came out BARELY medium, was very red on the inside. Also NO BACON! Customer service was okay but that's to be expected on canal st. All in all I would recommend against this place. It could be good if the people who worked there payed attention to what they're doing.
Amazing burgers very people friendly here and yummy fries can't go wrong here :) also u guys should try the blue cheese & bacon burger shesshhhhhh yummy

Not a bad burger, and not a terrible price either, but I don't think i've ever killed as many flies during one meal as I had while here. Granted, I think this is mostly a take-out spot, but it's still important to mention considering many of you may never step foot in here as customers. The curly fries, however, do seem to make it all worth while.
Came here at 4:10 am and this was closed, their yelp stated that it wasn't going to close till 5. The burgers and fries are good, but pretty disappointed that I was mislead driving to the city....

Black burger is unbelievable. I'm new to the city and always trying to find good spots. This is top 5 my favorite. How about getting a free milk shake with your combo. You can not beat that. & I love milk shakes. They are outstanding. I will come here again for sure.
Great late night spot with quality burger combos and curly fries. Veggie burgers too.
No comment

Love love love their burgers & the house sauce. The seasoned curly fries are good. I want to try the shakes one day. I'm addicted to milkshakes. Riff raff can filter in from the school close by. Also I THINK I saw management when I was there a week or two ago. He was hot...

They always add something to my burger that wasn't asked for whether its ketchup, lettuce, raw onions. The burger's ok. The onion rings are really good, and the Shakes are marvelous.  Its pricey since the move to Canal Street, burger/fries/shake is gonna cost you over $15.
No comment
No comment

This place is a definite must when you're grabbing a quick bite in the neighborhood! The two guys Jerry and Paul give such excellent service! They recommended me the "double black burger - medium well" and it was by far the best quality burger I've had in years! I would definitely be returning here! It was so good!!! Do not hesitate to try it out!!!!
No comment
Good vegan burgers. Plus I got a free milkshake with this yulp review ; ) great customer service wi the a smile. I just hope they are being paid well. Cause customers sometimes give them hell.

Best burger place near soho. Great prices, burger always taste amazing and they have curly fries! Employees are very nice and always make sure our orders are correct.  Their shakes are amazing as well!
No comment

Great food, have came here a few times and really like the burgers. I go a lot for lunch and after school with friends. Never had a problem just really good food.definitely recommend this place. Very good prices.  I would definitely come here again.
Had the strawberry  shake,  and a black burger. it was awesome. The staff was very friendly. No wait, great experience.

This is probably the best burger I've had for the price, and it's close to work. You can get a double cheeseburger with fries and a drink for a little over $10. Otherwise, the burger alone is $4-something for a single or $5-something for a double. I only really get the Black burger or the Double Black (just their name for a burger), and their curly fries are great.

I had the Philly  burger with cheese grilled onions mushrooms and peppers, it was excellent! So delicious and juicy. I also had a chocolate shake. Wonderful! It's right near where I work in SoHo so I will be here again soon.
The motzarella sticks were delicious. There were many different burger options. I got the classic  black burger, and it was cooked perfectly.
Ran into this place to escape the snow and grab a quick bite. I tried the bacon cheeseburger. The bacon was perfection. The beef patty was good but a bit dry. 4 stars for having shredded lettuce.

My family and I were looking to grab something quick to eat and happened to park near this place. The wait was pretty long for our food, around 35 minutes for 3 burgers, and the cashier got my order wrong. That being said, my family really enjoyed the food and want to go back. The amount of food was really filling as well.
Good vibes good burger downtown! I haven't tried the snake yet but I'll get to it next time I'm here.
Burgers are definitely fresh and customer service was great. I called in advance and they had it ready for me so I could beat the lines
Great food! Enjoyed it. Get the chipotle burger, great!bfirst time and I'd def go again, good place

From out of town, and I must say, black burger was quick and on point. Stopped there when first leaving my hotel for a quick bite.. But had to stop again before returning. I highly recommend this place if you are in SoHo!!!
Best burger spot on canal st with the best prices! They cook the burger just right too!
So good! Their burgers are so fresh and the fries are the best! Must go to if you're on canal st!
Very delicious fresch Burgers! Definitely recommend if you are around. Small place, doesn't have many seats, more like a take out place!
Best burger ive had. Every single time im in the city i gotta eat here. Hope to try everything on the menu.
Lunch time. Empty and just sat there unattended to. Ended up walking out...something I haven't had to do before.
This place is great best burgers!!!! I go here all the time highly recommended. Best place to go after a couple drinks or on a lunch break.
Black burger is the greatest. Quality fries and juicy burgers. The milkshakes are fantastic as well. A little on the pricey side I don't mind it's worth it. Love black burger!
No comment
Fast service! Amazing food! Amazing burger and great curly fries. Good for on the go! Great spot to eat on your break if you work in the area. Check them out!

It is the worst burger I wish I never had. The curly fries who as hard a shoe strings. I love a good burger anf I would pay for it , but I should be paid to eat this. Waste of money a hunger buster will never spend Bother some. This is just my opinion.

The burger itself was awful, but the place itself was fine --- just order something else that's not a burger. The bread, vegetables, options, and meat are all not well thought through at all - much better burger choices anywhere else.
I'be been a customer for 2 years and the consistency never fails. The burger and fries are always fresh and hot and of course delicious.

I went to the other one located on 362 Broadway. Well done. Friendly courteous staff they know their way around a burger even the bacon medium rare ones. ( they give us newbies a chance to decide what we want on our burgers ie:lettuce tomatoes onions, mayo (the standards). One note please bring back the calamari fries. At least once So at least us newcomers to your company can experience the crunchy "squiddy" goodness  of them at least once.
Delicious Burgers, the bun is crispy the house sauce is great and the meat taste really fresh. This is the In and Out Burger of NYC

Just moved to tribeca this weekend and decided to try out the burger place, walked in after 11pm place was small but a few customers in there, and one worker tiny Latino guy working. I ordered a double bacon cheese burger medium with all the trimmings and an order of onion rings. As spaces opened up I decided to have it there, the eating spaces were filthy, stains everywhere on the table, plates everywhere the floor was littered with napkins and straws, I took another look at the workspace and saw that it was filthy as well along with the grill and the floor by the grill was despicable. I ignored it because I spent over 1$ and decided to not waste food. The burger looked as if it was thrown into the box and the onion rings were overly well done / burnt. The meat which was supposed to be medium was way over well done (no pink at all) it was beyond sloppy because it was drenched in sauce, I would've moved past it but as I sat in the corner By the soda machine I heard squeaking, very loud squeaking. I just threw everything in the trash and left, won't be returning to this establishment, hope they sort out their problems, rodent and service wise.

Happened to be in the area for an afterwork event and we were a bit hungry waiting for the event to start so we decided to stop in here. I had the bacon burger (done medium) and it was tasty. The price wasn't bad and the burger was a respectable size. It was a cute little shop too and there were a couple of stools so you could eat there if you wanted. People behind the counter were friendly too. A decent spot!
No comment

The guys at BlackBurger saved our life - it's 1:30am, my friend and I didn't have dinner, so literally starving, and these saints swooped in and blessed us with beautiful beef patties. I have never posted here before but the patties and the curly fries were without a doubt the best thing to happen to our country.
Nice little place with some really good burgers and crispy fries!

In and out burger is similar to the chipotle burger just the chipotle part was disappointing no kick to the point that i added ketchup half way through.   The bacon was perfectly cooked and the best part.   The burger tasted like better meat then fast food and had good flavor but wasnt huge.   The bun was toasted on one side that gave good crunch but a very heavy bun not light and fluffy I am sure others like this.   Otherwise the lettuce and tomato were barely noticeable.  Afterwards went and ate some other food.

Really good cheap burger. Wasn't expecting much from the other reviews, knew it was a burger counter type place with limited seating. It was empty when I arrived, and the service was pretty quick. The prices were very cheap and the burger was very tasty. Fries were good (sure, I'll have a mountain of curly fries, thank you). Not much to say about the place other than if you're in the area and looking for a quick bite, Black Burger does the trick.
Bad burger n fries , bad delivery took one and half! Food was cold n fries was overcooked
No comment

Juicy patties, homemade sauce, super crispy bacon and super crispy fries. It was near my hotel to make my trip to NYC really comfortable.  Better than average but still not worth driving for this place.
Do Not Eat Here! My son got confirmed food poisoning a few weeks ago and had to go to the hospital.
No comment

Delicious burger! I got the black and blue bacon burger (I hope I got the name right?) And curly fries. Delicious! Juicy burger, seared and a little crispy on the outside, plenty of good cheese. Curly fries crispy and out of this world with chipotle mayo. (I wanted something spicier than ketchup, and the counter guy suggested this). This is a fast food place where you can specify temperature and your requests will be more what to leave off than what goes on. Grilled onions free, .50 extra to make any burger a turkey or veggie, they even have a lamb feta burger. Simple menu -burgers, shakes, grilled cheese and fries- even a burger salad - looks like there were wings, but definitely this is a burger place. Immaculate, a few counter seats. Yelp says they close at 7, but I was there at about 7:45 and their sign says they're open till the cows come home. Definitely a destination for a stop either way through the tunnel. I'll definitely be a repeat customer.

This place was awesome but today they decided to put bacon on my veggie burger. They fixed it but... Also I liked the first time I ate there. they had a black bean burger but the last two times it was a dr praegers which is yummy but doesn't give it that grilled burger taste. Disappointed won't be back again.
Quick easy delicious burgers with veggie and turkey substitutes available - I recommend the mozzarella sticks and the curly fries!
Love this place. Burgers are fresh and juicy. It does get pretty busy around lunch time but that's expected.

Preformed frozen patties out of a box, buns that belong in a school cafeteria, and fries that taste like fish. These are the things you can expect to get here. The hamburger is the same as you would get at Papaya Dog or one of those other cheap $2 hamburger places. The curly fries tasted like calamari because I'm sure they use the same oil for both which is saddening because curly fries are amazing. Don't be lured in by the look of this place, there isn't anything here for a burger lover or even someone looking for a good lunch.
Wonderful to see gluten-free "burger salad." Hearty, flavorful, and tossed to order. Caleb was knowledgable, confident, and pleasant. Burgers are never frozen and are cooked to specification.

Frozen patties with a regular bun does not make a good burger! The house sauce is pretty good. I liked the curly fries though am not sure why it smelled like fish! Overall, a cheap option if you are on Canal and want to grab a quick bite late at night.
Delicious burger and fries. Reasonably priced. Bun is a bit small for my liking but otherwise really great value and service.
Great deal with lunch! Check in during lunch and you can get a shake :)! Burgers are good, cooked on a flattop. Shakes are super good. Old school so it really tastes like ice cream! :)
Exactly what it's supposed to be: A cheap burger place for a quick meal. Tastes nice, not too expensive and offers a variety of different burgers including veggie options.

There isn't any indoor seating for more than a few people. I really like this place I can't stop eating the calamari fries. Next time I go there I have to try a burger, with a few friends after a night at canal room and they had burgers and said they were really good..
Great burgers and the curly fries omg!!! so good with the special sauce!
I got the chipotle burger. Did not disappoint! It was cooked perfectly. Would definitely come back again.
great cheap burgers. Everyone there is friendly and it's open late which is great! I work close by so this is great for those late nights when you need something to really fill you up.
Had a late night burger after a very festive night. Even in my drunken state, the burger was a bit overcooked and quite 'black'.
Their burgers are so delicious! Service was fast and burger and curly fries were amazing!

Tried the black burger with cheese.  Price point was like 5guys as was the burger size and style.  Taste was poor all the way around.  Not a good flavor, and even bland.  Nothing I can think of would make me return to try again, it's just mediocrity defined in a city with so much great food.

Gong Xi Fa Cai! Walking to the A train from the Chinese New Year parade, really hungry but not into the usual Chinatown/Little Italy suspects, I was actually craving a burger, and here this place appeared! Yay! The aroma of freshly cooked burger greets you as soon as you open the door. *inhale deeply*...*sigh happily*...*walk in*... all the steel countertops are spotless. Everything is cooked right in front of you, turkey burgers and angus beef burgers are great, juicy fresh meat, fresh springy buns, etc. and they are 4oz, so not to hard to handle if you don't like it too big. ;) Spicy curly cue fries on the side. Get! in! my! Belly! I wish there was a better soda selection though, it's just the fountain, some of those bottles of olde brooklyn sodas (root beer, cherry, etc) would be nicer. Bring a bit of cash for the tip box since their credit card receipts don't have a space for tips.
this place is the best. I had a burger and fries here one time and it was so good. I would recommend this place to anyone in the area looking for a quick cheap bite.
Black burger is awesome, I come here all the time for lunch. Their chipotle burger is the best in NY!!
Good simple burger.  Calamari fries are so so.  Guys are quick with the food.

Not very tasty and when they asked how I would like it cooked I said "medium-rare" and it came out looking like a McDonalds burger where there is no color at all, just brown. Crumby meat quality. I'm definitely not going back but some things are worth trying. This place won't be getting anymore of my money. Also there was a homeless man wandering around inside while I was eating which wasn't very pleasant.
Hey I usually get a burger & fries I find the food to be very good. I love good food. The calamari is the best.
No comment
I like this place!!!!!!!!  Not I love with it so much but it's kool for the price I guess, u know what they say I life u get what u pay for

I ate here several times while staying at the nearby Sheraton Tribeca. I was impressed. This little hole in the wall is host to some delicious burgers. I would put it at the level of a Five Guys, Smashburger, Habit, etc. It's the quality of a good restaurant at fast food prices. I had the Turkey Burger, the Texas Burger, and a regular Bacon Cheeseburger during separate visits. They were all well packaged, properly cooked, and delicious. The piece de la resistance here is the curly fries. You must get the curly fries, share them if your a health nut. Also this place is open late, so if your in need of a late night snack this is it my friend. Highly recommend this great burger joint.
Overall a  good burger, close to a Shake Shack burger, but slightly less awesome.

Just plain not good. Curly fries are sweet instead of salty, with some Cajun seasoning, sort of msg-ish. The bun fell apart in my hands and the burger itself was nothing to get excited about. $9 for a bad burger, bad fries and a soda makes me wish I had gotten a $1 slice of pizza next door.
shakes and burgers are yummmmmayy !!! around the block from where I live..food is amazing and good prices ! roommates and I always swing by for food and milkshakes =)

Burgers are good, although not really flavorful. I'd say they taste something like the burgers from Five Guys. The difference is that they're cheaper here and the Black Burger w/Cheese combo runs for around $7.35. The curly fires were good. Service was also good.
Open super late, thanks for the service to the community!  Super nice guys working there.  Fresh and juicy burger.  Fries are ok.  Excellent value.

The guy working the grill didn't change his gloves after adding RAW burgers to the grill.  He just wiped his hands on his pants then proceeded to handle the buns and toppings.  I tried to contact management directly, but they don't seem to have a website or direct contact.
No comment
